Note: The default for this field is _asAllowed.

Name: vsoePrice
Label: Allocation Price
Help:
Set the VSOE price for this item, if the price is known.
Note: If you need to use more than one VSOE price for an item, you can set the most common price here and then change the price on each order manually.

Name: vsoeSopGroup
Label: Allocation Type
Help:
Select an allocation type to associate with this item on sales transactions.
    * Normal - Revenue allocation follows EITF 08-01 rules when you use VSOE and the fair value price list with advanced revenue management.
    * Exclude - This item is excluded from revenue allocation. The item discounted sales amount is the revenue amount.
    * Software - The item is software. When you use VSOE with the EITF SuiteApp, both EITF 08-01 and SOP 97-2 rules apply for revenue allocation. When you use advanced revenue management, revenue allocation follows the fair value price list. Then if the fair value prices for any of the items in the allocation are estimates rather than VSOE, the allocation is recalculated using the residual method.
Note: Do not select the Software value unless you are using VSOE with the EITF SuiteApp or Advanced Revenue Management.

Name: weight
Label: Item Weight
Help: Set the weight of this item

Name: wipAcct
Label: WIP Account
Help:
This is an asset account used when a work order component issue is 
entered. This account is required if WIP is checked for any locations.

Name: wipVarianceAcct
Label: WIP Variance Account
Help:
This is an expense account for any actual cost or average cost 
assemblies when the reconciliation amount cannot be returned to the 
asset account because the amount has been shipped. This account is 
required if WIP is checked for any locations.

Name: built
Label: Built
Help:
Read only field that indicates the number of built assembly items. This number is determined by the amount of member items in stock.
 
If you use locations, this number only represents the number of built assembly items at the selected location.

Name: class
Help:
References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Classes.
 
This field is required when the Make Classes Mandatory preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: item
Label: Assembly
Help:
Set the assembly item to unbuild.
 
You must first create and build assembly items records before you can unbuild them.

Name: postingPeriod
Label: Posting Period
Help:
Select the period you want to post this transaction to.
If a period is closed, you cannot post to that period.

Name: quantity
Label: Quantity
Help: Set the number of assembly items to unbuild.

Name: total
Label: Projected Value
Help: Read-only field that returns the projected value of the assembly.

Name: tranDate
Label: Date
Help:
NetSuite inserts today's date for the posting date of this transaction.
You can type or pick another date.

Name: tranId
Label: Ref No.
Help:
Defaults to the largest Assembly Unbuild number incremented by one.
 
You can overwrite with another number.

Name: billingSchedule
Label: Billing Schedule
Help: Select the billing schedule associated with this billing account.

Name: cashSaleForm
Label: Cash Sale Form
Help: Select the cash sale form you want to use for this billing account.

Name: currency
Label: Currency
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Acco...

Name: customer
Label: Customer
Help: The name of the customer associated with this billing account.

Name: customerDefault
Label: Customer Default
Help: If checked, this field indicates that this is the default billing account for this customer.

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: References an existing custom form for this record type. ...

Name: frequency
Label: Frequency
Help: Indicates how often the customers is billed. The information for this field is sourced from the billing schedule.

Name: idNumber
Label: Account Number
Help: The number of the billing account. This number is automatically generated upon save.

Name: inactive
Label: Inactive
Help: Check this box if the billing account is no longer active.

Name: invoiceForm
Label: {#Invoice#} Form
Help: Select the invoice form you want to use for this billing account.

Name: memo
Label: Account Description
Help: Enter a description for this billing account.

Name: name
Label: Name
Help: The name of this billing account.

Name: startDate
Label: Start Date
Help:
Enter the date this person or company became a customer, lead or prospect.
If this person or company has a contract with you, enter the start date of the contract.
If you enter an estimate or an opportunity for this customer, this field will be updated with the date of that transaction.

Name: subsidiary
Help:
Select the subsidiary to associate with this entity or job. You cannot enter transactions for this entity or job unless a subsidiary is assigned.
 
If you select this entity on a transaction, the transaction is associated with this subsidiary. The entity is able to access only information associated with this subsidiary.
 
Note: Once a transaction has posted for the entity or job, you are not able to change the subsidiary selected on the entity or job record.

Name: applyToSubtotal
Label: Apply To Subtotal
Help: Check this box to create a billing schedule applied to the pre-tax, pre-discount subtotal of a transaction. To create a billing schedule applied to a transaction subtotal, Type must be set to Standard and Recurrence Frequency must be set to Custom.

Name: billForActuals
Label: Invoice Actual Time Only
Help:
Check the box to invoice only actual time worked and recorded in Time Tracking in each interval. If checked, you cannot enter an initial amount.
 
Clear the box to invoice planned time and actual time worked.

Name: frequency
Label: Recurrence Frequency
Help:
Select the frequency for bills to recur.
Select Daily to create bills once per day.
Select Weekly to create bills once per week.
Select Monthly to create bills once per month.
Select Quarterly to create bills once per quarter.
Select Twice a Year to create bills twice per year.
Select Annually to create bills once per year.
Select One Time to create a one-time bill.
Select End of Period to create a bill at the end of a calendar period.
Select Start of Period to create a bill at the beginning of a calendar period.
Select Custom to create a new frequency.

Name: inArrears
Label: In Arrears
Help:
Check this box to bill at the end of each period, instead of the beginning.
For example, on a billing schedule with no initial amount, standard monthly frequency, in arrears, the first invoice is created one month from one day after the sales order date.
Note: When this box is not checked, the first invoice bills for the initial amount plus the first recurring amount.

Name: initialAmount
Label: Initial Amount
Help:
Enter the initial bill amount generated by this billing schedule.
This can be entered as a percentage or a set currency amount if you use line-level billing schedules. You can only use percentage initial amounts if you apply billing schedules on the transaction level.

Name: initialTerms
Label: Initial Payment Terms
Help: Choose the terms applied to the initial payment amount.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: Check this box to inactivate this billing schedule. You cannot apply inactive schedules to orders.

Name: isPublic
Label: Public
Help:
Check this box to make this billing schedule public. You can select a public schedule on any estimate, sales order or item record.
If you do not check the Public box, this schedule is Private. A private billing schedule shows only in the transaction it is created from. If you create a private billing schedule from a transaction, that schedule is attached to items on the resulting sales order.
Note: This check box is available only for schedules created on-the-fly. If you create a regular schedule, it defaults to Public and cannot be changed.

Name: name
Label: Name
Help: Enter the name of this billing schedule.

Name: numberRemaining
Label: Recurrence Count
Help: Enter the number of subsequent payments you want the order amount divided into.

Name: recurrenceTerms
Label: Recurrence Payment Terms
Help:
Select the terms to be used on all invoices subsequent to the initial invoice.
To add new payment terms, go to Setup > Accounting > Accounting Lists > New and click Terms.

Name: repeatEvery
Label: Repeat Every
Help: Choose how often the recurring invoices are generated.

Name: scheduleType
Label: Type
Help:
The kind of billing schedule. The types available depend on the features enabled in your account. For example, the Fixed Bid Interval billing schedule type is only available when the Project Management feature is enabled.
    * Charge-Based – Lets you create charges, based on charge rules, which you can bill to customers.
    * Fixed Bid, Interval – Lets you bill customers for work completed at set intervals.
    * Standard – Lets you create a standard billing schedule based on an initial amount, recurrence frequency, and recurrence count.
    * Time and Materials – Bill customers based on actual expenses incurred in a project, such as raw materials and work hours.

Name: transaction
Label: Transaction
Help: This field shows the associated transaction for this schedule.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help:
Check this box to remove all references to this record from your account.
You can reactivate the record at any time.

Name: location
Help:
Select a location to associate with this transfer. 
The location you select determines which bins you are able to choose from. Items can be transferred to and from bins within only one location.

Name: memo
Label: Memo
Help: Optionally enter a Memo for this transfer. Then, you can search for the text entered here to find this transfer.

Name: tranDate
Label: Date
Help: Verify or enter the date of this transfer.

Name: availableForAllAssemblies
Label: Available For All Assemblies
Help:
Check the Available for All Assemblies box to allow all assemblies to use this BOM.
Clear the box to limit BOM use to only the selected assemblies.

Name: availableForAllLocations
Label: Available For All Locations
Help:
Check the Available for all Locations box to allow all locations to use this BOM.
Clear the box to allow only the selected locations use this BOM.

Name: createdDate
Label: Date Created
Help: The date this Bill of Materials was created.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help:
Check the Inactive box if you do not want this BOM or BOM revision to appear in search lists on records and forms.
Clear this box if you want this BOM or BOM revision to appear in lists.

Name: legacyBomForAssembly
Label: Legacy Bom For Assembly
Help: Click the Legacy BOM for Assembly link to display the legacy Bill of Materials.

Name: memo
Label: Memo
Help: Optionally, in the Memo field, enter any information you want to include with this BOM.

Name: name
Label: Name
Help:
Enter a unique and descriptive Bill of Materials (BOM) or BOM revision Name.
For example, Grill BOM or BOM Revision 1.

Name: useComponentYield
Label: Use Component Yield
Help:
Check the Use Component Yield box to apply component yield to all BOM revisions.
Component yield is the percentage of the component that survives the manufacturing process.
To learn more, see Component Yield Preferences

Name: usedOnAssembly
Label: Used On Assembly
Help: If checked, the read-only Used on Assembly box indicates that the BOM is associated to an assembly.

Name: billOfMaterials
Label: Bill of Materials
Help: Displays a link to the BOM you added this revision to.

Name: createdDate
Label: Date Created
Help: The date this Bill of Materials was created.

Name: effectiveEndDate
Label: Effective End Date
Help:
Click the calendar icon to set an Effective End Date.
Not entering both effective start and end dates, may affect future revisions.

Name: effectiveStartDate
Label: Effective Start Date
Help:
Click the calendar icon to set an Effective Start Date.
Not entering both effective start and end dates, may affect future revisions.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help:
Check the Inactive box if you do not want this BOM or BOM revision to appear in search lists on records and forms.
Clear this box if you want this BOM or BOM revision to appear in lists.

Name: memo
Label: Memo
Help: Optionally, in the Memo field, enter any information you want to include with this BOM.

Name: name
Label: Name
Help:
Enter a unique and descriptive Bill of Materials (BOM) or BOM revision Name.
For example, Grill BOM or BOM Revision 1.

Name: accountingBook
Help: If the Multi-Book Accounting feature is provisioned in your account, this is the accounting book associated with this budget.

Name: budgetType
Help: When the Multiple Budgets feature is enabled, budget category values are used on budget records to categorize types of budgets. In OneWorld accounts, budget category values are used to indicate whether budgeting is done at the local subsidiary level in local currency, or globally using the root subsidiary’s currency. Each budget category is associated with a budget category type of local or global.

Name: category
Help:
Select the category this budget is included in.
Assigning budgets to different categories enables you to create different budgets for the same set of class, department, or location criteria.
To create a new budget category, click New.

Name: class
Help:
If you want to create a budget for a specific class, select it here.
Leave this field blank to budget for all classes.

Name: currency
Help: This field indicates the currency for the budget. For accounts that are not OneWorld accounts, the currency is the base currency of the company. For global category type budgets in OneWorld, the currency is the base currency of the root parent company. For local category type budgets in OneWorld, the currency is the base currency of the local subsidiary, selected in the Subsidiary field.

Name: customer
Help: If this budget is associated with a specific customer or project, select it here.

Name: department
Help:
If you want to create a budget for a specific department, select it here.
Leave this field blank to budget for all departments.

Name: item
Help: If you want to create a budget for a specific item, select the item.

Name: location
Help:
If you want to create a budget for a specific location, select it here.
Leave this field blank to budget for all locations.

Name: subsidiary
Help: Select the subsidiary for which you want to create a budget.

Name: year
Help: Select the year for which you want to create a budget.

Name: budgetType
Label: Global
Help: When the Multiple Budgets feature is enabled, budget category values are used on budget records to categorize types of budgets. In OneWorld accounts, budget category values are used to indicate whether budgeting is done at the local subsidiary level in local currency, or globally using the root subsidiary’s currency. Each budget category is associated with a budget category type of local or global.

Name: accessLevel
Label: Event Access
Help: This field has a default value of public. The values used to populate this field are _public, _private or _showAsBusy.

Name: allDayEvent
Label: All Day
Help: This field requires a true or false value and is settable only.

Name: company
Label: Company
Help: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: contact
Label: Contact
Help: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: endByDate
Help: This field defines the end date for recurring events. Do not set this field for one-time (non-recurring) events.

Name: location
Label: Location
Help: Sets the location for the event. If a value is supplied

Name: message
Label: Message
Help:
Enter any message or notes for this event.
This message appears under the event title in the e-mail sent to the people invited to this event.

Name: noEndDate
Help: This field allows a true or false value only.

Name: organizer
Label: Organizer
Help: This field has a default value of the current user. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: recurrence
Label: Recurrence
Help:
This field is automatically filled in with the information entered when the event was created.
The event organizer can change when this event recurs by clicking Edit. Select a new option in the Repeat Every field on the Recurrence tab, and click Submit.

Name: reminderMinutes
Label: Set up Reminder
Help: This field has a default value of 15m. The values used to populate this field are _none, _0minutes, _5minutes, _10minutes, _15minutes, _30minutes, _1hour, _2hours, _3hours, _4hours, _5hours, _8hours, _1day, _2days, _3days, or _1week.

Name: reminderType
Label: Reminder type
Help:
Select Email to receive an e-mail reminder at the address you log in with.
Select Popup Window to receive a popup reminder.
Set the amount of time before the event your reminder should trigger in the Reminder field. If you select None, you will not receive a reminder.

Name: sendEmail
Help: This field has a default value of false. If set to True, each attendee listed in the attendeeList type is notified of the event via email.

Name: seriesStartDate
Help: This field is not available for add operations.

Name: startDate
Label: Start Date
Help: The startDate represents the day component and hour/min component of the event�s start time. Important: For both non-recurring and recurring events, you cannot set multi-day events using the startDate and endDate fields. The interval indicated by startDate/endDate must not cross midnight in the user's indicated time zone. For example, users cannot schedule an event that starts (in their own time zone) on 8/24/07 and ends on 8/25/07. The startDate and endDate must be the same date. Two separate events must be scheduled for events that extend beyond one calendar day.

Name: status
Label: Status
Help: This field has a default value of confirmed. The values used to populate this field are _cancelled, _completed, _confirmed or _tentative.

Name: supportCase
Label: Support Case
Help: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: timedEvent
Label: Timed Event
Help:
Check this box if this event requires reserved time on your calendar, such as an hour meeting or another time period you want others to see as not available.
Clear this box for items you want to include on your calendar but do not have a set time, such as birthdays and anniversaries.

Name: title
Label: Title
Help: This sets the subject line of the e-mail sent to those invited to the event, the title displayed if this event is marked public and the title displayed on the calendar of those invited to this event.

Name: transaction
Label: Transaction
Help:
This is a reference to an opportunity record that already exists in your NetSuite account.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: audience
Label: Audience
Help:
Select the audience for this campaign.
Tracking the target audience is useful for media marketing without a clear list of recipients.
You can create new campaign audience records at <_TABNAME=EDIT_CAMPAIGNAUDIENCE_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=EDIT_CAMPAIGNAUDIENCE_> > Campaign Audiences > New.

Name: baseCost
Label: Cost
Help:
Enter the cost of this campaign apart from the cost of any specific campaign events.
The base cost is added to the cost of individual campaign events to determine the total cost of the campaign.

Name: campaignId
Label: ID
Help:
The campaign ID is determined in one of the following ways:
    * If you use auto-generated numbers for campaigns, this ID is generated when you save the campaign.
    * If you do not use auto-generated numbers for campaigns, enter a campaign ID.
Campaign IDs make it easier to identify campaigns on reports and lists.

Name: category
Label: Category
Help:
Select the category this campaign belongs in.
Campaign categories are used to group campaigns on reports and lists.
You can create new campaign categories at <_TABNAME=EDIT_CAMPAIGNCATEGORY_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=EDIT_CAMPAIGNCATEGORY_> > Campaign Categories > New.

Name: convCostPerCustomer
Label: Cost per Purchaser
Help:
The cost per customer conversion for this campaign is calculated here.
This is calculated by dividing the cost of the campaign by the number of transactions entered with this campaign's promotion code.

Name: conversions
Label: Number of Purchasers
Help: This is the number of leads or prospects that have become customers as a result of this campaign.

Name: cost
Label: Total Cost
Help:
This cost is calculated by adding the base cost of the campaign to the cost of each individual campaign event. You cannot edit the amount in this field.
This amount is deducted from the revenue generated by this campaign to determine the return on investment.

Name: costPerCustomer
Label: Cost Per Lead
Help:
The cost per new customer for this campaign is calculated here.
Cost per customer is calculated by dividing the total cost of the campaign by the number of new customers your business gained as a result of this campaign.
The number of new customers is calculated by counting the transactions entered with this campaign's promotion code.

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help:
Select the campaign form you want to use.
To create a custom campaign form, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_CUSTENTRYFORM_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CUSTENTRYFORM_> > Entry Forms or select –New–.

Name: endDate
Label: End Date
Help: Enter or select the date this campaign ends.

Name: expectedRevenue
Label: Projected Income
Help: Enter the amount of revenue that is predicted that this marketing campaign will generate.

Name: family
Label: Family
Help:
Select the family of keywords this campaign keyword is a part of.
Keyword families are larger groupings of paid keywords. You can create a keyword family at <_TABNAME=EDIT_CAMPAIGNFAMILY_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=EDIT_CAMPAIGNFAMILY_> > Campaign Families > New.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: This field is false by default.

Name: keyword
Label: Keyword
Help: Enter the paid keyword you are tracking with this campaign.

Name: leadsGenerated
Label: Leads Generated
Help: This is the number of new leads generated by this campaign.

Name: message
Label: Description
Help:
Enter a description for this campaign.
This description only appears on the campaign record.

Name: offer
Label: Offer
Help:
Select an offer you want to associate with this campaign.
You can create new campaign offers at <_TABNAME=EDIT_CAMPAIGNOFFER_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=EDIT_CAMPAIGNOFFER_> > Offers > New.

Name: owner
Label: Campaign Manager
Help:
Select the campaign manager for his campaign.
The campaign manager receives a notification email message when a campaign event is delivered successfully.

Name: profit
Label: Profit
Help: This is the profit earned by this campaign. Profit is calculated by deducting the cost of the campaign from the total revenue.

Name: promotionCode
Label: Promotion
Help:
Select a promotion code that you want to associate with this campaign. You must instruct the recipients of your marketing message to enter this code on transactions in your Web store.
Promotion codes allow you to offer discounts through your campaigns.
You can create new promotion codes at <_TABNAME=EDIT_REFERRALCODE_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=EDIT_REFERRALCODE_> > Promotion Codes > New.

Name: roi
Label: Return on Investment
Help:
The return on investment of this campaign is calculated here.
Return on investment is calculated by deducting the cost of the campaign from the total revenue generated and dividing the difference by the campaign's cost.

Name: searchEngine
Label: Search Engine
Help:
Select the search engine you purchased this keyword from.
You can create new search engine records at <_TABNAME=EDIT_CAMPAIGNSEARCHENGINE_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=EDIT_CAMPAIGNSEARCHENGINE_> > Campaign Search Engines > New.

Name: startDate
Label: Start Date
Help: Enter or select the date this campaign begins.

Name: title
Label: Title
Help:
Enter a title for this campaign.
You can enter up to 99 characters in this field.

Name: totalRevenue
Label: Revenue
Help: This field shows the total sales of transactions associated with this campaign.

Name: uniqueVisitors
Label: Unique Visitors
Help: This is the number of unique visitors that have visited your website as a result of this campaign.

Name: url
Label: URL
Help:
Enter the URL for the campaign landing page or online customer form associated with this campaign.
If you enter a campaign ID or if you autonumber your campaigns, NetSuite automatically appends the URL to include the leadsource parameter. This is the destination URL you provide to search engine services for paid keywords.

Name: vertical
Label: Vertical
Help:
Select the market vertical you are targeting with this campaign.
You can create new verticals at <_TABNAME=EDIT_CAMPAIGNVERTICAL_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=EDIT_CAMPAIGNVERTICAL_> > Campaign Verticals > New.

Name: description
Label: Description
Help: Enter an optional description.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: This field is false by default.

Name: name
Label: Name
Help: Enter the name for this campaign metric.

Name: description
Label: Description
Help: Enter an optional description.

Name: isexternal
Label: Available Externally
Help: Check this box if you want this campaign category available for customers to select on online forms.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: This field is false by default.

Name: leadSource
Label: Default Lead Source
Help: If the Marketing Automation feature is not enabled, references a value in a user-defined list created by going to Setup > Sales > Setup Tasks > CRM Lists. Sets how this customer was referred to the organization. (Note: If the Marketing Automation feature is enabled, the lead source list originates from your list of campaigns.)

Name: name
Label: Name
Help: Enter the name for this campaign metric.

Name: parent
Label: Parent
Help: If this is a subcategory, choose a parent category.

Name: description
Label: Description
Help: Enter an optional description.

Name: eventType
Label: Type
Help: Available options are: _directMail, _email, _integration, _other

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: This field is false by default.

Name: name
Label: Name
Help: Enter the name for this campaign metric.

Name: description
Label: Description
Help: Enter an optional description.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: This field is false by default.

Name: name
Label: Name
Help: Enter the name for this campaign metric.

Name: description
Label: Description
Help: Enter an optional description.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: This field is false by default.

Name: name
Label: Name
Help: Enter the name for this campaign metric.

Name: campaignEvent
Label: Event
Help: This is the name of the campaign event.

Name: campaignResponseDate
Label: Date Created
Help: This is the date the campaign was sent.

Name: channel
Label: Channel
Help: This is the campaign channel used by this campaign event.

Name: entity
Label: Recipient
Help: This is the name of the campaign's recipient.

Name: leadSource
Label: Campaign
Help: If the Marketing Automation feature is not enabled, references a value in a user-defined list created by going to Setup > Sales > Setup Tasks > CRM Lists. Sets how this customer was referred to the organization. (Note: If the Marketing Automation feature is enabled, the lead source list originates from your list of campaigns.)

Name: note
Label: Note
Help: Enter a note about this campaign response.

Name: response
Label: Response Detail
Help:
Available values are:
_bounced
_clickedThru
_purchased
_received
_responded
_sent
_subscribed
_unsubscribed

Name: description
Label: Description
Help: Enter an optional description.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: This field is false by default.

Name: name
Label: Name
Help: Enter the name for this campaign metric.

Name: description
Label: Description
Help: Enter an optional description.

Name: externalDescription
Label: External Description
Help: Enter the description of this category that you want to show in the Campaign Subscription Center.

Name: externalName
Label: External Name
Help: Enter the name of this subscription category as you want it to appear in the Campaign Subscription Center.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: This field is false by default.

Name: name
Label: Name
Help: Enter the name for this campaign metric.

Name: subscribedByDefault
Label: Subscribed by Default
Help:
Select this box if you want new and current entities to be subscribed to this campaign subscription.
Do not select this box unless you have provided the appropriate notices and obtained sufficient consent to automatically subscribe new and existing entities for marketing messages.
Entities must manually subscribe to subscriptions that they are unsubscribed to.

Name: unsubscribed
Help:
Check this box, if you want new records to be unsubscribed to this campaign subscription.
Entities must manually subscribe to subscriptions that they are unsubscribed to.

Name: description
Label: Description
Help: Enter an optional description.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: This field is false by default.

Name: name
Label: Name
Help: Enter the name for this campaign metric.

Name: account
Label: Account
Help: Sets the cash or bank account to refund from.

Name: altHandlingCost
Label: Handling Cost
Help: This is the amount the customer was charged for handling.

Name: altShippingCost
Label: Shipping Cost
Help: Defaults to a calculated cost depending on the values selected in the shipMethod field. Costs associated with a given shipMethod can be edited at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Items.

Name: billAddressList
Label: Bill To Select
Help: Sets the billing address for this transaction. This field defaults to the default Billing Address set on the associated Customer record. Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the Customer record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.

Name: ccApproved
Label: Credit Card Approved
Help: Sets the status of the credit card to approved.

Name: ccExpireDate
Label: Expires (MM/YYYY)
Help: Sets the credit card expiration date.

Name: ccIsPurchaseCardBin
Label: Purchase Card BIN
Help:
If you use the Send Purchase Card Data feature, this box is marked when NetSuite determines that the credit card entered is a purchase card. If the Process as Purchase Card box is also checked, this credit card payment will be processed by NetSuite as a purchase card.
Contact your NetSuite account representative for more information.

Name: ccName
Label: Name on Card
Help: Defaults to the cardholder name from the default credit card on the customer's record. If the default credit card is not selected in creditCard, you must provide this value.

Name: ccNumber
Label: Credit Card #
Help:
Use this field to set the credit card number. Enter numbers only, without spaces. Partially masked values are not accepted. Only a 16-digit number is accepted.
On a get, this value is masked.
When searching on this field, you can use only the empty and notEmpty operators.

Name: ccProcessAsPurchaseCard
Label: Send Line-Level Data
Help:
This box is checked when NetSuite has determined that the credit card entered is a purchase card. You can clear this box if you need to process this payment as a Level I payment transaction.
If NetSuite does not recognize the credit card entered as a purchase card but you want to process it as one, check this box.

Name: ccStreet
Label: Card Street
Help: Defaults to the street address from the customer's billing address.

Name: ccZipCode
Label: Card Zip Code
Help: Defaults to the zip or postal code from the customer's billing address.

Name: chargeIt
Label: Process Credit Card
Help: If refund is by credit card, set to TRUE to process the credit to the customer's charge account over the Internet. You must have previously set up a NetSuite merchant account for this to work.

Name: class
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Classes. This field is required when the Make Classes Mandatory preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: createdFrom
Label: Created From
Help:
This field shows the return Authorization this refund is created from.
Click the link to open the return authorization.

Name: creditCard
Label: Cards on File
Help: References the credit card records associated with the customer record.

Name: creditCardProcessor
Label: Payment Processing Profile
Help: References a user-defined Credit Card Processor record at Setup > Company > Credit Card Processors.

Name: currency
Label: Currency
Help:
If you do not use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, the currency of the customer you are creating this transaction for is shown here.
If you use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, select the transaction currency you want to create this transaction in. This customer's primary currency is selected by default.
If you have already selected items on this transaction, selecting a new currency refreshes them to show the price in the new currency (except for items you entered custom prices for) and recalculates tax and gross profit.

Name: currencyName
Label: Currency
Help: A read only field that defaults to the currency associated with the customer referenced by the entity field.

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: If you customized a cash refund form, select it here, or click New to customize a new cash refund form.

Name: debitCardIssueNo
Label: {#Issue#} No.
Help: Sets the debit card authorization number for UK accounts only. The debit card authorization number is printed on the card. Required for users of SecPay or WorldPay.

Name: deferredRevenue
Label: Deferred Revenue
Help:
Deferred Revenue:
amount of revenue deferred on this transaction

Name: department
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when Make Departments Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: discountItem
Label: Discount Item
Help: References a value in a user defined discount list. To create new values, click Lists > Accounting > Items > New and then select Discount.

Name: discountRate
Label: Rate
Help: If the value entered here includes the percent sign, the discount rate applied to the item is calculated as a percent. If the value entered here does not include the percent sign, the discount rate is applied as an absolute discount value. For example, 10% would result in a ten percent discount on the item whereas 10 would result in a ten dollar discount on the item.

Name: discountTotal
Label: Discount Total
Help: This is a read-only field that returns the amount discounted on this Estimate.

Name: entity
Help: Sets the customer this Cash Refund is associated with. Required on Add.

Name: estGrossProfit
Label: Est. Gross Profit
Help: Estimated Gross Profit is a read-only field that equals the revenue amount minus the Est. Cost. At the transaction level, it equals the gross profit of all lines, factoring transaction-level discounts and markups.

Name: estGrossProfitPercent
Label: Est. Gross Profit Percent
Help: Estimated Gross Profit Margin, as a percentage: Read-only field that equals the Est. Gross Profit divided by revenue, expressed as a percentage. At the transaction level, it equals the gross profit percent of all lines, factoring transaction-level discounts and markups.

Name: exchangeRate
Label: Exchange Rate
Help: Defaults to the current currency exchange rate as defined in the currency record. This is only settable on an Add.

Name: excludeCommission
Label: Exclude Commissions
Help: Check this option to exclude this transaction and its subordinate transactions from inclusion in all commission calculations.

Name: handlingCost
Label: Handling Cost
Help: Enter the amount the customer was charged for handling.

Name: handlingTax1Rate
Label: Tax Rate
Help: The tax rate for this tax code is shown here.

Name: handlingTaxCode
Label: Handling Tax Code
Help: Select the tax code that determines the tax for handling charges.

Name: isTaxable
Label: Taxable
Help: If set to true, the entire order is taxable.

Name: job
Help: Select the job associated with the transaction you are refunding.

Name: leadSource
Label: Lead Source
Help:
Select the lead source this transaction is associated with.
If you use the Marketing Automation feature, your list of lead sources is your list of campaigns.
If you do not use Marketing Automation, you can create new lead sources at <_TABNAME=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > CRM Lists > New > Lead Source.

Name: location
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations. This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: memo
Label: Memo
Help: If you wish, enter a memo to describe this cash refund. It will appear on reports such as the 2-line Undeposited Funds register.

Name: message
Help: Defaults to the value selected in messageSel.

Name: messageSel
Label: Select Message
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > New > Customer Message.

Name: nexus
Label: Nexus
Help:
This field shows the nexus of the transaction. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. 
You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different nexus in the dropdown list, the corresponding tax registration number is automatically selected in the Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number field.

Name: otherRefNum
Help: Sets the customer PO number associated with the current Cash Refund.

Name: partner
Label: Partner
Help: References an existing partner record. Defaults to the partner set on the entity record.

Name: paymentMethod
Label: Pmt. Meth.
Help: Reference to a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > New > Payment Method. This value sets the type of card.

Name: pnRefNum
Label: P/N Ref.
Help: If you accept credit card payments, the Verisign authentication code appears here once the payment is approved.

Name: postingPeriod
Label: Posting Period
Help: Required on Add when the Accounting Periods feature is enabled.

Name: promoCode
Label: Promotion
Help: Sets a promotion code to apply to this transaction. Defaults to the default promotion code (if defined) at Setup > Marketing > Marketing Preferences. Customers associated with a partner can only use that partner's promotion codes. If you select a promotion code associated with a partner, this transaction is attributed to that partner for reporting purposes. To view existing Promotion Codes, go to Lists > Marketing > Promotion Codes.

Name: recognizedRevenue
Label: Recognized Revenue
Help:
Recognized Revenue:
cumulative amount of revenue recognized for this transaction

Name: refundCheck
Label: Create {1}
Help: If set the TRUE, the refund will be made by check. If FALSE, the refund will be made by cash or credit card.

Name: revenueStatus
Label: Revenue Status
Help:
The possible values for this field are:
   1. Pending: indicates that no recognition has occurred. All revenue is still deferred.
   2. In Progress: indicates that some recognition has occurred.
   3. Completed: indicates that all recognition has occurred. No deferred revenue remains.

Name: revRecOnRevCommitment
Label: Rev Rec on Rev Commit.
Help:
Check this check box to create a Revenue Commitment or Revenue Commitment Reversal.
    * On a Sales Order, the Revenue Commitment replaces an invoice
    * On a Return Authorization, the Revenue Commitment Reversal replaces a credit memo.
NetSuite creates all applicable Revenue Recognition schedules the Revenue Commitment or Revenue Commitment Reversal.

Name: salesEffectiveDate
Label: Sales Effective Date
Help:
You can change the sales effective date for this transaction.
The sales effective date determines which commission plan and historical sales team this transaction applies to.
If this return is created from a sales transaction, the sales effective date from the sale shown in the Created From field is set by default for this refund.

Name: salesRep
Label: Sales Rep
Help: Defaults to the sales representative associated with the customer referenced by the entity field. This field is NOT available when the Team Selling feature is enabled. If Team Selling is enabled, you must define sales reps in the CashRefundSalesTeamList list.

Name: shipMethod
Label: Ship Via
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Items. Sets the ship method for this transaction.

Name: shippingCost
Label: Shipping Cost
Help: Sets the shipping cost for this transaction. If your account is set up to automatically charge for shipping, this defaults to the value that corresponds to the shipping method selected. Shipping items can be added at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Item.

Name: shippingTax1Rate
Label: Tax Rate
Help: This is a read-only field that returns the tax rate associated with the value set in shippingTaxCode.

Name: shippingTaxCode
Label: Shipping Tax Code
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Taxes > Tax Items.

Name: subsidiaryTaxRegNum
Label: Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number
Help:
This field shows the tax registration number of the transaction nexus. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. 
You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different tax registration number in the dropdown list, the corresponding nexus is automatically selected in the Nexus field.

Name: subTotal
Label: Subtotal
Help: This is a read-only field that returns the total before any discounts, shipping cost, handling cost or tax is added to the order.

Name: syncPartnerTeams
Help: Check this box if you want to update the sales team on the customer's record with changes you make here.

Name: syncSalesTeams
Help: Check this box if you want to update the sales team on the customer's record with changes you make here.

Name: tax2Total
Label: PST
Help: This is a read-only field that returns the PST tax in Canadian Accounts.

Name: taxDetailsOverride
Label: Tax Details Override
Help: Check this box to override the tax information on the Tax Details subtab of the transaction. Only roles with at least the Edit level of the Tax Details Tab permission can override the tax details.

Name: taxItem
Label: Tax
Help:
A tax item is a tax that you collect at one certain rate and pay to one tax agency for this sale. NetSuite inserts the tax item for this customer from the record at Lists > Customers. To change it just for this refund, select another tax item.
To add additional choices to this list, go to Lists > New Item > Sales Tax Item.

Name: taxRate
Label: Tax %
Help: NetSuite inserts the percentage rate of the tax item from its record at Lists > Items. You can change it here for just this transaction if you wish.

Name: taxRegOverride
Label: Tax Registration Override
Help: Check this box to override the values in the Nexus and Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number fields. Only roles with at least the Edit level of the Tax Details Tab permission can override the values that NetSuite automatically selects in these fields.

Name: taxTotal
Label: Tax
Help: This is a read-only field that returns the result of the tax rate multiplied by the taxable total of line items for the transaction.

Name: toBeEmailed
Label: To Be Emailed
Help: Causes the Cash Refund to be mailed to all email addresses included in the email field.

Name: toBeFaxed
Label: To Be Faxed
Help: Causes the Cash Refund to be faxed to the fax number included in the fax field.

Name: toBePrinted
Label: To Be Printed
Help: If enabled, this invoice is saved in a queue of invoices that can be printed at a later date.

Name: toPrint2
Label: Print {1}
Help: If set to TRUE, the refund check is added to the check printing queue. The refundCheck field must also be set to TRUE.

Name: total
Label: Total
Help: This is a read-only field that returns the total of line items, tax and shipping costs.

Name: totalCostEstimate
Label: Est. Cost
Help:
The estimated cost of the specific number of items. This is calculated as:
estimated rate x quantity = estimated cost

Name: tranDate
Label: Date
Help: Required on Add. Defaults to the current date.

Name: tranId
Label: Refund #
Help: Defaults to the largest Cash Refund number incremented by one. You can overwrite with another number.

Name: tranIsVsoeBundle
Label: Transaction Is VSOE Bundle
Help: Check this box to include all items added to this transaction as a VSOE bundle.

Name: validFrom
Label: Valid From / Start Date (MM/YYYY)
Help: Enter the date when this card first became valid. Use the format MM/YYYY.

Name: vatRegNum
Label: VAT Registration
Help: Sets the Tax ID for UK accounts.

Name: vsoeAutoCalc
Label: Auto Calculate VSOE Allocation
Help:
The VSOE allocation amount can be calculated automatically by checking the Auto Calculate VSOE Allocation box. Allocation is the process to determine the VSOE price for items.
 
The total VSOE amount allocated is the revenue amount to be recognized for the bundle.

Name: account
Label: Account
Help: Sets the account to be credited when payment is received via credit card. The undepFunds field must be set to FALSE in order to set this field.

Name: altHandlingCost
Label: Handling Cost
Help:
The handling cost automatically calculates depending on the shipping method you select in the Ship Via field.
To change the cost of handling, go to Lists > Shipping Items and select the shipping method with the handling cost you want to change.

Name: altShippingCost
Label: Shipping Cost
Help: This is a read-only field that returns the shipping costs based on the shipping method selected in shipMethod.

Name: authCode
Label: Auth. Code
Help: Sets the authorization code for the transaction. If you have a NetSuite merchant account, then this field autofills with the authorization code as soon as the charge is approved. If you do not have a NetSuite merchant account, enter the authorization code you receive when the charge to the customer's credit card is validated outside of NetSuite, such as by a card-swipe terminal.

Name: billAddressList
Label: Bill To Select
Help: Sets the billing address for this transaction. This field defaults to the default Billing Address set on the associated Customer record. Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the Customer record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.

Name: ccApproved
Label: Credit Card Approved
Help: Sets the status of the credit card to approved.

Name: ccAvsStreetMatch
Label: AVS Street Match
Help:
References a value in a system list. This value sets the Address Verification Services (AVS) result code returned to VeriSign when a credit card transaction takes place.
Possible values include _Y, _N _X.
The possible values include:
_Y � The address information submitted did match.
_N � The address information submitted did not match.
_X � The credit card company does not support AVS, or no information was returned to VeriSign.
If getAuth is set to True, this value can NOT be set.

Name: ccAvsZipMatch
Label: AVS Zip Match
Help:
References a value in a system list. This value sets the Address Verification Services (AVS) result code returned to VeriSign when a credit card transaction takes place.
Possible values include _Y, _N _X.
The possible values include:
_Y � The address information submitted did match.
_N � The address information submitted did not match.
_X � The credit card company does not support AVS, or no information was returned to VeriSign.
If getAuth is set to True, this value can NOT be set.

Name: ccExpireDate
Label: Expires (MM/YYYY)
Help: Sets the credit card expiration date.

Name: ccIsPurchaseCardBin
Label: Purchase Card BIN
Help:
This box is marked when NetSuite determines that the credit card entered is a purchase card. If you use the Send Purchase Card Data feature and the Process as Purchase Card box is also checked, this credit card payment will be processed by NetSuite as a purchase card.
Contact your NetSuite account representative for more information.

Name: ccName
Label: Name on Card
Help: Defaults to the cardholder name from the default credit card on the customer's record. If the default credit card is not selected in creditCard, you must provide this value.

Name: ccNumber
Label: Credit Card #
Help:
Use this field to set the credit card number. Enter numbers only, without spaces. Partially masked values are not accepted. Only a 16-digit number is accepted.
On a get, this value is masked.
When searching on this field, you can use only the empty and notEmpty operators.

Name: ccProcessAsPurchaseCard
Label: Send Line-Level Data
Help:
This box is checked when NetSuite has determined that the credit card entered is a purchase card. You can clear this box if you need to process this payment as a Level I payment transaction.
If NetSuite does not recognize the credit card entered as a purchase card but you want to process it as one, check this box.

Name: ccSecurityCode
Label: CSC
Help: Enter the three-digit card security code from the back of the customer's credit card.

Name: ccSecurityCodeMatch
Label: CSC Match
Help:
This field shows the Card Security Code (CSC) result code returned to VeriSign when a credit card transaction takes place.
The possible codes are:
   1. Y - The code submitted did match.
   2. N - The code submitted did not match.
   3. X - The credit card company does not support CSC, or no information was returned to VeriSign.

Name: ccStreet
Label: Card Street
Help: Defaults to the street address from the customer's billing address.

Name: ccZipCode
Label: Card Zip Code
Help: Defaults to the zip or postal code from the customer's billing address.

Name: chargeIt
Label: Charge Credit Card
Help: If payment is by credit card, place a check mark in this box to process the credit card charge over the Internet. The effect is the same as swiping a card through a terminal. Funds will move if the card is accepted. If rejected, you will be told why. You must have previously set up a NetSuite merchant account for this to work.

Name: class
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Classes. This field is required when the Make Classes Mandatory preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: createdFrom
Label: Created From
Help: This field reference the Sales Order the current Cash Sales record is associated with.

Name: creditCard
Label: Cards on File
Help: References the credit card records associated with the customer record.

Name: creditCardProcessor
Label: Payment Processing Profile
Help:
Select a credit card processor.
 
For details about credit card processors, click Help and read Setting Up Credit Card Gateways in NetSuite.

Name: currency
Label: Currency
Help:
If you do not use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, the currency of the customer you are creating this transaction for is shown here.
If you use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, select the transaction currency you want to create this transaction in. This customer's primary currency is selected by default.
If you have already selected items on this transaction, selecting a new currency refreshes them to show the price in the new currency (except for items you entered custom prices for) and recalculates tax and gross profit.

Name: currencyName
Label: Currency
Help: A read only field that defaults to the currency associated with the customer referenced by the entity field.

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: If you customized a sales receipt form, select it here, or click New to customize a new sales receipt form.

Name: debitCardIssueNo
Label: {#Issue#} No.
Help: Sets the debit card authorization number for UK accounts only. The debit card authorization number is printed on the card. Required for users of SecPay or WorldPay.

Name: deferredRevenue
Label: Deferred Revenue
Help:
Deferred Revenue:
amount of revenue deferred on this transaction

Name: department
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when Make Departments Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: discountItem
Label: Discount Item
Help: References a value in a user defined discount list. To create new values, click Lists > Accounting > Items > New > Discount.

Name: discountRate
Label: Rate
Help:
If the value entered here includes the percent sign, the discount rate applied to the item is calculated as a percent. If the value entered here does not include the percent sign, the discount rate is applied as an absolute discount value.
For example, 10% would result in a ten percent discount on the item whereas 10 would result in a ten dollar discount on the item.

Name: discountTotal
Label: Discount Total
Help: This is a read-only field that returns the amount discounted on this cash sale.

Name: endDate
Label: End Date
Help: Sets the date for the last cash sale. This should only be set if Advanced Billing is being used. If a cash sale is created from a sales order that includes an End Date, this field autofills on the cash sale when the order is billed.

Name: entity
Help: Sets the customer this cash sale is associated with. Required on Add.

Name: estGrossProfit
Label: Est. Gross Profit
Help: Estimated Gross Profit: Read-only field that equals the revenue amount minus the Est. Cost. At the transaction level, it equals the gross profit of all lines, factoring transaction-level discounts and markups.

Name: estGrossProfitPercent
Label: Est. Gross Profit Percent
Help: Estimated Gross Profit Margin, as a percentage: Read-only field that equals the Est. Gross Profit divided by revenue, expressed as a percentage. At the transaction level, it equals the gross profit percent of all lines, factoring transaction-level discounts and markups.

Name: exchangeRate
Label: Exchange Rate
Help: Required on Add. Defaults to the exchange rate associated with the Customer set in the entity field.

Name: excludeCommission
Label: Exclude Commissions
Help: Check this option to exclude this transaction and its subordinate transactions from inclusion in all commission calculations.

Name: expCostDiscAmount
Help: The amount added to or taken away from the total shows here, based on what is selected in the Discount/Markup field.

Name: expCostDiscount
Help:
Select a discount or markup item to apply to billable expenses applied to this cash sale.
The rate of discount or markup automatically fills in the Rate field and is calculated in the Total.

Name: expCostDiscprint
Help: Check this box if you added a discount or markup to expenses and want to print it on the invoice.

Name: expCostDiscRate
Help:
The rate of the discount or markup item selected shows here.
This rate is applied to the billable expenses you select and calculated in the total for the cash sale.

Name: expCostDiscTaxable
Help: Place a check mark in this box if these expenses are taxable.

Name: expCostTaxCode
Help:
If expenses should be taxed, select the default tax code for all expenses.
If expenses should not be taxed, select -Not Taxable-.
You can edit individual expenses in the list below.

Name: expCostTaxRate1
Help: The tax rate of the code selected shows here.

Name: fob
Label: FOB
Help: Sets the location where the customers technically acquire ownership.

Name: handlingCost
Label: Handling Cost
Help:
The handling cost automatically calculates depending on the shipping method you select in the Ship Via field.
To change the cost of handling, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_SHIPITEM_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_SHIPITEM_> > Shipping Items and select the shipping method with the handling cost you want to change.

Name: handlingTax1Rate
Label: Tax Rate
Help: The tax rate for this tax code is shown here.

Name: handlingTaxCode
Label: Handling Tax Code
Help: Select the tax code that determines the tax for handling charges.

Name: ignoreAvs
Label: Ignore AVS
Help: Check the Ignore AVS box to ignore the results of the Address Verification System (AVS) pre-authorization check. If you choose to ignore the AVS check, when a customer's address information does not match the billing address of the credit card account, then Cybersource still processes the payment.

Name: isRecurringPayment
Label: Recurring Payment
Help:
This box is checked if this cash sale was generated from a sales order for a recurring payment.
Payments marked as recurring can be successfully processed even if the credit card expires during the billing schedule.
You should not check this box for standalone cash sales. You should only check this box for transactions with recurring payments. It can be used for cash sale sales orders with billing schedules or memorized cash sale sales order.

Name: isTaxable
Label: Taxable
Help: If set to true, the entire invoice is taxable.

Name: itemCostDiscAmount
Help: The amount added to or taken away from the total shows here, based on what is selected in the Discount/Markup field.

Name: itemCostDiscount
Help:
Select a discount or markup item to apply to billable items applied to this cash sale.
The rate of discount or markup automatically fills in the Rate field and is calculated in the Total.

Name: itemCostDiscPrint
Help: Check this box if you added a discount or markup and want to print it on the invoice.

Name: itemCostDiscRate
Help:
The rate of the discount or markup item selected shows here.
This rate is applied to the billable items you select and calculated in the total for the cash sale.

Name: itemCostDiscTaxable
Help:
Check the Apply Before Tax box to apply the markup to the price before you charge taxes. 
This applies to every billable item on the sale.

Name: itemCostTaxCode
Help:
If items should be taxed, select the default tax code for all items.
If items should not be taxed, select -Not Taxable-.
You can edit individual items in the list below.

Name: itemCostTaxRate1
Help: The tax rate of the code selected shows here.

Name: job
Help: When the Consolidate Jobs on Sales Transactions preference is enabled, the job field appears as a body field and as a line item field.

Name: leadSource
Label: Lead Source
Help: Defaults to the lead source associated with the entity set in the entity field. If a lead source is not associated with the entity, and a default lead source has been set up, defaults to the value set at Setup > Marketing > Set Up Marketing. The lead source can reference either of the following: If marketing automation is NOT enabled, this field references a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Sales > Setup Tasks > CRM Lists. If marketing automation IS enabled, this field references a value in the campaign list at Lists > Marketing > Campaigns.

Name: location
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations. This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: memo
Label: Memo
Help: Enter a memo to describe this cash sale. It will appear on reports such as the 2-line Undeposited Funds register.

Name: message
Help: Defaults to the value selected in messageSel.

Name: messageSel
Label: Select Message
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists.

Name: nexus
Label: Nexus
Help:
This field shows the nexus of the transaction. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic.
You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different nexus in the dropdown list, the corresponding tax registration number is automatically selected in the Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number field.

Name: opportunity
Label: Opportunity
Help: References all Opportunities associated with the selected Entity.

Name: otherRefNum
Help: Sets the customer PO number associated with the current invoice.

Name: partner
Label: Partner
Help: References an existing partner record. Defaults to the partner set on the entity record.

Name: paymentMethod
Label: Pmt. Meth.
Help: Reference to a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists.. This value sets the type of card.

Name: pnRefNum
Label: P/N Ref.
Help: If you accept credit card payments, the Verisign authentication code appears here once the payment is approved.

Name: postingPeriod
Label: Posting Period
Help: Required on Add when the Accounting Periods feature is enabled. Defaults to the current posting period.

Name: promoCode
Label: Promotion
Help:
Sets a promotion code to apply to this transaction.  In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. 
Note that validation of promotion code date range for a cash sale transaction generated from a sales order is different for Web services vs. the user interface.  In the user interface as long as sales order date was within the promotion code date range, cash sale can be generated without error, even if cash sale date is outside of promotion code date range.  In Web services, cash sale date must be within promotion code date range.

Name: recognizedRevenue
Label: Recognized Revenue
Help:
Recognized Revenue:
cumulative amount of revenue recognized for this transaction

Name: revenueStatus
Label: Revenue Status
Help:
The possible values for this field are:
   1. Pending: indicates that no recognition has occurred. All revenue is still deferred.
   2. In Progress: indicates that some recognition has occurred.
   3. Completed: indicates that all recognition has occurred. No deferred revenue remains.

Name: revRecOnRevCommitment
Label: Rev Rec on Rev Commit.
Help:
Check this check box to create a Revenue Commitment or Revenue Commitment Reversal.
    * On a Sales Order, the Revenue Commitment replaces an invoice
    * On a Return Authorization, the Revenue Commitment Reversal replaces a credit memo.
NetSuite creates all applicable Revenue Recognition schedules for the Revenue Commitment or Revenue Commitment Reversal.

Name: salesEffectiveDate
Label: Sales Effective Date
Help:
You can change the sales effective date for this transaction.
The sales effective date determines which commission plan and historical sales team this transaction applies to.

Name: salesGroup
Help: When team selling is enabled, this references a user defined sales team group at Lists > Relationships > Groups.

Name: salesRep
Label: Sales Rep
Help: Defaults to the sales representative associated with the customer referenced by the entity field. This field is NOT available when the Team Selling feature is enabled. If Team Selling is enabled, you must define sales reps in the CashSaleSalesTeamList list.

Name: shipAddressList
Label: Ship To Select
Help: Sets the shipping address for this transaction. This field defaults to the default Shipping Address set on the associated entity record. Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the entity record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.

Name: shipDate
Label: Ship Date
Help: Sets the ship date for this transaction.

Name: shipMethod
Label: Ship Via
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Items. Sets the ship method for this transaction.

Name: shippingCost
Label: Shipping Cost
Help: Sets the shipping cost for this transaction. If your account is set up to automatically charge for shipping, this defaults to the value that corresponds to the shipping method selected. Shipping items can be added at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Item.

Name: shippingTax1Rate
Label: Tax Rate
Help: The tax rate for this tax code is shown here.

Name: shippingTaxCode
Label: Shipping Tax Code
Help: Select the tax code that determines the tax charged for shipping.

Name: startDate
Label: Start Date
Help: Sets the date for creating the first bill. This should only be set if Advanced Billing is being used.

Name: subsidiary
Help: This field displays the subsidiary associated with this transaction.

Name: subsidiaryTaxRegNum
Label: Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number
Help:
This field shows the tax registration number of the transaction nexus. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. 
You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different tax registration number in the dropdown list, the corresponding nexus is automatically selected in the Nexus field.

Name: subTotal
Label: Subtotal
Help: This is a read-only field that returns the total before any discounts, shipping cost, handling cost or tax is added to the order.

Name: syncPartnerTeams
Help: Check this box if you want to update the sales team on the customer's record with changes you make here.

Name: syncSalesTeams
Help: Check this box if you want to update the sales team on the customer's record with changes you make here.

Name: tax2Total
Label: PST
Help: This is a read-only field that returns the PST tax in Canadian Accounts.

Name: taxDetailsOverride
Label: Tax Details Override
Help: Check this box to override the tax information on the Tax Details subtab of the transaction. Only roles with at least the Edit level of the Tax Details Tab permission can override the tax details.

Name: taxItem
Label: Tax
Help:
A tax item is a tax that you collect at one certain rate and pay to one tax agency for this sale. NetSuite inserts the tax item for this customer from the record at Lists > Customers. To change it just for this sale, select another tax item.
To add additional choices to this list, go to Lists > New Item > Sales Tax Item.

Name: taxRate
Label: Tax %
Help: NetSuite inserts the percentage rate of the tax item from its record at Lists > Items. You can change it here for just this transaction if you wish.

Name: taxRegOverride
Label: Tax Registration Override
Help: Check this box to override the values in the Nexus and Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number fields. Only roles with at least the Edit level of the Tax Details Tab permission can override the values that NetSuite automatically selects in these fields.

Name: taxTotal
Label: Tax
Help: This is a read-only field that returns the result of the tax rate multiplied by the taxable total of line items for the transaction.

Name: timeDiscAmount
Help: The amount added to or taken away from the total shows here, based on what is selected in the Discount/Markup field.

Name: timeDiscount
Help:
Select a discount or markup item to apply to billable time applied to this cash sale.
The rate of discount or markup automatically fills in the Rate field and is calculated in the Total.

Name: timeDiscPrint
Help: Check this box if you added a discount or markup and want to print it on the invoice.

Name: timeDiscRate
Help:
The rate of the discount or markup item selected shows here.
This rate is applied to the billable time you select and calculated in the total for the cash sale.

Name: timeDiscTaxable
Help: Check this box if the discount or markup item selected should be applied to the billable time you select before taxes are calculated for the cash sale.

Name: timeTaxCode
Help:
If time should be taxed, select the default tax code for all time entries.
If time should not be taxed, select -Not Taxable-.
You can edit individual time entries in the list below.

Name: timeTaxRate1
Help: The tax rate of the code selected shows here.

Name: toBeEmailed
Label: To Be Emailed
Help: Causes the Cash Sale to be mailed to all email addresses included in the email field.

Name: toBeFaxed
Label: To Be Faxed
Help: Causes the Cash Sale to be faxed to the fax number included in the fax field.

Name: toBePrinted
Label: To Be Printed
Help: If enabled, this Cash Sale is saved in a queue of invoices that can be printed at a later date.

Name: total
Label: Total
Help: This is a read-only field that returns the total of line items, tax and shipping costs.

Name: totalCostEstimate
Label: Est. Cost
Help: Estimated Cost: Estimated cost of the specific number of items; estimated rate x quantity = estimated cost.

Name: trackingNumbers
Label: Tracking Numbers
Help: Sets the shipping tracking number from the shipping company.

Name: tranDate
Label: Date
Help: Required on Add. Defaults to the current date.

Name: tranId
Label: Sale #
Help: Defaults to the largest Cash Sale number incremented by one. You can overwrite with another number.

Name: tranIsVsoeBundle
Label: Transaction Is VSOE Bundle
Help: Check this box to include all items added to this transaction as a VSOE bundle.

Name: undepFunds
Label: Undep. Funds
Help: Set to TRUE if you receive payment by cash or check. If set to FALSE, set an account in the account field.

Name: validFrom
Label: Valid From / Start Date (MM/YYYY)
Help: Enter the date when this card first became valid. Use the format MM/YYYY.

Name: vsoeAutoCalc
Label: Auto Calculate VSOE Allocation
Help:
The VSOE allocation amount for a sale can be calculated automatically by checking the Auto Calculate VSOE Allocation box.
 
Allocation is the process to determine the VSOE price for items on a sale. The total VSOE amount allocated is the revenue amount to be recognized for the bundle.

Name: amount
Label: Amount
Help:
The charge amount is shown here.
The charge amount is calculated as charge rate multiplied by charge quantity. You can manually override the charge amount.

Name: billingItem
Label: Item
Help:
The service item associated with this charge is shown here.
For project charges, the service item is used to group charges on invoices.
The service item's price is only used to determine the rate if the charge rule used to generate the charge explicitly bases the charge rate on the service item.

Name: billTo
Label: Customer:Project
Help: Choose the project or customer you are billing this charge to.

Name: chargeDate
Label: Date
Help: This is the date this charge was generated or created.

Name: chargeType
Label: Charge Type
Help: This field shows the type of rule or process used to generate this charge.

Name: class
Help: The class associated with this charge is shown here.

Name: createdDate
Label: Date Created
Help: This is the date this charge was created either manually or by a charge run.

Name: currency
Label: Currency
Help: The currency of this charge is shown here.

Name: department
Help: The department associated with this charge is shown here.

Name: description
Label: Description
Help: Enter a description of this charge.

Name: invoice
Label: {#Invoice#}
Help:
If the sales order has been billed, the invoice is shown here.
Charges that have been billed cannot be edited.

Name: invoiceLine
Label: {#Invoice#} Item Line
Help: If this charge has been billed, the invoice line containing this charge is shown here.

Name: location
Help: The location associated with this charge is shown here.

Name: quantity
Label: Quantity
Help:
The quantity for this charge is shown here.
The quantity for a project charge is set to 1.

Name: rate
Label: Rate
Help:
The rate for this charge is shown here.
The charge rates for project charges are determined by charge rules.

Name: rule
Label: Charge Rule
Help: If this is a project charge, the charge rule used to generate this charge is shown here.

Name: salesOrder
Label: Sales Order
Help: If this charge has been included on a sales order, the sales order is shown here.

Name: salesOrderLine
Label: Sales Order Line
Help: If this charge has been included on a sales order, the sales order line is shown here.

Name: stage
Label: Stage
Help:
Choose the status of this charge:
    * Ready - a charge must have this status in order to be billed.
    * Hold - a charge is given this status if it needs to be approved before it is billed or otherwise processed.
    * Processed - a charge with this status has been billed.

Name: timeRecord
Label: Time Entry
Help: The project time record that is being charged by this transaction is shown here.

Name: use
Label: Charge Use
Help:
This field shows the kind of charge this record represents.
Project charges uses include:
    * Actual - These are charges that can be billed when in the Ready stage.
    * Forecast - These charges represent predicted charge amounts over the entire project's life.

Name: account
Label: Account
Help: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: address
Label: Address
Help:
NetSuite inserts the address of the payee from the payee record. 
To enable or disable the Auto Fill preference, go to <_TABNAME=TRAN_USERPREFS_> > Set Preferences.
If you want, you can change it here for just this transaction by typing up to five rows of information.

Name: balance
Label: Balance
Help: This field is returned in an advanced search only. Note that in your advanced search you must set the BodyFieldsOnly flag to false.

Name: billPay
Help:
Check this box to send this check online.
You must follow the set up procedure in How Do I Set Up Online Bill Pay before you can use this feature.
The NetSuite basic package includes a set number of bill pay transactions. Click the Charges may apply link for more information.

Name: class
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Classes. This field is required when the Make Classes Mandatory preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: currency
Label: Currency
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Accounting > Currencies. (Note that the Multiple Currencies feature must be enabled before you can set currency values.) This value sets the currency that all transactions involving this customer are conducted in. If defaults are OFF, this field is required. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: department
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when Make Departments Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: entity
Label: Payee
Help: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: exchangeRate
Label: Exchange Rate
Help: Defaults to the exchange rate associated with the value selected for currency.

Name: landedCostMethod
Label: Cost Allocation Method
Help: Available values are: _quantity, _value, _weight

Name: landedCostPerLine
Label: Landed Cost per Line
Help: Check this box if you want to specify the landed cost per line item.

Name: location
Help: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: memo
Label: Memo
Help: If you want, enter a memo. What you enter here will print on the memo line of the check.

Name: postingPeriod
Label: Posting Period
Help: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: subsidiary
Help:
If you use NetSuite OneWorld, the Subsidiary field defaults to the primary subsidiary associated with the Payee.
Note: If you share vendor records with multiple subsidiaries, you can change the subsidiary from the primary subsidiary to a secondary subsidiary. Changing the subsidiary updates the bank account to that of the selected subsidiary, updates the currency to that of the new bank, and clears the lines on the Expenses and Items subtabs.

Name: tax2Total
Label: PST
Help: Here, NetSuite enters the total amount of PST based on the line items you enter below.

Name: taxTotal
Label: Tax
Help: Here, NetSuite enters the total amount of GST based on the line items you enter below.

Name: toBePrinted
Label: To Be Printed
Help:
If you want to save this in a queue of checks to print, check this box.
Otherwise, to save and print this check now, you can click Save & Print.

Name: tranDate
Label: Date
Help:
NetSuite inserts today's date for the posting date of this check. You can type or pick another date.
What you enter here determines the date range in which this transaction appears on the Bank register.
You can select or enter custom date ranges on registers.

Name: tranId
Help:
NetSuite automatically fills this field.
If you checked the To Be Printed box, this field autofills with To Print. You choose starting numbers when you print those checks.
If you are immediately printing this check, NetSuite increases the largest check number by one. You can type another number here, but the next number reverts to the standard pattern.
You can also use this field to record ACH, ATM, or other reference numbers.

Name: transactionNumber
Label: Transaction Number
Help: This field displays the system-generated number for this transaction type.

Name: userTotal
Label: Amount
Help: You can enter the dollar amount of the check, but NetSuite will update this amount as you add or edit line items.

Name: includeChildren
Label: Include Children
Help: Check the Include Children box to associate the class with all the sub-subsidiaries associated with each subsidiary selected in the Subsidiary field.

Name: isInactive
Label: {1} is Inactive
Help: This field is false by default.

Name: name
Label: Name
Help:
