Enter a name for this class. The name you enter here shows in lists of classes on records and transactions.
The name can be alphanumeric. The maximum number of characters is 31.

Name: parent
Label: Subclass of
Help:
Sets a parent class for this subclass.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: accountingBook
Label: Accounting Book
Help: If the Multi-Book Accounting feature is provisioned in your account, this is the accounting book associated with this consolidated exchange rate.

Name: averageRate
Label: Average Exchange Rate
Help: This is the average exchange rate. This rate is calculated from a weighted average of the exchange rates for transactions applied during the period to accounts with a general rate type of Average. This rate is used to translate accounts in the income statement and to build retained earnings.

Name: currentRate
Label: Current Exchange Rate
Help: This is the current exchange rate. Also referred to as ending rate. This rate is based on the currency exchange rate that is effective at the end of the reported upon period. This rate is used for most asset and liability accounts in the balance sheet.

Name: fromCurrency
Label: From Currency
Help: This is the currency from which the exchange rate is calculated.

Name: fromSubsidiary
Label: From Subsidiary
Help: This is the subsidiary from which the exchange rate is calculated.

Name: historicalRate
Label: Historical Exchange Rate
Help: This is the historical exchange rate. This rate is calculated from a weighted average of the exchange rates for transactions applied during the period to accounts with a general rate type of Historical. This rate is used for equity accounts, or owner's investments, in the balance sheet.

Name: isDerived
Label: Exchange Rate Derived
Help: If this box is checked, the exchange rate is indirect. Indirect rates are rates set between subsidiaries more than one hierarchical level removed from each other, such as a child and grandchild. Indirect rates are always set by the system and cannot be edited or auto calculated by users.

Name: isEliminationSubsidiary
Label: Is Elimination Subsidiary
Help: If this box is checked, the subsidiary associated with this consolidated exchange rate is an elimination subsidiary. You cannot edit the rates for an elimination subsidiary.

Name: isPeriodClosed
Label: Period Closed
Help: If this box is checked, the accounting period is closed.

Name: postingPeriod
Label: Posting Period
Help: This is the posting period for this exchange rate.

Name: toCurrency
Label: To Currency
Help: This is the currency into which the exchange rate is calculated.

Name: toSubsidiary
Label: To Subsidiary
Help: This is the subsidiary to which the exchange rate is calculated.

Name: altEmail
Label: Alt. Email
Help:
Enter an alternative e-mail address for this contact.
This e-mail address appears only on this record.

Name: assistant
Label: Assistant
Help: This is a reference to an existing contact. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: assistantPhone
Label: Assist. Phone
Help:
Enter the phone number for this contact's assistant.
This number appears only on this record.
Phone numbers can be entered in the following formats:999-999-9999, 1-999-999-9999, (999) 999-9999, 1(999) 999-9999 or 999-999-9999 ext 9999 .

Name: billPay
Help:
In order to send this contact payments online, check this box.
You must follow the set up procedure in How Do I Set Up Online Bill Pay before you can use this feature.

Name: comments
Label: Comments
Help:
Enter any other information you want to note about this contact.
These notes appears only on this record.
You can enter up to 999 characters of text.

Name: company
Label: Company
Help:
Select the company this contact works for.
 
This contact appears in contact lists for this company.

Name: contactSource
Label: Lead Source
Help:
Select how this contact came to do business with your company.
If you do not use the Marketing Automation feature, you can create new leads sources at  <_TABNAME=EDIT_CRMOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=EDIT_CRMOTHERLIST_> > CRM Lists > New > Lead Source.
If you have enabled the Marketing Automation feature, this field fills with the names of your campaigns, and you cannot create new lead sources at <_TABNAME=EDIT_CRMOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=EDIT_CRMOTHERLIST_> > CRM Lists. Instead, create new campaigns at <_TABNAME=EDIT_CAMPAIGN_> > Campaigns > New.

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: dateCreated
Label: Date Created
Help: When adding a record, this field defaults to the current system date and time. This field cannot be overwritten. The default value is set regardless of any use default settings.

Name: defaultAddress
Help: The default billing address automatically shows here when you enter and add it using the Address subtab.

Name: email
Label: Email
Help: Sets the email address for this contact. When this contact is invited to an event, a notification is sent to this address.

Name: entityId
Label: Entity ID
Help: Sets how the contact's name appears in all lists

Name: fax
Label: Fax
Help:
Enter a fax number for this record. You should enter the fax number exactly as it must be dialed. If a '1' is required to fax to this number, be sure to include it at the beginning of the number.
The number you enter here automatically appears in the To Be Faxed field of transactions when you select this customer.
To fax NetSuite forms, an administrator must first set up fax service at Setup > Set Up Printing, Fax and E-mail > Fax.

Name: firstName
Label: First Name
Help: This field is required for the Online Bill Pay feature.

Name: globalSubscriptionStatus
Label: Global Subscription Status
Help:
Email recipients can have one of four subscription statuses:
    * Confirmed Opt-In - When an email recipient has indicated that they want to receive your campaign messages, they are assigned this subscription status. Only a recipient can set his or her subscription status to Confirmed Opt-In.
    * Soft Opt-In - Recipients with this status can receive opt-in messages that enable them to confirm whether or not they want to receive your email campaigns as well as email marketing campaigns.
      You can set a recipient’s status to Soft Opt-In manually or through a mass update.
    * Soft Opt-Out - Recipients with this status cannot receive campaign email messages but can receive opt-in messages.
      You can change this subscription status to Soft Opt-In manually or through a mass update.
    * Confirmed Opt-Out - Only the recipient can set their subscription status to Confirmed Opt-Out.
      Recipients with this status cannot receive email campaigns or opt-in messages. Recipients with this status can only opt in again through the Customer Center or by clicking the link in a campaign message they have received prior to opting out.

Name: homePhone
Label: Home Phone
Help:
Enter the contact's home phone number. This number appears only on this record.
Phone numbers can be entered in the following formats:999-999-9999, 1-999-999-9999, (999) 999-9999, 1(999) 999-9999 or 999-999-9999 ext 9999 .

Name: image
Label: Image
Help:
References an existing file in the file cabinet for your account.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: isInactive
Help: This element has a default value of false. If set to true, this contact is not displayed on the Contacts list in the UI and cannot be associated with other records.

Name: isPrivate
Label: Private
Help: This field has a default value of false. If set to true the contact can only be viewed by the user that entered the contact record (as recorded with the login operation).

Name: lastName
Label: Last Name
Help: This field is required for the Online Bill Pay feature.

Name: middleName
Label: Middle Name
Help:
Enter the contact's middle name or initial. This field is optional.
What you enter here automatically appears second in the Contact field.

Name: mobilePhone
Label: Mobile Phone
Help:
Enter the contact's mobile or cell phone number. This number appears only on this record.
Phone numbers can be entered in the following formats:999-999-9999, 1-999-999-9999, (999) 999-9999, 1(999) 999-9999 or 999-999-9999 ext 9999 .

Name: officePhone
Label: Office Phone
Help:
Enter the contact's work phone number. This number appears only on this record.
Phone numbers can be entered in the following formats:999-999-9999, 1-999-999-9999, (999) 999-9999, 1(999) 999-9999 or 999-999-9999 ext 9999 .

Name: phone
Label: Main Phone
Help: This field is required for the Online Bill Pay feature. Must be entered in the following formats:999-999-9999, 1-999-999-9999, (999) 999-9999, 1(999) 999-9999 or 999-999-9999 ext 9999.

Name: phoneticName
Label: Furigana
Help: Enter the furigana character you want to use to sort this record.

Name: salutation
Label: Mr./Ms...
Help:
Enter the contact's salutation.
Examples are Mr., Mrs., Ms. and Miss.

Name: subsidiary
Help:
Select the subsidiary to associate with this contact. You cannot enter transactions for this contact unless a subsidiary is assigned.
 
If you select this contact on a transaction, the transaction is associated with this subsidiary. The contact is able to access only information associated with this subsidiary.
 
Note: Once a transaction has posted for the contact, you are not able to change the subsidiary selected on the contact record.

Name: supervisor
Label: Supervisor
Help: References an existing contact. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: supervisorPhone
Label: Sup. Phone
Help:
Enter the phone number for this contact's supervisor.
This number appears only on this record.
Phone numbers can be entered in the following formats:999-999-9999, 1-999-999-9999, (999) 999-9999, 1(999) 999-9999 or 999-999-9999 ext 9999 .

Name: title
Label: Job Title
Help:
Enter this contact's title at his or her company.
On the record for this contact's company, in the Contacts section, this title appears next to the contacts name.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: Sets whether the current category is active. Defaults to False.  An inactive category cannot be used as a selection.

Name: name
Label: Contact Category
Help: Sets the name that is displayed for selecting this category in the UI.

Name: private
Label: Private
Help: Check this box if you want to be the only one to use this contact category.

Name: sync
Help: Check this box if you want to be able to sync contacts of this category when you synchronize your list of contacts with another device.

Name: description
Label: Description
Help: Enter a description of this note type.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: Sets whether the current category is active. Defaults to False.  An inactive category cannot be used as a selection.

Name: name
Label: Role
Help: Sets the name that is displayed for selecting this category in the UI.

Name: account
Label: Expense Account
Help:
Select the appropriate default account to assign.
If you are entering a payment method, select the default bank account for this payment method. Then, the account autofills the Deposit To field on transactions when this payment method is selected.
If you are creating a landed cost category, select the expense account to be used as a clearing account for the landeded cost of items. Then, when the item is sold, the cost of goods sold is accurately reflected. This field shows only for landed cost category records, not for service or material types.
If you are creating a project expense type select which account you want debited when posting project time transactions. 
Note: If you enable the Expand Accounts preference, you can choose any account, not just bank accounts or expense accounts, when you are creating a landed cost category or a project expense type. 
Enabling the Expand Accounts preference has no effect when you are entering a payment method.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help:
Check this box to remove all references to this record from your account.
You can reactivate the record at any time.

Name: itemCostType
Label: Cost Type
Help:
In the Cost Type field, select one of the following:
    * Landed
    * Material
    * Service
Note: The option for Landed shows only if you have enabled the Landed Cost feature.

Name: name
Label: Name
Help: Enter the name for this record. This name appears in lists that include this record.

Name: code
Label: Code
Help:
Set the name of the promotion code.
Promotion codes can be assigned to lead, prospect, and customer records.

Name: dateSent
Label: Date Sent
Help: This field shows the date the coupon code was sent to the recipient.

Name: promotion
Label: Promotion
Help: This field displays the name of the promotion that the selected coupon code is used with.

Name: recipient
Label: Recipient
Help:
This field displays the recipient of the selected coupon code.
Note that the recipient of the coupon code may differ from the customer who used the coupon code.

Name: used
Label: Used
Help: The coupon has been used by the recipient when the Used box is checked.

Name: account
Label: Account
Help:
Select the Accounts Receivable account that will be affected by this transaction.
Click New to set up a new account.

Name: altHandlingCost
Label: Handling Cost
Help:
The handling cost automatically calculates depending on the shipping method you select in the Ship Via field.
To change the cost of handling, go to Lists > Shipping Items and select the shipping method with the handling cost you want to change.

Name: altShippingCost
Label: Shipping Cost
Help: This is a read-only field that returns the shipping costs based on the shipping method selected in shipMethod.

Name: applied
Label: Applied
Help: A read-only field that returns the amount of credit applied.

Name: autoApply
Label: Auto Apply
Help: If TRUE, credit is automatically applied to the oldest open receivable.

Name: billAddressList
Label: Bill To Select
Help:
Sets the billing address for this transaction. This field defaults to the default Billing Address set on the associated Customer record.
Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the Customer record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.

Name: class
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Classes. This field is required when the Make Classes Mandatory preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. Depending on account configuration, this field may need to be set at the item line level.

Name: currency
Label: Currency
Help:
If you do not use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, the currency of the customer you are creating this transaction for is shown here.
If you use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, select the transaction currency you want to create this transaction in. This customer's primary currency is selected by default.
If you have already selected items on this transaction, selecting a new currency refreshes them to show the price in the new currency (except for items you entered custom prices for) and recalculates tax and gross profit.

Name: currencyName
Label: Currency
Help: A read only field that defaults to the currency associated with the customer referenced by the entity field.

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: If you customized a credit memo form, select it here, or click New to customize a new credit memo form.

Name: deferredRevenue
Label: Deferred Revenue
Help:
Deferred Revenue:
amount of revenue deferred on this transaction

Name: department
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when Make Departments Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. Depending on account configuration, this field may need to be set at the item line level.

Name: discountItem
Label: Discount Item
Help: References a value in a user-defined list created by going to Lists > Accounting > Items > New > Discount.

Name: discountRate
Label: Rate
Help: Defaults to the rate associated with the value set in the discountItem field.

Name: discountTotal
Label: Discount Total
Help:
A read-only calculated field that returns the amount discounted on this credit memo.
If this discount item is taxable, the discount is applied before taxes. If it is not taxable, the discount is applied after taxes.

Name: entity
Help: References an entity record that currently exists in your account. Required on Add.

Name: estGrossProfit
Label: Est. Gross Profit
Help: Estimated Gross Profit: Read-only field that equals the revenue amount minus the Est. Cost. At the transaction level, it equals the gross profit of all lines, factoring transaction-level discounts and markups.

Name: estGrossProfitPercent
Label: Est. Gross Profit Percent
Help: Estimated Gross Profit Margin, as a percentage: Read-only field that equals the Est. Gross Profit divided by revenue, expressed as a percentage. At the transaction level, it equals the gross profit percent of all lines, factoring transaction-level discounts and markups.

Name: exchangeRate
Label: Exchange Rate
Help: Required on Add. Defaults to the exchange rate associated with the Customer set in the entity field.

Name: excludeCommission
Label: Exclude Commissions
Help: Check this option to exclude this transaction and its subordinate transactions from inclusion in all commission calculations.

Name: handlingCost
Label: Handling Cost
Help: Enter the amount the customer was charged for handling.

Name: handlingTax1Rate
Label: Tax Rate
Help: The tax rate for this tax code is shown here.

Name: handlingTaxCode
Label: Handling Tax Code
Help: Select the tax code that determines the tax for handling charges.

Name: isMultiShipTo
Label: Enable Item Line Shipping
Help:
Check this box if you want to allow shipping to more than one address, using alternative shipping methods, for this transaction.  
Checking this box adds the fields Ship To, Carrier and Ship Via fields to the Item line.
Search "Multiple Shipping Routes" in the Help Center for more information.

Name: isTaxable
Label: Taxable
Help: If set to true, the entire order is taxable.

Name: job
Help: Select the project associated with this credit.

Name: leadSource
Label: Lead Source
Help:
Select the lead source this transaction is associated with.
If you use the Marketing Automation feature, your list of lead sources is your list of campaigns.
If you do not use Marketing Automation, you can create new lead sources by going to <_TABNAME=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > CRM Lists > New and clicking Lead Sources.

Name: location
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations. This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. Depending on account configuration, this field may need to be set at the item line level.

Name: memo
Label: Memo
Help: If you wish, enter a memo to describe this credit. It will appear on reports such as the 2-line Accounts Receivable register that your customers can see if you give them permission to log in and view their transaction history.

Name: message
Help: Defaults to the value selected in messageSel.

Name: messageSel
Label: Select Message
Help: References a value in a user-defined list created by going to Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > New > Customer Message.

Name: nexus
Label: Nexus
Help:
This field shows the nexus of the transaction. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. 
You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different nexus in the dropdown list, the corresponding tax registration number is automatically selected in the Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number field.

Name: otherRefNum
Help: Sets the customer PO number associated with the current invoice.

Name: partner
Label: Partner
Help: References an existing partner record. Defaults to the partner set on the entity record.

Name: postingPeriod
Label: Posting Period
Help: Required on Add when the Accounting Periods feature is enabled. Defaults to the current posting period.

Name: promoCode
Label: Promotion
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Marketing > Promotion Codes. If default promotion codes are setup, defaults to the value set at Setup > Marketing > Marketing Preferences. Entities associated with a partner can only use that partner's promotion codes.

Name: recognizedRevenue
Label: Recognized Revenue
Help:
Recognized Revenue:
cumulative amount of revenue recognized for this transaction

Name: revenueStatus
Label: Revenue Status
Help:
The possible values for this field are:
   1. Pending: indicates that no recognition has occurred. All revenue is still deferred.
   2. In Progress: indicates that some recognition has occurred.
   3. Completed: indicates that all recognition has occurred. No deferred revenue remains.

Name: revRecOnRevCommitment
Label: Rev Rec on Rev Commit.
Help:
Check this check box to create a Revenue Commitment or Revenue Commitment Reversal.
    * On a Sales Order, the Revenue Commitment replaces an invoice
    * On a Return Authorization, the Revenue Commitment Reversal replaces a credit memo.
NetSuite creates all applicable Revenue Recognition schedules the Revenue Commitment or Revenue Commitment Reversal.

Name: salesEffectiveDate
Label: Sales Effective Date
Help:
You can change the sales effective date for this transaction.
The sales effective date determines which commission plan and historical sales team this transaction applies to.
If this credit memo is created from a return authorization, the sales effective date from the return shown in the Created From field is set by default for this credit memo.

Name: salesRep
Label: Sales Rep
Help: Defaults to the sales representative associated with the customer referenced by the entity field. This field is NOT available when the Team Selling feature is enabled. If Team Selling is enabled, you must define sales reps in the CreditMemoSalesTeamList list.

Name: shipMethod
Label: Ship Via
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Items. Sets the ship method for this transaction.

Name: shippingCost
Label: Shipping Cost
Help: Sets the shipping cost for this transaction. If your account is set up to automatically charge for shipping, this defaults to the value that corresponds to the shipping method selected. Shipping items can be added at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Items.

Name: shippingTax1Rate
Label: Tax Rate
Help: The tax rate for this tax code is shown here.

Name: shippingTaxCode
Label: Shipping Tax Code
Help: Select the tax code that determines the tax charged for shipping.

Name: subsidiaryTaxRegNum
Label: Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number
Help:
This field shows the tax registration number of the transaction nexus. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. 
You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different tax registration number in the dropdown list, the corresponding nexus is automatically selected in the Nexus field.

Name: subTotal
Label: Subtotal
Help: This is a read-only field that returns the total before any discounts, shipping cost, handling cost or tax is added to the order.

Name: syncPartnerTeams
Help: Check this box if you want to update the sales team on the customer's record with changes you make here.

Name: syncSalesTeams
Help: Check this box if you want to update the sales team on the customer's record with changes you make here.

Name: tax2Total
Label: PST
Help: This is a read-only field that returns the PST tax in Canadian Accounts.

Name: taxDetailsOverride
Label: Tax Details Override
Help: Check this box to override the tax information on the Tax Details subtab of the transaction. Only roles with at least the Edit level of the Tax Details Tab permission can override the tax details.

Name: taxItem
Label: Tax
Help: NetSuite inserts the tax item for this customer from the record at Lists > Customers. To credit a previous sale, duplicate the tax item from that sale.

Name: taxRate
Label: Tax %
Help: NetSuite inserts the percentage rate of the tax item from its record at Lists > Items. To credit a previous sale, duplicate the tax rate from that sale.

Name: taxRegOverride
Label: Tax Registration Override
Help: Check this box to override the values in the Nexus and Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number fields. Only roles with at least the Edit level of the Tax Details Tab permission can override the values that NetSuite automatically selects in these fields.

Name: taxTotal
Label: Tax
Help: This is a read-only field that returns the result of the tax rate multiplied by the taxable total of line items for the transaction.

Name: toBeEmailed
Label: To Be Emailed
Help: Causes the invoice to be mailed to all email addresses included in the email field.

Name: toBeFaxed
Label: To Be Faxed
Help: Causes the invoice to be faxed to the fax number included in the fax field.

Name: toBePrinted
Label: To Be Printed
Help: If enabled, this invoice is saved in a queue of invoices that can be printed at a later date.

Name: total
Label: Total
Help: This is a read-only field that returns the total of line items, tax and shipping costs.

Name: totalCostEstimate
Label: Est. Cost
Help: Estimated Cost: Estimated cost of the specific number of items; estimated rate x quantity = estimated cost.

Name: tranDate
Label: Date
Help: Required on Add. Defaults to the current date.

Name: tranId
Label: Credit #
Help: Defaults to the largest credit memo number incremented by one. You can overwrite with another number.

Name: tranIsVsoeBundle
Label: Transaction Is VSOE Bundle
Help: Check this box to include all items added to this transaction as a VSOE bundle.

Name: unapplied
Label: Unapplied
Help: A read-only field that returns the remaining amount of credit to be applied.

Name: vsoeAutoCalc
Label: Auto Calculate VSOE Allocation
Help:
The VSOE allocation amount can be calculated automatically by checking the Auto Calculate VSOE Allocation box.
 
Allocation is the process to determine the VSOE price for items. The total VSOE amount allocated is the revenue amount to be recognized for the bundle.

Name: currencyPrecision
Label: Currency Precision
Help:
Displays the precision of the currency, which designates the number of digits to the right of the decimal point used in currency transactions. Precision can be zero or two.
The level of decimal precision indicated is used for inventory costing calculations to maintains consistency between inventory costing and reporting. Values in report results are rounded to the base currency precision. This rounding applies to currency values and non-currency values, including formula column values.
To change this read-only field to a dropdown list through which you can change the precision from zero or two, contact NetSuite Technical Support.

Name: displaySymbol
Label: Symbol
Help:
Enter the currency symbol and text to use for this currency. Include spaces if you want to separate the symbol from the currency value.
For example, $ USD or $CAD.

Name: exchangeRate
Label: Default Exchange Rate
Help:
Enter an exchange rate for this currency against the base currency of this company, or if you use OneWorld, for this currency against the base currency of the root parent subsidiary.
For example, if your company is located in Canada and you are defining the U.S. dollar, and the current exchange rate is 1.02 Canadian dollars to 1.00 U.S. dollar, the Default Exchange Rate for the U.S. dollar is 1.02/1.00, or 1.02.
This rate is the basis for rates in the Currency Exchange Rates table that are used in foreign currency transactions. If you use OneWorld, this rate also is the basis for rates in the Consolidated Exchange Rates table that are used in consolidated financials.For more information, see the help topic Setting Currency Exchange Rates.

Name: formatSample
Label: Format Sample
Help: This is a read-only field that displays a sample value formatted according to the value set in the locale field.

Name: fxRateUpdateTimezone
Label: Update Time Zone
Help: Update currency exchange rates daily at approximately 6 am in this time zone.

Name: inclInFxRateUpdates
Help:
If the Currency Exchange Rate Integration feature is enabled in your account, this box is checked to indicate that exchange rates should be updated automatically by the system every day.
Clear this box if you do not want automatic updates to this currency.
If this box is cleared for a base currency, the only automatic updates that occur with that currency are updates to other base currencies. For example, if the definition of GBP as a base currency does not have automatic update enabled, then no updates occur, except with other base currencies, which consider the GBP a foreign currency.

Name: isBaseCurrency
Label: Is Base Currency
Help:
Indicates that this currency is the company's base currency or in OneWorld accounts, the base currency for a subsidiary.
Note: After you have entered transactions in foreign currencies, you cannot change a base currency.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: This field is false by default.

Name: locale
Label: Default Locale
Help: Set the locale for the field. Determines the default values for the formatSample and ISO Code.

Name: name
Label: Name
Help:
Enter a unique name for the currency.
Because many countries use the same name for their currencies, you should use a combined name that includes the country name or abbreviation as well as the name of the currency. For example, pesos are the currency in the Philippines, Uruguay, and Mexico. In the Name field, you might enter “Mexican peso.”
This name appears in the Currency field on records and transactions.

Name: overrideCurrencyFormat
Label: Override Currency Format
Help: Check this box to customize the currency format.

Name: symbol
Label: ISO Code
Help: Determines the way currency figures appear on reports and printed   transactions. Defaults to the symbol associated with the value set in the locale field.

Name: symbolPlacement
Label: Symbol Placement
Help:
Select whether the symbol appears before or after the number.
Note: The symbol position you select in the Symbol Placement field appears only on transaction records. It does not appear on reports.

Name: baseCurrency
Label: Base Currency
Help:
Select the base currency on which this exchange rate is based.
If you use subsidiary management and consolidation, you can select the base currency for any subsidiary to which you have access. If you do not use subsidiary management and consolidation, your base currency is shown here.

Name: effectiveDate
Label: Effective Date
Help: Set the date this exchange rate becomes effective in the Effective Date field.

Name: exchangeRate
Label: Exchange Rate
Help:
Enter an exchange rate for this currency against the base currency of this company, or if you use OneWorld, for this currency against the base currency of the root parent subsidiary.
For example, if your company is located in Canada and you are defining the U.S. dollar, and the current exchange rate is 1.02 Canadian dollars to 1.00 U.S. dollar, the Default Exchange Rate for the U.S. dollar is 1.02/1.00, or 1.02.
This rate is the basis for rates in the Currency Exchange Rates table that are used in foreign currency transactions. If you use OneWorld, this rate also is the basis for rates in the Consolidated Exchange Rates table that are used in consolidated financials.For more information, see the help topic Setting Currency Exchange Rates.

Name: transactionCurrency
Label: Currency
Help:
Select a foreign currency in the Currency field.
For example, if you are setting the exchange rate for the Euro to your base currency, the U.S. dollar, select the name of your base currency, USA in the Base Currency field and then select Euro in the Currency field.

Name: accessRole
Label: Role
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Users/Roles > Manage Roles. This value sets the role assigned to this customer. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: accountNumber
Label: Account
Help: Assigned account number for this customer. Required when ...

Name: aging
Label: Current
Help: The overdue A/R balance is shown here with the balance totals for each aging period.

Name: aging1
Label: 1-30 Days
Help: The overdue A/R balance is shown here.

Name: aging2
Label: 31-60 Days
Help: The overdue A/R balance is shown here.

Name: aging3
Label: 61-90 Days
Help: The overdue A/R balance is shown here.

Name: aging4
Label: Over 90 Days
Help: The overdue A/R balance is shown here.

Name: alcoholRecipientType
Label: Alcohol Recipient Type
Help: FedEx requires that all packages containing alcohol are declared with the intended recipient type on the shipping note. This preference sets the default type for this customer.

Name: altEmail
Label: Alt. Email
Help: Enter an alternative email address for this person.

Name: altName
Label: Customer
Help: This is the name of this person or company.

Name: altPhone
Label: Alt. Phone
Help: Phone numbers can be entered in the following formats: 99...

Name: assignedWebSite
Label: Assigned Web Site
Help:
Use this list to select the web site where you want to assign access to a customer account. The customer will be restricted to using the customer account associated with the web site you select here. 
If you leave this field blank, then the customer has access to all your web sites. If you use OneWorld, customers have access to all web sites under the same subsidiary.

Name: balance
Label: Balance
Help:
Customer's current accounts receivable balance. This field is returned in an advanced search only. It is not returned when using the CustomerSearchBasic search object. Note that in your advanced search you must set the BodyFieldsOnly flag to false. This field is a read-only field.
NetSuite converts the balance of all transactions in foreign currencies to your preferred currency using the exchange rate for the current date.

Name: billPay
Label: Enable Online Bill Pay
Help: When enabled, the companyName, phone, accountNumber field...

Name: buyingReason
Label: Buying Reason
Help: Choose the prospect or customer's reason for buying from your company. You can create additional options for this field at <_TABNAME=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > CRM Lists.

Name: buyingTimeFrame
Label: Buying Time Frame
Help: Select the time frame for the prospect or customer to purchase. You can create additional options for this field at <_TABNAME=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > CRM Lists.

Name: campaignCategory
Label: Campaign Category
Help: References a value in a user defined list at Setup > Marketing > Campaign Categories. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: category
Label: Category
Help: References a value in a user defined list at Setup > Acco...

Name: clickStream
Label: Click-Stream (1st Visit)
Help: Read-only field that returns the click stream for this customer on first visit.

Name: comments
Label: Comments
Help: Enter any other information you wish to track for this customer.

Name: companyName
Label: Company Name
Help: The name of the customer. Required when billPay is enable...

Name: consolAging
Label: Consolidated Current
Help: The overdue consolidated A/R balance is shown here with the balance totals for each aging period. These totals include the balance from all the customers and subcustomers in this hierarchy.

Name: consolAging1
Label: 1-30 Days
Help:
The overdue consolidated A/R balance is shown here with the balance
 totals for each aging period. These totals include the balance from all
 the customers and subcustomers in this hierarchy.

Name: consolAging2
Label: 31-60 Days
Help:
The overdue consolidated A/R balance is shown here with the balance
 totals for each aging period. These totals include the balance from all
 the customers and subcustomers in this hierarchy.

Name: consolAging3
Label: 61-90 Days
Help:
The overdue consolidated A/R balance is shown here with the balance
 totals for each aging period. These totals include the balance from all
 the customers and subcustomers in this hierarchy.

Name: consolAging4
Label: Over 90 Days
Help:
The overdue consolidated A/R balance is shown here with the balance
 totals for each aging period. These totals include the balance from all
 the customers and subcustomers in this hierarchy.

Name: consolBalance
Label: Consolidated
Help: The current accounts receivable balance due for the customer-subcustomer hierarchy this customer is a part of is shown here.

Name: consolDaysOverdue
Label: Consolidated
Help: This field shows the number of days overdue the consolidated overdue balance is.

Name: consolDepositBalance
Label: Consolidated
Help:
This field displays the total amount of unapplied deposits for the customer-subcustomer hierarchy this customer is a member of.
Deposits are recorded in the general ledger, as a liability, when the customer makes an advance payment before delivery of goods or services. A deposit balance exists until the goods or services are delivered. Deposits do not affect the customer's accounts receivable balance.

Name: consolOverdueBalance
Label: Consolidated
Help:
This field shows the consolidated total owed for open transactions for this customer-subcustomer hierarchy that are past their due date based on the invoice terms.
Note: For open transactions that do not have a due date, the transaction date is used as the due date to calculate this total.

Name: consolUnbilledOrders
Label: Consolidated
Help:
This field displays the total amount of orders that have been entered but not yet billed for the customer-subcustomer hierarchy this customer is a part of.
 
If you have enabled the preference Customer Credit Limit Includes Orders, then this total is included in credit limit calculations.
 
Set this preference at <_TABNAME=ADMI_ACCTSETUP_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_ACCTSETUP_> > Set Up Accounting > General.

Name: creditHoldOverride
Label: Credit Hold
Help: This is a read-only field. Possible values include _auto, _on, and _off.

Name: creditLimit
Label: Credit Limit
Help: A credit limit for this customer. If set, and depending on preferences, a warning is generated when this customer's limit is exceeded during a transaction addition.

Name: currency
Label: Currency
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Acco...

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: References an existing custom form for this record type. ...

Name: dateCreated
Label: Date Created
Help:
When adding a record, this field defaults to the current system date and time. This field cannot be overwritten. 
Note: In search, this field respects search criteria down to the second.

Name: daysOverdue
Label: Days
Help: The number of days overdue this balance is overdue is shown here.

Name: defaultAddress
Help: Read-only field that returns the default Billing address ...

Name: defaultOrderPriority
Label: Default Order Priority
Help: Enter a number to designate the priority for this customer.

Name: defaultTaxReg
Label: Default Tax Reg. Number
Help: Select the default tax registration number for this entity.

Name: depositBalance
Label: Deposit Balance
Help:
This field is returned in an advanced search only. It is not returned when using the CustomerSearchBasic search object. 
Note that in your advanced search you must set the BodyFieldsOnly flag to false. 
This field is a read-only field

Name: displaySymbol
Label: Currency Symbol
Help:
Enter a currency symbol and text to use for this currency.  Include spaces if you want to separate the symbol from the currency value.
For example, $ USD or $CAD.
Use the Symbol Placement field to select where the symbol appears.

Name: drAccount
Label: Deferred Revenue Reclassification Account
Help:
Select the deferred revenue account to use by default to post revenue reclassification amounts generated by revenue reclassification journal entries for this customer. 
You can override this account on a sales order for this customer.

Name: email
Label: {1} Email
Help: Sets the email address for the customer. If giveAccess is...

Name: emailPreference
Label: Email Preference
Help: Reference to a value in a system list. Values: _PDF, _HTM...

Name: emailTransactions
Label: Email Transactions
Help:
Set a preferred transaction delivery method for this customer.
 
Choose to send transactions by regular mail, by email, by fax, or by a combination of the three. Then, when you select the customer on a transaction, their preferred delivery method is marked by default.
    * Email – Check this box to check the To Be Emailed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected.
    * Print – Check this box to check the To Be Printed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected.
    * Fax – Check this box to check the To Be Faxed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected.
Once you enter these settings on the customer record, these boxes are checked by default for transactions created from the customer record or for transactions that are copied or converted.
Note: These settings override any customized settings on transaction forms you use.
There are also preferences to set default values for new customer records at Setup > Company > Preferences > Printing, Fax,& Email Preferences. On the Print subtab, Fax subtab, or Email subtab, check Customers Default to [Print/Fax/Email] Transactions.
You can also set these fields using the Mass Update function. Go to Lists > Mass Updates > Mass Updates > General and click Customer.

Name: endDate
Label: End Date
Help: Projected end date for this customer (used in the case of...

Name: entityId
Label: Entity ID
Help: The name of the customer record. Required on add and upda...

Name: entityStatus
Label: Status
Help: References a value in the status list defined at Setup > ...

Name: estimatedBudget
Label: Estimated Budget
Help: Enter the estimated budget the prospect or customer has for this opportunity.

Name: fax
Label: Fax
Help: Sets the fax number for the customer.

Name: faxTransactions
Label: Fax Transactions
Help:
Set a preferred transaction delivery method for this customer.
 
Choose to send transactions by regular mail, by email, by fax, or by a combination of the three. Then, when you select the customer on a transaction, their preferred delivery method is marked by default.
    * Email – Check this box to check the To Be Emailed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected.
    * Print – Check this box to check the To Be Printed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected.
    * Fax – Check this box to check the To Be Faxed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected.
Once you enter these settings on the customer record, these boxes are checked by default for transactions created from the customer record or for transactions that are copied or converted.
Note: These settings override any customized settings on transaction forms you use.
There are also preferences to set default values for new customer records at Setup > Company > Preferences > Printing, Fax,& Email Preferences. On the Print subtab, Fax subtab, or Email subtab, check Customers Default to [Print/Fax/Email] Transactions.
You can also set these fields using the Mass Update function. Go to Lists > Mass Updates > Mass Updates > General and click Customer.

Name: firstName
Label: First Name
Help: Required when the isPerson field is set as TRUE designati...

Name: firstVisit
Label: First Visit
Help: Read-only field that returns the date the customer first ...

Name: fxAccount
Label: Foreign Currency Adjustment Revenue Account
Help:
Select the revenue account to use by default to post foreign currency adjustments that result when exchange rates are different for billing and revenue postings for this customer. You must select an income account.
You can override this account on a sales order for this customer.

Name: giveAccess
Label: Login Access
Help: Enables access to your NetSuite account for the customer.

Name: globalSubscriptionStatus
Label: Global Subscription Status
Help:
Email recipients can have one of four subscription statuses:
    * Confirmed Opt-In - When an email recipient has indicated that they want to receive your campaign and bulk merge email, they are assigned this subscription status. Only a recipient can set his or her subscription status to Confirmed Opt-In.
    * Soft Opt-In - Recipients with this status can receive opt-in messages that enable them to confirm whether or not they want to receive your email campaigns as well as bulk email.
      You can set a recipient’s status to Soft Opt-In manually or through a mass update.
    * Soft Opt-Out - Recipients with this status cannot receive campaign or bulk email messages but can receive opt-in messages.
      You can change this subscription status to Soft Opt-In manually or through a mass update.
    * Confirmed Opt-Out - Only the recipient can set their subscription status to Confirmed Opt-Out.
      Recipients with this status cannot receive email campaigns, bulk email, or opt-in messages. Recipients with this status can only opt in again through the Customer Center or by clicking the link in an email message they have received prior to opting out.

Name: homePhone
Label: Home Phone
Help: Only settable when isPerson is set to TRUE defining this ...

Name: image
Label: Image
Help: References an image file that has already been uploaded t...

Name: isBudgetApproved
Label: Budget Approved
Help: Check this box if the customer's budget has been approved.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: This field is false by default.

Name: isPerson
Label: Is Individual
Help: By default, this is set to True which specifies the type ...

Name: keywords
Label: Search Engine Keywords (1st Visit)
Help: This is a read-only field that returns the search engine ...

Name: language
Label: Language
Help: References a value in the Language system list.

Name: lastName
Label: Last Name
Help: Required when the isPerson field is set as TRUE designating this customer as an Individual.

Name: lastPageVisited
Label: Last Page Visited
Help: This field displays the last page this customer viewed on his or her most recent visit to your Web site.

Name: lastVisit
Label: Last Visit
Help: Read-only field that returns the date the customer first visited the account website.

Name: leadSource
Label: Lead Source
Help: If the Marketing Automation feature is not enabled, references a value in a user-defined list created by going to Setup > Sales > CRM Lists. Sets how this customer was referred to the organization. For details on how to modify this list via Web services, see �LeadSource� in the Records Guide. (Note: If the Marketing Automation feature is enabled, the lead source list originates from your list of campaigns.) In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: mobilePhone
Label: Mobile Phone
Help: Only settable when isPerson is set to TRUE defining this customer as an individual.

Name: negativeNumberFormat
Label: Negative Number Format
Help: Select the customer’s negative number format preference, if any. The format controls whether the negative number is preceded by the minus sign (-) or is enclosed in parentheses ( ).

Name: numberFormat
Label: Number Format
Help: Select the customer’s positive number format preference, if any. The format controls the thousands separator and decimals display.

Name: openingBalance
Label: Opening Balance
Help: Enter the opening balance of this customer's account.

Name: openingBalanceAccount
Label: {1} Account
Help: Select the account this opening balance is applied to.

Name: openingBalanceDate
Label: {1} Date
Help: Enter the date of the balance entered in the Opening Balance field.

Name: overdueBalance
Label: Overdue
Help:
This field is returned in an advanced search only. It is not returned when using the CustomerSearchBasic search object. Note that in your advanced search you must set the BodyFieldsOnly flag to false. This field is a read-only field.
NetSuite converts the overdue balance of all transactions in foreign currencies to your preferred currency using the exchange rate for the current date.

Name: overrideCurrencyFormat
Label: Override Currency Format
Help: Check this box to customize the currency format.

Name: parent
Label: Parent
Help:
If this customer is subcustomer of another customer or a smaller entity of another customer, select the larger parent customer.
If you select a parent customer in this field, this record shows indented under the parent customer in the Customers list.

Name: partner
Label: Partner
Help:
References a partner record. This value sets the partner responsible for referring this customer.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: password
Label: Password
Help: Sets the password assigned to allow this customer access to NetSuite.

Name: password2
Label: Confirm Password
Help: Sets the password confirmation field.

Name: phone
Label: Phone
Help: Enter a phone number for your customer. It will appear on the Customer List report.

Name: phoneticName
Label: Furigana
Help: Enter the furigana character you want to use to sort this record.

Name: prefCCProcessor
Label: Preferred Payment Processing Profile
Help: References a record at Setup > Company > Credit Card Processors. Sets the credit card processor used to process orders. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: priceLevel
Label: Price Level
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > Price Level. This value sets the price level for selling to this customer. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: printOnCheckAs
Label: Print on {1} As
Help: What you enter here prints on the Pay to the Order of line of a check instead of what you entered in the Customer field.

Name: printTransactions
Label: Print Transactions
Help:
Set a preferred transaction delivery method for this customer.
 
Choose to send transactions by regular mail, by email, by fax, or by a combination of the three. Then, when you select the customer on a transaction, their preferred delivery method is marked by default.
    * Email – Check this box to check the To Be Emailed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected.
    * Print – Check this box to check the To Be Printed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected.
    * Fax – Check this box to check the To Be Faxed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected.
Once you enter these settings on the customer record, these boxes are checked by default for transactions created from the customer record or for transactions that are copied or converted.
Note: These settings override any customized settings on transaction forms you use.
There are also preferences to set default values for new customer records at Setup > Company > Preferences > Printing, Fax,& Email Preferences. On the Print subtab, Fax subtab, or Email subtab, check Customers Default to [Print/Fax/Email] Transactions.
You can also set these fields using the Mass Update function. Go to Lists > Mass Updates > Mass Updates > General and click Customer.

Name: receivablesAccount
Label: Default Receivables Account
Help:
Choose the A/R account to use by default on receivables transactions for this customer.
If you select Use System Preference, the account selected at <_TABNAME=ADMI_ACCTSETUP_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_ACCTSETUP_> > Accounting Preferences > Items/Transactions in the Default Receivables Account field is used as this customer's default.

Name: referrer
Label: Referrer (1st Visit)
Help: Read-only field that returns the site that referred the customer to the NetSuite account website.

Name: reminderDays
Label: Reminder Days
Help: Sets the number of days before the end date that a reminder should be sent for renewing a customer's contract or project.

Name: representingSubsidiary
Label: Represents {1}
Help: Indicates that this entity is an intercompany customer. Select the subsidiary this customer represents as a buyer in intercompany transactions.

Name: requirePwdChange
Label: Require Password Change On Next Login

Name: resaleNumber
Label: Resale Number
Help: Customer's  tax license number for cases where you do not collect sales tax from this customer because the merchandise will be resold.

Name: salesGroup
Label: Choose Team
Help: When team selling is enabled, this references a user defined sales team group at Lists > Relationships > Groups. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: salesReadiness
Label: Sales Readiness
Help: Choose how close the prospect or customer is to purchasing. You can create additional options for this field at <_TABNAME=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > CRM Lists.

Name: salesRep
Label: Sales Rep
Help: References an employee record. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: salutation
Label: Mr./Ms...
Help: Enter the title of this person, such as Mr., Mrs., Ms., Dr., Rev., etc.

Name: sendEmail
Label: Send New Access Notification Email
Help: If true, the customer is automatically sent an email notification when access to NetSuite is provided.

Name: shipComplete
Label: Ship Complete
Help: Check this box if you only want to ship orders to this customer when they are completely fulfilled.

Name: shippingItem
Label: Shipping Item
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Items. This value sets the default shipping method for this customer. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: sourceWebSite
Label: Source Web Site
Help: This field is read-only. It shows the web site where the customer registered for a customer account.

Name: startDate
Label: Start Date
Help:
Enter the date this person or company became a customer, lead or prospect.
If this person or company has a contract with you, enter the start date of the contract.
If you enter an estimate or an opportunity for this customer, this field will be updated with the date of that transaction.

Name: subsidiary
Help:
Select the subsidiary to associate with this entity or job. You cannot enter transactions for this entity or job unless a subsidiary is assigned.
 
If you select this entity on a transaction, the transaction is associated with this subsidiary. The entity is able to access only information associated with this subsidiary.
 
Note: Once a transaction has posted for the entity or job, you are not able to change the subsidiary selected on the entity or job record.

Name: symbolPlacement
Label: Symbol Placement
Help: Select whether the symbol appears before or after the number.

Name: syncPartnerTeams
Label: Update Transactions
Help: Check this box if you want to update this customer's transactions to reflect the changes you make to the partner team.

Name: taxable
Label: Taxable
Help: True indicates that this customer pays sales tax according to the rate defined in the tax Item field. False indicates that this customer does not pay sales tax, but only if Tax Item field is empty.

Name: taxItem
Label: Tax Code
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Taxes > Tax Codes. This value provides the standard tax rate associated with this customer. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: terms
Label: Terms
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > Term. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: territory
Label: Territory
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Sales > Sales Management > Sales Territories. This value sets the sales territory this customer belongs in. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: thirdPartyAcct
Label: 3rd Party Billing Account Number
Help:
Enter this customer’s FedEx® or UPS® account number in the 3rd Party Billing Account Number field.
This account number is used if you select Consignee Billing on item fulfillments using UPS or select Bill Recipient on item fulfillments using FedEx.

Name: thirdPartyCountry
Label: 3rd Party Billing Country
Help: Select the country associated with the customer’s UPS or FedEx account number.

Name: thirdPartyZipcode
Label: 3rd Party Billing Zip
Help: Enter the zip code associated with the customer’s UPS or FedEx account number.

Name: title
Label: Job Title
Help: Enter the job title for this person's position at his or her company.

Name: unbilledOrders
Label: Unbilled Orders
Help:
This field displays the total amount of orders that have been entered but not yet billed.
If you have enabled the preference Customer Credit Limit Includes Orders, then this total is included in credit limit calculations.
Set this preference at <_TABNAME=ADMI_ACCTSETUP_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_ACCTSETUP_> > Set Up Accounting > General.
If you use the Multiple Currencies feature, the amount in this field is shown in the customer's currency.

Name: url
Label: URL
Help: Sets the URL associated with the customer.

Name: vatRegNumber
Label: VAT Registration No.
Help: For the UK edition only. Note that this field is not validated when submitted via Web services.

Name: visits
Label: Number of Visits
Help:
This field displays the total number of visits this customer has made to your Web site.
A new visit is counted after the customer leaves your site and returns.

Name: webLead
Label: Web Lead
Help: This is a read-only hidden field that defines whether a customer registered via a NetSuite website. It returns a string of either Yes or No.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help:
Check this box to remove all references to this record from your account.
You can reactivate the record at any time.

Name: name
Label: Customer
Help: Enter the name for this record. This name appears in lists that include this record.

Name: authCode
Label: Auth. Code
Help:
If you have a NetSuite merchant account, then this field autofills with the authorization code as soon as the charge is approved.
If you do not have a NetSuite merchant account, enter the authorization code you receive when the charge to the customer's credit card is validated outside of NetSuite, such as by a card-swipe terminal.

Name: ccApproved
Label: Credit Card Approved
Help:
Place a check mark in this box only if the credit card transaction has been performed outside NetSuite, such as by a card-swipe terminal.
If you have a NetSuite merchant account, then this field is automatically filled as soon as the transaction is approved.

Name: ccAvsStreetMatch
Label: AVS Street Match
Help:
This field shows the Address Verification Services (AVS) result code returned to VeriSign when a credit card transaction takes place.
The possible codes are:
   1. Y  The address information submitted did match.
   2. N  The address information submitted did not match.
   3. X  The credit card company does not support AVS, or no information was returned to VeriSign.

Name: ccAvsZipMatch
Label: AVS Zip Match
Help:
This field shows the Address Verification Services (AVS) result code returned to VeriSign when a credit card transaction takes place.
The possible codes are:
   1. Y  The address information submitted did match.
   2. N  The address information submitted did not match.
   3. X  The credit card company does not support AVS, or no information was returned to VeriSign.

Name: ccExpireDate
Label: Expires (MM/YYYY)
Help: Enter the credit card's expiration date using this format: MM/YYYY.

Name: ccIsPurchaseCardBin
Label: Purchase Card BIN
Help:
If you use the Send Purchase Card Data feature, this box is marked when NetSuite determines that the credit card entered is a purchase card. If the Process as Purchase Card box is also checked, this credit card payment will be processed by NetSuite as a purchase card.
Contact your NetSuite account representative for more information.

Name: ccName
Label: Name on Card
Help:
NetSuite enters the cardholder name from the default credit card on the customer's record.
If the field contains no value or the wrong value, check the customer's record at <_TABNAME=LIST_CUSTJOB_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CUSTJOB_> > Customers. On the Financial subtab of the customer's record, verify that the Cardholder Name field contains the correct information.

Name: ccNumber
Label: Credit Card #
Help:
Use this field to set the credit card number. Enter numbers only, without spaces. Partially masked values are not accepted. Only a 16-digit number is accepted.
On a get, this value is masked.
When searching on this field, you can use only the empty and notEmpty operators.

Name: ccProcessAsPurchaseCard
Label: Send Line-Level Data
Help:
This box is checked when NetSuite has determined that the credit card entered is a purchase card. You can clear this box if you need to process this payment as a Level I payment transaction.
If NetSuite does not recognize the credit card entered as a purchase card but you want to process it as one, check this box.

Name: ccSecurityCode
Label: CSC
Help: Enter the three-digit card security code on the back of the customer's credit card.

Name: ccSecurityCodeMatch
Label: CSC Match
Help:
This field shows the Card Security Code (CSC) result code returned to VeriSign when a credit card transaction takes place.
The possible codes are:
   1. Y  The code submitted did match.
   2. N  The code submitted did not match.
   3. X  The credit card company does not support CSC, or no information was returned to VeriSign.

Name: ccStreet
Label: Card Street
Help:
NetSuite enters the street address from the customer's billing address.
If the field contains no value or the wrong value, check the customer's record at <_TABNAME=LIST_CUSTJOB_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CUSTJOB_> > Customers. On the Address subtab of the customer's record, make sure the default billing address contains the correct street address.

Name: ccZipCode
Label: Card Zip Code
Help:
NetSuite enters the zip or postal code from the customer's billing address.
If the field contains no value or the wrong value, check the customer's record at <_TABNAME=LIST_CUSTJOB_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CUSTJOB_> > Customers. On the Address subtab of the customer's record, make sure the default billing address contains the correct zip or postal code.

Name: chargeIt
Label: Process Credit Card
Help: If payment is by credit card, place a check mark in this box to process the credit card charge over the Internet. The effect is the same as swiping a card through a terminal. Funds will move if the card is accepted. If rejected, you will be told why. You must have previously set up a NetSuite merchant account for this to work.

Name: checkNum
Label: Check #
Help: If your customer paid by check, enter the number here.

Name: class
Help:
Select a class to associate with this transaction.
To create a new class, select New.
For details on existing classes, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_CLASS_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CLASS_> > Classes.

Name: creditCard
Label: Cards on File
Help:
Select a credit card stored on the customer record to use as the payment method for this deposit.
Click New to enter a new credit card.

Name: creditCardProcessor
Label: Payment Processing Profile
Help:
Select the credit card processor you want to use for this transaction.
You can set up credit card processors at <_TABNAME=ADMI_CREDCARD_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_CREDCARD_> > Set Up Credit Card Processing.

Name: currency
Label: Currency
Help:
If you do not use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, the currency of the customer you are creating this transaction for is shown here.
If you use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, select the transaction currency you want to create this transaction in. This customer's primary currency is selected by default.
If you have already selected items on this transaction, selecting a new currency refreshes them to show the price in the new currency (except for items you entered custom prices for) and recalculates tax and gross profit.

Name: currencyName
Label: Currency
Help:
This customer's currency is shown in this field.
All currency amounts on this transaction are shown in this currency.

Name: customer
Help:
Select the customer. If you are using projects, select the appropriate project rather than the master customer account.
Click New to set up a new customer. Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_CUSTJOB_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CUSTJOB_> > Customers for details about existing customers and projects.

Name: debitCardIssueNo
Label: {#Issue#} No.
Help: If the card is a debit card, enter the card's issue number.

Name: department
Help:
Select a department to associate with this deposit.
To create a new department, select New.
For details on existing departments, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_DEPARTMENT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_DEPARTMENT_> > Departments.

Name: exchangeRate
Label: Exchange Rate
Help:
The currency's exchange rate is shown in this field.
You can edit the exchange rate for this transaction only, or you can update the currency record with the exchange rate you enter here.

Name: ignoreAvs
Label: Ignore AVS
Help:
Check the Ignore AVS box to ignore the results of the Address Verification System (AVS) pre-authorization check.
 
If you choose to ignore the AVS check, when a customer's address information does not match the billing address of the credit card account, then Cybersource still processes the payment.

Name: isRecurringPayment
Label: Recurring Payment
Help:
This box is checked if this cash sale was generated from a sales order for a recurring payment.
Payments marked as recurring can be successfully processed even if the credit card expires during the billing schedule.
You should not check this box for standalone cash sales. You should only check this box for transactions with recurring payments. It can be used for cash sale sales orders with billing schedules or memorized cash sale sales order.

Name: location
Help:
Select a location to associate with this transaction.
To create a new location, select New.
For details on existing locations, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_LOCATION_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_LOCATION_> > Locations.

Name: memo
Label: Memo
Help: Enter a Memo to identify this deposit transaction.

Name: payment
Label: Payment Amount
Help: Enter the curency amount of the deposit here.

Name: paymentMethod
Label: Pmt. Meth.
Help:
Select the payment method for this deposit.
To add additional choices to this list, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_ACCOUNTINGOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_ACCOUNTINGOTHERLIST_> > Accounting Lists > New > Payment Method.

Name: pnRefNum
Label: P/N Ref.
Help: If you accept credit card payments, the Verisign authentication code appears here once the payment is approved.

Name: postingPeriod
Label: Posting Period
Help:
Select the period you want to post this deposit to.
If a period is closed, you cannot post to that period.

Name: salesOrder
Label: Sales Order
Help:
This deposit is reserved for the sales order shown here. This deposit can only be applied to this order.
If this deposit amount exceeds the sales order amount, the excess is used to create a separate deposit that can be applied to any invoice.

Name: tranDate
Label: Date
Help:
NetSuite inserts today's date for this deposit. You can enter or select another date.
What you enter here determines the date range in which this transaction appears on the Accounts Receivable Register.
Deposits are recorded in your general ledger as a liability until the goods or services are actually delivered and do not affect the customer's accounts receivable balance.

Name: tranId
Label: Deposit #
Help: The system generated deposit number.

Name: undepFunds
Label: Undep. Funds
Help:
* If you receive payment by cash or check, click
      Undep. Funds.
      Once you deposit the money, you will need to go to <_TABNAME=EDIT_TRAN_DEPOSIT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=EDIT_TRAN_DEPOSIT_> > Make Deposits.
    * If you receive payment by credit card, click Account
      and select the account to be credited.

Name: validFrom
Label: Valid From / Start Date (MM/YYYY)
Help: Enter the date when this card first became valid.

Name: description
Label: Long Text
Help: Enter a description of this other list item.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help:
Check this box to remove all references to this record from your account.
You can reactivate the record at any time.

Name: name
Label: Customer Message
Help: Enter the name for this record. This name appears in lists that include this record.

Name: preferred
Label: Preferred
Help: Terms set on customer records override terms marked as preferred here.

Name: account
Label: Account
Help: Sets the account used for payments already deposited. Required when undepFunds is set to FALSE.

Name: applied
Label: Applied
Help: A read-only field that returns the total of payments applied.

Name: arAcct
Label: A/R Account
Help:
Select the Accounts Receivable account that will be affected by this transaction.
Click —New — to set up a new account.

Name: authCode
Label: Auth. Code
Help:
Sets the authorization code for the transaction.
If you have a NetSuite merchant account, then this field autofills with the authorization code as soon as the charge is approved.
If you do not have a NetSuite merchant account, enter the authorization code you receive when the charge to the customer's credit card is validated outside of NetSuite, such as by a card-swipe terminal.

Name: autoApply
Label: Auto Apply
Help: If set to TRUE, payments are automatically applied to the oldest open receivable.

Name: balance
Label: Current Balance
Help:
A read-only field that returns the balance in the customer's account.
This field is returned in an advanced search only. Note that in your advanced search you must set the BodyFieldsOnly flag to false. This field is a read-only field.

Name: ccApproved
Label: Credit Card Approved
Help: Sets the status of the credit card to approved.

Name: ccAvsStreetMatch
Label: AVS Street Match
Help:
References a value in a system list. This value sets the Address Verification Services (AVS) result code returned to VeriSign when a credit card transaction takes place.
Possible values include _Y, _N _X.
The possible values include:
_Y � The address information submitted did match.
_N � The address information submitted did not match.
_X � The credit card company does not support AVS, or no information was returned to VeriSign.
If getAuth is set to True, this value can NOT be set.

Name: ccAvsZipMatch
Label: AVS Zip Match
Help:
References a value in a system list. This value sets the Address Verification Services (AVS) result code returned to VeriSign when a credit card transaction takes place.
Possible values include _Y, _N _X.
The possible values include:
_Y � The address information submitted did match.
_N � The address information submitted did not match.
_X � The credit card company does not support AVS, or no information was returned to VeriSign.
If getAuth is set to True, this value can NOT be set.

Name: ccExpireDate
Label: Expires (MM/YYYY)
Help: Sets the credit card expiration date.

Name: ccIsPurchaseCardBin
Label: Purchase Card BIN
Help:
This box is marked when NetSuite determines that the credit card entered is a purchase card. If you use the Send Purchase Card Data feature and the Process as Purchase Card box is also checked, this credit card payment will be processed by NetSuite as a purchase card.
Contact your NetSuite account representative for more information.

Name: ccName
Label: Name on Card
Help: Defaults to the cardholder name from the default credit card on the customer's record. If the default credit card is not selected in creditCard, you must provide this value.

Name: ccNumber
Label: Credit Card #
Help:
Use this field to set the credit card number. Enter numbers only, without spaces. Partially masked values are not accepted. Only a 16-digit number is accepted.
On a get, this value is masked.
When searching on this field, you can use only the empty and notEmpty operators.

Name: ccProcessAsPurchaseCard
Label: Send Line-Level Data
Help:
This box is checked when NetSuite has determined that the credit card entered is a purchase card. You can clear this box if you need to process this payment as a Level I payment transaction.
If NetSuite does not recognize the credit card entered as a purchase card but you want to process it as one, check this box.

Name: ccSecurityCode
Label: CSC
Help: Settable only if the Use Card Security Code for Credit Card Transactions company preference is enabled at Set Up > Accounting > Set Up Accounting.

Name: ccSecurityCodeMatch
Label: CSC Match
Help:
References a value in a system list. Possible values include:
_Y � The security code information submitted did match.
_N � The security code information submitted did not match.
_X � The credit card company does not support security codes.

Name: ccStreet
Label: Card Street
Help: Defaults to the street address from the customer's billing address.

Name: ccZipCode
Label: Card Zip Code
Help: Defaults to the zip or postal code from the customer's billing address.

Name: chargeIt
Label: Charge Credit Card
Help: Check this box to make this payment by charging the credit card chosen in the Credit Card Select field.

Name: checkNum
Label: Check #
Help: Sets the check number used for the payment.

Name: class
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Classes. This field is required when the Make Classes Mandatory preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: creditCard
Label: Cards on File
Help: References the credit card records associated with the customer record.

Name: creditCardProcessor
Label: Payment Processing Profile
Help: References a user-defined Credit Card Processor record at Setup > Company > Credit Card Processors.

Name: currency
Label: Currency
Help:
If you do not use the Multiple Currencies or Multi-Currency Customers features, the currency of the customer for whom you are creating this transaction is shown here.
If you use the Multiple Currencies or Multi-Currency Customers features, select the transaction currency in which you want to accept payment. This customer's primary currency is selected by default.
The currency you select filters the list of invoices to which you can apply payment, and lists of credits and deposits you can apply.
If you are accepting payment through a top-level customer, you can make payments toward any invoices entered for a customer in the hierarchy as long as the invoice currency is set as a transaction currency for that top-level parent.
Important: Beginning with Version 2014 Release 2, the capabilities associated with the Multiple Currencies, Multi-Currency Customers, and Multi-Currency Vendors features are combined in the Multiple Currencies feature. If you are new to NetSuite, already using all three features, or not using all three features, only the Multiple Currencies box will appear on the Company subtab of the Enable Features page. You can enable or disable this feature. When you enable this feature, you gain access to support for multiple currency customers and vendors. If you are already using Multiple Currencies and Multi-Currency Customers or Multi-Currency Vendors but not all three features, you will continue to see and maintain three boxes on the Company subtab. Regardless of the number of boxes visible in your account, the purpose associated with these three features remains the same.

Name: currencyName
Label: Currency
Help: A read only field that defaults to the currency associated with the customer referenced by the entity field.

Name: customer
Help: References an exiting customer or job record. Required on Add.

Name: debitCardIssueNo
Label: {#Issue#} No.
Help: Sets the debit card authorization number for UK accounts only. The debit card authorization number is printed on the card. Required for users of SecPay or WorldPay.

Name: department
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments.

Name: exchangeRate
Label: Exchange Rate
Help: Required on Add. Defaults to the rate associated with the customer set in the customer field.

Name: ignoreAvs
Label: Ignore AVS
Help:
Check the Ignore AVS box to ignore the results of the Address Verification System (AVS) pre-authorization check.
 
If you choose to ignore the AVS check, when a customer's address information does not match the billing address of the credit card account, then Cybersource still processes the payment.

Name: isRecurringPayment
Label: Recurring Payment
Help:
This box is checked if this payment was created for a recurring cash sale.
Payments marked as recurring can be successfully processed even if the credit card expires during the billing schedule.
You should not check this box for standalone payments. You should only check this box for transactions with recurring payments.
It can be used for cash sale sales orders with billing schedules or memorizes cash sale sales orders.

Name: location
Help: This field is only settable if the Mulit-Location Inventory (MLI) feature is turned off.
