Name: memo
Label: Memo
Help: If you wish, enter a memo to describe this payment. It will appear on reports such as the 2-line Accounts Receivable register that NetSuite merchants and their guest-customers can see (if given permission to log in and view their transaction history).

Name: payment
Label: Payment Amount
Help: Sets the total amount of payment for this customer.

Name: paymentMethod
Label: Pmt. Meth.
Help: Reference to a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > New > Payment Method. This value sets the type of card.

Name: pending
Label: Pending
Help: A read-only field that returns the sum of unapproved credit card payments for the customer.

Name: pnRefNum
Label: P/N Ref.
Help: If you accept credit card payments, the Verisign authentication code appears here once the payment is approved.

Name: postingPeriod
Label: Posting Period
Help: Required on Add when the Accounting Periods feature is enabled.

Name: subsidiary
Help: This field shows the subsidiary associated with this transaction.

Name: total
Label: To Apply
Help: NetSuite adds the payment amount from above plus any credits you have chosen to apply and displays the total here.

Name: tranDate
Label: Date
Help: Required on Add. Defaults to the current date.

Name: tranId
Label: Payment #
Help: This is the document number automatically generated for the transaction by NetSuite.

Name: unapplied
Label: Unapplied
Help: A read-only field that returns the difference between amounts available to apply to payments and payments  applied.

Name: undepFunds
Label: Undep. Funds
Help: Set to TRUE if entering a payment that will be deposited to a bank account later. If set to FALSE, set an account in the account field.

Name: validFrom
Label: Valid From / Start Date (MM/YYYY)
Help: Enter the date when this card first became valid.

Name: account
Label: Account
Help: Sets the Accounts Receivable account that will be affected by this refunded transaction.

Name: address
Label: Address
Help: Read-only field that returns the billAddressList field value.

Name: arAcct
Label: A/R Account
Help:
Select the Accounts Receivable account that will be affected by this transaction.
Click —New — to set up a new account.

Name: balance
Label: Current Balance
Help: A read-only field that returns the balance in the customer�s account.

Name: ccApproved
Label: Credit Card Approved
Help: Sets the status of the credit card to approve.

Name: ccExpireDate
Label: Expires (MM/YYYY)
Help: Sets the credit card expiration date.

Name: ccIsPurchaseCardBin
Label: Purchase Card BIN
Help:
If you use the Send Purchase Card Data feature, this box is marked when NetSuite determines that the credit card entered is a purchase card. If the Process as Purchase Card box is also checked, this credit card payment will be processed by NetSuite as a purchase card.
Contact your NetSuite account representative for more information.

Name: ccName
Label: Name on Card
Help: Defaults to the cardholder name from the default credit card on the customer's record. If the default credit card is not selected in creditCard, you must provide this value.

Name: ccNumber
Label: Credit Card #
Help: Sets the card number here. Enter numbers only, without spaces. On a get, this information is masked.

Name: ccProcessAsPurchaseCard
Label: Send Line-Level Data
Help:
This box is checked when NetSuite has determined that the credit card entered is a purchase card. You can clear this box if you need to process this payment as a Level I payment transaction.
If NetSuite does not recognize the credit card entered as a purchase card but you want to process it as one, check this box.

Name: ccStreet
Label: Card Street
Help: Defaults to the street address from the customer's billing address.

Name: ccZipCode
Label: Card Zip Code
Help: Defaults to the zip or postal code from the customer's billing address.

Name: chargeIt
Label: Process Credit Card
Help: If refund is by credit card, place a check mark in this box to process the credit to the customer's charge account over the Internet. You must have previously set up a NetSuite merchant account for this to work.

Name: creditCard
Label: Cards on File
Help: References the credit card records associated with the customer record.

Name: creditCardProcessor
Label: Payment Processing Profile
Help:
Select the credit card processor you want to use for this transaction.
You can set up credit card processors at <_TABNAME=ADMI_CREDCARD_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_CREDCARD_> > Set Up Credit Card Processing.

Name: currency
Label: Currency
Help:
If you do not use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, the currency of the customer you are creating this transaction for is shown here.
If you use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, select the currency of the credits or deposits you want to refund. The currency selected in the Currency field filters the list of credits and deposits on the Apply subtab.

Name: currencyName
Label: Currency
Help: A read only field that defaults to the currency associated with the customer referenced by the entity field.

Name: customer
Help: References an existing customer record.

Name: debitCardIssueNo
Label: {#Issue#} No.
Help: If the card is a debit card, enter the card's issue number.

Name: department
Help:
Choose a department to associate with this transaction.
Click New to enter a new department.
Go to Lists > Departments for details about existing departments.

Name: exchangeRate
Label: Exchange Rate
Help: Defaults to the current currency exchange rate as defined in the currency record. This is only settable on an Add.

Name: location
Help:
Choose a location to associate with this transaction.
Select New to enter a new location record.
Go to Lists > Locations for details about existing location records.

Name: memo
Label: Memo
Help:
Enter an optional memo to describe this refund.
For example, you may want to include the original transaction number on the refund.
This memo appears on issued checks and register reports.

Name: paymentMethod
Label: Pmt. Meth.
Help: Reference to a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > New > Payment Method. This value sets the type of card.

Name: pnRefNum
Label: P/N Ref.
Help: If you accept credit card payments, the Verisign authentication code appears here once the transaction is approved.

Name: postingPeriod
Label: Posting Period
Help: Required on Add when the Accounting Periods feature is enabled.

Name: subsidiary
Help: This field shows the subsidiary associated with this transaction.

Name: toBePrinted
Label: To Be Printed
Help: If enabled, this invoice is saved in a queue of invoices that can be printed at a later date.

Name: total
Label: Refund Amount
Help: This is a read-only field that returns the total of line items, tax and shipping costs.

Name: tranDate
Label: Date
Help: Required on Add. Defaults to the current date.

Name: tranId
Help: Defaults to the largest Customer Refund number incremented by one. You can overwrite with another number.

Name: transactionNumber
Label: Transaction Number
Help: The number automatically generated for the transaction by NetSuite.

Name: validFrom
Label: Valid From / Start Date (MM/YYYY)
Help: Enter the date when this card first became valid.

Name: description
Label: Description
Help:
Enter a description of this customer status.
This field can hold 199 characters.

Name: includeInLeadReports
Label: Include In Lead Reports
Help: Check this box if you want records with this status to appear in leads reports.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: Check this box to inactivate this status.

Name: name
Label: Status
Help:
Enter a title for this status.
What you enter here appears in the Status field of lead, prospect or customer records, depending on the stage you select.
If you select the stage Prospect, this status also appears in the Status field of Estimates.

Name: probability
Label: Probability
Help: Enter the likelihood a lead, prospect or customer with this status will purchase from your company.

Name: stage
Label: Stage
Help: Select which stage in the sales cycle this customer status represents.

Name: subsidiary
Help:
Select the subsidiary to associate with this entity or job. You cannot enter transactions for this entity or job unless a subsidiary is assigned.
 
If you select this entity on a transaction, the transaction is associated with this subsidiary. The entity is able to access only information associated with this subsidiary.
 
Note: Once a transaction has posted for the entity or job, you are not able to change the subsidiary selected on the entity or job record.

Name: customForm
Help: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: name
Help: Enter a name for this record.

Name: owner
Help:
The owner is the user who created this record.
By default, the owner is set to the current user.
If this field appears as a dropdown or popup field, you can change the owner to another user.

Name: defaultSelection
Help: To create a static default for the segment, use this dropdown list to select the default value. The static default is overwritten if a dynamic default is generated. (Dynamic defaults are configured by using the Source List dropdown list on the Application & Sourcing subtab.)

Name: description
Help: If appropriate, enter notes about the segment. Th description is visible only on this page, for people who have permission to view or edit the segment.

Name: fieldType
Help:
This choice determines whether a user setting a value for the segment on a record can save multiple selections, as follows:
    * List/Record - The user can save only one selection.
    * Multiple Select - The user can save multiple selections.
Be aware that the following limitations exist when a segment has a type of Multiple Select:
    * The segment cannot have GL Impact.
    * The segment cannot be applied to transaction columns.
    * You cannot configure dynamic defaulting for the segment.

Name: hasGLImpact
Help:
When you enable GL Impact, segment values that are saved on transaction instances are displayed on the GL Impact page for those transactions. Custom segments applied to transaction types or columns can have GL impact.
You can check the GL Impact box even when the segment is not applied to transaction types or columns. However, until you apply the segment to a transaction type or column, this setting has no effect.
After a segment has been created, the GL Impact setting cannot be modified.

Name: help
Help: Enter field-level help for the segment. Users working with the segment can click the segment’s label to display a popup window containing your help text.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: If a custom segment is no longer needed, inactivate it by checking this box.

Name: isMandatory
Help:
Check this box to make the segment a required field on records where it appears. This option affects all record types to which the segment has been applied.
Be aware that even with this configuration, the segment is not necessarily mandatory in all situations. For more information, see Making a Custom Segment Mandatory in the Help Center.

Name: label
Help: This text is used as the segment’s label when the segment appears on a record as a field or transaction column. The label must be unique across all classifications in your system. For example, if you have classifications called Class, Department, Location, or Subsidiary, you cannot use any of those words as this segment's label. You also cannot name a segment Account, and you cannot duplicate an existing segment’s label.

Name: recordScriptId
Help:
This is the identification
number for the custom record that is associated with the custom segment. Every
custom segment has a custom record. This ID is the custom segment type and is
important for web services. You would use the record ID with the internal ID to
reference this custom segment in a script.

Name: recordType
Help: The custom record type that is linked to this custom segment. The custom record type has the same name as the custom segment. The custom record type name is a link that opens the Custom Record configuration page.

Name: scriptId
Label: ID
Help:
Enter the identification number for the custom segment. As a best practice, enter an ID that begins with an underscore, because NetSuite will prepend the ID with cseg. If you do not enter a value, the system generates one.
This value cannot be changed after the new segment is saved. This ID is used in the API for the custom GL plug-in.

Name: showInList
Help: Check this box to display the custom segment column on a custom record list or sublist. Clear this box to remove the custom segment column from the custom record list or sublist.

Name: includeChildren
Label: Include Children
Help: Check the Include Children box to associate the department with all the sub-subsidiaries associated with each subsidiary selected in the Subsidiary field.

Name: isInactive
Label: {1} is Inactive
Help: This field is false by default.

Name: name
Label: Name
Help:
Enter a name for this department. The name you enter here shows in lists of departments on records and transactions.
The name can be alphanumeric. The maximum number of characters is 31.

Name: parent
Label: Subdepartment of
Help:
References a record that currently exists in this Department list. Therefore, you should define all departments that will be used as parent records before submitting child department records.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: account
Label: Account
Help:
Select the bank account to receive these funds. Click New to set up a new bank account.
For details about existing bank accounts, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_ACCOUNT_> > Accounts.

Name: class
Help:
Choose a class to associate with this transaction.
To enter a new class, click New.
For details about existing classes, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_CLASS_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CLASS_> > Classes.

Name: currencyName
Help: The currency of this bank account is shown in this field.

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: Select the custom form for this deposit.

Name: department
Help:
Choose a department to associate with this transaction.
Click New to enter a new department.
Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_DEPARTMENT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_DEPARTMENT_> > Departments for details about existing departments.

Name: exchangeRate
Label: Exchange Rate
Help:
The currency's exchange rate is shown in this field.
If the bank account's currency is the same as the subsidiary's base currency, the exchange rate is a read-only field.

Name: location
Help:
Select a location to associate with this transaction.
To create a new location, select New.
For details on existing locations, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_LOCATION_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_LOCATION_> > Locations.

Name: memo
Label: Memo
Help: If you want, enter a memo to describe this deposit. It will appear on reports.

Name: postingPeriod
Label: Posting Period
Help:
Select the period to which you want to post this deposit.
If a period is closed, you cannot post to that period.

Name: subsidiary
Help: If you use NetSuite OneWorld, the subsidiary defaults to that associated with the selected bank account.

Name: toBePrinted
Label: To Be Printed
Help:
If you enter multiple deposits before printing, you can print all the slips at once. To do this, check the To Be Printed box on each transaction page as you enter deposits.
 
To print the queued deposits, go to <_TABNAME=TRAN_PRINT_DEPOSIT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=TRAN_PRINT_DEPOSIT_> Print Deposits.

Name: total
Label: Amount
Help: Enter the Amount being deposited.

Name: tranDate
Label: Date
Help:
NetSuite inserts today's date for the posting date of this deposit. You can type or pick another date.
What you enter here determines the date range in which this transaction appears on the Bank register.
You can select or enter custom date ranges on registers.

Name: tranId
Label: Deposit #
Help: This field displays the system-generated number associated with this deposit.

Name: arAcct
Label: A/R Account
Help:
Select the Accounts Receivable account that will be affected by this transaction. Click New to set up a new account.
For details on accounts, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_ACCOUNT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_ACCOUNT_> > Chart of Accounts.

Name: class
Help:
Select a class to associate with this transaction.
To create a new class, select New.
For details on existing classes, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_CLASS_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CLASS_> > Classes.

Name: customer
Help: The customer or project shows in this field.

Name: department
Help:
Select a department to associate with this transaction.
To create a new department, select New.
For details on existing departments, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_DEPARTMENT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_DEPARTMENT_> > Departments.

Name: depDate
Help: This field shows the date the pre-payment was originally deposited.

Name: deposit
Label: Application Of
Help: This field shows a link to the customer deposit being applied.

Name: location
Help:
Select a location to associate with this transaction.
To create a new location, select New.
For details on existing locations, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_LOCATION_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_LOCATION_> > Locations.

Name: memo
Label: Memo
Help: Enter a memo to identify this application transaction.

Name: postingPeriod
Label: Posting Period
Help:
Select the period you want to post this deposit to.
If a period is closed, you cannot post to that period.

Name: tranDate
Label: Date
Help:
The current date defaults to show in this field.
You can select or enter another date if necessary.

Name: availableToPartners
Label: Available to Adv. Partners
Help: If true, this item is available in the Advanced Partner Center.

Name: class
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Classes. This field is required when the Make Classes Mandatory preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: department
Help: Set a department to associate with this item. For details on existing department records, in the UI go to Setup > Company > Departments.

Name: description
Label: Description
Help: Enter a description for this item. This description will appear in the Description column of sales forms.

Name: includeChildren
Label: Include Children
Help:
Check the Include Children box to share the item with all the sub-subsidiaries associated with each subsidiary selected in the Subsidiary field.
Note: When sharing items across subsidiaries, all of the options selected on the item record must be compatible across subsidiaries.
 
For example, when entering an inventory item to be shared across subsidiaries, you should select Income and Asset accounts on the item record that are also shared across the same subsidiaries.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: Sets the item as inactive. By default, this field is set to false.

Name: issueProduct
Label: Product
Help:
Select the product this item is associated with.
Product records are tracked with versions and builds for issue management.
To create product records, go to <_TABNAME=ADMI_ISSUEPRODUCT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_ISSUEPRODUCT_> > Products > New.

Name: itemId
Label: Item Name/Number
Help:
Type up to 60 characters for the name of this item. This name appears in lists on transactions.
If you have the option of entering a display name and do not, the item name prints in the Item column of sales forms.
If you have the option to enter a vendor name and do not, the item name prints in the Item column of purchase forms when Basic printing is used. If you have entered a display name, it will print on purchases instead of the item name when Basic printing is used.

Name: location
Help:
Select a location to associate with this item.
To use a location, the Multi-Location Inventory feature must be enabled.
    * If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is not enabled:
      Selecting an item record location limits the items that certain roles can access.
      For example, Role A is set up to access only items associated with Location One. Therefore, employees who have Role A can access only items associated with Location One.
      Note: If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is not enabled, you cannot use this field to track inventory by locations. For example, you cannot track how many widgets you have in stock in Location One.
      For more information click here.
    * If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is enabled:
      Selecting an item record location classifies the item by that location to limit the items that certain roles can access. To track inventory per location, use the Locations subtab at the bottom of this form.
      For more information click here.
Select New to enter a new location record.
Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_LOCATION_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_LOCATION_> > Locations for details about existing location records.

Name: account
Label: Account
Help: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: availableToPartners
Label: Available to Adv. Partners
Help: If true, this item is available in the Advanced Partner Center.

Name: class
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Classes. This field is required when the Make Classes Mandatory preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: deferredRevenueAccount
Help:
Set the deferred revenue account to associate with this item. Then, when this item is sold and associated with a revenue recognition template, the revenue from the sale is deferred.
The sale amount is posted to a deferred revenue account, as opposed to a standard income account.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: department
Help: Set a department to associate with this item. For details on existing department records, in the UI go to Setup > Company > Departments.

Name: description
Label: Description
Help: Enter a description for this item. This description will appear in the Description column of sales forms.

Name: displayName
Label: Display Name/Code
Help:
You can set an optional name for this item in addition to the item name. If you are integrating with a Yahoo! store, this field is imported from Yahoo!.
The display name prints in the Item column of the sales form when Basic printing is used. If this item is a member of a kit, this name appears in the Item column when the Print Items box is checked. 
If you do not set a display name, then item name appears on printed forms.

Name: expenseAccount
Help: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: includeChildren
Label: Include Children
Help:
Check the Include Children box to share the item with all the sub-subsidiaries associated with each subsidiary selected in the Subsidiary field.
Note: When sharing items across subsidiaries, all of the options selected on the item record must be compatible across subsidiaries.
 
For example, when entering an inventory item to be shared across subsidiaries, you should select Income and Asset accounts on the item record that are also shared across the same subsidiaries.

Name: incomeAccount
Label: Income Account
Help: References an existing income account at Lists > Accounting > Accounts. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: Sets the item as inactive. By default, this field is set to false.

Name: isPreTax
Label: Apply Before Tax
Help:
Check this box to apply this markup or discount before taxes are calculated.
Important: This option is only for use in countries that levy sales tax; for example, the United States. In OneWorld accounts, this checkbox does not have any effect on countries that use value-added tax (VAT). However, this option can be used for Brazil, China, and India. For more information, see the Help topic Applying Sales Tax or VAT to Discount Items

Name: issueProduct
Label: Product
Help:
Select the product this item is associated with.
Product records are tracked with versions and builds for issue management.
To create product records, go to <_TABNAME=ADMI_ISSUEPRODUCT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_ISSUEPRODUCT_> > Products > New.

Name: itemId
Label: Item Name/Number
Help:
Type up to 60 characters for the name of this item. This name appears in lists on transactions.
If you have the option of entering a display name and do not, the item name prints in the Item column of sales forms.
If you have the option to enter a vendor name and do not, the item name prints in the Item column of purchase forms when Basic printing is used. If you have entered a display name, it will print on purchases instead of the item name when Basic printing is used.

Name: location
Help:
Select a location to associate with this item.
To use a location, the Multi-Location Inventory feature must be enabled.
    * If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is not enabled:
      Selecting an item record location limits the items that certain roles can access.
      For example, Role A is set up to access only items associated with Location One. Therefore, employees who have Role A can access only items associated with Location One.
      Note: If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is not enabled, you cannot use this field to track inventory by locations. For example, you cannot track how many widgets you have in stock in Location One.
      For more information click here.
    * If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is enabled:
      Selecting an item record location classifies the item by that location to limit the items that certain roles can access. To track inventory per location, use the Locations subtab at the bottom of this form.
      For more information click here.
Select New to enter a new location record.
Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_LOCATION_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_LOCATION_> > Locations for details about existing location records.

Name: nonPosting
Label: Posting
Help:
Select Non-Posting if this discount item should not post to a general ledger account.
When a discount item is marked non-posting, it does not post as an individual transaction line. The item it is applied to posts the net amount after the discount.
When you create a sales transaction and add the non-posting discount after a line-item, the discount is applied to the previous line-item only.
    * If a 10% non-posting discount is applied to a $100 line item, the amount of revenue that posts to the associated revenue account for that item is $90.
    * If a 10% posting discount is applied to a $100 line item, the amount of revenue that posts to the associated revenue account for that item is $100. Also, an offsetting debit amount of $10 posts to the related discount account, such as the Sales Discounts account.
For Non-posting discounts, select an account the discount amount posts to.
Note: You cannot select Non-Posting when creating a Discount for Purchase item.

Name: parent
Label: Subitem of
Help:
References an existing item record. Only required if the item is a child of another item.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: rate
Label: Rate
Help: Defines the rate for this item. If a value is entered followed by the percentage sign, the discount is interpreted as a percentage discount (i.e.  -.10% sets a ten percent discount for the item). If a value without the percentage sign is entered, the rate is interpreted as a flat dollar value.

Name: revRecSchedule
Help:
Sets the revenue recognition template that will be applied to this item. In order to set this field, the item record referenced in the item field must have a deferred revenue account associated with it. This field then defaults to the rev. rec.  template associated to the item on the item record.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: salesTaxCode
Label: Sales Tax Code
Help:
This field is required for customers subscribing to International versions on NetSuite. Sets the default tax code to be used on sales transactions. 
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: taxSchedule
Label: Schedule
Help:
Select the tax schedule you want to apply to this item.
You can create new tax schedules at Setup > Accounting > Taxes > Tax Schedules > New.

Name: upcCode
Label: UPC Code
Help: Defines whether this is a unv part code. Bar codes for items are generated in Code 128 by default. If you prefer to use the UPC code format, set this field to True on each item record.

Name: vendorName
Label: Vendor Name/Code
Help: Sets the preferred vendor for this item. If the Multiple Vendors feature is enabled, this field is unavailable and you must set the preferred vendor in the itemVendorsList.

Name: availableToPartners
Label: Available to Adv. Partners
Help: If true, this item is available in the Advanced Partner Center.

Name: billingSchedule
Label: Billing Schedule
Help:
Allows users to reference default Billing Schedules for items.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: class
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Classes. This field is required when the Make Classes Mandatory preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: costEstimate
Label: Item Defined Cost
Help: Enter an Item Defined Cost amount.

Name: costEstimateType
Label: Cost Estimate Type
Help:
The Cost Estimate Type determines what value NetSuite uses to calculate estimated Gross Profit.
The estimated Gross Profit for Items on a transaction provides the data needed to calculate the total estimated Gross Profit on that transaction.
The individual line items that you enter in a transaction determine the amounts that post when you process that transaction.
The following Cost Estimate Types on Items are available:
    * Item Defined Cost - a user-defined amount, entered into the Item Defined Cost field on the Item definition page.
    * Average Cost - NetSuite calculates an average cost of the units purchased. 
    * Last Purchase Price - This field displays the most recent purchase price of the item as determined by purchase order receipt transactions. 
    * Purchase Price - Price entered that you pay for this item. If you do not enter a price, then the most recent purchase price from purchase orders provides the price for this item by default.
    * Preferred Vendor Rate - This option is only used if the Multi-Vendor feature is enabled and multiple vendors supply the same item.
          o First priority is to use the preferred vendor rate if defined on the Item record.
          o Next priority would be to use the purchase price.
          o Last priority would be the purchase order rate. (Initially this uses the preferred vendor rate cost, and then after a purchase order is entered, this type uses the most recent actual purchase order rate. Special orders and drop-shipped items use this cost information.)
    * Derived from member items - Total costs of items currently included in a kit. This Cost Estimate Type only applies to kits and sums the estimated costs of each item in the kit, based on each of their individual Cost Estimate Types. Uses the latest definition of the kit, not its historical definition.

Name: createRevenuePlansOn
Label: Create Revenue Plans On
Help:
Select the event that triggers creation of revenue recognition plans. Match the event with the amount source of the item's revenue recognition rule.
    * Revenue Arrangement Creation - Revenue plans can be created when the revenue arrangement is created. Use this option with rules that have Event-Amount as the Amount Source.
    * Billing - Revenue plans can be created when the sales order is billed and from stand-alone cash sales, invoices, credit memos, and cash refunds. Use this option with rules that have Event-Percent based on amount as the Amount Source.
    * Fulfillment - This option is available only when Advanced Shipping is enabled. Revenue plans can be created upon fulfillment. Use this option with rules that have Event-Percent based on quantity as the Amount Source.
    * Project Progress - This option is available only when the Projects feature is enabled. Use this option with rules that have Event-Percent Complete as the Amount Source.

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: daysBeforeExpiration
Label: Days Before Expiration
Help:
If you want this item to expire, enter the number of days it should remain active after purchase.
If this item is downloadable and the same customer purchases this item more than once, the countdown to expiration restarts with each purchase.
Note: If this item is a gift certificate and the buyer lives in California, Connecticut, Louisiana, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, Rhode Island or Washington, by law the gift certificate cannot expire.

Name: deferredRevenueAccount
Label: Deferred Revenue Account
Help:
Set the deferred revenue account to associate with this item. Then, when this item is sold and associated with a revenue recognition template, the revenue from the sale is deferred.
The sale amount is posted to a deferred revenue account, as opposed to a standard income account.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: deferRevRec
Label: Hold Revenue Recognition
Help:
Check this box to delay recognizing revenue from the sale of this item. When this box is check, revenue recognition schedules or revenue plans are created with the status On Hold.
For more information, see the help topic Delaying Revenue Recognition for an Item.

Name: department
Help: Set a department to associate with this item. For details on existing department records, in the UI go to Setup > Company > Departments.

Name: directRevenuePosting
Label: Direct Revenue Posting
Help:
Check this box to disable advanced revenue management for this item. When checked, posting transactions that include this item post directly to the item revenue account. No revenue element or revenue arrangement is created. When you check this box, the Deferred Revenue Account on the Accounting subtab is disabled.
When you create sales transactions that include items that have this box checked, all the items in the transaction must have the box checked. You cannot mix items that post directly to revenue with items that post to deferred revenue in the same transaction. This restriction also applies to kit items. All items in a kit must post either to revenue or to deferred revenue.
You cannot check or clear the box after the item has been used in a transaction with advanced revenue management.
By default, this box is not checked.

Name: displayName
Label: Display Name/Code
Help:
You can set an optional name for this item in addition to the item name. If you are integrating with a Yahoo! store, this field is imported from Yahoo!.
The display name prints in the Item column of the sales form when Basic printing is used. If this item is a member of a kit, this name appears in the Item column when the Print Items box is checked. 
If you do not set a display name, then item name appears on printed forms.

Name: dontShowPrice
Label: Don't Show Price
Help:
Check this box to hide the price of this item online.
This is useful for items you want to advertise but don't want to sell or for items that you track inventory for and want to display but are offered in combination with other items.

Name: excludeFromSitemap
Label: Exclude from Sitemap
Help: Check this box to exclude a tab, category or item page from the site map.

Name: featuredDescription
Label: Featured Description
Help: Settable only if item is featured. You can provide letters, numbers and basic HTML code.

Name: immediateDownload
Label: Immediate Download
Help:
Check this box if you want customers to be able to download the item immediately after checking out.
Clear this box to make download available after the order is billed. Customers then receive email that the download is available through the My Account tab of your site.

Name: includeChildren
Label: Include Children
Help:
Check the Include Children box to share the item with all the sub-subsidiaries associated with each subsidiary selected in the Subsidiary field.
Note: When sharing items across subsidiaries, all of the options selected on the item record must be compatible across subsidiaries.
 
For example, when entering an inventory item to be shared across subsidiaries, you should select Income and Asset accounts on the item record that are also shared across the same subsidiaries.

Name: incomeAccount
Label: Income Account
Help: References an existing income account at Lists > Accounting > Accounts. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: isDonationItem
Label: Variable Amount
Help: If true, the item is set as a variable-priced donation item. This enables customers to enter their own prices for this item, such as for donations.

Name: isFulfillable
Label: Can be Fulfilled
Help:
Check the Can be Fulfilled/Received box to enable this item to be received and fulfilled during order processing.
Clear this box if this item does not require being received and fulfilled.
Note: Once this item has been added to transactions, this setting cannot be changed.
This field is used when the Advanced Billing and Advanced Shipping features are both enabled.

Name: isGcoCompliant
Label: Google Checkout Compliant
Help: Check this box to make the item available for purchase with Google Checkout.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: Sets the item as inactive. By default, this field is set to false.

Name: isOnline
Label: Display in Web Site
Help: Set to true to make this item available online in your Web site. You cannot sell this item online unless this field is set to true.

Name: issueProduct
Label: Product
Help:
Select the product this item is associated with.
Product records are tracked with versions and builds for issue management.
To create product records, go to <_TABNAME=ADMI_ISSUEPRODUCT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_ISSUEPRODUCT_> > Products > New.

Name: isTaxable
Label: Taxable
Help: Check this box if the item is subject to sales tax.

Name: itemId
Label: Item Name/Number
Help:
Type up to 60 characters for the name of this item. This name appears in lists on transactions.
If you have the option of entering a display name and do not, the item name prints in the Item column of sales forms.
If you have the option to enter a vendor name and do not, the item name prints in the Item column of purchase forms when Basic printing is used. If you have entered a display name, it will print on purchases instead of the item name when Basic printing is used.

Name: itemRevenueCategory
Label: Item Revenue Category
Help: The item revenue category is a classification for items that have similar characteristics and revenue allocation requirements. It is used in the fair value price list.

Name: location
Help:
Select a location to associate with this item.
To use a location, the Multi-Location Inventory feature must be enabled.
    * If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is not enabled:
      Selecting an item record location limits the items that certain roles can access.
      For example, Role A is set up to access only items associated with Location One. Therefore, employees who have Role A can access only items associated with Location One.
      Note: If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is not enabled, you cannot use this field to track inventory by locations. For example, you cannot track how many widgets you have in stock in Location One.
      For more information click here.
    * If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is enabled:
      Selecting an item record location classifies the item by that location to limit the items that certain roles can access. To track inventory per location, use the Locations subtab at the bottom of this form.
      For more information click here.
Select New to enter a new location record.
Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_LOCATION_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_LOCATION_> > Locations for details about existing location records.

Name: maxDonationAmount
Label: Maximum Variable Amount
Help: If isDonationItem is set to true, set this field to the maximum amount that can be paid or donated for this item.

Name: metaTagHtml
Label: Meta Tag HTML
Help: Sets the metatag information for the item page in web store.

Name: noPriceMessage
Label: No Price Message
Help:
If you opted to not show a price online, enter the message that should show instead of the price.
For example, you might enter "Call for Price."

Name: numOfAllowedDownloads
Label: Number Of Downloads
Help:
Enter the maximum number of times a customer who has purchased this item can download it from the Customer Center.
If the same customer purchases this item more than once, the number of available downloads is multiplied by the number of times the item has been purchased.

Name: offerSupport
Label: Offer Support
Help: When enabled, items can be referenced on case records either through the UI or via web services using the item field.

Name: onSpecial
Label: On Special
Help: Set to true if you want to put this item on special. The item then appears in the Specials category in your store or site.

Name: outOfStockBehavior
Label: Out Of Stock Behavior
Help:
Select a custom out of stock behavior for this item. It overwrites the overall site’s out of stock behavior. Your choices are:
    * Default - Uses the behavior selected in the Web Store Out of Stock Items field at Setup > Web Site > Setup Tasks > Set Up Web Site > Shopping.
    * Disallow back orders but display out of stock messages
    * Allow back orders but display out of stock messages
    * Remove items when out of stock
    * Allow back orders with no out of stock message

Name: outOfStockMessage
Label: Out Of Stock Message
Help: You can enter a custom out of stock message for this item. The message here replaces the default out of stock message.

Name: overallQuantityPricingType
Label: Calculate Quantity Discounts
Help:
Available values are:
_byLineQuantity
_byOverallItemQuantity
_byOverallParentQuantity
_byOverallScheduleQuantity

Name: pageTitle
Label: Page Title
Help: Sets the display title in the upper-left corner of an Internet browser when customers view this item in your Web store.

Name: parent
Label: Subitem of
Help:
References an existing item record. Only required if the item is a child of another item.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: pricingGroup
Label: Pricing Group
Help:
Select the pricing group this item is a member of.
Using pricing groups allows you to assign customer-specific price levels for a group of items.
You can create new pricing groups at <_TABNAME=EDIT_OTHERLIST_> > <_TABNAME=EDIT_OTHERLIST_> > Accounting Lists > New > Pricing Group.

Name: quantityPricingSchedule
Label: Quantity Pricing Schedule
Help: Set the pricing schedule you want to use to set prices for this item. You can create new pricing schedules at Lists > Accounting > Quantity Pricing Schedules > New. Selecting a pricing schedule sets the Use Marginal Rates and Calculate Quantity Discounts fields.

Name: relatedItemsDescription
Label: Related Items Description
Help: Sets the description displayed for a group of related items.

Name: revenueAllocationGroup
Label: Revenue Allocation Group
Help: Select a revenue allocation group to use in GroupSum functions in fair value formulas. The value you select here is the default. You can change it on the revenue element.

Name: revenueRecognitionRule
Label: Revenue Recognition Rule
Help:
Select the revenue rule to use by default for this item in a revenue arrangement.
Be sure the rule you select has an Amount Source that is appropriate for the value you select in the Create Revenue Plans On field. For more information, see the field level help for Create Revenue Plans On.

Name: revRecForecastRule
Label: Rev Rec Forecast Rule
Help:
Select a revenue rule to use for forecast revenue recognition plans. The default is determined by the same accounting preference as the Revenue Recognition Rule.
You may select the same rule or a different rule for actual and forecast rules. Percent complete rules are not available as forecast rules. For information about forecast revenue plans for project progress, see Working with Percent-Complete Revenue Recognition Plans.

Name: revRecSchedule
Label: Revenue Recognition Template
Help:
Sets the revenue recognition template that will be applied to this item. In order to set this field, the item record referenced in the item field must have a deferred revenue account associated with it. This field then defaults to the rev. rec.  template associated to the item on the item record.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: salesDescription
Label: Sales Description
Help: Sets the description displayed when an item's store display name is clicked.

Name: searchKeywords
Label: Search Keywords
Help: Enter alternative search keywords that customers might use to find this item using your Web store�s internal search. These can include synonyms, acronyms, alternate languages or misspellings. These keywords are seen as equally important as the item name when searches are conducted.

Name: showDefaultDonationAmount
Label: Show Default Amount
Help: Can only be set when isDonation is set to True. If true, the item's online price is displayed as a suggested price.

Name: sitemapPriority
Label: Sitemap Priority
Help:
Use the Sitemap Priority list to indicate the relative importance of your Web site URLs.
You can select a priority ranging from 0.0 to 1.0 on item, category, and tab records.
NetSuite assigns the default priority “Auto” to all new and existing tab, category and item records in your account. The priority is calculated based on the position of the item or category in the hierarchy of your Web site.
For example, your Web site tabs automatically generate a default priority value of 1.0 because they are top level pages. A category published to a tab gets a priority of 0.5. An item published to a category on a tab gets a priority of 0.3.

Name: specialsDescription
Label: Specials Description
Help: Settable only if onSpecial is set to True. You can provide letters, numbers and basic HTML code.

Name: storeDescription
Label: Store Description
Help: Sets the item description. This field can contain plain text as well as basic html code.

Name: storeDetailedDescription
Label: Detailed Description
Help: Sets the detailed item description. This field can contain plain text as well as basic html code.

Name: storeDisplayImage
Label: Item Display Image
Help: References an existing image file in the file cabinet. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: storeDisplayName
Label: Store Display Name
Help: Sets the item name for your Web site.

Name: storeDisplayThumbnail
Label: Item Display Thumbnail
Help: References an existing image file in the file cabinet. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: storeItemTemplate
Label: Item Drilldown Template
Help: References an existing item template at Setup > Web Site > Item/Category Templates.

Name: taxSchedule
Label: Schedule
Help:
Select the tax schedule you want to apply to this item.
You can create new tax schedules at Setup > Accounting > Taxes > Tax Schedules > New.

Name: upcCode
Label: UPC Code
Help: Defines whether this is a unv part code. Bar codes for items are generated in Code 128 by default. If you prefer to use the UPC code format, set this field to True on each item record.

Name: useMarginalRates
Label: Use Marginal Rates
Help:
Set to true if you want the quantity discounts in the schedule to be applied to each pricing bracket separately.
For example, a schedule offers no discount for the first 100 items sold and a 5% discount if more than 100 are sold. If 150 items are sold, the first 100 are at normal price, and the other fifty items are sold at 5% discount.
The fault value is false, which applies the discount to all items sold.

Name: vsoeDeferral
Label: Deferral
Help:
In this field set how to handle deferment when this item is sold as part of a bundle. The available options are:
_deferBundleUntilDelivered � Until this item is marked delivered, the revenue recognition of all items in the bundle is deferred. A typical use for this option is to identify items whose revenue recognition depends on the delivery of the item itself, in addition to the delivery of a separate service. For example, a specified upgrade would typically be marked Defer Bundle Until Delivered.
_deferUntilItemDelivered � Until this item is marked delivered, the revenue recognition of this item is deferred. This setting is the default for this field. 
Note: The deferral setting you set for each item in a bundle works together with the deferral settings for other items in the bundle.

Name: vsoeDelivered
Label: Default as Delivered
Help: Check this box to automatically set this item to a Delivered status when this item is added to a transaction. Clear this box to leave the delivery status clear by default.

Name: vsoePermitDiscount
Label: Permit Discount
Help:
Set one of the following options to determine how discounts are handled for this item.
_asAllowed - Allows a portion of an applicable discount to be applied against this item if its status is Delivered when the VSOE allocation is performed.
_never - Does not allow a discount to be applied against this item when the VSOE allocation is performed. This selection would be common for a Specified Upgrade. 
Note: The default for this field is _asAllowed.

Name: vsoePrice
Label: Allocation Price
Help:
Set the VSOE price for this item, if the price is known.
Note: If you need to use more than one VSOE price for an item, you can set the most common price here and then change the price on each order manually.

Name: vsoeSopGroup
Label: Allocation Type
Help:
Select an allocation type to associate with this item on sales transactions.
    * Normal - Revenue allocation follows EITF 08-01 rules when you use VSOE and the fair value price list with advanced revenue management.
    * Exclude - This item is excluded from revenue allocation. The item discounted sales amount is the revenue amount.
    * Software - The item is software. When you use VSOE with the EITF SuiteApp, both EITF 08-01 and SOP 97-2 rules apply for revenue allocation. When you use advanced revenue management, revenue allocation follows the fair value price list. Then if the fair value prices for any of the items in the allocation are estimates rather than VSOE, the allocation is recalculated using the residual method.
Note: Do not select the Software value unless you are using VSOE with the EITF SuiteApp or Advanced Revenue Management.

Name: accountNumber
Label: Account
Help:
If you, your payroll service, or other benefits provider assigns account numbers to your employees, enter that account number here.
This field is required for the Online Bill Pay feature.

Name: altName
Label: Employee
Help: To update the internal ID of the Name field to altName, in the UI go to: 1. Setup > Company > Auto-Generated Numbers. 2. Enable auto-generated numbers for Employees, set Enable Override to TRUE, and then click Save. When you edit existing Employee records, the internal ID for the Name field becomes altName.

Name: approvalLimit
Label: Expense Approval Limit
Help: Sets the amount of the largest expense report this supervisor can approve.

Name: approver
Label: Expense Approver
Help:
References an employee record. Sets the person who approves the employees expense reports and purchase requests.
If you have set a supervisor, you can NOT set an approver. 
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: baseWage
Label: Base Wage
Help: Enter the employee's base wage. Depending on the selected base wage type, enter the hourly, monthly, or yearly total.

Name: baseWageType
Label: Base Wage Type
Help: Select whether the employee's base wage is calculated on an hourly, monthly, or yearly basis.

Name: billingClass
Label: Billing Class
Help: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: billPay
Label: Enable Online Bill Pay
Help:
Check this box in order to send this employee payments online.
You cannot use this feature for paychecks.
You must follow the set up procedures at <_TABNAME=ADMI_XML_PAYTRUST_SETUP_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_XML_PAYTRUST_SETUP_> > Online Bill Pay before you can use this feature.

Name: birthDate
Label: Birth Date
Help:
Enter the employee's date of birth.
You can type or pick another date.

Name: class
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Classes. This field is required when the Make Classes Mandatory preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: comments
Label: Notes
Help: Enter other information you want to track for this employee.

Name: commissionPaymentPreference
Label: Pay Commissions Using
Help: Select in the dropdown whether the payor for this employee's commissions always should be Payroll, always should be Accounts Payable, or should vary according to preferences set in the NetSuite system.

Name: compensationCurrency
Label: Compensation Currency
Help: Select the currency for this employee's compensation.

Name: concurrentWebServicesUser
Label: Concurrent Web Services User
Help: This field appears only if the Web services feature is enabled in NetSuite.

Name: currency
Label: Currency
Help: The currency for an employee automatically defaults to the base currency of the associated subsidiary or company. This currency must be used for transactions with this employee.

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: defaultAcctCorpCardExp
Label: Default Account for Corporate Card Expenses
Help: Select the default credit card account to use for corporate card expenses on expense reports.

Name: defaultAddress
Help: This field displays in text format the employee's address, as entered in fields on the Address subtab.

Name: defaultExpenseReportCurrency
Label: Default Currency For {#Expense Reports#}
Help: Select the default currency for this employee’s expense reports.

Name: department
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when Make Departments Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: directDeposit
Label: Use Direct Deposit
Help:
Check this box to use Direct Deposit for transferring funds to an employee's bank account. Direct Deposit transactions take place over the Internet and in real time.
These transactions have immediate accounting impact on your books. Payments you transmit are withdrawn from your company's bank account.

Name: eligibleForCommission
Label: Eligible for Commission
Help: Check the box to indicate this employee can be paid commission.

Name: email
Label: Email
Help: Sets the employee's e-mail address.

Name: employeeStatus
Label: Employee Status
Help: References a value in a user defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Employee Related Lists > Employee Status. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: employeeType
Label: Type
Help: Choose the type of employee for tax reporting purposes.

Name: entityId
Label: Entity ID
Help:
If the Auto box is not checked, manually enter an ID for this record.
If the Auto box is checked, NetSuite assigns an ID for this record based on your settings at <_TABNAME=ADMI_NUMBERING_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_NUMBERING_> > Auto-Generated Numbers.

Name: ethnicity
Label: Ethnicity
Help:
Select the employee's ethnicity.
You can create a new ethnicity category at <_TABNAME=EDIT_EMPOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=EDIT_EMPOTHERLIST_> > Employee Related Lists.

Name: expenseLimit
Label: Expense Limit
Help: In the Expense Limit field, enter the amount this employee can expense without approval from a supervisor or approver.

Name: fax
Label: Fax
Help:
Enter a fax number for this record. You should enter the fax number exactly as it must be dialed. If a '1' is required to fax to this number, be sure to include it at the beginning of the number.
The number you enter here automatically appears in the To Be Faxed field of transactions when you select this customer.
To fax NetSuite forms, an administrator must first set up fax service at <_TABNAME=ADMI_PRINTING_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_PRINTING_> > Printing, Fax & Email Preferences.

Name: firstName
Label: First Name
Help: Required for Online Bill pay feature.

Name: gender
Label: Gender
Help: Select the employee's gender.

Name: giveAccess
Label: Login Access
Help: Check this box to give your employee access to NetSuite. Then, set a role to customize the level of access using the EmployeeRolesList field.

Name: globalSubscriptionStatus
Label: Global Subscription Status
Help:
Email recipients can have one of four subscription statuses:
    * Confirmed Opt-In - When an email recipient has indicated that they want to receive your campaign messages, they are assigned this subscription status. Only a recipient can set his or her subscription status to Confirmed Opt-In.
    * Soft Opt-In - Recipients with this status can receive opt-in messages that enable them to confirm whether or not they want to receive your email campaigns as well as email marketing campaigns.
      You can set a recipient’s status to Soft Opt-In manually or through a mass update.
    * Soft Opt-Out - Recipients with this status cannot receive campaign email messages but can receive opt-in messages.
      You can change this subscription status to Soft Opt-In manually or through a mass update.
    * Confirmed Opt-Out - Only the recipient can set their subscription status to Confirmed Opt-Out.
      Recipients with this status cannot receive email campaigns or opt-in messages. Recipients with this status can only opt in again through the Employee Center or by clicking the link in a campaign message they have received prior to opting out.

Name: hasOfflineAccess
Help: If set to True, the user is granted offline access privileges. The Offline Client for Sales feature must be enabled and your account must be provisioned for Offline Client for Sales in order for this field to be settable.

Name: hireDate
Label: Hire Date
Help:
Enter the date this employee was hired.
You can type or pick another date.

Name: homePhone
Label: Home Phone
Help: Enter this employee's home phone number here.

Name: image
Label: Image
Help: References an image file that has already been uploaded to the account. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: inheritIPRules
Label: Inherit Allowed IP Addresses from Company
Help:
Check this box to allow this employee NetSuite login access at the IP addresses listed at Setup > Company Information.
If you check this box, this employee has access to NetSuite at every company computer with access unless you specify IP address(es) in the IP Address Restriction field.
If you do not check this box, you must enter an IP Address where this employee can log in in the field below, or this employee will not be able to log in to NetSuite.

Name: initials
Label: Initials
Help:
NetSuite automatically completes this field as you enter first, middle and last names.
If you want to make changes to an employee's initials, enter up to three letters in this field.

Name: IPAddressRule
Label: Extra Allowed IP Addresses
Help:
Enter the IP address(es) where you want this employee to have access in the following formats:
   1. A dotted decimal IP address such as 123.456.78.90
   2. A range of IP addresses entered in dotted decimal with a dash and no spaces between such as 123.45.567.8-123.45.568.9
   3. A list of IP address separated by spaces or commas such as 123.456.78.90, 123.546.768.97, . . .
   4. An IP address and mask, such as 209.209.48.32/255.255.0.0.
   5. The text "ALL" -- allows all IP addresses
You can enter up to 1024 characters.
If you do not enter an IP Address here, you must check the Inherit IP Rules from Company box, or this employee will no longer be able to log in to NetSuite.

Name: isInactive
Label: Is Inactive
Help: This field is false by default.

Name: isJobResource
Label: Job Resource
Help: Set this field to TRUE so that this employee can be added as a resource on projects and tasks. Note that if this field is set to TRUE, the Work Calendar (workCalendar) field becomes a mandatory field.

Name: isSalesRep
Label: Sales Rep
Help:
Check this box to mark this employee as a sales representative.
Sales representatives are listed in the sales rep dropdown list for sales order forms and for sales territory assignments.

Name: isSupportRep
Label: Support Rep
Help: Sets the employee as a Support Rep.

Name: job
Label: Job
Help: Select a job to assign to this employee.

Name: jobDescription
Label: Job Description
Help: Enter a description of the duties related to the job this person currently performs.

Name: laborCost
Label: Labor Cost
Help: Enter the employee's hourly overhead labor rate. This rate is used to calculate the estimated cost of jobs this employee works on.

Name: lastName
Label: Last Name
Help:
Enter the employee's last name here.
What you enter here automatically appears last in the Employee field. The first letter of what you enter here appears in the Initials field.
This field is required for the Online Bill Pay feature.

Name: lastPaidDate
Label: Last Paid Date
Help: Sets the last day this employee was paid. NetSuite automatically updates this whenever a new paycheck is generated.

Name: lastReviewDate
Label: Last Review Date
Help:
Enter the date of this person's last salary evaluation.
You can type or pick another date.

Name: location
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: maritalStatus
Label: Marital Status
Help:
Select the employee's marital status.
You can create a new marital status at <_TABNAME=EDIT_EMPOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=EDIT_EMPOTHERLIST_> > Employee Related Lists.

Name: middleName
Label: Middle Name
Help:
Enter a middle name or initial here.
What you enter here automatically appears second in the Employee field. The first letter of what you enter here appears in the Initials field.
Enter up to 25 characters in this field.

Name: mobilePhone
Label: Mobile Phone
Help: Phone numbers can be entered in the following formats:999-999-9999,  1-999-999-9999, (999) 999-9999, 1(999) 999-9999  or 999-999-9999 ext 9999

Name: nextReviewDate
Label: Next Review Date
Help:
Enter the date of this person's next salary evaluation.
You can type or pick another date.

Name: officePhone
Label: Office Phone
Help: Phone numbers can be entered in the following formats:999-999-9999,  1-999-999-9999, (999) 999-9999, 1(999) 999-9999  or 999-999-9999 ext 9999

Name: password
Label: Password
Help: If this user has access multiple accounts, you can NOT submit a new password on an update. If attempted, the request will succeed but the password is not changed in the database.

Name: password2
Label: Confirm Password
Help: This field must match the value entered in password.

Name: payFrequency
Label: Pay Frequency
Help: References a value in a system list.

Name: phone
Label: Phone
Help: Phone numbers can be entered in the following formats: 999-999-9999,  1-999-999-9999, (999) 999-9999, 1(999) 999-9999  or 999-999-9999 ext 9999

Name: phoneticName
Label: Furigana
Help: Enter the furigana character you want to use to sort this record.

Name: purchaseOrderApprovalLimit
Label: Purchase Approval Limit
Help: In the Purchase Approval Limit field, enter the maximum amount an employee is allowed to approve on a purchase request when specified as an approver for an employee.

Name: purchaseOrderApprover
Label: Purchase Approver
Help:
In the Purchase Approver field, select the person that approves the employee’s purchase requests. If no approver is selected, the supervisor approves purchase requests.
 
If a purchase approver is selected, the supervisor is no longer part of the approval hierarchy.

Name: purchaseOrderLimit
Label: Purchase Limit
Help: In the Purchase Limit field, enter the amount this employee can purchase without approval from a supervisor or approver.

Name: releaseDate
Label: Termination/Release Date
Help:
Enter this person's last date of employment.
You can type or pick another date.

Name: requirePwdChange
Label: Require Password Change On Next Login
Help: If set to TRUE, the employee is required to change the default password assign on the next login attempt.

Name: salesRole
Label: Sales Role
Help: Note that the Team Selling feature must be turned ON for this field to be available.

Name: salutation
Label: Mr./Ms...
Help: Enter an appropriate salutation for this employee.

Name: sendEmail
Label: Send New Access Notification Email
Help:
If set to True, an email notification is automatically sent to this employee informing them of access privileges to NetSuite. The standard NetSuite email message also contains a link to let the user create a password. 
If set to false, the Manually Assign or Change Password field must be set to True. The administrator must create the password, and tell the user  the password, and when and how to log in.
For security reasons, do not send the password by email.

Name: socialSecurityNumber
Label: Social Security Number
Help: Enter the social security number of this employee.

Name: startDateTimeOffCalc
Label: Start Date for Time-Off Calculations
Help: Enter the start date for the purpose of time-off calculations. The date entered here is used to calculate the number of days this employee is entitled to time-off, based on the minimum and maximum tenures set in the time-off plan. If there is no value specified in this field, this employee cannot be assigned a time-off plan.

Name: subsidiary
Help:
Select the subsidiary to associate with this employee. You cannot enter transactions for this employee unless a subsidiary is assigned.
If you select this employee on time transactions, the transaction is associated with this subsidiary. The employee is able to access only information associated with this subsidiary.
Note: Once a transaction has posted for the employee, you are not able to change the subsidiary selected on the employee record.

Name: supervisor
Label: Supervisor
Help:
References an employee record. This employee will approve expense reports and purchase requests.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: template
Label: Template
Help:
Use templates to enter data for employees quickly.
To set up employee record templates, go to <_TABNAME=EDIT_EMPLOYEE_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=EDITEMPLOYEE_> > Employees, and click New Template.

Name: terminationCategory
Label: Termination Reason Category
Help: Select whether the termination is voluntary or involuntary. A voluntary termination indicates the employee ended their employment and an involuntary termination indicates the company ended the employment.

Name: terminationDetails
Label: Termination Details
Help: Enter details of the termination.

Name: terminationReason
Label: Termination Reason
Help: Select the reason for the termination. When the Termination Reason Tracking feature is enabled, NetSuite provides several default termination reasons, but you can change them or create your own.

Name: terminationRegretted
Label: Termination Regretted
Help:
Select whether or not the termination is regretted.
A regretted termination indicates that the company regards the termination as a loss, meaning the employee was a high performer and an asset.
A non-regretted termination indicates that the company does not see the termination as a loss. |
If you do not want to track this information, select Unspecified

Name: timeApprover
Label: Time Approver
Help:
In the Time Approver field, select the person who approves the employee’s time transactions. If no time approver is selected, the employee’s supervisor approves time entries.
 
If both a supervisor and a time approver are selected, then only the time approver can approve time entries using their Employee Center role.

Name: timeOffPlan
Label: Time-Off Plan
Help: Select the time-off plan to assign to this employee.

Name: title
Label: Job Title
Help: Enter this employee's official job title here.

Name: usePerquest
Label: Include in Payroll
Help:
Check this box if you want to include this employee in your pay runs.
This employee will also be included in the Employee list on payroll forms and reports.

Name: useTimeData
Label: Compensation Type
Help: If enabled, the employee is paid for hours entered in NetSuite time transactions.

Name: workAssignment
Label: Work Assignment
Help: Select whether to assign a job or a position to this employee.

Name: workCalendar
Label: Work Calendar
Help: This field is mandatory if the Job Resource (isJobResource) field is set to TRUE.

Name: workplace
Label: Workplace
Help:
Select the workplace where this employee works.
The address of this workplace will be used to define the taxes you are required to withhold and pay for this employee.

Name: comments
Label: Comments
Help: Enter any notes or comments about the group here.

Name: email
Label: Email
Help: If this group has an address in your e-mail application, enter that address here.

Name: groupName
Label: Name
Help: Set the name of the group.

Name: groupOwner
Label: Owner
Help: Select the owner of the group. You are selected as the owner by default. To allow only the owner to edit the group, check the Restrict Group Editing to Owner box.

Name: isFunctionalTeam
Label: Functional Team
Help:
Check this box to mark this group as a functional team.
Functional teams can can be emailed copies of the issue from the Communication subtab on issue records. You may want to check this box for all product team groups and then create additional function team groups for other teams you want to email.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help:
When you check this box, you can no longer view this group's shared calendar and invite this group to events.
This group also no longer appears in the Groups list unless you check the Show Inactives box at the bottom of the page.

Name: isManufacturingWorkCenter
Label: Manufacturing Work Center
Help: Check the Manufacturing Work Center box to enable this group to be used as a work center with routing records.

Name: isPrivate
Label: Private
Help: Set this field to true if you want only members of this group to be able to see the group's list of members.

Name: isProductTeam
Label: Product Team
Help:
Check this box to mark this group as a product team.
Product team groups can be selected in the Product Team field on issues. Product teams designate who is responsible for resolving an issue. Members of this team are emailed when an issue is first entered so that everyone is aware of the problem.

Name: isSalesRep
Label: Sales Group
Help:
Check this box to mark this group a sales group.
On sales orders and customer records, sales groups are listed in the Sales Rep field. When you assign a sales territory, sales groups are listed in the Sales Rep. field.

Name: issueRole
Label: {1} Role
Help: Select a role that corresponds to the role of this group’s members, and this group can be assigned to issues.

Name: isSupportRep
Label: Support Group
Help: Set this field to True if the group is a support group. On case records, support groups are listed in the Assigned To field. When you assign a case territory, support groups are listed in the Support Rep. field.

Name: laborResources
Label: Labor Resources
Help: Enter the number of labor resources associated with this work center.

Name: machineResources
Label: Machine Resources
Help: Enter the number of machine resources associated with this work center.

Name: parentGroupType
Help: This field shows the type of group you are creating, based on the link you clicked to open this page.

Name: restrictionGroup
Label: Restrict To
Help: If you want to restrict the use of this group to members of a specific group, set that group here. If you restrict the use of this group, then this group cannot be made private.

Name: savedSearch
Label: Saved Search
Help: Set this field to the saved search that returns the members of this group. In the UI you can created new saved searches by going to Lists > Search > Saved Searches.

Name: workCalendar
Label: Work Calendar
Help: Select a work calendar to associate with this work center.

Name: altHandlingCost
Label: Handling Cost
Help:
The handling cost automatically calculates depending on the shipping method you select in the Ship Via field.
To change the cost of handling, go to Lists > Shipping Items and select the shipping method with the handling cost you want to change.

Name: altSalesTotal
Help: The Alternate Sales Amount feature must be enabled in your account in order to populate this field. The value entered sets an Alternate Sales Amount for line items on the Estimate. This value can then be used for commission calculations.

Name: altShippingCost
Label: Shipping Cost
Help: This is a read-only field that returns the shipping costs based on the shipping method selected in shipMethod.

Name: billAddressList
Label: Bill To Select
Help: Sets the billing address for this transaction. This field defaults to the default Billing Address set on the associated Customer record. Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the Customer record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.

Name: billingSchedule
Help:
Choose the billing schedule you want to associate with this transaction.
When you select a billing schedule, all items on the order are billed according to the billing schedule.
Click New to enter a new billing schedule.
When you create a new billing schedule on-the-fly, it can be identified as Public or Private. Private billing schedules show only in the transaction it is created from. If you create a private billing schedule from an estimate, that schedule is attached to items on the resulting sales order.
Go to <_TABNAME=EDIT_BILLINGSCHEDULE_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=EDIT_BILLINGSCHEDULE_> > Billing Schedules for details about existing billing schedules.

Name: class
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Classes. This field is required when the Make Classes Mandatory preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: currency
Label: Currency
Help:
If you do not use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, the currency of the customer you are creating this transaction for is shown here.
If you use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, select the transaction currency you want to create this transaction in. This customer's primary currency is selected by default.
If you have already selected items on this transaction, selecting a new currency refreshes them to show the price in the new currency (except for items you entered custom prices for) and recalculates tax and gross profit.

Name: currencyName
Label: Currency
Help: A read only field that defaults to the currency associated with the customer referenced by the entity field.

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: Select the customized estimate form to use.

Name: department
