Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when Make Departments Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. Depending on account configuration, this field may need to be set at the item line level.

Name: discountItem
Label: Discount Item
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Items > New > Discount.

Name: discountRate
Label: Rate
Help: Defaults to the rate associated with the value set in the discountItem field.

Name: discountTotal
Label: Discount Total
Help: A read-only calculated field that returns the amount discounted on this Estimate. If this discount item is taxable, the discount is applied before taxes. If it is not taxable, the discount is applied after taxes.

Name: dueDate
Label: Due Date
Help: Sets the due date for this Estimate.

Name: endDate
Label: End Date
Help: Sets the end date for this Estimate.

Name: entity
Help: Sets the customer this Estimate is associated with. Required on Add.

Name: entityStatus
Label: Status (Customer)
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Sales > Setup Tasks > Customer Statuses. Defaults to the value set at Setup > Sales > Sales Preferences.

Name: estGrossProfit
Label: Est. Gross Profit
Help: Estimated Gross Profit: Read-only field that equals the revenue amount minus the Est. Cost. At the transaction level, it equals the gross profit of all lines, factoring transaction-level discounts and markups.

Name: estGrossProfitPercent
Label: Est. Gross Profit Percent
Help: Estimated Gross Profit Margin, as a percentage: Read-only field that equals the Est. Gross Profit divided by revenue, expressed as a percentage. At the transaction level, it equals the gross profit percent of all lines, factoring transaction-level discounts and markups.

Name: exchangeRate
Label: Exchange Rate
Help: Required on Add. Defaults to the exchange rate associated with the Customer set in the entity field.

Name: expectedCloseDate
Label: Expected Close Date
Help: Required on Add. Defaults to the current date.

Name: fob
Label: FOB
Help: Sets the location where the customers technically acquire ownership.

Name: forecastType
Label: Forecast Type
Help: References an existing Forecast Type defined at Setup > Sales > Sales Preferences > Forecast (subtab on Preferences page). Note that although the display name for each forecast type can be customized, the actual internal ID associated with each forecast type is static as follows: Low Forecast Name: 1 Medium Forecast Name: 2 High Forecast Name: 3

Name: handlingCost
Label: Handling Cost
Help:
The handling cost automatically calculates depending on the shipping method you select in the Ship Via field.
To change the cost of handling, go to <_TABNAME=EDIT_SHIPITEM_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=EDIT_SHIPITEM_> > Shipping Items and select the shipping method with the handling cost you want to change.

Name: handlingTax1Rate
Label: Tax Rate
Help: The tax rate for this handling shipping item is shown here.

Name: handlingTaxCode
Label: Handling Tax Code
Help: Select the tax code for this handling shipping item.

Name: includeInForecast
Label: Include In Forecast
Help:
Check this box to include this estimate in sales forecast reports, key performance indicators and snapshots.
If this estimate has a probability below the min. probability you set at Setup > Set Up SFA > Forecasts, it will not appear on reports, key performance indicators and snapshots. If you use NetSuite or NetCRM and this estimate was created from an opportunity, checking this box removes the opportunity from the sales forecast. Clearing this box includes the opportunity instead.

Name: isTaxable
Label: Taxable
Help: Place a check mark in this box if the order you are quoting will be taxable.

Name: job
Help: Select the project this estimate is associated with.

Name: leadSource
Label: Lead Source
Help: Defaults to the lead source associated with the entity set in the entity field. If a lead source is not associated with the entity, and a default lead source has been set up, defaults to the value set at Setup > Marketing > Set Up Marketing. The lead source can reference either of the following: If marketing automation is NOT enabled, this field references a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Sales > Setup Tasks > CRM Lists. If marketing automation IS enabled, this field references a value in the campaign list at Lists > Marketing > Campaigns.

Name: location
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations. This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. Depending on account configuration, this field may need to be set at the item line level.

Name: memo
Label: Memo
Help: If you wish, enter a memo to describe this estimate. It will appear on reports such as the 2-line Estimates register that your customers can see if you give them permission to log in and view their transaction history.

Name: message
Help: Defaults to the value selected in messageSel.

Name: messageSel
Label: Select Message
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > New > Customer Message.

Name: nexus
Label: Nexus
Help:
This field shows the nexus of the transaction. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. 
You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different nexus in the dropdown list, the corresponding tax registration number is automatically selected in the Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number field.

Name: opportunity
Label: Opportunity
Help: Sets the Opportunity to associate with this Estimate. Valid options include all Opportunities associated with the selected Entity. Therefore, you will need to first perform a search for opportunities related to the desired entity

Name: otherRefNum
Help: Sets the customer PO number associated with this estimate.

Name: partner
Label: Partner
Help: References an existing partner record. Defaults to the partner set on the entity record.

Name: probability
Label: Probability (%)
Help: Required on Add.Defaults to the probability of the status selected. Status probability defaults are defined at Setup > Customer Status Definitions. If this estimate is for a prospect, the prospect's record is updated with the value entered here.

Name: promoCode
Label: Promotion
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Marketing > Promotion Codes. If default promotion codes are setup, defaults to the value set at Setup > Marketing > Marketing Preferences. Entities associated with a partner can only use that partner's promotion codes.

Name: salesGroup
Help: When team selling is enabled, this references a user defined sales team group at Lists > Relationships > Groups.

Name: salesRep
Label: Sales Rep
Help: Defaults to the sales representative associated with the customer referenced by the entity field. This field is NOT available when the Team Selling feature is enabled. If Team Selling is enabled, you must define sales reps in the EstimateSalesTeamList list.

Name: shipAddressList
Label: Ship To Select
Help: Sets the shipping address for this transaction. This field defaults to the default Shipping Address set on the associated entity record. Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the entity record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.

Name: shipDate
Label: Ship Date
Help: Sets the ship date for this transaction.

Name: shipMethod
Label: Ship Via
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Items. Sets the ship method for this transaction.

Name: shippingCost
Label: Shipping Cost
Help: Sets the shipping cost for this transaction. If your account is set up to automatically charge for shipping, this defaults to the value that corresponds to the shipping method selected. Shipping items can be added at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Item.

Name: shippingTax1Rate
Label: Tax Rate
Help: The tax rate for this shipping item tax code is show here.

Name: shippingTaxCode
Label: Shipping Tax Code
Help: Select the tax code to apply to this shipping item.

Name: startDate
Label: Start Date
Help: If there is an expected closing date for this estimate, accept today's date or enter a new date here.

Name: subsidiary
Help: This field displays the subsidiary associated with this transaction.

Name: subsidiaryTaxRegNum
Label: Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number
Help:
This field shows the tax registration number of the transaction nexus. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. 
You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different tax registration number in the dropdown list, the corresponding nexus is automatically selected in the Nexus field.

Name: subTotal
Label: Subtotal
Help: This is a read-only field that returns the total before any discounts, shipping cost, handling cost or tax is added to the order.

Name: syncPartnerTeams
Help: Check this box if you want to update the partner team on the customer record with changes you make here.

Name: syncSalesTeams
Help: Check this box if you want to update the sales team on the customer's record with changes you make here.

Name: tax2Total
Label: PST
Help: NetSuite multiplies the tax rate by the taxable total of line items and enters it here.

Name: taxDetailsOverride
Label: Tax Details Override
Help: Check this box to override the tax information on the Tax Details subtab of the transaction. Only roles with at least the Edit level of the Tax Details Tab permission can override the tax details.

Name: taxItem
Label: Tax
Help:
A tax item is a tax that you collect at one certain rate and pay to one tax agency for this invoice. NetSuite inserts the tax item for this customer from the record at Lists > Customers. To change it just for this estimate, select another tax item.
To add additional choices to this list, go to Lists > New Item > Sales Tax Item.

Name: taxRate
Label: Tax %
Help: NetSuite inserts the percentage rate of the tax item from its record at Lists > Items. You can change it here for just this transaction if you wish.

Name: taxRegOverride
Label: Tax Registration Override
Help: Check this box to override the values in the Nexus and Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number fields. Only roles with at least the Edit level of the Tax Details Tab permission can override the values that NetSuite automatically selects in these fields.

Name: taxTotal
Label: Tax
Help: NetSuite multiplies the tax rate by the taxable total of line items and enters it here.

Name: terms
Label: Terms
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > New > Term. This value sets the discount term to apply to the Estimate.

Name: title
Label: Title
Help:
Enter a title for this estimate. The estimate title text appears on lists, shows in search and reporting results, and shows on the Estimates subtab of records it is associated with.
 
When an estimate is converted from an opportunity, the title from the opportunity defaults into the title field on the estimate.   If there is already an estimate against the opportunity, then the second estimate has a number following the title.
 
For example, if the first estimate title is “Project Estimate”, then the second estimate title is “Project Estimate1”. For each subsequent estimate created against that opportunity, the number in the title increases by 1 to help distinguish between multiple estimates associated to a single opportunity.
 
The estimate title field is also available for customization, direct list editing, and mass updates.

Name: toBeEmailed
Label: To Be Emailed
Help: Causes the Estimate to be mailed to all email addresses included in the email field.

Name: toBeFaxed
Label: To Be Faxed
Help: Causes the Estimate to be faxed to the fax number included in the fax field.

Name: toBePrinted
Label: To Be Printed
Help: If enabled, this Estimate is saved in a queue of Estimates that can be printed at a later date.

Name: total
Label: Total
Help: This is a read-only field that returns the total of line items, tax and shipping costs.

Name: totalCostEstimate
Label: Est. Cost
Help: Estimated Cost: Estimated cost of the specific number of items; estimated rate x quantity = estimated cost.

Name: trackingNumbers
Label: Tracking Numbers
Help: Sets the shipping tracking number from the shipping company.

Name: tranDate
Label: Date
Help: Required on Add. Defaults to the current date.

Name: tranId
Label: Estimate #
Help: Defaults to the largest Estimate number incremented by one. You can overwrite with another number.

Name: visibleToCustomer
Label: Available In Customer Center
Help:
Check the Available in Customer Center box to make this estimate available to customers in the Customer Center.
 
Clear this box to leave this estimate off the list of estimates available to customers in the Customer Center.
This field is checked by default.

Name: defaultRate
Label: Default Rate
Help:
Enter a default rate to be used on expense reports for this category.
This rate can be overridden on individual line items.

Name: description
Label: Description
Help:
Enter a description of the expense category.
If you use the Google Checkout Integration feature, enter a description for the tracking URL. This field is optional.

Name: expenseAcct
Label: Expense Account
Help: References an existing account of type Expense in the user defined list of accounts at Lists > Accounting > Accounts. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: This field is false by default.

Name: name
Label: Name
Help:
Enter the name of an expense category.
If you use the Google Checkout Integration feature, enter a name for the tracking URL.
Name the tracking URL for the tracking pixel vendor you use. If you use multiple vendors, you must create a conversion tracking URL record for each vendor.

Name: rateRequired
Label: Rate is Required
Help:
Check this box to require a quantity and rate when this category is selected on expense reports.
Quantity and rate fields are used to calculate the amount on line items with rate required expenses.

Name: account
Label: Account
Help: Set the account value for this expense.

Name: accountingApproval
Label: Accounting Approval
Help: Set to true if  this expense report is ready to pay.

Name: acctCorpCardExp
Label: Account for Corporate Card Expenses
Help: Select the credit card account to use for corporate card expenses.

Name: advance
Label: Advance to Apply
Help: Sets the amount advanced to employee for these expenses.

Name: amount
Label: Total Reimbursable Amount
Help: This is a read-only field that returns the total of all expense line items minus advances.

Name: approvalStatus
Label: Approval Status
Help:
When you use SuiteFlow for expense report approvals, the forms now include an Approval Status field. The Approval Status field reflects the state of the transaction in the approval process.
Expense reports may have one of the following statuses:
    * Pending Approval – The expense is in the approval queue.
    * Approved – The expense has been given approval for processing.
    * Rejected – The expense has not been approved and will not be processed.

Name: class
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Classes. This field is required when the Make Classes Mandatory preference is enabled at  Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: complete
Label: Complete
Help:
If set to true, this expense report is is complete. If set to false, this expense report is not complete.
Only complete reports are submitted for approval and processing.

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help:
Reference an existing custom form for this record type.
 
To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required. If defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms.
 
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: department
Help: Set a department to associate with this item. For details on existing department records, in the UI go to Setup > Company > Departments.

Name: dueDate
Label: Date Due
Help: Sets the due date for this Expense Report.

Name: entity
Label: Employee
Help: Sets the employee for this expense report. Required on Add.

Name: location
Help:
References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations.
This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: memo
Label: Purpose
Help: Sets a description for the expense report.

Name: nextApprover
Label: Next Approver
Help:
When you use SuiteFlow for expense approvals, expense reports include a Next Approver field. This field is populated based on the associated workflow.
For example, in your workflow you may create a state of Pending Approval. In that state you create a formula to set the Next Approver as the employee’s supervisor.

Name: postingPeriod
Label: Posting Period
Help: Required on Add when the Accounting Periods feature is enabled. Defaults to the current posting period.

Name: subsidiary
Help: References a value defined at Setup > Company > Classifications > Subsidiaries.

Name: supervisorApproval
Label: Supervisor Approval
Help: Can only be set for roles that have approval permissions.

Name: total
Label: Expenses Total
Help: This is a read-only field that returns the total of expense item lines for the expense report.

Name: tranDate
Label: Date
Help: Defaults to the current date.

Name: tranId
Label: Exp. Rept. #
Help: Defaults to the largest Expense Report number incremented by 1. You can overwrite with another number.

Name: useMultiCurrency
Label: Use Multicurrency
Help: Set to false to not allow expenses to be entered in foreign currencies on this expense report.

Name: altTagCaption
Label: Alt Image Tag
Help:
Alt text appears when users mouse-over images on your site and it should be as concise and descriptive as possible.
Best practice is to use multiple terms separated by a comma. The Alt Image Text field accepts hyphenated terms and double quotes.
For example: flat-screen, “home theater”, HD.

Name: attachFrom
Label: Attach From
Help: In the dropdown, choose Computer to attach a file from your hard drive, or Web to attach a file by linking to it on the Internet.

Name: bundleable
Label: Available for SuiteBundles
Help:
Check this box to include the file in a bundle.
If you include this file in a bundle, clearing this box does not remove the file from the bundle. If you want to remove the file from a bundle, you have to update the bundle and remove the file.

Name: caption
Label: Caption
Help: Enter the name of this file as you want it displayed in your Web site.

Name: class
Label: Class Restriction
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Classes. This field is required when Make Classes Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: department
Label: Department Restriction
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when Make Departments Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: description
Label: Description
Help: Enter a description for this file. This description appears on the file record only.

Name: featuredDescription
Label: Featured Description
Help: This description appears below the item's store display name on the Welcome page of your store or site.

Name: fileSize
Label: File Size (bytes)
Help: This field defaults to the size of the file. This field is read-only.

Name: folder
Label: Folder
Help: Defaults to the name of the folder that your file is stored in. You can specify a new folder name if you wish.

Name: hideInBundle
Label: Hide in SuiteBundle
Help:
Check this box if you want this file to not be viewable by those who install this file as part of a SuiteBundle.
Note: You cannot hide Client SuiteScript in a bundle.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: Set to true if you want to inactivate this record. If set to true, this file or folder will no longer appear on lists.

Name: isOnline
Label: Available Without Login
Help:
* Check this box if you want this file accessible externally. The file may be accessed with a URL that points to the file record.
    * Clear this box if you want the file only accessible to those who are logged in to NetSuite with permission to view file cabinet documents.

Name: isPrivate
Label: Private File
Help: Set to true if you want the documents and images in this folder to be seen by only you.

Name: mediaFile
Label: Select File
Help: Click Browse and find the file you want to upload to NetSuite. When you have selected the file, click Submit to upload the document.

Name: mediaTypeName
Label: File Type
Help: This field defaults to the file�s format that was previously set when the file was added to the file cabinet. This field is read-only.

Name: name
Label: File Name
Help: Enter a name for this file cabinet folder. You can use folders to organize the documents and images you store in your file cabinet.

Name: siteDescription
Label: Site Description
Help:
Enter a brief description for this file.
This description appears under the file's display name on catalog pages in your store or site.
You can enter letters, numbers, and basic HTML code.

Name: storeDisplayThumbnail
Label: Thumbnail
Help:
Select an image from your file cabinet you want to use as the thumbnail image for this file.
This image shows with this file before a customer clicks the file for more information.
Upload images at <_TABNAME=LIST_IMAGE_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_IMAGE_>. Click Add File in the Images folder.
You can automatically resize images less than 5 megapixels in size at <_TABNAME=ADMI_IMAGERESIZE_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_IMAGERESIZE_> > Image Resizing.

Name: textFileEncoding
Label: Character Encoding
Help: Choose the proper character encoding for the file.

Name: url
Label: URL
Help: Displays the URL of the file in the file cabinet. This is a read-only field.

Name: bundleable
Help:
Check this box to include the file in a bundle.
If you include this file in a bundle, clearing this box does not remove the file from the bundle. If you want to remove the file from a bundle, you have to update the bundle and remove the file.

Name: class
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Classes. This field is required when Make Classes Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: department
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when Make Departments Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: description
Help: Enter a description for this file. This description appears on the file record only.

Name: folderType
Help:
The Type field automatically populates with the appropriate value for the folder selected. File Cabinet folders help to organize the files you use for different purposes. In most cases, when you create a subfolder, the Type is automatically set.
If you are creating or customizing an SSP application subfolder, you may have the option to select a value for type. Note the following about the options available:
    * Documents and Files - intended for storing documents and files for general use. SuiteScript files must be stored in the SuiteScripts folder or a subfolder thereof. The value for Type in SuiteScript subfolders are set to Documents and Files.
    * SuiteCommerce Advanced Site Templates - intended for storing SSP application assets. Use this option for SSP application subfolders.

Name: group
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Lists > Relationships > Groups.

Name: hideInBundle
Help:
Check this box if you want this file to not be viewable by those who install this file as part of a SuiteBundle.
Note: You cannot hide Client SuiteScript in a bundle.

Name: isInactive
Help: Set to true if you want to inactivate this record. If set to true, this file or folder will no longer appear on lists.

Name: isOnline
Help:
* Check this box if you want this file accessible externally. The file may be accessed with a URL that points to the file record.
    * Clear this box if you want the file only accessible to those who are logged in to NetSuite with permission to view file cabinet documents.

Name: isPrivate
Help: Set to true if you want the documents and images in this folder to be seen by only you.

Name: location
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Locations. This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: name
Help: Enter a name for this file cabinet folder. You can use folders to organize the documents and images you store in your file cabinet.

Name: parent
Help: If this folder is a subfolder of another, set the parent folder here.

Name: availableToPartners
Label: Available to Adv. Partners
Help: If true, this item is available in the Advanced Partner Center.

Name: billingSchedule
Label: Billing Schedule
Help:
Allows users to reference default Billing Schedules for items.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: class
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Classes. This field is required when the Make Classes Mandatory preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: costEstimate
Label: Item Defined Cost
Help: Enter an Item Defined Cost amount.

Name: costEstimateType
Label: Cost Estimate Type
Help:
The Cost Estimate Type determines what value NetSuite uses to calculate estimated Gross Profit.
The estimated Gross Profit for Items on a transaction provides the data needed to calculate the total estimated Gross Profit on that transaction.
The individual line items that you enter in a transaction determine the amounts that post when you process that transaction.
The following Cost Estimate Types on Items are available:
    * Item Defined Cost - a user-defined amount, entered into the Item Defined Cost field on the Item definition page.
    * Average Cost - NetSuite calculates an average cost of the units purchased. 
    * Last Purchase Price - This field displays the most recent purchase price of the item as determined by purchase order receipt transactions. 
    * Purchase Price - Price entered that you pay for this item. If you do not enter a price, then the most recent purchase price from purchase orders provides the price for this item by default.
    * Preferred Vendor Rate - This option is only used if the Multi-Vendor feature is enabled and multiple vendors supply the same item.
          o First priority is to use the preferred vendor rate if defined on the Item record.
          o Next priority would be to use the purchase price.
          o Last priority would be the purchase order rate. (Initially this uses the preferred vendor rate cost, and then after a purchase order is entered, this type uses the most recent actual purchase order rate. Special orders and drop-shipped items use this cost information.)
    * Derived from member items - Total costs of items currently included in a kit. This Cost Estimate Type only applies to kits and sums the estimated costs of each item in the kit, based on each of their individual Cost Estimate Types. Uses the latest definition of the kit, not its historical definition.

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: daysBeforeExpiration
Label: Days Before Expiration
Help:
If you want this item to expire, enter the number of days it should remain active after purchase.
If this item is downloadable and the same customer purchases this item more than once, the countdown to expiration restarts with each purchase.
Note: If this item is a gift certificate and the buyer lives in California, Connecticut, Louisiana, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, Rhode Island or Washington, by law the gift certificate cannot expire.

Name: department
Help: Set a department to associate with this item. For details on existing department records, in the UI go to Setup > Company > Departments.

Name: displayName
Label: Display Name/Code
Help:
You can set an optional name for this item in addition to the item name. If you are integrating with a Yahoo! store, this field is imported from Yahoo!.
The display name prints in the Item column of the sales form when Basic printing is used. If this item is a member of a kit, this name appears in the Item column when the Print Items box is checked. 
If you do not set a display name, then item name appears on printed forms.

Name: dontShowPrice
Label: Don't Show Price
Help:
Check this box to hide the price of this item online.
This is useful for items you want to advertise but don't want to sell or for items that you track inventory for and want to display but are offered in combination with other items.

Name: excludeFromSitemap
Label: Exclude from Sitemap
Help: Check this box to exclude a tab, category or item page from the site map.

Name: featuredDescription
Label: Featured Description
Help: Settable only if item is featured. You can provide letters, numbers and basic HTML code.

Name: includeChildren
Label: Include Children
Help:
Check the Include Children box to share the item with all the sub-subsidiaries associated with each subsidiary selected in the Subsidiary field.
Note: When sharing items across subsidiaries, all of the options selected on the item record must be compatible across subsidiaries.
 
For example, when entering an inventory item to be shared across subsidiaries, you should select Income and Asset accounts on the item record that are also shared across the same subsidiaries.

Name: incomeAccount
Label: Income Account
Help: References an existing income account at Lists > Accounting > Accounts. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: isDonationItem
Label: Variable Amount
Help: If true, the item is set as a variable-priced donation item. This enables customers to enter their own prices for this item, such as for donations.

Name: isFulfillable
Label: Can be Fulfilled
Help:
Check the Can be Fulfilled/Received box to enable this item to be received and fulfilled during order processing.
Clear this box if this item does not require being received and fulfilled.
Note: Once this item has been added to transactions, this setting cannot be changed.
This field is used when the Advanced Billing and Advanced Shipping features are both enabled.

Name: isGcoCompliant
Label: Google Checkout Compliant
Help: Check this box to make the item available for purchase with Google Checkout.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: Sets the item as inactive. By default, this field is set to false.

Name: isOnline
Label: Display in Web Site
Help: Set to true to make this item available online in your Web site. You cannot sell this item online unless this field is set to true.

Name: issueProduct
Label: Product
Help:
Select the product this item is associated with.
Product records are tracked with versions and builds for issue management.
To create product records, go to <_TABNAME=ADMI_ISSUEPRODUCT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_ISSUEPRODUCT_> > Products > New.

Name: isTaxable
Label: Taxable
Help: Check this box if the item is subject to sales tax.

Name: itemId
Label: Item Name/Number
Help:
Type up to 60 characters for the name of this item. This name appears in lists on transactions.
If you have the option of entering a display name and do not, the item name prints in the Item column of sales forms.
If you have the option to enter a vendor name and do not, the item name prints in the Item column of purchase forms when Basic printing is used. If you have entered a display name, it will print on purchases instead of the item name when Basic printing is used.

Name: liabilityAccount
Label: Liability Account
Help:
Select the liabilty account that will be affected by this item. Click New to set up a new account.
Go to Setup > Accounts for details about existing accounts.

Name: location
Help:
Select a location to associate with this item.
To use a location, the Multi-Location Inventory feature must be enabled.
    * If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is not enabled:
      Selecting an item record location limits the items that certain roles can access.
      For example, Role A is set up to access only items associated with Location One. Therefore, employees who have Role A can access only items associated with Location One.
      Note: If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is not enabled, you cannot use this field to track inventory by locations. For example, you cannot track how many widgets you have in stock in Location One.
      For more information click here.
    * If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is enabled:
      Selecting an item record location classifies the item by that location to limit the items that certain roles can access. To track inventory per location, use the Locations subtab at the bottom of this form.
      For more information click here.
Select New to enter a new location record.
Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_LOCATION_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_LOCATION_> > Locations for details about existing location records.

Name: maxDonationAmount
Label: Maximum Variable Amount
Help: If isDonationItem is set to true, set this field to the maximum amount that can be paid or donated for this item.

Name: metaTagHtml
Label: Meta Tag HTML
Help: Sets the metatag information for the item page in web store.

Name: noPriceMessage
Label: No Price Message
Help:
If you opted to not show a price online, enter the message that should show instead of the price.
For example, you might enter "Call for Price."

Name: offerSupport
Label: Offer Support
Help: When enabled, items can be referenced on case records either through the UI or via web services using the item field.

Name: onSpecial
Label: On Special
Help: Set to true if you want to put this item on special. The item then appears in the Specials category in your store or site.

Name: outOfStockBehavior
Label: Out Of Stock Behavior
Help:
Select a custom out of stock behavior for this item. It overwrites the overall site’s out of stock behavior. Your choices are:
    * Default - Uses the behavior selected in the Web Store Out of Stock Items field at Setup > Web Site > Setup Tasks > Set Up Web Site > Shopping.
    * Disallow back orders but display out of stock messages
    * Allow back orders but display out of stock messages
    * Remove items when out of stock
    * Allow back orders with no out of stock message

Name: outOfStockMessage
Label: Out Of Stock Message
Help: You can enter a custom out of stock message for this item. The message here replaces the default out of stock message.

Name: pageTitle
Label: Page Title
Help: Sets the display title in the upper-left corner of an Internet browser when customers view this item in your Web store.

Name: parent
Label: Subitem of
Help:
References an existing item record. Only required if the item is a child of another item.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: pricesIncludeTax
Label: Prices Include Tax
Help: Check this box to save the base price as the tax inclusive price. Clear this box to save the base price as the tax exclusive price.

Name: rate
Label: Price
Help: Defines the rate for this item. If a value is entered followed by the percentage sign, the discount is interpreted as a percentage discount (i.e.  -.10% sets a ten percent discount for the item). If a value without the percentage sign is entered, the rate is interpreted as a flat dollar value.

Name: relatedItemsDescription
Label: Related Items Description
Help: Sets the description displayed for a group of related items.

Name: salesDescription
Label: Sales Description
Help: Sets the description displayed when an item's store display name is clicked.

Name: salesTaxCode
Label: Sales Tax Code
Help:
This field is required for customers subscribing to International versions on NetSuite. Sets the default tax code to be used on sales transactions. 
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: searchKeywords
Label: Search Keywords
Help: Enter alternative search keywords that customers might use to find this item using your Web store�s internal search. These can include synonyms, acronyms, alternate languages or misspellings. These keywords are seen as equally important as the item name when searches are conducted.

Name: showDefaultDonationAmount
Label: Show Default Amount
Help: Can only be set when isDonation is set to True. If true, the item's online price is displayed as a suggested price.

Name: sitemapPriority
Label: Sitemap Priority
Help:
Use the Sitemap Priority list to indicate the relative importance of your Web site URLs.
You can select a priority ranging from 0.0 to 1.0 on item, category, and tab records.
NetSuite assigns the default priority “Auto” to all new and existing tab, category and item records in your account. The priority is calculated based on the position of the item or category in the hierarchy of your Web site.
For example, your Web site tabs automatically generate a default priority value of 1.0 because they are top level pages. A category published to a tab gets a priority of 0.5. An item published to a category on a tab gets a priority of 0.3.

Name: specialsDescription
Label: Specials Description
Help: Settable only if onSpecial is set to True. You can provide letters, numbers and basic HTML code.

Name: storeDescription
Label: Store Description
Help: Sets the item description. This field can contain plain text as well as basic html code.

Name: storeDetailedDescription
Label: Detailed Description
Help: Sets the detailed item description. This field can contain plain text as well as basic html code.

Name: storeDisplayImage
Label: Item Display Image
Help: References an existing image file in the file cabinet. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: storeDisplayName
Label: Store Display Name
Help: Sets the item name for your Web site.

Name: storeDisplayThumbnail
Label: Item Display Thumbnail
Help: References an existing image file in the file cabinet. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: storeItemTemplate
Label: Item Drilldown Template
Help: References an existing item template at Setup > Web Site > Item/Category Templates.

Name: taxSchedule
Label: Schedule
Help:
Select the tax schedule you want to apply to this item.
You can create new tax schedules at Setup > Accounting > Taxes > Tax Schedules > New.

Name: upcCode
Label: UPC Code
Help: Defines whether this is a unv part code. Bar codes for items are generated in Code 128 by default. If you prefer to use the UPC code format, set this field to True on each item record.

Name: urlComponent
Label: URL Component
Help:
Enter a short, descriptive name for this item to appear as part of its URL in the Web store.
Setting a name to show in the URL can result in better ranking from search engines.
If you leave this field blank, NetSuite terms and numbers are used as identifiers in the URL.
Note: Descriptive URL components are case sensitive. Descriptive URLs must match the case used in the URL Component field of an item record to point to the correct page.

Name: accountingBook
Label: Accounting Book
Help: You must select an accounting book before you select the subsidiary. Only active accounting books appear on the list.

Name: class
Help: Select the class that the transaction must be associated with in order to meet the mapping rule.

Name: department
Help: Select the department that the transaction must include in order to meet the mapping rule.

Name: destinationAccount
Label: Destination Account
Help:
Select the account that you want transactions post to for the secondary book that you selected from the Accounting Book list.
Select -Same- if you want skip mapping for the set of dimensions you have selected. This enables you to apply the mapping rules to all dimensions except a specific set.

Name: effectiveDate
Label: Effective Date
Help: Enter or select the date that the account mapping begins.

Name: endDate
Label: End Date
Help:
Enter or select the date that the account mapping ends. This field can be left blank until a new account mapping is needed.
When blank, the mapping continues indefinitely.

Name: location
Help: Select the location that the transaction must be associated with in order to meet the mapping rule.

Name: sourceAccount
Label: Source Account
Help:
Select an account that is used for the primary book. This is the account that is mapped from.
The list includes both primary book accounts and secondary book accounts.

Name: subsidiary
Help:
Select the subsidiary that must be associated with the transaction in order to meeting the mapping rule.
You must select an accounting book to select a subsidiary.

Name: description
Label: Description
Help: Enter a short unique description for the job.

Name: employmentCategory
Label: Employment Category
Help: Select Full-Time or Part-Time from the Employment Category dropdown list.

Name: isInactive
Label: Job Is Inactive
Help: Check this box to make this job inactive. This affects how the job appears on the Jobs list.

Name: jobId
Label: Job ID
Help: This is a read-only field generated by NetSuite when the job record is created.

Name: title
Label: Title
Help: Enter a unique job title for this job.

Name: actualDeliveryDate
Label: Actual Delivery Date
Help:
Use the picker to input the actual date the shipment arrived at the receiving location.
The expected and actual dates can be used for the reporting of variances and setting performance metrics.

Name: actualShippingDate
Label: Actual Shipping Date
Help:
Input a date when the consignment was actually shipped.
The expected and actual dates can be used for the reporting of variances and setting performance metrics.

Name: billOfLading
Label: Bill Of Lading
Help: Enter the number from your bill of lading documentation in this field.

Name: expectedDeliveryDate
Label: Expected Delivery Date
Help: Use the picker to add the date when the shipment is expected to be delivered to the receiving location.

Name: expectedShippingDate
Label: Expected Shipping Date
Help: Use the date picker to insert the date for when the shipment is expected to leave. The field can be edited to reflect changing circumstances.

Name: externalDocumentNumber
Label: External Document Number
Help:
Add the identifying number for the shipment as supplied by your shipping company here.
You can customize the Inbound Shipments list page to include this field for easy identification of the shipment.

Name: shipmentMemo
Label: Memo
Help:
Use this field to highlight key, or frequently used information.
It is best practice to add a User Note in the Communications subtab to log call other types of communication relating to the shipment.

Name: shipmentNumber
Label: Shipment Number
Help:
This is a system generated number. The format can be customized by updating the Inbound Shipment field at: 
Setup > Company > Auto-Generated Numbers > Transaction Numbers.

Name: shipmentStatus
Label: Status
Help:
This is a read only field and updates to reflect the progress of the shipment. The five statuses are:
    * To be Shipped
    * In Transit
    * Partially Received
    * Received
    * Closed

Name: vesselNumber
Label: Vessel Number
Help: Input the vessel's IMO number, or other identifying reference in this field.

Name: accountingBook
Label: Accounting Book
Help: Select an accounting book. You may select the primary book or any secondary accounting book to which you have access.

Name: approved
Label: Approved
Help:
Check this box to indicate that this journal entry is approved.
If you check this box, this journal entry will post immediately.
If you do not check this box, this journal entry must be approved before it posts.

Name: class
Help: If this entry is associated with a particular class, select it. Click —New— to set up a new class.

Name: createdFrom
Label: Void Of
Help:
This field shows the original transaction that is being voided.
 
Click the link to open the original transaction.

Name: currency
Label: Currency
Help:
This field is the currency used for all amounts in this journal entry.
For regular journal entries, currency defaults to the base currency of your company or root parent subsidiary, and can be changed to any other currency available in your account.
For intercompany journal entries in OneWorld, currency defaults to the base currency of the selected initiating subsidiary and can be changed to the currency of the To Subsidiary.

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: Select the custom journal entry record, if required.

Name: department
Help:
If you like, select a department.
Click New to enter a new department.

Name: exchangeRate
Label: Exchange Rate
Help:
This field displays the default exchange rate of the To Subsidiary's currency to the Subsidiary's currency.
You can edit the exchange rate for this transaction only, or you can update the currency exchange rates list.

Name: location
Help:
Select a location to associate with this line item. Select New to create a new location record.
Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_LOCATION_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_LOCATION_> > Locations for details about existing locations.

Name: memo
Label: Memo
Help: If you wish, enter a memo to describe this journal entry. It will appear on this transaction detail as well as reports such as a 2-line account register.

Name: postingPeriod
Label: Posting Period
Help: The current period is entered as the posting period for the journal entry. If this period is closed before the journal entry is approved, the posting period is the earliest open period.

Name: reversalDate
Label: Reversal Date
Help:
If this journal entry is intended to be reversed, enter the date for the reversing entry to be posted.
If Defer Entry is checked, this field is mandatory.

Name: reversalDefer
Label: Defer Entry
Help:
Check this box to make the reversal a memorized transaction that automatically occurs on the date entered in the required Reversal Date field.
Clear this box to make the reversal an immediately entered transaction with the date in the Reversal Date field.

Name: reversalEntry
Label: Reversal No.
Help: If this journal entry is a reversal journal entry, the reversal number appears in this read-only field.

Name: subsidiary
Label: From {1}
Help:
If you are entering a regular, book specific, or statistical journal entry:
In the Subsidiary field, select the subsidiary to associate with this journal entry.
Note: If the subsidiary you select is assigned to one or more shared vendor records, you can make journal entries for any of the vendors to which the selected subsidiary is assigned. To do this, on the Lines subtab, select the shared vendor from the Name field. 
Note: When a journal entry is associated with a subsidiary, the journal posts to that subsidiary and the schedule is restricted to be viewed only by entities associated with the subsidiary.
If you are entering an intercompany journal entry:
In the Subsidiary field, choose the subsidiary initiating the ledger transaction. The first line of this journal entry must post to the subsidiary you choose here.
Note: All lines of an intercompany journal entry must post to either the Subsidary or the To Subsidiary. No other subsidiaries can be associated with lines on this journal entry.
If you are entering an advanced intercompany journal entry:
In the Subsidiary field, choose the subsidiary initiating the ledger transaction. The first line of this journal entry must post to the subsidiary you choose here. The remaining lines can post to any subsidiary to which you are granted access.

Name: toSubsidiary
Label: To {1}
Help:
Choose the second subsidiary for this ledger transaction.
Note: All lines of this journal entry must post to either the Subsidary or the To Subsidiary. No other subsidiaries can be associated with lines on this journal entry.

Name: tranDate
Label: Date
Help: NetSuite inserts today's date as the date of this journal entry. You can enter or select another date.

Name: tranId
Label: Entry No.
Help:
NetSuite increases the largest journal entry number by one. If you wish, you can type another number.
The next journal entry number will revert to the standard pattern.
You can enter a maximum of 45 characters in this field.

Name: altShippingCost
Help: This field displays shipping costs associated with this transfer order.

Name: class
Help:
Select a class to associate with this transaction.
To create a new class, select New.
For details on existing classes, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_CLASS_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CLASS_> > Classes.

Name: department
Help:
Select a department to associate with this transaction.
To create a new department, select New.
For details on existing departments, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_DEPARTMENT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_DEPARTMENT_> > Departments.

Name: employee
Help:
Select an employee to associate with this transfer order.
Select New to add a new employee.
Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_EMPLOYEE_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_EMPLOYEE_> > Employees for details about existing employees.

Name: incoterm
Help:
For transfer orders and intercompany transfer orders, use the following default international commercial terms (incoterms) to define when the transfer of ownership occurs for items being transferred between locations:
    * Ex Work (EXW) – inventory ownership is transferred at the shipping point
    * Delivered at Place (DAP) – inventory ownership is transferred at the destination point
Be aware that the incoterm you select impacts accounting and inventory information.
When creating a transfer order, you can only select EXW or DAP. After the order status is pending approval or pending fulfillment, you can choose another incoterm.

Name: location
Help:
In the From Location field, select the originating location for the transfer. Items are taken out of this location and the inventory count for the item is decreased at the location when the order is fulfilled.
You are not required to enter a source location to enter a transfer order, but you must choose a source location to approve and fulfill the transfer order.
To create a new location, select New.
For details on existing locations, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_LOCATION_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_LOCATION_> > Locations.

Name: memo
Help:
Enter a memo to identify this transfer order.
When you use the Search Transactions feature, you can search for specific words and phrases in the Memo field.

Name: orderStatus
Help:
Select Pending Approval to route this order through the approval process before it is fulfilled.
Select Pending Fulfillment to skip the approval process.

Name: shipAddressList
Help: Select the appropriate shipping address for this transaction. Select New to enter a new shipping address.

Name: shipComplete
Help:
Check this box if you want to ship this order when there are enough items available to fully fulfill the orders.
When fulfilling orders in bulk, you can filter the list to include those orders marked Ship Complete that can be completely fulfilled by selecting Respect Ship Complete in the Filter By field.

Name: shipDate
Help: The date defaults to show the current date. You can type or pick another shipping date for this order.

Name: shipMethod
Help:
Select a shipping method for this order.
If you automatically charge for shipping, the shipping amount is entered in the shipping costs field. To automatically charge for shipping, go to <_TABNAME=ADMI_SHIPPING_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_SHIPPING_> > Shipping and check the Charge for Shipping box. Click Submit. You must also set up the charge details of your shipping items.
To add or edit shipping items, go to Lists > Accounting > Shipping Items.

Name: shippingCost
Help:
The shipping cost automatically calculates depending on the shipping method you select in the Ship Via field above.
To change the cost of a shipping method, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_SHIPITEM_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_SHIPITEM_> > Shipping Items and select the shipping method you want to change.
If you use UPS Real-Time rates and a package is over 150lbs, the package is charged as multiple packages equal to or less than 150lbs.

Name: subsidiary
Help:
Select the subsidiary where the items will be taken from. The selection you make in this field determines which locations are available to be selected in the From Location field.
For example, if you select Subsidiary B here, you can choose a source location from a list of locations limited to only those associated with Subsidiary B.

Name: subTotal
Help: As you add items, the total shows in this field.

Name: toSubsidiary
Help:
Select the subsidiary where the items are to be received. The selection you make in this field determines which locations are available to be selected in the To Location field.
For example, if you select Subsidiary B here, you can choose a destination location from a list of locations limited to only those associated with Subsidiary B.

Name: total
Help: This field shows the total amount associated with this order, including shipping and handling costs.

Name: tranDate
Help:
The current date autofills for this transfer order.
You can select or enter a different date.

Name: tranId
Help:
Enter the number of this transfer order.
If you use autogenerated numbering, the next order number in the sequence shows here. You can enter another number if you choose.

Name: transferLocation
Help:
In the Destination Location field, select the receiving location for the transfer. The inventory count and asset value for the item is increased at this location when the items are received.
You are required to enter a destination location to enter or approve a transfer order.
The Ship To Address of the transfer order defaults to the address of the destination location.
To create a new location, select New.
For details on existing locations, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_LOCATION_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_LOCATION_> > Locations.

Name: useItemCostAsTransferCost
Help:
Check this box to use the transfer price as a declared shipping value for reference only. For example, for insurance or international shipping.
    * The transfer price is not a charge for the destination location.
    * The transfer price does not affect inventory costing on transactions.
    * The transfer price defaults to show the value in the Transfer Price field of item records.
    * Partial fulfillment and receipt of transfer orders is allowed, but you cannot receive more than you have fulfilled on any date. For example, if you have fulfilled 10 widgets out of 20 on a transfer order, you cannot receive 12 widgets on that order.
Clear this box to use the transfer price shown on the transfer order as the item cost on the item receipt.
Important: If no transfer price is entered on the transfer order, no cost is recorded on the item receipt.
    * Any difference between the actual cost and the transfer price posts to a Gain/Loss account when the item is shipped.
    * The transfer price and the Gain/Loss account are defined on each item record.
    * The transfer price defaults to show the value in the Transfer Price field of item records.
If you use approval routing, this setting can be changed on a transfer order as long as the transfer order is not yet approved. Once the transfer order is approved, this setting cannot be changed.

Name: account
Label: Adjustment Account
Help:
Select the appropriate account for inventory adjustments. Usually, this will be an expense account.
For details on accounts, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_ACCOUNT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_ACCOUNT_> > Chart of Accounts.

Name: adjLocation
Label: Adjustment {1}
Help:
To select the location to associate with this adjustment transaction:
   1. Select New to enter a new location.
   2. Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_LOCATION_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_LOCATION_> > Locations for information on existing locations.
Note: You can select locations for items on the Adjustments subtab.

Name: class
Help:
Select a class to associate with this transaction.
To create a new class, select New.
For details on existing classes, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_CLASS_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CLASS_> > Classes.

Name: customer
Label: Customer
Help:
If this inventory adjustment is a project-related cost but is not specifically billed as a line item, select the appropriate customer or project.
For example, when a caterer bills his or her customers a per person rate for a beer and wine bar, they can then enter an inventory adjustment to account for the actual number of bottles consumed.

Name: department
Help:
Select a department to associate with this transaction.
To create a new department, select New.
For details on existing departments, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_DEPARTMENT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_DEPARTMENT_> > Departments.

Name: estimatedTotalValue
Label: Estimated Total Value
Help:
This is the total value of the change in your inventory.
When you submit the adjustment, the current cost is determined from your inventory database and your adjustment totals are updated.

Name: location
Help:
Select a location to associate with this assembly. Select New to enter a new location.
Go to Lists > Locations for details about existing locations.

Name: memo
Label: Memo
Help: Enter an optional memo for this adjustment. It will appear on a register or Account Detail report.

Name: postingPeriod
Label: Posting Period
Help:
Select the period you want to post this inventory adjustment to.
If a period is closed, you cannot post to that period.

Name: subsidiary
Help: If you have a NetSuite OneWorld account, select a Subsidiary from the list.

Name: tranDate
Label: Date
Help:
Today's date autofills as the date of this inventory adjustment.
You can enter or choose another date.

Name: tranId
Label: Ref No.
Help:
Enter an optional reference number for this inventory adjustment.
Reference Numbers for inventory adjustments do not have to be consecutive.
You can enter a maximum of 45 characters in this field.

Name: account
Label: Adjustment Account
Help: Select an Adjustment Account. The inventory value variance amounts post to this account.

Name: class
Help: If you use Classes, select one to identify with this revaluation.

Name: department
Help: If you use Departments, select one to identify with this revaluation.

Name: subsidiary
Help: If you have a NetSuite OneWorld account, select a subsidiary from the dropdown list in the Subsidiary field.

Name: alternateDemandSourceItem
Label: Alternate Source Item
Help:
For demand planning purposes, choose another item if you want to examine the historical sales of an item other than the one on the current record. When this field is left blank, the source for historical data is the original item.
For example, if you are setting up Item A for demand planning, but Item A does not have an extensive sales history, you can choose Item B as an alternate source for historical data. Then, when demand calculations need to be made for Item A, NetSuite uses Item B’s history for the calculations.
Note: You can select only an item that is of the same item type to be an alternate source. For example, if the original item is an inventory item, the alternate source item must also be an inventory item.

Name: assetAccount
Label: Asset Account
Help: References an existing asset account at Lists > Accounting > Accounts. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: autoLeadTime
Label: Auto-Calculate
Help:
Lead time is the average number of days between ordering this item from the vendor and receiving it.
    * Check the Auto-Calculate box if you want NetSuite to calculate the lead time based on the most recent order history of this item. This is calculated by taking the number of days between the order entry and receipt on the three most recent purchase orders, and dividing by three.
          o If there are multiple receipts for the item against the same purchase order, only the first receipt is used for the calculation.
          o Lead time calculation is not weighted by number of units received.
          o More recent purchase orders without receipts are ignored.
    * Clear the Auto-Calculate box to manually enter a lead time value in days. If the Auto-Calculate box is cleared and no value is entered, then the default value from the Set Up Inventory Management page is used.

Name: autoPreferredStockLevel
Label: Auto-Calculate
Help:
The preferred stock level is the optimum quantity to maintain in stock of an item.
Set to true if you want NetSuite to calculate the preferred stock level based on demand for the item. The preferred stock level is calculated as:
    (daily demand * number of days supply preferred)

Name: autoReorderPoint
Label: Auto-Calculate
Help:
The Reorder Point is the quantity level at which you need to reorder or build more of this item. Set this field to false to manually calculate the point at which to reorder or build more of this item
Set this field to true if you want NetSuite to calculate the reorder point based on demand for the item over time. The reorder point depends on the safety stock definition and is calculated as follows:
Without safety stock defined:   Reorder point = (average lead time days * demand)
With safety stock defined in days:    Reorder point = [(average lead time days + safety stock days) * demand]
With safety stock quantity defined:    Reorder point = [(average lead time days * demand) + safety stock quantity)

Name: availableToPartners
Label: Available to Adv. Partners
Help: If true, this item is available in the Advanced Partner Center.

Name: averageCost
Label: Average Cost
Help:
This field displays the current average cost of the item across all locations. Using the weighted-average method, the average cost is calculated as the total units available during a period divided by the beginning inventory cost plus the cost of additions to inventory.
Note: The average cost calculated per location is listed for each location on the Locations subtab.
If you use Multiple Units of Measure, average cost is calculated using stock units.

Name: backwardConsumptionDays
Label: Backward Consumption Days
Help:
When you use the Forecast Consumption demand source method, set the following:
    * Forward Consumption – Number of days after the order date to consider
    * Backward Consumption – Number of days prior to the order date to consider
When backward and forward consumption days are entered for an item, these fields determine the window, or time period, that is considered for each sales order when a forecast amount may be consumed to calculate demand. If an order falls within the consumption window, that order quantity is calculated as being consumed and the forecast is adjusted to account for the order consumption.
Note: NetSuite always considers backward consumption first.  
The forecast closest to the order in the backward window is consumed first.
The forecast closest to the order in the forward window is considered if there are remaining quantities to be consumed.
Note: Only sales order and invoice quantities can consume forecast quantities. Demand from transfer orders and work orders does not consume forecast quantities.

Name: billExchRateVarianceAcct
Label: Exchange Rate Variance Account
Help:
Select the account to post to for variances in exchange rates associated with this item. These variances occur when there are exchange rate differences between the receipt and the bill for an item.
Note: After you select a variance account in this field, you can select another account at a later date if a change is necessary. Account changes are noted on the System Notes subtab of the History subtab of item records.

Name: billingSchedule
Label: Billing Schedule
Help:
Allows users to reference default Billing Schedules for items.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: billPriceVarianceAcct
Label: Price Variance Account
Help:
Select the account to post to for variances in billing prices associated with this item. These variances occur when there is a difference in the price of an item showing on the purchase order and the price of an item showing on the bill.
Note: After you select a variance account in this field, you can select another account at a later date if a change is necessary. Account changes are noted on the System Notes subtab of the History subtab of item records.

Name: billQtyVarianceAcct
Label: Quantity Variance Account
Help:
Select the account to post to for variances in billing quantities associated with this item. These variances occur when there is a difference in the quantity of an item showing on the receipt and the quantity of an item showing on the bill.
Note: After you select a variance account in this field, you can select another account at a later date if a change is necessary. Account changes are noted on the System Notes subtab of the History subtab of item records.

Name: class
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Classes. This field is required when the Make Classes Mandatory preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: cogsAccount
Label: COGS Account
Help: References an existing COGs account at Lists > Accounting > Accounts. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: contingentRevenueHandling
Label: Eligible For Contingent Revenue Handling
Help: Check this box to indicate that the item is subject to contingent revenue handling. When checked, revenue allocation is affected.

Name: copyDescription
Label: Copy from Sales Order
Help: Sets the description from a sales order.

Name: cost
Label: Purchase Price
Help:
Enter the price you pay for this item.
If you do not enter a price, purchase orders for this item show the most recent purchase price by default.
If you select a preferred vendor for this item, the price is shown in the currency selected on the vendor's record. If no preferred vendor is selected, the price is shown in your base currency.

Name: costCategory
Label: Cost Category
Help: Select a cost category to associate with this item. View existing cost categories at <_TABNAME=LIST_ACCOUNTINGOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY= LIST_ACCOUNTINGOTHERLIST_> > Accounting Lists > Cost Category. For more details, click Help and read Creating Cost Categories.

Name: costEstimate
Label: Item Defined Cost
Help: Enter an Item Defined Cost amount.

Name: costEstimateType
Label: Cost Estimate Type
Help:
The Cost Estimate Type determines what value NetSuite uses to calculate estimated Gross Profit.
The estimated Gross Profit for Items on a transaction provides the data needed to calculate the total estimated Gross Profit on that transaction.
The individual line items that you enter in a transaction determine the amounts that post when you process that transaction.
The following Cost Estimate Types on Items are available:
    * Item Defined Cost - a user-defined amount, entered into the Item Defined Cost field on the Item definition page.
    * Average Cost - NetSuite calculates an average cost of the units purchased. 
    * Last Purchase Price - This field displays the most recent purchase price of the item as determined by purchase order receipt transactions. 
    * Purchase Price - Price entered that you pay for this item. If you do not enter a price, then the most recent purchase price from purchase orders provides the price for this item by default.
    * Preferred Vendor Rate - This option is only used if the Multi-Vendor feature is enabled and multiple vendors supply the same item.
          o First priority is to use the preferred vendor rate if defined on the Item record.
          o Next priority would be to use the purchase price.
          o Last priority would be the purchase order rate. (Initially this uses the preferred vendor rate cost, and then after a purchase order is entered, this type uses the most recent actual purchase order rate. Special orders and drop-shipped items use this cost information.)
    * Derived from member items - Total costs of items currently included in a kit. This Cost Estimate Type only applies to kits and sums the estimated costs of each item in the kit, based on each of their individual Cost Estimate Types. Uses the latest definition of the kit, not its historical definition.

Name: costingMethod
Label: Costing Method
Help: Because the costingMethod field becomes read-only when set, it is not returned in get and basic search operations.  Instead, the read-only field costingMethodDisplay is returned.  The costingMethod field can be used only for addRecord operations and in searches.

Name: costingMethodDisplay
Label: Costing Method
Help:
This is a read-only value that returns the costing method for the item. 
Because the costingMethod field becomes read-only when set, it is not returned in get and basic search operations.  Instead, the read-only field CostingMethodDisplay is returned.

Name: countryOfManufacture
Label: Manufacturer Country
Help: References a value in a system list. Values are listed at platformCommonTyp:Country.

Name: createRevenuePlansOn
Label: Create Revenue Plans On
Help:
Select the event that triggers creation of revenue recognition plans. Match the event with the amount source of the item's revenue recognition rule.
    * Revenue Arrangement Creation - Revenue plans can be created when the revenue arrangement is created. Use this option with rules that have Event-Amount as the Amount Source.
    * Billing - Revenue plans can be created when the sales order is billed and from stand-alone cash sales, invoices, credit memos, and cash refunds. Use this option with rules that have Event-Percent based on amount as the Amount Source.
    * Fulfillment - This option is available only when Advanced Shipping is enabled. Revenue plans can be created upon fulfillment. Use this option with rules that have Event-Percent based on quantity as the Amount Source.
    * Project Progress - This option is available only when the Projects feature is enabled. Use this option with rules that have Event-Percent Complete as the Amount Source.

Name: currency
Label: Currency
Help: This is a read-only field. If a preferred vendor has been specified in vendorName, the field returns the currency set on that vendor record. Otherwise, the base currency for the company is returned.

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: defaultItemShipMethod
Label: Default Shipping Method
Help:
Select the shipping method to display by default when adding the item to a sales order.
You can override the default shipping method and enter any shipping method when fulfilling an order.

Name: defaultReturnCost
Label: Default Return Cost
Help: Enter the rate you want to default to show as the cost for this item when it is returned. What you enter in this field defaults to show in the Override Rate field on item receipts. You can still change this value after it appears on the item receipt.

Name: deferredRevenueAccount
Label: Deferred Revenue Account
Help:
Set the deferred revenue account to associate with this item. Then, when this item is sold and associated with a revenue recognition template, the revenue from the sale is deferred.
The sale amount is posted to a deferred revenue account, as opposed to a standard income account.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: deferRevRec
Label: Hold Revenue Recognition
Help:
Check this box to delay recognizing revenue from the sale of this item. When this box is check, revenue recognition schedules or revenue plans are created with the status On Hold.
For more information, see the help topic Delaying Revenue Recognition for an Item.

Name: demandModifier
Label: Estimated Demand Change
Help:
Set the default percentage of expected demand change to use for calculating item demand. For example, if you know that new customers will increase sales of this item in the future, you can enter 10% expected demand change to be added on to previous sales totals. 
If no expected demand change percentage is set, then the default value from the Set Up Inventory Management page is used.

Name: demandSource
Label: Demand Source
Help:
Select a Demand Source to determine where demand data is sourced for an item.
    * Forecast from Demand Plan – Source only the item's demand plan record.
      Note: A sales order with a related work order generates a supply plan for the sales order. The Mass Create Work Orders page automatically suggests a supply for the sales order.
    * Entered and Planned Orders – Source open orders and use the expected ship date as the demand date. If the item is a member of an assembly, demand for the assembly is included demand calculations for the item.
    * Order and Forecast – Calculates demand for an item by including both the forecast amount and the amount on orders that have been entered.
      Forecast demand for an item is calculated by combining (Quantity forecast over time) + (quantity on sales orders and invoices entered)
    * Forecast Consumption – Calculates demand for an item by subtracting from the forecast quantity any item quantities on orders entered. This removes duplication if an order is already included as part of a forecast.
      Demand for an item is calculated as (Quantity forecast over time) - (quantity on sales orders and invoices entered).

Name: demandTimeFence
Label: Demand Time Fence
Help:
Demand Time Fence defaults to the number entered in the Default Demand Time Fence field.
Verify the default or enter a number between zero and 365 to determine the demand time fence for this item.

Name: department
Help: Set a department to associate with this item. For details on existing department records, in the UI go to Setup > Company > Departments.

Name: directRevenuePosting
Label: Direct Revenue Posting
Help:
Check this box to disable advanced revenue management for this item. When checked, posting transactions that include this item post directly to the item revenue account. No revenue element or revenue arrangement is created. When you check this box, the Deferred Revenue Account on the Accounting subtab is disabled.
When you create sales transactions that include items that have this box checked, all the items in the transaction must have the box checked. You cannot mix items that post directly to revenue with items that post to deferred revenue in the same transaction. This restriction also applies to kit items. All items in a kit must post either to revenue or to deferred revenue.
You cannot check or clear the box after the item has been used in a transaction with advanced revenue management.
By default, this box is not checked.

Name: displayName
Label: Display Name/Code
Help:
You can set an optional name for this item in addition to the item name. If you are integrating with a Yahoo! store, this field is imported from Yahoo!.
The display name prints in the Item column of the sales form when Basic printing is used. If this item is a member of a kit, this name appears in the Item column when the Print Items box is checked. 
If you do not set a display name, then item name appears on printed forms.

Name: distributionCategory
Label: Distribution Category
Help:
Choose the appropriate category. Once a distribution category is defined on the item record, NetSuite can incorporate network transfers into demand planning for the item.
Note: The network and category you select must be associated with the subsidiary selected for the item in the Classifications section of the item record. For details about how categories are associated with subsidiaries, click Help and read Creating Distribution Categories.

Name: distributionNetwork
Label: Distribution Network
Help:
Choose the appropriate network to determine the distribution categories available to you. If the distribution network field is blank, then distribution category must also be blank.
Note: The network and category you select must be associated with the subsidiary selected for the item in the Classifications section of the item record. For details about how networks are associated with subsidiaries, click Help and read Creating a Distribution Network.

Name: dontShowPrice
Label: Don't Show Price
Help:
Check this box to hide the price of this item online.
This is useful for items you want to advertise but don't want to sell or for items that you track inventory for and want to display but are offered in combination with other items.

Name: dropshipExpenseAccount
Label: Dropship Expense Account
Help: When the Automated Intercompany Drop Ship feature is enabled, this field defaults to the account specified in the Default Expense Account on Accounting Preference page, but you can override this account. The account you select must have the Eliminate Intercompany Transactions box checked.

Name: enforceMinQtyInternally
Label: Enforce Minimum Internally
Help: Check this box to apply the minimum quantity restriction on sales orders generated from NetSuite. When you clear this box, but enter a number in the Minimum Quantity field, the minimum quantity is only applied to web store orders.

Name: excludeFromSitemap
Label: Exclude from Sitemap
Help: Check this box to exclude a tab, category or item page from the site map.

Name: expenseAccount
Help: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: featuredDescription
Label: Featured Description
Help: Settable only if item is featured. You can provide letters, numbers and basic HTML code.

Name: fixedLotSize
