Name: billingSchedule
Label: Billing Schedule
Help:
Allows users to reference default Billing Schedules for items.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: class
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Classes. This field is required when the Make Classes Mandatory preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: copyDescription
Label: Copy from Sales Order
Help: Sets the description from a sales order.

Name: cost
Label: Purchase Price
Help:
Enter the price you pay for this item.
If you do not enter a price, purchase orders for this item show the most recent purchase price by default.
If you select a preferred vendor for this item, the price is shown in the currency selected on the vendor's record. If no preferred vendor is selected, the price is shown in your base currency.

Name: costCategory
Label: Cost Category
Help: Select a cost category to associate with this item. View existing cost categories at <_TABNAME=LIST_ACCOUNTINGOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY= LIST_ACCOUNTINGOTHERLIST_> > Accounting Lists > Cost Category. For more details, click Help and read Creating Cost Categories.

Name: costEstimate
Label: Item Defined Cost
Help: Enter an Item Defined Cost amount.

Name: costEstimateType
Label: Cost Estimate Type
Help:
The Cost Estimate Type determines what value NetSuite uses to calculate estimated Gross Profit.
The estimated Gross Profit for Items on a transaction provides the data needed to calculate the total estimated Gross Profit on that transaction.
The individual line items that you enter in a transaction determine the amounts that post when you process that transaction.
The following Cost Estimate Types on Items are available:
    * Item Defined Cost - a user-defined amount, entered into the Item Defined Cost field on the Item definition page.
    * Average Cost - NetSuite calculates an average cost of the units purchased. 
    * Last Purchase Price - This field displays the most recent purchase price of the item as determined by purchase order receipt transactions. 
    * Purchase Price - Price entered that you pay for this item. If you do not enter a price, then the most recent purchase price from purchase orders provides the price for this item by default.
    * Preferred Vendor Rate - This option is only used if the Multi-Vendor feature is enabled and multiple vendors supply the same item.
          o First priority is to use the preferred vendor rate if defined on the Item record.
          o Next priority would be to use the purchase price.
          o Last priority would be the purchase order rate. (Initially this uses the preferred vendor rate cost, and then after a purchase order is entered, this type uses the most recent actual purchase order rate. Special orders and drop-shipped items use this cost information.)
    * Derived from member items - Total costs of items currently included in a kit. This Cost Estimate Type only applies to kits and sums the estimated costs of each item in the kit, based on each of their individual Cost Estimate Types. Uses the latest definition of the kit, not its historical definition.

Name: countryOfManufacture
Label: Manufacturer Country
Help: References a value in a system list. Values are listed at platformCommonTyp:Country.

Name: createRevenuePlansOn
Label: Create Revenue Plans On
Help:
Select the event that triggers creation of revenue recognition plans. Match the event with the amount source of the item's revenue recognition rule.
    * Revenue Arrangement Creation - Revenue plans can be created when the revenue arrangement is created. Use this option with rules that have Event-Amount as the Amount Source.
    * Billing - Revenue plans can be created when the sales order is billed and from stand-alone cash sales, invoices, credit memos, and cash refunds. Use this option with rules that have Event-Percent based on amount as the Amount Source.
    * Fulfillment - This option is available only when Advanced Shipping is enabled. Revenue plans can be created upon fulfillment. Use this option with rules that have Event-Percent based on quantity as the Amount Source.
    * Project Progress - This option is available only when the Projects feature is enabled. Use this option with rules that have Event-Percent Complete as the Amount Source.

Name: currency
Label: Purchase Currency
Help: This is a read-only field. If a preferred vendor has been specified in vendorName, the field returns the currency set on that vendor record. Otherwise, the base currency for the company is returned.

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: defaultItemShipMethod
Label: Default Shipping Method
Help:
Select the shipping method to display by default when adding the item to a sales order.
You can override the default shipping method and enter any shipping method when fulfilling an order.

Name: deferralAccount
Label: Deferred Expense
Help:
Select a deferred expense account if you want to amortize expenses instead of posting to a standard expense account.
 
Note: If you do not select a deferred expense account for an item, you can associate an amortization template with the item on transactions only if the template identifies a specific deferred expense account.

Name: deferredRevenueAccount
Label: Deferred Revenue Account
Help:
Set the deferred revenue account to associate with this item. Then, when this item is sold and associated with a revenue recognition template, the revenue from the sale is deferred.
The sale amount is posted to a deferred revenue account, as opposed to a standard income account.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: deferRevRec
Label: Hold Revenue Recognition
Help:
Check this box to delay recognizing revenue from the sale of this item. When this box is check, revenue recognition schedules or revenue plans are created with the status On Hold.
For more information, see the help topic Delaying Revenue Recognition for an Item.

Name: department
Help: Set a department to associate with this item. For details on existing department records, in the UI go to Setup > Company > Departments.

Name: directRevenuePosting
Label: Direct Revenue Posting
Help:
Check this box to disable advanced revenue management for this item. When checked, posting transactions that include this item post directly to the item revenue account. No revenue element or revenue arrangement is created. When you check this box, the Deferred Revenue Account on the Accounting subtab is disabled.
When you create sales transactions that include items that have this box checked, all the items in the transaction must have the box checked. You cannot mix items that post directly to revenue with items that post to deferred revenue in the same transaction. This restriction also applies to kit items. All items in a kit must post either to revenue or to deferred revenue.
You cannot check or clear the box after the item has been used in a transaction with advanced revenue management.
By default, this box is not checked.

Name: displayName
Label: Display Name/Code
Help:
You can set an optional name for this item in addition to the item name. If you are integrating with a Yahoo! store, this field is imported from Yahoo!.
The display name prints in the Item column of the sales form when Basic printing is used. If this item is a member of a kit, this name appears in the Item column when the Print Items box is checked. 
If you do not set a display name, then item name appears on printed forms.

Name: dontShowPrice
Label: Don't Show Price
Help:
Check this box to hide the price of this item online.
This is useful for items you want to advertise but don't want to sell or for items that you track inventory for and want to display but are offered in combination with other items.

Name: dropshipExpenseAccount
Label: Dropship Expense Account
Help: When the Automated Intercompany Drop Ship feature is enabled, this field defaults to the account specified in the Default Expense Account on Accounting Preference page, but you can override this account. The account you select must have the Eliminate Intercompany Transactions box checked.

Name: enforceMinQtyInternally
Label: Enforce Minimum Internally
Help: Check this box to apply the minimum quantity restriction on sales orders generated from NetSuite. When you clear this box, but enter a number in the Minimum Quantity field, the minimum quantity is only applied to web store orders.

Name: excludeFromSitemap
Label: Exclude from Sitemap
Help: Check this box to exclude a tab, category or item page from the site map.

Name: expenseAccount
Label: Expense Account
Help: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: featuredDescription
Label: Featured Description
Help: Settable only if item is featured. You can provide letters, numbers and basic HTML code.

Name: generateAccruals
Label: Generate Accruals
Help: Check this box to automatically generate and post an accrual to the General Ledger.

Name: handlingCost
Label: Handling Cost
Help: As an option, you set a handling cost for this item in dollars. You must also create a shipping item for per-item shipping and handling costs at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Items > New. When this item is set on sales orders, invoices or cash sales, the appropriate shipping and handling charges are automatically calculated.

Name: hazmatHazardClass
Label: Hazmat Hazard Class
Help: Enter the DOT hazardous material class or division.

Name: hazmatId
Label: Hazmat Id
Help:
Enter the regulatory identifier for the commodity from the Federal Express Ground Hazardous Materials Shipping Guide.
The format is UNXXXX, where XXXX is a four digit number.

Name: hazmatItemUnits
Label: Hazmat Item Units
Help: Enter the unit of measure for this item, such as kg or ml.

Name: hazmatItemUnitsQty
Label: Hazmat Item Units Quantity
Help: Enter the quantity for the item units.

Name: hazmatPackingGroup
Label: Hazmat Packing Group
Help: Select the hazardous material packaging group for the item.

Name: hazmatShippingName
Label: Hazmat Shipping Name
Help:
Enter the shipping name for the ID as listed in the Federal Express Ground Hazardous Materials Shipping Guide.
This item appears on the OP950 form.

Name: includeChildren
Label: Include Children
Help:
Check the Include Children box to share the item with all the sub-subsidiaries associated with each subsidiary selected in the Subsidiary field.
Note: When sharing items across subsidiaries, all of the options selected on the item record must be compatible across subsidiaries.
 
For example, when entering an inventory item to be shared across subsidiaries, you should select Income and Asset accounts on the item record that are also shared across the same subsidiaries.

Name: incomeAccount
Label: Income Account
Help: References an existing income account at Lists > Accounting > Accounts. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: isDonationItem
Label: Variable Amount
Help: If true, the item is set as a variable-priced donation item. This enables customers to enter their own prices for this item, such as for donations.

Name: isDropShipItem
Label: Drop Ship Item
Help: If isDropShipItem is set to true, isSpecialOrderItem can NOT be true.

Name: isFulfillable
Label: Can be Fulfilled
Help:
Check the Can be Fulfilled/Received box to enable this item to be received and fulfilled during order processing.
Clear this box if this item does not require being received and fulfilled.
Note: Once this item has been added to transactions, this setting cannot be changed.
This field is used when the Advanced Billing and Advanced Shipping features are both enabled.

Name: isGcoCompliant
Label: Google Checkout Compliant
Help: Check this box to make the item available for purchase with Google Checkout.

Name: isHazmatItem
Label: Hazmat/Dangerous Goods
Help: Check this box if this item is categorized as either hazardous material or dangerous goods. These items can only be shipped using FedEx integration.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: Sets the item as inactive. By default, this field is set to false.

Name: isOnline
Label: Display in Web Site
Help: Set to true to make this item available online in your Web site. You cannot sell this item online unless this field is set to true.

Name: isSpecialOrderItem
Label: Special Order Item
Help: If isSpecialOrderItem is set to true, isDropShipItem can NOT be true.

Name: issueProduct
Label: Product
Help:
Select the product this item is associated with.
Product records are tracked with versions and builds for issue management.
To create product records, go to <_TABNAME=ADMI_ISSUEPRODUCT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_ISSUEPRODUCT_> > Products > New.

Name: isTaxable
Label: Taxable
Help: Check this box if the item is subject to sales tax.

Name: itemCarrier
Label: Carrier
Help: Select the default shipping carrier for the item.

Name: itemId
Label: Item Name/Number
Help:
Type up to 60 characters for the name of this item. This name appears in lists on transactions.
If you have the option of entering a display name and do not, the item name prints in the Item column of sales forms.
If you have the option to enter a vendor name and do not, the item name prints in the Item column of purchase forms when Basic printing is used. If you have entered a display name, it will print on purchases instead of the item name when Basic printing is used.

Name: itemRevenueCategory
Label: Item Revenue Category
Help: The item revenue category is a classification for items that have similar characteristics and revenue allocation requirements. It is used in the fair value price list.

Name: location
Help:
Select a location to associate with this item.
To use a location, the Multi-Location Inventory feature must be enabled.
    * If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is not enabled:
      Selecting an item record location limits the items that certain roles can access.
      For example, Role A is set up to access only items associated with Location One. Therefore, employees who have Role A can access only items associated with Location One.
      Note: If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is not enabled, you cannot use this field to track inventory by locations. For example, you cannot track how many widgets you have in stock in Location One.
      For more information click here.
    * If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is enabled:
      Selecting an item record location classifies the item by that location to limit the items that certain roles can access. To track inventory per location, use the Locations subtab at the bottom of this form.
      For more information click here.
Select New to enter a new location record.
Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_LOCATION_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_LOCATION_> > Locations for details about existing location records.

Name: manufacturer
Label: Manufacturer
Help: Type the name of the company that manufactures this item.

Name: manufacturerAddr1
Label: Manufacturer Address
Help: Set the address of the manufacturer. This is necessary to fill out international shipping forms when you sell and ship this item.

Name: manufacturerCity
Label: Manufacturer City
Help: Set the city location of the manufacturer of this item. This is necessary to automatically fill out international forms when you ship this item across borders.

Name: manufacturerState
Label: Manufacturer State
Help: Set the state where this item's manufacturer is located.

Name: manufacturerTariff
Label: HS Tariff Number
Help: Set the Harmonized System (HS) tariff code number or the Harmonized Tariff Schedule (HTS) code number. This number should be six to ten characters.

Name: manufacturerTaxId
Label: Manufacturer Tax Id
Help: Enter the Tax ID Number (TIN) for the manufacturer.

Name: manufacturerZip
Label: Manufacturer Zip Code
Help: Set the postal code of the location of this manufacturer.

Name: matrixItemNameTemplate
Label: Matrix Item Name Template
Help:
This field is used to control how the matrix item will be displayed in the Matrix Item Name/Number field.
Compose the order in which attributes and matrix options are displayed by selecting from the Insert Item Attribute and Insert Matrix Option dropdown lists.
Add custom separator characters to easier distinguish the various options. 
Example: Item Name: Fabric / Color / Waist / Length [Location]

Name: maxDonationAmount
Label: Maximum Variable Amount
Help: If isDonationItem is set to true, set this field to the maximum amount that can be paid or donated for this item.

Name: maximumQuantity
Label: Maximum Order Qty
Help:
Enter the greatest quantity of this item that customers can purchase. If customers enter an item quantity above the maximum amount, a warning message is displayed. Web store customers are unable to complete checkout unless they enter a quantity equal to or below the maximum quantity.
 Leave this field empty to allow customers to check out without maximum quantity restrictions.
You can edit this warning at Setup > Site Builder/SuiteCommerce Advanced > Customize Text.

Name: metaTagHtml
Label: Meta Tag HTML
Help: Sets the metatag information for the item page in web store.

Name: minimumQuantity
Label: Minimum Order Qty
Help:
Enter the smallest quantity you allow customers to purchase for this item. When customers add this item to their carts in the Web store, the quantity for this item is defaulted to the minimum number of items. 
Leave this field empty to allow customers to check out with no minimum quantity restrictions.

Name: mpn
Label: Manufacturer Part Number
Help: MPN (Manufacturers Part Number) - Set the part number used by the manufacturer to identify this item.

Name: multManufactureAddr
Label: Multiple Manufacturer Addresses
Help: Check the Multiple Manufacture Addresses box if this manufacturer uses more than one address.

Name: nexTagCategory
Label: NexTag Category
Help:
Enter the name of the NexTag category this item should be included in.
This category is included in the product feeds you can export at Setup > Web Site > Product Feeds.
Go to www.nextag.com for more information on the available categories.

Name: noPriceMessage
Label: No Price Message
Help:
If you opted to not show a price online, enter the message that should show instead of the price.
For example, you might enter "Call for Price."

Name: offerSupport
Label: Offer Support
Help: When enabled, items can be referenced on case records either through the UI or via web services using the item field.

Name: onSpecial
Label: On Special
Help: Set to true if you want to put this item on special. The item then appears in the Specials category in your store or site.

Name: outOfStockBehavior
Label: Out Of Stock Behavior
Help:
Select a custom out of stock behavior for this item. It overwrites the overall site’s out of stock behavior. Your choices are:
    * Default - Uses the behavior selected in the Web Store Out of Stock Items field at Setup > Web Site > Setup Tasks > Set Up Web Site > Shopping.
    * Disallow back orders but display out of stock messages
    * Allow back orders but display out of stock messages
    * Remove items when out of stock
    * Allow back orders with no out of stock message

Name: outOfStockMessage
Label: Out Of Stock Message
Help: You can enter a custom out of stock message for this item. The message here replaces the default out of stock message.

Name: overallQuantityPricingType
Label: Calculate Quantity Discounts
Help:
Available values are:
_byLineQuantity
_byOverallItemQuantity
_byOverallParentQuantity
_byOverallScheduleQuantity

Name: pageTitle
Label: Page Title
Help: Sets the display title in the upper-left corner of an Internet browser when customers view this item in your Web store.

Name: parent
Label: Subitem of
Help:
References an existing item record. Only required if the item is a child of another item.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: preferenceCriterion
Label: Preference Criterion
Help:
Set the NAFTA criterion for this item. Available values are:
_A
_B
_C
_D
_E
_F

Name: pricesIncludeTax
Label: Prices Include Tax
Help: Check this box to save the base price as the tax inclusive price. Clear this box to save the base price as the tax exclusive price.

Name: pricingGroup
Label: Pricing Group
Help:
Select the pricing group this item is a member of.
Using pricing groups allows you to assign customer-specific price levels for a group of items.
You can create new pricing groups at <_TABNAME=EDIT_OTHERLIST_> > <_TABNAME=EDIT_OTHERLIST_> > Accounting Lists > New > Pricing Group.

Name: producer
Label: Producer
Help: Set to true if you produce this item for the purposes of the NAFTA Certificate of Origin.

Name: purchaseDescription
Label: Purchase Description
Help: Sets the description of this item that is displayed on vendor orders. You should include the unit of measure in this description.

Name: purchaseOrderAmount
Label: Vendor Bill - Purchase Order Amount Tolerance
Help: Enter the tolerance limit for the discrepancy between the amount on the vendor bill and purchase order.

Name: purchaseOrderQuantity
Label: Vendor Bill - Purchase Order Quantity Tolerance
Help: Enter the tolerance limit for the discrepancy between the quantity on the vendor bill and purchase order.

Name: purchaseOrderQuantityDiff
Label: Vendor Bill - Purchase Order Quantity Difference
Help: Enter the difference limit for the discrepancy between the quantity on the vendor bill and purchase order.

Name: purchaseUnit
Label: Purchase Unit
Help: Select the unit you use to purchase this item from the vendor.

Name: quantityPricingSchedule
Label: Quantity Pricing Schedule
Help: Set the pricing schedule you want to use to set prices for this item. You can create new pricing schedules at Lists > Accounting > Quantity Pricing Schedules > New. Selecting a pricing schedule sets the Use Marginal Rates and Calculate Quantity Discounts fields.

Name: rate
Label: Price
Help: Defines the rate for this item. If a value is entered followed by the percentage sign, the discount is interpreted as a percentage discount (i.e.  -.10% sets a ten percent discount for the item). If a value without the percentage sign is entered, the rate is interpreted as a flat dollar value.

Name: receiptAmount
Label: Vendor Bill - Item Receipt Amount Tolerance
Help: Enter the tolerance limit for the discrepancy between the amount on the vendor bill and item receipt.

Name: receiptQuantity
Label: Vendor Bill - Item Receipt Quantity Tolerance
Help: Enter the tolerance limit for the discrepancy between the quantity on the vendor bill and item receipt.

Name: receiptQuantityDiff
Label: Vendor Bill - Item Receipt Quantity Difference
Help: Enter the difference limit for the discrepancy between the quantity on the vendor bill and item receipt.

Name: relatedItemsDescription
Label: Related Items Description
Help: Sets the description displayed for a group of related items.

Name: residual
Label: Residual
Help:
Enter an amount or percentage to remain in the deferral account and not be amortized. A residual amount generally represents the salvage value of a fixed asset.
 
Note: A residual amount entered on a transaction overrides a residual amount entered on an item record.

Name: revenueAllocationGroup
Label: Revenue Allocation Group
Help: Select a revenue allocation group to use in GroupSum functions in fair value formulas. The value you select here is the default. You can change it on the revenue element.

Name: revenueRecognitionRule
Label: Revenue Recognition Rule
Help:
Select the revenue rule to use by default for this item in a revenue arrangement.
Be sure the rule you select has an Amount Source that is appropriate for the value you select in the Create Revenue Plans On field. For more information, see the field level help for Create Revenue Plans On.

Name: revRecForecastRule
Label: Rev Rec Forecast Rule
Help:
Select a revenue rule to use for forecast revenue recognition plans. The default is determined by the same accounting preference as the Revenue Recognition Rule.
You may select the same rule or a different rule for actual and forecast rules. Percent complete rules are not available as forecast rules. For information about forecast revenue plans for project progress, see Working with Percent-Complete Revenue Recognition Plans.

Name: revRecSchedule
Label: Revenue Recognition Template
Help:
Sets the revenue recognition template that will be applied to this item. In order to set this field, the item record referenced in the item field must have a deferred revenue account associated with it. This field then defaults to the rev. rec.  template associated to the item on the item record.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: salesDescription
Label: Sales Description
Help: Sets the description displayed when an item's store display name is clicked.

Name: salesTaxCode
Label: Sales Tax Code
Help:
This field is required for customers subscribing to International versions on NetSuite. Sets the default tax code to be used on sales transactions. 
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: saleUnit
Label: Sale Unit
Help: Select the unit you use to sell this item to customers on sales transactions.

Name: scheduleBCode
Label: Schedule B Code
Help:
Select the code for the Schedule B form for this item. Available values are:
_1000, _1000cubicMeters, _barrels, _carat, _cleanYieldKilogram, _contentKilogram, _contentTon, _cubicMeters, _curie, _dozen, _dozenPairs, _dozenPieces, _fiberMeter, _gram, _gross, _grossContainers, _hundred, _kilogram, _kilogramTotalSugars, _liter, _meter, _millicurie, _noQuantityReq, _number, _pack, _pairs, _pieces, _proofLiter, _runningBales, _square, _squareCentimeters, _squareMeters, _ton

Name: scheduleBNumber
Label: Schedule B Number
Help: Enter the number for the Schedule B form for this item.

Name: scheduleBQuantity
Label: Schedule B Quantity
Help: Enter the quantity for the Schedule B form for this item.

Name: searchKeywords
Label: Search Keywords
Help: Enter alternative search keywords that customers might use to find this item using your Web store�s internal search. These can include synonyms, acronyms, alternate languages or misspellings. These keywords are seen as equally important as the item name when searches are conducted.

Name: shipIndividually
Label: Ships Individually
Help:
Check this box if this item always ships alone and with no other items in the same package.
This helps determine the number of packages needed and the shipping rate on order fulfillments.

Name: shipPackage
Label: Package
Help:
Select the type of package this item normally ships in. The information for this package type automatically fills in on order fulfillments for this item.
Setting up and assigning package types helps determine the number of packages on an order and helps return accurate real-time shipping rates.
Create package types at Setup > Accounting > Shipping > Packages subtab.

Name: shippingCost
Label: Shipping Cost
Help: As an option, you may set a shipping cost for this item in dollars. You must also create a shipping item for per-item shipping costs at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Items > New. When this item is set on sales orders, invoices or cash sales, the appropriate shipping charges are automatically calculated.

Name: shoppingDotComCategory
Label: Shopping.com Category
Help:
Enter the name of the Shopping.com category that this item should go under.
This category is included in the product feeds that you can export from Setup > Web Site > Product Feeds.
Go to www.shopping.com for more information on the categories available.

Name: shopzillaCategoryId
Label: Shopzilla Category ID
Help:
Enter the name of the Shopzilla category this item should be included in.
This category is included in the product feeds you export at Setup > Web Site > Product Feeds.
Go to www.shopzilla.com for more information on the available categories.

Name: showDefaultDonationAmount
Label: Show Default Amount
Help: Can only be set when isDonation is set to True. If true, the item's online price is displayed as a suggested price.

Name: sitemapPriority
Label: Sitemap Priority
Help:
Use the Sitemap Priority list to indicate the relative importance of your Web site URLs.
You can select a priority ranging from 0.0 to 1.0 on item, category, and tab records.
NetSuite assigns the default priority “Auto” to all new and existing tab, category and item records in your account. The priority is calculated based on the position of the item or category in the hierarchy of your Web site.
For example, your Web site tabs automatically generate a default priority value of 1.0 because they are top level pages. A category published to a tab gets a priority of 0.5. An item published to a category on a tab gets a priority of 0.3.

Name: softDescriptor
Label: Soft Descriptor
Help:
In the Soft Descriptor list, select the name that will appear on the customer's credit card statement when this item is purchased.
Enter soft descriptors to select in this field at Setup > Accounting > Payment Processing > Credit Card Soft Descriptors.

Name: specialsDescription
Label: Specials Description
Help: Settable only if onSpecial is set to True. You can provide letters, numbers and basic HTML code.

Name: stockDescription
Label: Stock Description
Help: Enter up to 21 characters to specify information about this item, such as New, Refurbished or Ships 2-3 days.

Name: storeDescription
Label: Store Description
Help: Sets the item description. This field can contain plain text as well as basic html code.

Name: storeDetailedDescription
Label: Detailed Description
Help: Sets the detailed item description. This field can contain plain text as well as basic html code.

Name: storeDisplayImage
Label: Item Display Image
Help: References an existing image file in the file cabinet. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: storeDisplayName
Label: Store Display Name
Help: Sets the item name for your Web site.

Name: storeDisplayThumbnail
Label: Item Display Thumbnail
Help: References an existing image file in the file cabinet. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: storeItemTemplate
Label: Item Drilldown Template
Help: References an existing item template at Setup > Web Site > Item/Category Templates.

Name: taxSchedule
Label: Schedule
Help:
Select the tax schedule you want to apply to this item.
You can create new tax schedules at Setup > Accounting > Taxes > Tax Schedules > New.

Name: unitsType
Label: Units Type
Help: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: upcCode
Label: UPC Code
Help: Defines whether this is a unv part code. Bar codes for items are generated in Code 128 by default. If you prefer to use the UPC code format, set this field to True on each item record.

Name: urlComponent
Label: URL Component
Help:
Enter a short, descriptive name for this item to appear as part of its URL in the Web store.
Setting a name to show in the URL can result in better ranking from search engines.
If you leave this field blank, NetSuite terms and numbers are used as identifiers in the URL.
Note: Descriptive URL components are case sensitive. Descriptive URLs must match the case used in the URL Component field of an item record to point to the correct page.

Name: useMarginalRates
Label: Use Marginal Rates
Help:
Set to true if you want the quantity discounts in the schedule to be applied to each pricing bracket separately.
For example, a schedule offers no discount for the first 100 items sold and a 5% discount if more than 100 are sold. If 150 items are sold, the first 100 are at normal price, and the other fifty items are sold at 5% discount.
The fault value is false, which applies the discount to all items sold.

Name: vendor
Label: Preferred {1}
Help: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: vendorName
Label: Vendor Name/Code
Help: Sets the preferred vendor for this item. If the Multiple Vendors feature is enabled, this field is unavailable and you must set the preferred vendor in the itemVendorsList.

Name: vsoeDeferral
Label: Deferral
Help:
In this field set how to handle deferment when this item is sold as part of a bundle. The available options are:
_deferBundleUntilDelivered � Until this item is marked delivered, the revenue recognition of all items in the bundle is deferred. A typical use for this option is to identify items whose revenue recognition depends on the delivery of the item itself, in addition to the delivery of a separate service. For example, a specified upgrade would typically be marked Defer Bundle Until Delivered.
_deferUntilItemDelivered � Until this item is marked delivered, the revenue recognition of this item is deferred. This setting is the default for this field. 
Note: The deferral setting you set for each item in a bundle works together with the deferral settings for other items in the bundle.

Name: vsoeDelivered
Label: Default as Delivered
Help: Check this box to automatically set this item to a Delivered status when this item is added to a transaction. Clear this box to leave the delivery status clear by default.

Name: vsoePermitDiscount
Label: Permit Discount
Help:
Set one of the following options to determine how discounts are handled for this item.
_asAllowed - Allows a portion of an applicable discount to be applied against this item if its status is Delivered when the VSOE allocation is performed.
_never - Does not allow a discount to be applied against this item when the VSOE allocation is performed. This selection would be common for a Specified Upgrade. 
Note: The default for this field is _asAllowed.

Name: vsoePrice
Label: Allocation Price
Help:
Set the VSOE price for this item, if the price is known.
Note: If you need to use more than one VSOE price for an item, you can set the most common price here and then change the price on each order manually.

Name: vsoeSopGroup
Label: Allocation Type
Help:
Select an allocation type to associate with this item on sales transactions.
    * Normal - Revenue allocation follows EITF 08-01 rules when you use VSOE and the fair value price list with advanced revenue management.
    * Exclude - This item is excluded from revenue allocation. The item discounted sales amount is the revenue amount.
    * Software - The item is software. When you use VSOE with the EITF SuiteApp, both EITF 08-01 and SOP 97-2 rules apply for revenue allocation. When you use advanced revenue management, revenue allocation follows the fair value price list. Then if the fair value prices for any of the items in the allocation are estimates rather than VSOE, the allocation is recalculated using the residual method.
Note: Do not select the Software value unless you are using VSOE with the EITF SuiteApp or Advanced Revenue Management.

Name: weight
Label: Item Weight
Help: Set the weight of this item

Name: availableToPartners
Label: Available to Adv. Partners
Help: If true, this item is available in the Advanced Partner Center.

Name: billingSchedule
Label: Billing Schedule
Help:
Allows users to reference default Billing Schedules for items.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: class
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Classes. This field is required when the Make Classes Mandatory preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: contingentRevenueHandling
Label: Eligible For Contingent Revenue Handling
Help: Check this box to indicate that the item is subject to contingent revenue handling. When checked, revenue allocation is affected.

Name: costCategory
Label: Cost Category
Help: Select a cost category to associate with this item. View existing cost categories at <_TABNAME=LIST_ACCOUNTINGOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY= LIST_ACCOUNTINGOTHERLIST_> > Accounting Lists > Cost Category. For more details, click Help and read Creating Cost Categories.

Name: costEstimate
Label: Item Defined Cost
Help: Enter an Item Defined Cost amount.

Name: costEstimateType
Label: Cost Estimate Type
Help:
The Cost Estimate Type determines what value NetSuite uses to calculate estimated Gross Profit.
The estimated Gross Profit for Items on a transaction provides the data needed to calculate the total estimated Gross Profit on that transaction.
The individual line items that you enter in a transaction determine the amounts that post when you process that transaction.
The following Cost Estimate Types on Items are available:
    * Item Defined Cost - a user-defined amount, entered into the Item Defined Cost field on the Item definition page.
    * Average Cost - NetSuite calculates an average cost of the units purchased. 
    * Last Purchase Price - This field displays the most recent purchase price of the item as determined by purchase order receipt transactions. 
    * Purchase Price - Price entered that you pay for this item. If you do not enter a price, then the most recent purchase price from purchase orders provides the price for this item by default.
    * Preferred Vendor Rate - This option is only used if the Multi-Vendor feature is enabled and multiple vendors supply the same item.
          o First priority is to use the preferred vendor rate if defined on the Item record.
          o Next priority would be to use the purchase price.
          o Last priority would be the purchase order rate. (Initially this uses the preferred vendor rate cost, and then after a purchase order is entered, this type uses the most recent actual purchase order rate. Special orders and drop-shipped items use this cost information.)
    * Derived from member items - Total costs of items currently included in a kit. This Cost Estimate Type only applies to kits and sums the estimated costs of each item in the kit, based on each of their individual Cost Estimate Types. Uses the latest definition of the kit, not its historical definition.

Name: countryOfManufacture
Label: Manufacturer Country
Help: References a value in a system list. Values are listed at platformCommonTyp:Country.

Name: createRevenuePlansOn
Label: Create Revenue Plans On
Help:
Select the event that triggers creation of revenue recognition plans. Match the event with the amount source of the item's revenue recognition rule.
    * Revenue Arrangement Creation - Revenue plans can be created when the revenue arrangement is created. Use this option with rules that have Event-Amount as the Amount Source.
    * Billing - Revenue plans can be created when the sales order is billed and from stand-alone cash sales, invoices, credit memos, and cash refunds. Use this option with rules that have Event-Percent based on amount as the Amount Source.
    * Fulfillment - This option is available only when Advanced Shipping is enabled. Revenue plans can be created upon fulfillment. Use this option with rules that have Event-Percent based on quantity as the Amount Source.
    * Project Progress - This option is available only when the Projects feature is enabled. Use this option with rules that have Event-Percent Complete as the Amount Source.

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: defaultItemShipMethod
Label: Default Shipping Method
Help:
Select the shipping method to display by default when adding the item to a sales order.
You can override the default shipping method and enter any shipping method when fulfilling an order.

Name: deferredRevenueAccount
Label: Deferred Revenue Account
Help:
Set the deferred revenue account to associate with this item. Then, when this item is sold and associated with a revenue recognition template, the revenue from the sale is deferred.
The sale amount is posted to a deferred revenue account, as opposed to a standard income account.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: deferRevRec
Label: Hold Revenue Recognition
Help:
Check this box to delay recognizing revenue from the sale of this item. When this box is check, revenue recognition schedules or revenue plans are created with the status On Hold.
For more information, see the help topic Delaying Revenue Recognition for an Item.

Name: department
Help: Set a department to associate with this item. For details on existing department records, in the UI go to Setup > Company > Departments.

Name: directRevenuePosting
Label: Direct Revenue Posting
Help:
Check this box to disable advanced revenue management for this item. When checked, posting transactions that include this item post directly to the item revenue account. No revenue element or revenue arrangement is created. When you check this box, the Deferred Revenue Account on the Accounting subtab is disabled.
When you create sales transactions that include items that have this box checked, all the items in the transaction must have the box checked. You cannot mix items that post directly to revenue with items that post to deferred revenue in the same transaction. This restriction also applies to kit items. All items in a kit must post either to revenue or to deferred revenue.
You cannot check or clear the box after the item has been used in a transaction with advanced revenue management.
By default, this box is not checked.

Name: displayName
Label: Display Name/Code
Help:
You can set an optional name for this item in addition to the item name. If you are integrating with a Yahoo! store, this field is imported from Yahoo!.
The display name prints in the Item column of the sales form when Basic printing is used. If this item is a member of a kit, this name appears in the Item column when the Print Items box is checked. 
If you do not set a display name, then item name appears on printed forms.

Name: dontShowPrice
Label: Don't Show Price
Help:
Check this box to hide the price of this item online.
This is useful for items you want to advertise but don't want to sell or for items that you track inventory for and want to display but are offered in combination with other items.

Name: enforceMinQtyInternally
Label: Enforce Minimum Internally
Help: Check this box to apply the minimum quantity restriction on sales orders generated from NetSuite. When you clear this box, but enter a number in the Minimum Quantity field, the minimum quantity is only applied to web store orders.

Name: excludeFromSitemap
Label: Exclude from Sitemap
Help: Check this box to exclude a tab, category or item page from the site map.

Name: featuredDescription
Label: Featured Description
Help: Settable only if item is featured. You can provide letters, numbers and basic HTML code.

Name: handlingCost
Label: Handling Cost
Help: As an option, you set a handling cost for this item in dollars. You must also create a shipping item for per-item shipping and handling costs at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Items > New. When this item is set on sales orders, invoices or cash sales, the appropriate shipping and handling charges are automatically calculated.

Name: hazmatHazardClass
Label: Hazmat Hazard Class
Help: Enter the DOT hazardous material class or division.

Name: hazmatId
Label: Hazmat Id
Help:
Enter the regulatory identifier for the commodity from the Federal Express Ground Hazardous Materials Shipping Guide.
The format is UNXXXX, where XXXX is a four digit number.

Name: hazmatItemUnits
Label: Hazmat Item Units
Help: Enter the unit of measure for this item, such as kg or ml.

Name: hazmatItemUnitsQty
Label: Hazmat Item Units Quantity
Help: Enter the quantity for the item units.

Name: hazmatPackingGroup
Label: Hazmat Packing Group
Help: Select the hazardous material packaging group for the item.

Name: hazmatShippingName
Label: Hazmat Shipping Name
Help:
Enter the shipping name for the ID as listed in the Federal Express Ground Hazardous Materials Shipping Guide.
This item appears on the OP950 form.

Name: includeChildren
Label: Include Children
Help:
Check the Include Children box to share the item with all the sub-subsidiaries associated with each subsidiary selected in the Subsidiary field.
Note: When sharing items across subsidiaries, all of the options selected on the item record must be compatible across subsidiaries.
 
For example, when entering an inventory item to be shared across subsidiaries, you should select Income and Asset accounts on the item record that are also shared across the same subsidiaries.

Name: incomeAccount
Label: Income Account
Help: References an existing income account at Lists > Accounting > Accounts. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: isDonationItem
Label: Variable Amount
Help: If true, the item is set as a variable-priced donation item. This enables customers to enter their own prices for this item, such as for donations.

Name: isFulfillable
Label: Can be Fulfilled
Help:
Check the Can be Fulfilled/Received box to enable this item to be received and fulfilled during order processing.
Clear this box if this item does not require being received and fulfilled.
Note: Once this item has been added to transactions, this setting cannot be changed.
This field is used when the Advanced Billing and Advanced Shipping features are both enabled.

Name: isGcoCompliant
Label: Google Checkout Compliant
Help: Check this box to make the item available for purchase with Google Checkout.

Name: isHazmatItem
Label: Hazmat/Dangerous Goods
Help: Check this box if this item is categorized as either hazardous material or dangerous goods. These items can only be shipped using FedEx integration.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: Sets the item as inactive. By default, this field is set to false.

Name: isOnline
Label: Display in Web Site
Help: Set to true to make this item available online in your Web site. You cannot sell this item online unless this field is set to true.

Name: issueProduct
Label: Product
Help:
Select the product this item is associated with.
Product records are tracked with versions and builds for issue management.
To create product records, go to <_TABNAME=ADMI_ISSUEPRODUCT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_ISSUEPRODUCT_> > Products > New.

Name: isTaxable
Label: Taxable
Help: Check this box if the item is subject to sales tax.

Name: itemCarrier
Label: Carrier
Help: Select the default shipping carrier for the item.

Name: itemId
Label: Item Name/Number
Help:
Type up to 60 characters for the name of this item. This name appears in lists on transactions.
If you have the option of entering a display name and do not, the item name prints in the Item column of sales forms.
If you have the option to enter a vendor name and do not, the item name prints in the Item column of purchase forms when Basic printing is used. If you have entered a display name, it will print on purchases instead of the item name when Basic printing is used.

Name: itemRevenueCategory
Label: Item Revenue Category
Help: The item revenue category is a classification for items that have similar characteristics and revenue allocation requirements. It is used in the fair value price list.

Name: location
Help:
Select a location to associate with this item.
To use a location, the Multi-Location Inventory feature must be enabled.
    * If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is not enabled:
      Selecting an item record location limits the items that certain roles can access.
      For example, Role A is set up to access only items associated with Location One. Therefore, employees who have Role A can access only items associated with Location One.
      Note: If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is not enabled, you cannot use this field to track inventory by locations. For example, you cannot track how many widgets you have in stock in Location One.
      For more information click here.
    * If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is enabled:
      Selecting an item record location classifies the item by that location to limit the items that certain roles can access. To track inventory per location, use the Locations subtab at the bottom of this form.
      For more information click here.
Select New to enter a new location record.
Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_LOCATION_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_LOCATION_> > Locations for details about existing location records.

Name: manufacturer
Label: Manufacturer
Help: Type the name of the company that manufactures this item.

Name: manufacturerAddr1
Label: Manufacturer Address
Help: Set the address of the manufacturer. This is necessary to fill out international shipping forms when you sell and ship this item.

Name: manufacturerCity
Label: Manufacturer City
Help: Set the city location of the manufacturer of this item. This is necessary to automatically fill out international forms when you ship this item across borders.

Name: manufacturerState
Label: Manufacturer State
Help: Set the state where this item's manufacturer is located.

Name: manufacturerTariff
Label: HS Tariff Number
Help: Set the Harmonized System (HS) tariff code number or the Harmonized Tariff Schedule (HTS) code number. This number should be six to ten characters.

Name: manufacturerTaxId
Label: Manufacturer Tax Id
Help: Enter the Tax ID Number (TIN) for the manufacturer.

Name: manufacturerZip
Label: Manufacturer Zip Code
Help: Set the postal code of the location of this manufacturer.

Name: matrixItemNameTemplate
Label: Matrix Item Name Template
Help:
This field is used to control how the matrix item will be displayed in the Matrix Item Name/Number field.
Compose the order in which attributes and matrix options are displayed by selecting from the Insert Item Attribute and Insert Matrix Option dropdown lists.
Add custom separator characters to easier distinguish the various options. 
Example: Item Name: Fabric / Color / Waist / Length [Location]

Name: maxDonationAmount
Label: Maximum Variable Amount
Help: If isDonationItem is set to true, set this field to the maximum amount that can be paid or donated for this item.

Name: maximumQuantity
Label: Maximum Order Qty
Help:
Enter the greatest quantity of this item that customers can purchase. If customers enter an item quantity above the maximum amount, a warning message is displayed. Web store customers are unable to complete checkout unless they enter a quantity equal to or below the maximum quantity.
 Leave this field empty to allow customers to check out without maximum quantity restrictions.
You can edit this warning at Setup > Site Builder/SuiteCommerce Advanced > Customize Text.

Name: metaTagHtml
Label: Meta Tag HTML
Help: Sets the metatag information for the item page in web store.

Name: minimumQuantity
Label: Minimum Order Qty
Help:
Enter the smallest quantity you allow customers to purchase for this item. When customers add this item to their carts in the Web store, the quantity for this item is defaulted to the minimum number of items. 
Leave this field empty to allow customers to check out with no minimum quantity restrictions.

Name: mpn
Label: Manufacturer Part Number
Help: MPN (Manufacturers Part Number) - Set the part number used by the manufacturer to identify this item.

Name: multManufactureAddr
Label: Multiple Manufacturer Addresses
Help: Check the Multiple Manufacture Addresses box if this manufacturer uses more than one address.

Name: nexTagCategory
Label: NexTag Category
Help:
Enter the name of the NexTag category this item should be included in.
This category is included in the product feeds you can export at Setup > Web Site > Product Feeds.
Go to www.nextag.com for more information on the available categories.

Name: noPriceMessage
Label: No Price Message
Help:
If you opted to not show a price online, enter the message that should show instead of the price.
For example, you might enter "Call for Price."

Name: offerSupport
Label: Offer Support
Help: When enabled, items can be referenced on case records either through the UI or via web services using the item field.

Name: onSpecial
Label: On Special
Help: Set to true if you want to put this item on special. The item then appears in the Specials category in your store or site.

Name: outOfStockBehavior
Label: Out Of Stock Behavior
Help:
Select a custom out of stock behavior for this item. It overwrites the overall site’s out of stock behavior. Your choices are:
    * Default - Uses the behavior selected in the Web Store Out of Stock Items field at Setup > Web Site > Setup Tasks > Set Up Web Site > Shopping.
    * Disallow back orders but display out of stock messages
    * Allow back orders but display out of stock messages
    * Remove items when out of stock
    * Allow back orders with no out of stock message

Name: outOfStockMessage
Label: Out Of Stock Message
Help: You can enter a custom out of stock message for this item. The message here replaces the default out of stock message.

Name: overallQuantityPricingType
Label: Calculate Quantity Discounts
Help:
Available values are:
_byLineQuantity
_byOverallItemQuantity
_byOverallParentQuantity
_byOverallScheduleQuantity

Name: pageTitle
Label: Page Title
Help: Sets the display title in the upper-left corner of an Internet browser when customers view this item in your Web store.

Name: parent
Label: Subitem of
Help:
References an existing item record. Only required if the item is a child of another item.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: preferenceCriterion
Label: Preference Criterion
Help:
Set the NAFTA criterion for this item. Available values are:
_A
_B
_C
_D
_E
_F

Name: pricesIncludeTax
Label: Prices Include Tax
Help: Check this box to save the base price as the tax inclusive price. Clear this box to save the base price as the tax exclusive price.

Name: pricingGroup
Label: Pricing Group
Help:
Select the pricing group this item is a member of.
Using pricing groups allows you to assign customer-specific price levels for a group of items.
You can create new pricing groups at <_TABNAME=EDIT_OTHERLIST_> > <_TABNAME=EDIT_OTHERLIST_> > Accounting Lists > New > Pricing Group.

Name: producer
Label: Producer
Help: Set to true if you produce this item for the purposes of the NAFTA Certificate of Origin.

Name: quantityPricingSchedule
Label: Quantity Pricing Schedule
Help: Set the pricing schedule you want to use to set prices for this item. You can create new pricing schedules at Lists > Accounting > Quantity Pricing Schedules > New. Selecting a pricing schedule sets the Use Marginal Rates and Calculate Quantity Discounts fields.

Name: rate
Label: Price
Help: Defines the rate for this item. If a value is entered followed by the percentage sign, the discount is interpreted as a percentage discount (i.e.  -.10% sets a ten percent discount for the item). If a value without the percentage sign is entered, the rate is interpreted as a flat dollar value.

Name: relatedItemsDescription
Label: Related Items Description
Help: Sets the description displayed for a group of related items.

Name: revenueAllocationGroup
Label: Revenue Allocation Group
Help: Select a revenue allocation group to use in GroupSum functions in fair value formulas. The value you select here is the default. You can change it on the revenue element.

Name: revenueRecognitionRule
Label: Revenue Recognition Rule
Help:
Select the revenue rule to use by default for this item in a revenue arrangement.
Be sure the rule you select has an Amount Source that is appropriate for the value you select in the Create Revenue Plans On field. For more information, see the field level help for Create Revenue Plans On.

Name: revRecForecastRule
Label: Rev Rec Forecast Rule
Help:
Select a revenue rule to use for forecast revenue recognition plans. The default is determined by the same accounting preference as the Revenue Recognition Rule.
You may select the same rule or a different rule for actual and forecast rules. Percent complete rules are not available as forecast rules. For information about forecast revenue plans for project progress, see Working with Percent-Complete Revenue Recognition Plans.

Name: revReclassFXAccount
Label: Foreign Currency Adjustment Account
Help:
Select the account to use for the foreign currency adjustment during reclassification.
You can select any account with an account type of income, other income, expense, or other expense, including the gain and loss accounts generated by the system after qualifying revaluation transactions. You can change the Foreign Currency Adjustment Account on the revenue element before revenue recognition plans are created.

Name: revRecSchedule
Label: Revenue Recognition Template
Help:
Sets the revenue recognition template that will be applied to this item. In order to set this field, the item record referenced in the item field must have a deferred revenue account associated with it. This field then defaults to the rev. rec.  template associated to the item on the item record.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: salesDescription
Label: Sales Description
Help: Sets the description displayed when an item's store display name is clicked.

Name: salesTaxCode
Label: Sales Tax Code
Help:
This field is required for customers subscribing to International versions on NetSuite. Sets the default tax code to be used on sales transactions. 
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: saleUnit
Label: Sale Unit
Help: Select the unit you use to sell this item to customers on sales transactions.

Name: scheduleBCode
Label: Schedule B Code
Help:
Select the code for the Schedule B form for this item. Available values are:
_1000, _1000cubicMeters, _barrels, _carat, _cleanYieldKilogram, _contentKilogram, _contentTon, _cubicMeters, _curie, _dozen, _dozenPairs, _dozenPieces, _fiberMeter, _gram, _gross, _grossContainers, _hundred, _kilogram, _kilogramTotalSugars, _liter, _meter, _millicurie, _noQuantityReq, _number, _pack, _pairs, _pieces, _proofLiter, _runningBales, _square, _squareCentimeters, _squareMeters, _ton

Name: scheduleBNumber
Label: Schedule B Number
Help: Enter the number for the Schedule B form for this item.

Name: scheduleBQuantity
Label: Schedule B Quantity
Help: Enter the quantity for the Schedule B form for this item.

Name: searchKeywords
Label: Search Keywords
Help: Enter alternative search keywords that customers might use to find this item using your Web store�s internal search. These can include synonyms, acronyms, alternate languages or misspellings. These keywords are seen as equally important as the item name when searches are conducted.

Name: shipIndividually
Label: Ships Individually
Help:
Check this box if this item always ships alone and with no other items in the same package.
This helps determine the number of packages needed and the shipping rate on order fulfillments.

Name: shipPackage
Label: Package
Help:
Select the type of package this item normally ships in. The information for this package type automatically fills in on order fulfillments for this item.
Setting up and assigning package types helps determine the number of packages on an order and helps return accurate real-time shipping rates.
Create package types at Setup > Accounting > Shipping > Packages subtab.

Name: shippingCost
Label: Shipping Cost
Help: As an option, you may set a shipping cost for this item in dollars. You must also create a shipping item for per-item shipping costs at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Items > New. When this item is set on sales orders, invoices or cash sales, the appropriate shipping charges are automatically calculated.

Name: shoppingDotComCategory
Label: Shopping.com Category
Help:
Enter the name of the Shopping.com category that this item should go under.
This category is included in the product feeds that you can export from Setup > Web Site > Product Feeds.
Go to www.shopping.com for more information on the categories available.

Name: shopzillaCategoryId
Label: Shopzilla Category ID
Help:
Enter the name of the Shopzilla category this item should be included in.
This category is included in the product feeds you export at Setup > Web Site > Product Feeds.
Go to www.shopzilla.com for more information on the available categories.

Name: showDefaultDonationAmount
Label: Show Default Amount
Help: Can only be set when isDonation is set to True. If true, the item's online price is displayed as a suggested price.

Name: sitemapPriority
Label: Sitemap Priority
Help:
Use the Sitemap Priority list to indicate the relative importance of your Web site URLs.
You can select a priority ranging from 0.0 to 1.0 on item, category, and tab records.
NetSuite assigns the default priority “Auto” to all new and existing tab, category and item records in your account. The priority is calculated based on the position of the item or category in the hierarchy of your Web site.
For example, your Web site tabs automatically generate a default priority value of 1.0 because they are top level pages. A category published to a tab gets a priority of 0.5. An item published to a category on a tab gets a priority of 0.3.

Name: softDescriptor
Label: Soft Descriptor
Help:
In the Soft Descriptor list, select the name that will appear on the customer's credit card statement when this item is purchased.
Enter soft descriptors to select in this field at Setup > Accounting > Payment Processing > Credit Card Soft Descriptors.

Name: specialsDescription
Label: Specials Description
Help: Settable only if onSpecial is set to True. You can provide letters, numbers and basic HTML code.

Name: stockDescription
Label: Stock Description
Help: Enter up to 21 characters to specify information about this item, such as New, Refurbished or Ships 2-3 days.

Name: storeDescription
Label: Store Description
Help: Sets the item description. This field can contain plain text as well as basic html code.

Name: storeDetailedDescription
Label: Detailed Description
Help: Sets the detailed item description. This field can contain plain text as well as basic html code.

Name: storeDisplayImage
Label: Item Display Image
Help: References an existing image file in the file cabinet. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: storeDisplayName
Label: Store Display Name
Help: Sets the item name for your Web site.

Name: storeDisplayThumbnail
Label: Item Display Thumbnail
Help: References an existing image file in the file cabinet. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: storeItemTemplate
Label: Item Drilldown Template
Help: References an existing item template at Setup > Web Site > Item/Category Templates.

Name: taxSchedule
Label: Schedule
Help:
Select the tax schedule you want to apply to this item.
You can create new tax schedules at Setup > Accounting > Taxes > Tax Schedules > New.

Name: unitsType
Label: Units Type
Help: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: upcCode
Label: UPC Code
Help: Defines whether this is a unv part code. Bar codes for items are generated in Code 128 by default. If you prefer to use the UPC code format, set this field to True on each item record.

Name: urlComponent
Label: URL Component
Help:
Enter a short, descriptive name for this item to appear as part of its URL in the Web store.
Setting a name to show in the URL can result in better ranking from search engines.
If you leave this field blank, NetSuite terms and numbers are used as identifiers in the URL.
Note: Descriptive URL components are case sensitive. Descriptive URLs must match the case used in the URL Component field of an item record to point to the correct page.

Name: useMarginalRates
Label: Use Marginal Rates
Help:
Set to true if you want the quantity discounts in the schedule to be applied to each pricing bracket separately.
For example, a schedule offers no discount for the first 100 items sold and a 5% discount if more than 100 are sold. If 150 items are sold, the first 100 are at normal price, and the other fifty items are sold at 5% discount.
The fault value is false, which applies the discount to all items sold.

Name: vsoeDeferral
Label: Deferral
Help:
In this field set how to handle deferment when this item is sold as part of a bundle. The available options are:
_deferBundleUntilDelivered � Until this item is marked delivered, the revenue recognition of all items in the bundle is deferred. A typical use for this option is to identify items whose revenue recognition depends on the delivery of the item itself, in addition to the delivery of a separate service. For example, a specified upgrade would typically be marked Defer Bundle Until Delivered.
_deferUntilItemDelivered � Until this item is marked delivered, the revenue recognition of this item is deferred. This setting is the default for this field. 
Note: The deferral setting you set for each item in a bundle works together with the deferral settings for other items in the bundle.

Name: vsoeDelivered
Label: Default as Delivered
Help: Check this box to automatically set this item to a Delivered status when this item is added to a transaction. Clear this box to leave the delivery status clear by default.

Name: vsoePermitDiscount
Label: Permit Discount
Help:
Set one of the following options to determine how discounts are handled for this item.
_asAllowed - Allows a portion of an applicable discount to be applied against this item if its status is Delivered when the VSOE allocation is performed.
_never - Does not allow a discount to be applied against this item when the VSOE allocation is performed. This selection would be common for a Specified Upgrade. 
Note: The default for this field is _asAllowed.

Name: vsoePrice
Label: Allocation Price
Help:
Set the VSOE price for this item, if the price is known.
Note: If you need to use more than one VSOE price for an item, you can set the most common price here and then change the price on each order manually.

Name: vsoeSopGroup
Label: Allocation Type
Help:
Select an allocation type to associate with this item on sales transactions.
    * Normal - Revenue allocation follows EITF 08-01 rules when you use VSOE and the fair value price list with advanced revenue management.
    * Exclude - This item is excluded from revenue allocation. The item discounted sales amount is the revenue amount.
    * Software - The item is software. When you use VSOE with the EITF SuiteApp, both EITF 08-01 and SOP 97-2 rules apply for revenue allocation. When you use advanced revenue management, revenue allocation follows the fair value price list. Then if the fair value prices for any of the items in the allocation are estimates rather than VSOE, the allocation is recalculated using the residual method.
Note: Do not select the Software value unless you are using VSOE with the EITF SuiteApp or Advanced Revenue Management.

Name: weight
Label: Item Weight
Help: Set the weight of this item

Name: direction
Label: Direction
Help: Value of inbound or outbound. Defines whether the note was originally generated from an external (inbound) source (such as copied from an email) or generated from within the record.

Name: note
Label: Memo
Help: Sets the content of the note.

Name: noteDate
Label: Date
Help: Default value of the current date and time.

Name: noteType
Label: Type
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Sales > CRM Lists > Note Type. This value describes the type of note � for example, phone call or meeting. For details on how to modify this list via Web services, see NoteType. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: title
Label: Title
Help: Enter a title for this note.

Name: description
Label: Description
Help: Enter a description of this note type.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: Sets whether the current category is active. Defaults to False.  An inactive category cannot be used as a selection.

Name: name
Label: Note Type
Help: Sets the name that is displayed for selecting this category in the UI.

Name: actionItem
Label: Action Item
Help: Record the next step in the negotiation process.

Name: altSalesRangeHigh
Label: Alt. Sales Range High
Help: Must be greater than or equal to the amount in the projaltsalesamt field.

Name: altSalesRangeLow
Label: Alt. Sales Range Low
Help: Must be lower than or equal to the projected amount in the projaltsalesamt field.

Name: billAddressList
Label: Bill To Select
Help:
Defaults to the address associated with the selection for billAddress. If explicitly set via web services, this acts as a custom address and overrides for this transaction only.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: buyingReason
Label: Buying Reason
Help: Choose the prospect or customer's reason for buying from your company. You can create additional options for this field at <_TABNAME=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > CRM Lists.

Name: buyingTimeFrame
Label: Buying Time Frame
Help: Select the time frame for the prospect or customer to purchase. You can create additional options for this field at <_TABNAME=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > CRM Lists.

Name: class
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Classes. This field is required when the Make Classes Mandatory preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. If you are using a customForm that has class customized at the body level, you can NOT set this field at the item level. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: closeDate
Label: Actual Close
Help: This field corresponds to the date that the Opportunity entityStatus is set to Closed Won. Note that this field is read-only in both the UI and in Web services.

Name: currency
Label: Currency
Help:
If you do not use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, the currency of the customer you are creating this transaction for is shown here.
If you use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, select the transaction currency you want to create this transaction in. This customer's primary currency is selected by default.
If you have already selected items on this transaction, selecting a new currency refreshes them to show the price in the new currency (except for items you entered custom prices for) and recalculates tax and gross profit.

Name: currencyName
Label: Currency
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Lists > Accounting > Currencies.

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: daysOpen
Label: Days Open
Help: This field shows the number of days this opportunity has been open.

Name: department
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. If you are using a customForm that has department customized at the body level, you can NOT set this field at the item level. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: entity
Help:
References a company record that already exists in your account.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: entityStatus
Label: Status (Customer)
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Sales > Setup Tasks > Customer Statuses. Defaults to the value set at Setup > Sales > Preferences > Sales Preferences. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: estGrossProfit
Label: Est. Gross Profit
Help: Estimated Gross Profit: Read-only field that equals the revenue amount minus the Est. Cost. At the transaction level, it equals the gross profit of all lines, factoring transaction-level discounts and markups.

Name: estGrossProfitPercent
Label: Est. Gross Profit Percent
Help: Estimated Gross Profit Margin, as a percentage: Read-only field that equals the Est. Gross Profit divided by revenue, expressed as a percentage. At the transaction level, it equals the gross profit percent of all lines, factoring transaction-level discounts and markups.

Name: estimatedBudget
Label: Estimated Budget
Help: Enter the estimated budget the prospect or customer has for this opportunity.

Name: exchangeRate
Label: Exchange Rate
Help: Defaults to the current exchange rate for the currency associated with the company referenced in the entity field. This can only be provided for an add.

Name: expectedCloseDate
Label: Expected Close Date
Help: Required when default preferences are turned off. Defaults to the current Date/Time.

Name: forecastType
Label: Forecast Type
Help: References an existing Forecast Type defined at Setup > Sales > Sales Preferences > Forecasts (subtab on Preferences page). Note that although the display name for each forecast type can be customized, the actual internal ID associated with each forecast type is static as follows: Low Forecast Name: 1 Medium Forecast Name: 2 High Forecast Name: 3

Name: isBudgetApproved
Label: Budget Approved
Help: Check this box if the budget for this opportunity has been approved by the prospect or customer.

Name: job
Help: Select the project associated with this opportunity.

Name: leadSource
Label: Lead Source
Help:
References a lead source that is already defined in your account. If a value is not provided, the field is populated with the lead source associated with the company referenced in the entity field (if a lead source exists for that company).
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: location
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations. To set this field, the Multi-Location Inventory feature must be enabled. If you are using a customForm that has location customized at the body level, you can NOT set this field at the item level. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: memo
Label: Details
Help: Enter additional information about the opportunity.

Name: nexus
Label: Nexus
Help:
This field shows the nexus of the transaction. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. 
You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different nexus in the dropdown list, the corresponding tax registration number is automatically selected in the Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number field.

Name: partner
Label: Partner
Help:
References a partner record that already exists in your account. If a value is not provided, the field is populated with the partner associated with the company referenced in the entity field (if a partner exists for that company).
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

Name: probability
Label: Probability (%)
Help:
If the value for probability is not provided, a calculated value based on the Status populates the field.
If the value for probability is set, it overrides the slaved value depending on the default settings. 
For example:
� If conditional defaults are ON, on update the probability changes if the status changes and the probability is NOT specified in the request.
� If conditional defaults are OFF, on update the probability does NOT change if status changes.
� If conditional defaults are ON, and a value for both status and probability are submitted, then the submitted values are set.

Name: projAltSalesAmt
Label: Alt. Sales Total
Help: Sets the projected alternate sales amount of the opportunity based on the items selected on the opportunity and the estimates associated with the opportunity.

Name: projectedTotal
Label: Projected Total
Help: This field is required when there are no items in the itemList field. When items are listed and a value is not provided, the field is calculated. Provided values may be overridden by the system. See Projected Total, Range High and Range Low Fields.

Name: rangeHigh
Label: Range High
Help: If not provided, this field is calculated. Provided values may be overridden by the system. See Projected Total, Range High and Range Low Fields.

Name: rangeLow
Label: Range Low
Help: If not provided, this field is calculated. Provided values may be overridden by the system. See Projected Total, Range High and Range Low Fields.

Name: salesGroup
Help: When team selling is enabled, this references a user defined sales team group at Lists > Relationships > Groups.

Name: salesReadiness
Label: Sales Readiness
Help: Choose how close the prospect or customer is to purchasing. You can create additional options for this field at <_TABNAME=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > CRM Lists.

Name: salesRep
Label: Sales Rep
Help:
References an employee record that already exists in your account. If a value is not provided, the field is populated with the sales representative associated with the company referenced in the entity field (if a sales representative exists for that company).
