Help: When enabled, items can be referenced on case records either through the UI or via web services using the item field.

Name: onSpecial
Label: On Special
Help: Set to true if you want to put this item on special. The item then appears in the Specials category in your store or site.

Name: outOfStockBehavior
Label: Out Of Stock Behavior
Help:
Select a custom out of stock behavior for this item. It overwrites the overall site’s out of stock behavior. Your choices are:
    * Default - Uses the behavior selected in the Web Store Out of Stock Items field at Setup > Web Site > Setup Tasks > Set Up Web Site > Shopping.
    * Disallow back orders but display out of stock messages
    * Allow back orders but display out of stock messages
    * Remove items when out of stock
    * Allow back orders with no out of stock message

Name: outOfStockMessage
Label: Out Of Stock Message
Help: You can enter a custom out of stock message for this item. The message here replaces the default out of stock message.

Name: overallQuantityPricingType
Label: Calculate Quantity Discounts
Help:
Available values are:
_byLineQuantity
_byOverallItemQuantity
_byOverallParentQuantity
_byOverallScheduleQuantity

Name: pageTitle
Label: Page Title
Help: Sets the display title in the upper-left corner of an Internet browser when customers view this item in your Web store.

Name: parent
Label: Subitem of
Help:
References an existing item record. Only required if the item is a child of another item.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: pricesIncludeTax
Label: Prices Include Tax
Help: Check this box to save the base price as the tax inclusive price. Clear this box to save the base price as the tax exclusive price.

Name: pricingGroup
Label: Pricing Group
Help:
Select the pricing group this item is a member of.
Using pricing groups allows you to assign customer-specific price levels for a group of items.
You can create new pricing groups at <_TABNAME=EDIT_OTHERLIST_> > <_TABNAME=EDIT_OTHERLIST_> > Accounting Lists > New > Pricing Group.

Name: purchaseDescription
Label: Purchase Description
Help: Sets the description of this item that is displayed on vendor orders. You should include the unit of measure in this description.

Name: purchaseOrderAmount
Label: Vendor Bill - Purchase Order Amount Tolerance
Help: Enter the tolerance limit for the discrepancy between the amount on the vendor bill and purchase order.

Name: purchaseOrderQuantity
Label: Vendor Bill - Purchase Order Quantity Tolerance
Help: Enter the tolerance limit for the discrepancy between the quantity on the vendor bill and purchase order.

Name: purchaseOrderQuantityDiff
Label: Vendor Bill - Purchase Order Quantity Difference
Help: Enter the difference limit for the discrepancy between the quantity on the vendor bill and purchase order.

Name: purchaseUnit
Label: Purchase Unit
Help: Select the unit you use to purchase this item from the vendor.

Name: quantityPricingSchedule
Label: Quantity Pricing Schedule
Help: Set the pricing schedule you want to use to set prices for this item. You can create new pricing schedules at Lists > Accounting > Quantity Pricing Schedules > New. Selecting a pricing schedule sets the Use Marginal Rates and Calculate Quantity Discounts fields.

Name: rate
Label: Price
Help: Defines the rate for this item. If a value is entered followed by the percentage sign, the discount is interpreted as a percentage discount (i.e.  -.10% sets a ten percent discount for the item). If a value without the percentage sign is entered, the rate is interpreted as a flat dollar value.

Name: receiptAmount
Label: Vendor Bill - Item Receipt Amount Tolerance
Help: Enter the tolerance limit for the discrepancy between the amount on the vendor bill and item receipt.

Name: receiptQuantity
Label: Vendor Bill - Item Receipt Quantity Tolerance
Help: Enter the tolerance limit for the discrepancy between the quantity on the vendor bill and item receipt.

Name: receiptQuantityDiff
Label: Vendor Bill - Item Receipt Quantity Difference
Help: Enter the difference limit for the discrepancy between the quantity on the vendor bill and item receipt.

Name: relatedItemsDescription
Label: Related Items Description
Help: Sets the description displayed for a group of related items.

Name: residual
Label: Residual
Help:
Enter an amount or percentage to remain in the deferral account and not be amortized. A residual amount generally represents the salvage value of a fixed asset.
 
Note: A residual amount entered on a transaction overrides a residual amount entered on an item record.

Name: revenueAllocationGroup
Label: Revenue Allocation Group
Help: Select a revenue allocation group to use in GroupSum functions in fair value formulas. The value you select here is the default. You can change it on the revenue element.

Name: revenueRecognitionRule
Label: Revenue Recognition Rule
Help:
Select the revenue rule to use by default for this item in a revenue arrangement.
Be sure the rule you select has an Amount Source that is appropriate for the value you select in the Create Revenue Plans On field. For more information, see the field level help for Create Revenue Plans On.

Name: revRecForecastRule
Label: Rev Rec Forecast Rule
Help:
Select a revenue rule to use for forecast revenue recognition plans. The default is determined by the same accounting preference as the Revenue Recognition Rule.
You may select the same rule or a different rule for actual and forecast rules. Percent complete rules are not available as forecast rules. For information about forecast revenue plans for project progress, see Working with Percent-Complete Revenue Recognition Plans.

Name: revReclassFXAccount
Label: Foreign Currency Adjustment Account
Help:
Select the account to use for the foreign currency adjustment during reclassification.
You can select any account with an account type of income, other income, expense, or other expense, including the gain and loss accounts generated by the system after qualifying revaluation transactions. You can change the Foreign Currency Adjustment Account on the revenue element before revenue recognition plans are created.

Name: revRecSchedule
Label: Revenue Recognition Template
Help:
Sets the revenue recognition template that will be applied to this item. In order to set this field, the item record referenced in the item field must have a deferred revenue account associated with it. This field then defaults to the rev. rec.  template associated to the item on the item record.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: salesDescription
Label: Sales Description
Help: Sets the description displayed when an item's store display name is clicked.

Name: salesTaxCode
Label: Sales Tax Code
Help:
This field is required for customers subscribing to International versions on NetSuite. Sets the default tax code to be used on sales transactions. 
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: saleUnit
Label: Sale Unit
Help: Select the unit you use to sell this item to customers on sales transactions.

Name: searchKeywords
Label: Search Keywords
Help: Enter alternative search keywords that customers might use to find this item using your Web store�s internal search. These can include synonyms, acronyms, alternate languages or misspellings. These keywords are seen as equally important as the item name when searches are conducted.

Name: showDefaultDonationAmount
Label: Show Default Amount
Help: Can only be set when isDonation is set to True. If true, the item's online price is displayed as a suggested price.

Name: sitemapPriority
Label: Sitemap Priority
Help:
Use the Sitemap Priority list to indicate the relative importance of your Web site URLs.
You can select a priority ranging from 0.0 to 1.0 on item, category, and tab records.
NetSuite assigns the default priority “Auto” to all new and existing tab, category and item records in your account. The priority is calculated based on the position of the item or category in the hierarchy of your Web site.
For example, your Web site tabs automatically generate a default priority value of 1.0 because they are top level pages. A category published to a tab gets a priority of 0.5. An item published to a category on a tab gets a priority of 0.3.

Name: softDescriptor
Label: Soft Descriptor
Help:
In the Soft Descriptor list, select the name that will appear on the customer's credit card statement when this item is purchased.
Enter soft descriptors to select in this field at Setup > Accounting > Payment Processing > Credit Card Soft Descriptors.

Name: specialsDescription
Label: Specials Description
Help: Settable only if onSpecial is set to True. You can provide letters, numbers and basic HTML code.

Name: storeDescription
Label: Store Description
Help: Sets the item description. This field can contain plain text as well as basic html code.

Name: storeDetailedDescription
Label: Detailed Description
Help: Sets the detailed item description. This field can contain plain text as well as basic html code.

Name: storeDisplayImage
Label: Item Display Image
Help: References an existing image file in the file cabinet. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: storeDisplayName
Label: Store Display Name
Help: Sets the item name for your Web site.

Name: storeDisplayThumbnail
Label: Item Display Thumbnail
Help: References an existing image file in the file cabinet. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: storeItemTemplate
Label: Item Drilldown Template
Help: References an existing item template at Setup > Web Site > Item/Category Templates.

Name: taxSchedule
Label: Schedule
Help:
Select the tax schedule you want to apply to this item.
You can create new tax schedules at Setup > Accounting > Taxes > Tax Schedules > New.

Name: unitsType
Label: Units Type
Help: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: upcCode
Label: UPC Code
Help: Defines whether this is a unv part code. Bar codes for items are generated in Code 128 by default. If you prefer to use the UPC code format, set this field to True on each item record.

Name: urlComponent
Label: URL Component
Help:
Enter a short, descriptive name for this item to appear as part of its URL in the Web store.
Setting a name to show in the URL can result in better ranking from search engines.
If you leave this field blank, NetSuite terms and numbers are used as identifiers in the URL.
Note: Descriptive URL components are case sensitive. Descriptive URLs must match the case used in the URL Component field of an item record to point to the correct page.

Name: useMarginalRates
Label: Use Marginal Rates
Help:
Set to true if you want the quantity discounts in the schedule to be applied to each pricing bracket separately.
For example, a schedule offers no discount for the first 100 items sold and a 5% discount if more than 100 are sold. If 150 items are sold, the first 100 are at normal price, and the other fifty items are sold at 5% discount.
The fault value is false, which applies the discount to all items sold.

Name: vendor
Label: Preferred {1}
Help: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: vendorName
Label: Vendor Name/Code
Help: Sets the preferred vendor for this item. If the Multiple Vendors feature is enabled, this field is unavailable and you must set the preferred vendor in the itemVendorsList.

Name: vsoeDeferral
Label: Deferral
Help:
In this field set how to handle deferment when this item is sold as part of a bundle. The available options are:
_deferBundleUntilDelivered � Until this item is marked delivered, the revenue recognition of all items in the bundle is deferred. A typical use for this option is to identify items whose revenue recognition depends on the delivery of the item itself, in addition to the delivery of a separate service. For example, a specified upgrade would typically be marked Defer Bundle Until Delivered.
_deferUntilItemDelivered � Until this item is marked delivered, the revenue recognition of this item is deferred. This setting is the default for this field. 
Note: The deferral setting you set for each item in a bundle works together with the deferral settings for other items in the bundle.

Name: vsoeDelivered
Label: Default as Delivered
Help: Check this box to automatically set this item to a Delivered status when this item is added to a transaction. Clear this box to leave the delivery status clear by default.

Name: vsoePermitDiscount
Label: Permit Discount
Help:
Set one of the following options to determine how discounts are handled for this item.
_asAllowed - Allows a portion of an applicable discount to be applied against this item if its status is Delivered when the VSOE allocation is performed.
_never - Does not allow a discount to be applied against this item when the VSOE allocation is performed. This selection would be common for a Specified Upgrade. 
Note: The default for this field is _asAllowed.

Name: vsoePrice
Label: Allocation Price
Help:
Set the VSOE price for this item, if the price is known.
Note: If you need to use more than one VSOE price for an item, you can set the most common price here and then change the price on each order manually.

Name: vsoeSopGroup
Label: Allocation Type
Help:
Select an allocation type to associate with this item on sales transactions.
    * Normal - Revenue allocation follows EITF 08-01 rules when you use VSOE and the fair value price list with advanced revenue management.
    * Exclude - This item is excluded from revenue allocation. The item discounted sales amount is the revenue amount.
    * Software - The item is software. When you use VSOE with the EITF SuiteApp, both EITF 08-01 and SOP 97-2 rules apply for revenue allocation. When you use advanced revenue management, revenue allocation follows the fair value price list. Then if the fair value prices for any of the items in the allocation are estimates rather than VSOE, the allocation is recalculated using the residual method.
Note: Do not select the Software value unless you are using VSOE with the EITF SuiteApp or Advanced Revenue Management.

Name: availableToPartners
Label: Available to Adv. Partners
Help: If true, this item is available in the Advanced Partner Center.

Name: billingSchedule
Label: Billing Schedule
Help:
Allows users to reference default Billing Schedules for items.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: class
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Classes. This field is required when the Make Classes Mandatory preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: contingentRevenueHandling
Label: Eligible For Contingent Revenue Handling
Help: Check this box to indicate that the item is subject to contingent revenue handling. When checked, revenue allocation is affected.

Name: costCategory
Label: Cost Category
Help: Select a cost category to associate with this item. View existing cost categories at <_TABNAME=LIST_ACCOUNTINGOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY= LIST_ACCOUNTINGOTHERLIST_> > Accounting Lists > Cost Category. For more details, click Help and read Creating Cost Categories.

Name: costEstimate
Label: Item Defined Cost
Help: Enter an Item Defined Cost amount.

Name: costEstimateType
Label: Cost Estimate Type
Help:
The Cost Estimate Type determines what value NetSuite uses to calculate estimated Gross Profit.
The estimated Gross Profit for Items on a transaction provides the data needed to calculate the total estimated Gross Profit on that transaction.
The individual line items that you enter in a transaction determine the amounts that post when you process that transaction.
The following Cost Estimate Types on Items are available:
    * Item Defined Cost - a user-defined amount, entered into the Item Defined Cost field on the Item definition page.
    * Average Cost - NetSuite calculates an average cost of the units purchased. 
    * Last Purchase Price - This field displays the most recent purchase price of the item as determined by purchase order receipt transactions. 
    * Purchase Price - Price entered that you pay for this item. If you do not enter a price, then the most recent purchase price from purchase orders provides the price for this item by default.
    * Preferred Vendor Rate - This option is only used if the Multi-Vendor feature is enabled and multiple vendors supply the same item.
          o First priority is to use the preferred vendor rate if defined on the Item record.
          o Next priority would be to use the purchase price.
          o Last priority would be the purchase order rate. (Initially this uses the preferred vendor rate cost, and then after a purchase order is entered, this type uses the most recent actual purchase order rate. Special orders and drop-shipped items use this cost information.)
    * Derived from member items - Total costs of items currently included in a kit. This Cost Estimate Type only applies to kits and sums the estimated costs of each item in the kit, based on each of their individual Cost Estimate Types. Uses the latest definition of the kit, not its historical definition.

Name: createJob
Label: Create {1}
Help: Check this box to make this item eligible to create a job record when it is sold.

Name: createRevenuePlansOn
Label: Create Revenue Plans On
Help:
Select the event that triggers creation of revenue recognition plans. Match the event with the amount source of the item's revenue recognition rule.
    * Revenue Arrangement Creation - Revenue plans can be created when the revenue arrangement is created. Use this option with rules that have Event-Amount as the Amount Source.
    * Billing - Revenue plans can be created when the sales order is billed and from stand-alone cash sales, invoices, credit memos, and cash refunds. Use this option with rules that have Event-Percent based on amount as the Amount Source.
    * Fulfillment - This option is available only when Advanced Shipping is enabled. Revenue plans can be created upon fulfillment. Use this option with rules that have Event-Percent based on quantity as the Amount Source.
    * Project Progress - This option is available only when the Projects feature is enabled. Use this option with rules that have Event-Percent Complete as the Amount Source.

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: deferredRevenueAccount
Label: Deferred Revenue Account
Help:
Set the deferred revenue account to associate with this item. Then, when this item is sold and associated with a revenue recognition template, the revenue from the sale is deferred.
The sale amount is posted to a deferred revenue account, as opposed to a standard income account.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: deferRevRec
Label: Hold Revenue Recognition
Help:
Check this box to delay recognizing revenue from the sale of this item. When this box is check, revenue recognition schedules or revenue plans are created with the status On Hold.
For more information, see the help topic Delaying Revenue Recognition for an Item.

Name: department
Help: Set a department to associate with this item. For details on existing department records, in the UI go to Setup > Company > Departments.

Name: directRevenuePosting
Label: Direct Revenue Posting
Help:
Check this box to disable advanced revenue management for this item. When checked, posting transactions that include this item post directly to the item revenue account. No revenue element or revenue arrangement is created. When you check this box, the Deferred Revenue Account on the Accounting subtab is disabled.
When you create sales transactions that include items that have this box checked, all the items in the transaction must have the box checked. You cannot mix items that post directly to revenue with items that post to deferred revenue in the same transaction. This restriction also applies to kit items. All items in a kit must post either to revenue or to deferred revenue.
You cannot check or clear the box after the item has been used in a transaction with advanced revenue management.
By default, this box is not checked.

Name: displayName
Label: Display Name/Code
Help:
You can set an optional name for this item in addition to the item name. If you are integrating with a Yahoo! store, this field is imported from Yahoo!.
The display name prints in the Item column of the sales form when Basic printing is used. If this item is a member of a kit, this name appears in the Item column when the Print Items box is checked. 
If you do not set a display name, then item name appears on printed forms.

Name: dontShowPrice
Label: Don't Show Price
Help:
Check this box to hide the price of this item online.
This is useful for items you want to advertise but don't want to sell or for items that you track inventory for and want to display but are offered in combination with other items.

Name: enforceMinQtyInternally
Label: Enforce Minimum Internally
Help: Check this box to apply the minimum quantity restriction on sales orders generated from NetSuite. When you clear this box, but enter a number in the Minimum Quantity field, the minimum quantity is only applied to web store orders.

Name: excludeFromSitemap
Label: Exclude from Sitemap
Help: Check this box to exclude a tab, category or item page from the site map.

Name: featuredDescription
Label: Featured Description
Help: Settable only if item is featured. You can provide letters, numbers and basic HTML code.

Name: includeChildren
Label: Include Children
Help:
Check the Include Children box to share the item with all the sub-subsidiaries associated with each subsidiary selected in the Subsidiary field.
Note: When sharing items across subsidiaries, all of the options selected on the item record must be compatible across subsidiaries.
 
For example, when entering an inventory item to be shared across subsidiaries, you should select Income and Asset accounts on the item record that are also shared across the same subsidiaries.

Name: incomeAccount
Label: Income Account
Help: References an existing income account at Lists > Accounting > Accounts. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: isDonationItem
Label: Variable Amount
Help: If true, the item is set as a variable-priced donation item. This enables customers to enter their own prices for this item, such as for donations.

Name: isFulfillable
Label: Can be Fulfilled
Help:
Check the Can be Fulfilled/Received box to enable this item to be received and fulfilled during order processing.
Clear this box if this item does not require being received and fulfilled.
Note: Once this item has been added to transactions, this setting cannot be changed.
This field is used when the Advanced Billing and Advanced Shipping features are both enabled.

Name: isGcoCompliant
Label: Google Checkout Compliant
Help: Check this box to make the item available for purchase with Google Checkout.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: Sets the item as inactive. By default, this field is set to false.

Name: isOnline
Label: Display in Web Site
Help: Set to true to make this item available online in your Web site. You cannot sell this item online unless this field is set to true.

Name: issueProduct
Label: Product
Help:
Select the product this item is associated with.
Product records are tracked with versions and builds for issue management.
To create product records, go to <_TABNAME=ADMI_ISSUEPRODUCT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_ISSUEPRODUCT_> > Products > New.

Name: isTaxable
Label: Taxable
Help: Check this box if the item is subject to sales tax.

Name: itemId
Label: Item Name/Number
Help:
Type up to 60 characters for the name of this item. This name appears in lists on transactions.
If you have the option of entering a display name and do not, the item name prints in the Item column of sales forms.
If you have the option to enter a vendor name and do not, the item name prints in the Item column of purchase forms when Basic printing is used. If you have entered a display name, it will print on purchases instead of the item name when Basic printing is used.

Name: itemRevenueCategory
Label: Item Revenue Category
Help: The item revenue category is a classification for items that have similar characteristics and revenue allocation requirements. It is used in the fair value price list.

Name: location
Help:
Select a location to associate with this item.
To use a location, the Multi-Location Inventory feature must be enabled.
    * If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is not enabled:
      Selecting an item record location limits the items that certain roles can access.
      For example, Role A is set up to access only items associated with Location One. Therefore, employees who have Role A can access only items associated with Location One.
      Note: If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is not enabled, you cannot use this field to track inventory by locations. For example, you cannot track how many widgets you have in stock in Location One.
      For more information click here.
    * If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is enabled:
      Selecting an item record location classifies the item by that location to limit the items that certain roles can access. To track inventory per location, use the Locations subtab at the bottom of this form.
      For more information click here.
Select New to enter a new location record.
Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_LOCATION_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_LOCATION_> > Locations for details about existing location records.

Name: matrixItemNameTemplate
Label: Matrix Item Name Template
Help:
This field is used to control how the matrix item will be displayed in the Matrix Item Name/Number field.
Compose the order in which attributes and matrix options are displayed by selecting from the Insert Item Attribute and Insert Matrix Option dropdown lists.
Add custom separator characters to easier distinguish the various options. 
Example: Item Name: Fabric / Color / Waist / Length [Location]

Name: maxDonationAmount
Label: Maximum Variable Amount
Help: If isDonationItem is set to true, set this field to the maximum amount that can be paid or donated for this item.

Name: maximumQuantity
Label: Maximum Order Qty
Help:
Enter the greatest quantity of this item that customers can purchase. If customers enter an item quantity above the maximum amount, a warning message is displayed. Web store customers are unable to complete checkout unless they enter a quantity equal to or below the maximum quantity.
 Leave this field empty to allow customers to check out without maximum quantity restrictions.
You can edit this warning at Setup > Site Builder/SuiteCommerce Advanced > Customize Text.

Name: metaTagHtml
Label: Meta Tag HTML
Help: Sets the metatag information for the item page in web store.

Name: minimumQuantity
Label: Minimum Order Qty
Help:
Enter the smallest quantity you allow customers to purchase for this item. When customers add this item to their carts in the Web store, the quantity for this item is defaulted to the minimum number of items. 
Leave this field empty to allow customers to check out with no minimum quantity restrictions.

Name: noPriceMessage
Label: No Price Message
Help:
If you opted to not show a price online, enter the message that should show instead of the price.
For example, you might enter "Call for Price."

Name: offerSupport
Label: Offer Support
Help: When enabled, items can be referenced on case records either through the UI or via web services using the item field.

Name: onSpecial
Label: On Special
Help: Set to true if you want to put this item on special. The item then appears in the Specials category in your store or site.

Name: outOfStockBehavior
Label: Out Of Stock Behavior
Help:
Select a custom out of stock behavior for this item. It overwrites the overall site’s out of stock behavior. Your choices are:
    * Default - Uses the behavior selected in the Web Store Out of Stock Items field at Setup > Web Site > Setup Tasks > Set Up Web Site > Shopping.
    * Disallow back orders but display out of stock messages
    * Allow back orders but display out of stock messages
    * Remove items when out of stock
    * Allow back orders with no out of stock message

Name: outOfStockMessage
Label: Out Of Stock Message
Help: You can enter a custom out of stock message for this item. The message here replaces the default out of stock message.

Name: overallQuantityPricingType
Label: Calculate Quantity Discounts
Help:
Available values are:
_byLineQuantity
_byOverallItemQuantity
_byOverallParentQuantity
_byOverallScheduleQuantity

Name: pageTitle
Label: Page Title
Help: Sets the display title in the upper-left corner of an Internet browser when customers view this item in your Web store.

Name: parent
Label: Subitem of
Help:
References an existing item record. Only required if the item is a child of another item.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: pricesIncludeTax
Label: Prices Include Tax
Help: Check this box to save the base price as the tax inclusive price. Clear this box to save the base price as the tax exclusive price.

Name: pricingGroup
Label: Pricing Group
Help:
Select the pricing group this item is a member of.
Using pricing groups allows you to assign customer-specific price levels for a group of items.
You can create new pricing groups at <_TABNAME=EDIT_OTHERLIST_> > <_TABNAME=EDIT_OTHERLIST_> > Accounting Lists > New > Pricing Group.

Name: quantityPricingSchedule
Label: Quantity Pricing Schedule
Help: Set the pricing schedule you want to use to set prices for this item. You can create new pricing schedules at Lists > Accounting > Quantity Pricing Schedules > New. Selecting a pricing schedule sets the Use Marginal Rates and Calculate Quantity Discounts fields.

Name: rate
Label: Price
Help: Defines the rate for this item. If a value is entered followed by the percentage sign, the discount is interpreted as a percentage discount (i.e.  -.10% sets a ten percent discount for the item). If a value without the percentage sign is entered, the rate is interpreted as a flat dollar value.

Name: relatedItemsDescription
Label: Related Items Description
Help: Sets the description displayed for a group of related items.

Name: revenueAllocationGroup
Label: Revenue Allocation Group
Help: Select a revenue allocation group to use in GroupSum functions in fair value formulas. The value you select here is the default. You can change it on the revenue element.

Name: revenueRecognitionRule
Label: Revenue Recognition Rule
Help:
Select the revenue rule to use by default for this item in a revenue arrangement.
Be sure the rule you select has an Amount Source that is appropriate for the value you select in the Create Revenue Plans On field. For more information, see the field level help for Create Revenue Plans On.

Name: revRecForecastRule
Label: Rev Rec Forecast Rule
Help:
Select a revenue rule to use for forecast revenue recognition plans. The default is determined by the same accounting preference as the Revenue Recognition Rule.
You may select the same rule or a different rule for actual and forecast rules. Percent complete rules are not available as forecast rules. For information about forecast revenue plans for project progress, see Working with Percent-Complete Revenue Recognition Plans.

Name: revReclassFXAccount
Label: Foreign Currency Adjustment Account
Help:
Select the account to use for the foreign currency adjustment during reclassification.
You can select any account with an account type of income, other income, expense, or other expense, including the gain and loss accounts generated by the system after qualifying revaluation transactions. You can change the Foreign Currency Adjustment Account on the revenue element before revenue recognition plans are created.

Name: revRecSchedule
Label: Revenue Recognition Template
Help:
Sets the revenue recognition template that will be applied to this item. In order to set this field, the item record referenced in the item field must have a deferred revenue account associated with it. This field then defaults to the rev. rec.  template associated to the item on the item record.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: salesDescription
Label: Sales Description
Help: Sets the description displayed when an item's store display name is clicked.

Name: salesTaxCode
Label: Sales Tax Code
Help:
This field is required for customers subscribing to International versions on NetSuite. Sets the default tax code to be used on sales transactions. 
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: saleUnit
Label: Sale Unit
Help: Select the unit you use to sell this item to customers on sales transactions.

Name: searchKeywords
Label: Search Keywords
Help: Enter alternative search keywords that customers might use to find this item using your Web store�s internal search. These can include synonyms, acronyms, alternate languages or misspellings. These keywords are seen as equally important as the item name when searches are conducted.

Name: showDefaultDonationAmount
Label: Show Default Amount
Help: Can only be set when isDonation is set to True. If true, the item's online price is displayed as a suggested price.

Name: sitemapPriority
Label: Sitemap Priority
Help:
Use the Sitemap Priority list to indicate the relative importance of your Web site URLs.
You can select a priority ranging from 0.0 to 1.0 on item, category, and tab records.
NetSuite assigns the default priority “Auto” to all new and existing tab, category and item records in your account. The priority is calculated based on the position of the item or category in the hierarchy of your Web site.
For example, your Web site tabs automatically generate a default priority value of 1.0 because they are top level pages. A category published to a tab gets a priority of 0.5. An item published to a category on a tab gets a priority of 0.3.

Name: softDescriptor
Label: Soft Descriptor
Help:
In the Soft Descriptor list, select the name that will appear on the customer's credit card statement when this item is purchased.
Enter soft descriptors to select in this field at Setup > Accounting > Payment Processing > Credit Card Soft Descriptors.

Name: specialsDescription
Label: Specials Description
Help: Settable only if onSpecial is set to True. You can provide letters, numbers and basic HTML code.

Name: storeDescription
Label: Store Description
Help: Sets the item description. This field can contain plain text as well as basic html code.

Name: storeDetailedDescription
Label: Detailed Description
Help: Sets the detailed item description. This field can contain plain text as well as basic html code.

Name: storeDisplayImage
Label: Item Display Image
Help: References an existing image file in the file cabinet. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: storeDisplayName
Label: Store Display Name
Help: Sets the item name for your Web site.

Name: storeDisplayThumbnail
Label: Item Display Thumbnail
Help: References an existing image file in the file cabinet. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: storeItemTemplate
Label: Item Drilldown Template
Help: References an existing item template at Setup > Web Site > Item/Category Templates.

Name: taxSchedule
Label: Schedule
Help:
Select the tax schedule you want to apply to this item.
You can create new tax schedules at Setup > Accounting > Taxes > Tax Schedules > New.

Name: unitsType
Label: Units Type
Help: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: upcCode
Label: UPC Code
Help: Defines whether this is a unv part code. Bar codes for items are generated in Code 128 by default. If you prefer to use the UPC code format, set this field to True on each item record.

Name: urlComponent
Label: URL Component
Help:
Enter a short, descriptive name for this item to appear as part of its URL in the Web store.
Setting a name to show in the URL can result in better ranking from search engines.
If you leave this field blank, NetSuite terms and numbers are used as identifiers in the URL.
Note: Descriptive URL components are case sensitive. Descriptive URLs must match the case used in the URL Component field of an item record to point to the correct page.

Name: useMarginalRates
Label: Use Marginal Rates
Help:
Set to true if you want the quantity discounts in the schedule to be applied to each pricing bracket separately.
For example, a schedule offers no discount for the first 100 items sold and a 5% discount if more than 100 are sold. If 150 items are sold, the first 100 are at normal price, and the other fifty items are sold at 5% discount.
The fault value is false, which applies the discount to all items sold.

Name: vsoeDeferral
Label: Deferral
Help:
In this field set how to handle deferment when this item is sold as part of a bundle. The available options are:
_deferBundleUntilDelivered � Until this item is marked delivered, the revenue recognition of all items in the bundle is deferred. A typical use for this option is to identify items whose revenue recognition depends on the delivery of the item itself, in addition to the delivery of a separate service. For example, a specified upgrade would typically be marked Defer Bundle Until Delivered.
_deferUntilItemDelivered � Until this item is marked delivered, the revenue recognition of this item is deferred. This setting is the default for this field. 
Note: The deferral setting you set for each item in a bundle works together with the deferral settings for other items in the bundle.

Name: vsoeDelivered
Label: Default as Delivered
Help: Check this box to automatically set this item to a Delivered status when this item is added to a transaction. Clear this box to leave the delivery status clear by default.

Name: vsoePermitDiscount
Label: Permit Discount
Help:
Set one of the following options to determine how discounts are handled for this item.
_asAllowed - Allows a portion of an applicable discount to be applied against this item if its status is Delivered when the VSOE allocation is performed.
_never - Does not allow a discount to be applied against this item when the VSOE allocation is performed. This selection would be common for a Specified Upgrade. 
Note: The default for this field is _asAllowed.

Name: vsoePrice
Label: Allocation Price
Help:
Set the VSOE price for this item, if the price is known.
Note: If you need to use more than one VSOE price for an item, you can set the most common price here and then change the price on each order manually.

Name: vsoeSopGroup
Label: Allocation Type
Help:
Select an allocation type to associate with this item on sales transactions.
    * Normal - Revenue allocation follows EITF 08-01 rules when you use VSOE and the fair value price list with advanced revenue management.
    * Exclude - This item is excluded from revenue allocation. The item discounted sales amount is the revenue amount.
    * Software - The item is software. When you use VSOE with the EITF SuiteApp, both EITF 08-01 and SOP 97-2 rules apply for revenue allocation. When you use advanced revenue management, revenue allocation follows the fair value price list. Then if the fair value prices for any of the items in the allocation are estimates rather than VSOE, the allocation is recalculated using the residual method.
Note: Do not select the Software value unless you are using VSOE with the EITF SuiteApp or Advanced Revenue Management.

Name: categoryListLayout
Label: Category List Layout
Help:
Select a layout for the subcategories you place in this category.
To create new layouts, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_STOREITEMLISTLAYOUT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_STOREITEMLISTLAYOUT_> > Web Site Item/Category Layouts > New.

Name: description
Help: Enter a brief description for this category. You can enter text, numbers and basic HTML. This field holds 999 characters.

Name: excludeFromSitemap
Label: Exclude from Sitemap
Help: Check this box to exclude a tab, category or item page from the sitemap.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: This field is false by default.

Name: isOnline
Label: Display in Web Site
Help: Set to true to make this item available online in your Web site. You cannot sell this item online unless this field is set to true.

Name: itemId
Help: Required on Add.

Name: itemListLayout
Label: Item List Layout
Help:
Select a layout for the items you place in this category.
To select a layout or create new layouts, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_SITEITEMTEMPLAT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_SITEITEMTEMPLAT_> > Item/Category Templates.

Name: metaTagHtml
Label: Meta Tag HTML
Help: Enter the Meta Tag HTML you want to appear in the  section of this item page. Meta tags enable your Web site to be found by search engines.

Name: pageTitle
Label: Page Title
Help: Enter the text you want to appear as the page title of the browser window.

Name: parentCategory
Help: Required on Add.

Name: relatedItemsListLayout
Label: Related Items List Layout
Help:
Select the list layout you want to use to display your lists of related items on this category.
Set up list layouts at <_TABNAME=LIST_SITEITEMTEMPLAT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_SITEITEMTEMPLAT_> > Item/Category Templates.
Set up related items at <_TABNAME=LIST_RELATEDITEMS_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_RELATEDITEMS_> > Related Item Groups.

Name: searchKeywords
Label: Search Keywords
Help: Enter alternate search keywords that customers might use to find this item using your web store global search. These can include synonyms, acronyms, alternate languages or misspellings. These keywords are considered equally as important as the item name when searches are conducted.

Name: sitemapPriority
Label: Sitemap Priority
Help:
Select a value in the Sitemap Priority list to designate the relative importance of this page to the rest of your Web site's URLs. You can select a priority ranging from 0.0 to 1.0 on item, category, and tab records.
Note that NetSuite assigns the default priority “Auto” to all new and existing tab, category and item records in your account. You can select a different value in the Sitemap Priority list to override the default “Auto” priority. NetSuite uses the value you set when you generate the sitemap.

Name: storeDetailedDescription
Help: Sets the detailed item description. This field can contain plain text as well as basic html code.

Name: storeDisplayImage
Label: Image
Help:
References an existing image file in the file cabinet.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: storeDisplayThumbnail
Label: Thumbnail
Help:
References an existing image file in the file cabinet.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: urlComponent
Label: URL Component
Help:
Enter a short, descriptive name for this category to appear as part of its URL in the Web store.
Setting a name to show in the URL can result in better ranking from search engines.
If you leave this field blank, NetSuite terms and numbers are used as identifiers in the URL.

Name: assigned
Label: Assigned To
Help: If you want to assign this solution to someone, select that person in this field.

Name: createdDate
Label: Creation Date/Time
Help: The date this solution was created is shown here.

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help:
This field shows your default solution form.
If you select another form, this page will change to that form.
To create a custom solution form, select New.

Name: displayOnline
Label: Display Online
Help:
Check this box if you want this solution available for published knowledge bases.
If you do not check this box, this solution will not display if you publish its topic in a knowledge base.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: This field is false by default.

Name: lastModifiedDate
Label: Last Modified Date/Time
Help: The date and time this solution was last modified is shown here.

Name: longDescription
Label: Description
Help:
Enter the text of this solution or topic here.
You can use Javascript, HTML and CRMDSK tags in this description.
Click Preview to see how this solution will appear when published.

Name: message
Label: Abstract
Help: Required on Add.

Name: solutionCode
Label: ID
Help: Required on Add. Defaults to the next available system code.

Name: status
Label: Status
Help: Required on Add.

Name: title
Label: Title
Help: Required on Add.

Name: country
Label: Country
Help: Select the country that you are making this record for.

Name: fullName
Label: Full Name
Help: Enter the unabbreviated name of this county, state, or province.

Name: shortname
Label: Short Name
Help:
Enter the abbreviation for this county, state, or province.
If you want to use this abbreviation in addresses, enable the Use Abbreviations for States preference at <_TABNAME=ADMI_GENERAL_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_GENERAL_> > General Preferences.

Name: approved
Label: Approved
Help:
Check this box to indicate that this journal entry is approved.
If you check this box, this journal entry will post immediately.
If you do not check this box, this journal entry must be approved before it posts.

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: Select the custom journal entry record, if required.

Name: memo
Label: Memo
Help: If you wish, enter a memo to describe this journal entry. It will appear on this transaction detail as well as reports such as a 2-line account register.

Name: postingPeriod
Label: Accounting Period
Help: The current period is entered as the posting period for the journal entry. If this period is closed before the journal entry is approved, the posting period is the earliest open period.

Name: reversalDate
Label: Reversal Date
Help:
If this journal entry is intended to be reversed, enter the date for the reversing entry to be posted.
If Defer Entry is checked, this field is mandatory.

Name: reversalDefer
Label: Defer Entry
Help:
Check this box to make the reversal a memorized transaction that automatically occurs on the date entered in the required Reversal Date field.
Clear this box to make the reversal an immediately entered transaction with the date in the Reversal Date field.

Name: subsidiary
Help:
If you are entering a regular, book specific, or statistical journal entry:
In the Subsidiary field, select the subsidiary to associate with this journal entry.
Note: If the subsidiary you select is assigned to one or more shared vendor records, you can make journal entries for any of the vendors to which the selected subsidiary is assigned. To do this, on the Lines subtab, select the shared vendor from the Name field. 
Note: When a journal entry is associated with a subsidiary, the journal posts to that subsidiary and the schedule is restricted to be viewed only by entities associated with the subsidiary.
If you are entering an intercompany journal entry:
In the Subsidiary field, choose the subsidiary initiating the ledger transaction. The first line of this journal entry must post to the subsidiary you choose here.
Note: All lines of an intercompany journal entry must post to either the Subsidary or the To Subsidiary. No other subsidiaries can be associated with lines on this journal entry.
If you are entering an advanced intercompany journal entry:
In the Subsidiary field, choose the subsidiary initiating the ledger transaction. The first line of this journal entry must post to the subsidiary you choose here. The remaining lines can post to any subsidiary to which you are granted access.

Name: tranDate
Label: Date
Help: NetSuite inserts today's date as the date of this journal entry. You can enter or select another date.

Name: tranId
Label: Entry No.
Help:
NetSuite increases the largest journal entry number by one. If you wish, you can type another number.
The next journal entry number will revert to the standard pattern.
You can enter a maximum of 45 characters in this field.

Name: unitsType
Label: Unit of Measure Type
Help: This field displays the unit type to associate with this statistical journal entry.

Name: addrLanguage
Help: Select the default language for NetSuite users in this subsidiary. Individual users can choose their language at <_TABNAME=TRAN_USERPREFS_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=TRAN_USERPREFS_> > Set Preferences.

Name: checkLayout
Label: Check Default Chart Type
Help: Select the check layout you want to use when printing checks from this subsidiary.

Name: country
Label: Country
Help: Select the country in which this subsidiary is located.

Name: currency
Label: Currency
Help: Set the base currency used by this subsidiary. If you do not set a currency, the currency of the parent is used.

Name: edition
Label: Edition
Help: This field shows the edition of NetSuite used by this subsidiary.

Name: email
Label: Return Email Address
Help: Enter the return email address for this subsidiary.

Name: fax
Label: Fax
Help: Enter the fax number for this subsidiary.

Name: federalIdNumber
Label: Employer Identification Number (EIN)
Help:
Enter the appropriate tax identification number for this subsidiary:
    * United States  Employee Identification Number (EIN) or Federal Identification Number (FIN)
    * Australia  Australian Business Number
    * United Kingdom  VAT Registration Number
    * All other locations  VAT Registration Number
This number is required for all businesses with employees or acting as corporations or partnerships for tax purposes. If you think you need a tax identification number or do not know what your number is, contact the tax agency with jurisdiction over this subsidiary.

Name: fiscalCalendar
Label: Fiscal Calendar
Help: Select the calendar to roll up accounting periods. The fiscal calendar determines the start date for the accounting year.

Name: inboundEmail
Help:
Use this email address to forward email from your support email address for this subsidiary to NetSuite.
When email arrives at this address, it is converted into case records in NetSuite. These cases records are associated with this subsidiary.
You must set up this process with your email server. Click Help in the upper right corner of this page for more information.
Caution: Only use this email address for the purpose of capturing email messages as case records. All messages sent to this address are converted to cases in your NetSuite account.

Name: interCoAccount
Label: Intercompany Account
Help:
If the Intercompany Time and Expense feature is enabled in your account, an Intercompany Account is automatically associated with a subsidiary after qualifying transactions are created in the system, such as a journal to eliminate Time and Expense.
This account is determined by the subsidiary’s base currency. It is used to offset the transfer of charges from intercompany time and expenses from this subsidiary to others.

Name: isElimination
Label: Elimination
Help: Set to true if this subsidiary record is to be used only for journal entries and transactions between subsidiaries.

Name: isInactive
Label: {1} is Inactive
Help: Set to true if this subsidiary is no longer active or used in your account. Inactivated subsidiaries no longer show in the Subsidiary field on records and transactions unless they are currently attached to a record. Web sites of inactive subsidiaries are no longer available online.

Name: legalName
Label: Legal Name
Help: Enter the legal name of this subsidiary as it shoudl appear on tax forms.

Name: logo
Label: Subsidiary Logo (Forms)
Help: Set the logo that should appear on printed and emailed transaction forms for this subsidiary. If you do not set a logo here, the logo for the parent subsidiary or company is used. To upload a logo into NetSuite, click Add New next to the Logo field in the UI. Be sure to check the Available Without Login box.

Name: name
Label: Name
Help:
Set the name of this subsidiary the way it should appear on all forms except checks. 
Note: On checks, your company name is pre-printed with address and MICR information.

Name: pageLogo
Label: Subsidiary Logo (Pages)
Help:
Select the logo image to be displayed on all pages for this subsidiary.
Click New to upload a logo. Logos must be in JPG or GIF format.
Note: The logo selected in this field does not affect printed forms. The logo on printed forms is determined by the selection in the Subsidiary Logo (Forms) field.
To upload a logo, click Add New. Check the Available Without Login box.

Name: parent
Label: Sub{1} of
Help:
Set this field to the direct parent of the subsidiary.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
Setting a parent subsidiary sets your company hierarchy which is shown in the subsidiaries list.

Name: purchaseOrderAmount
Label: Vendor Bill - Purchase Order Amount Tolerance
Help: Enter the tolerance limit for the discrepancy between the amount on the vendor bill and purchase order.

Name: purchaseOrderQuantity
Label: Vendor Bill - Purchase Order Quantity Tolerance
Help: Enter the tolerance limit for the discrepancy between the quantity on the vendor bill and purchase order.

Name: purchaseOrderQuantityDiff
Label: Vendor Bill - Purchase Order Quantity Difference
Help: Enter the difference limit for the discrepancy between the quantity on the vendor bill and purchase order.

Name: receiptAmount
Label: Vendor Bill - Item Receipt Amount Tolerance
Help: Enter the tolerance limit for the discrepancy between the amount on the vendor bill and item receipt.

Name: receiptQuantity
Label: Vendor Bill - Item Receipt Quantity Tolerance
Help: Enter the tolerance limit for the discrepancy between the quantity on the vendor bill and item receipt.

Name: receiptQuantityDiff
Label: Vendor Bill - Item Receipt Quantity Difference
Help: Enter the difference limit for the discrepancy between the quantity on the vendor bill and item receipt.

Name: showSubsidiaryName
Label: Always Display Subsidiary Name
Help:
Check this box to display only the subsidiary name with your role in the upper right  corner of a page.  In addition, when logging in to an employee center, vendor center, or customer center, the dashboard displays only the logo of the subsidiary, not the company logo.
Clear this box to display the parent and the subsidiary name in your account.

Name: ssnOrTin
Label: SSN or TIN (Social Security Number, Tax ID Number)
Help:
If you are a US citizen and are self-employed with no employees, enter your Social Security Number (SSN). If you are not a US citizen but have a Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN) issued by the IRS for purposes of operating a business with no employees, enter your TIN.
These numbers are used for tax purposes only.

Name: state
Label: State
Help: Select the state or province in which this subsidiary is located.

Name: state1TaxNumber
Label: ACN
Help:
Enter your Australian Company Number if one has been assigned to your company.
For information about the ACN, see http://www.asic.gov.au.

Name: taxFiscalCalendar
Label: Tax Fiscal Calendar
Help: Select the calendar to roll up the tax periods. The tax fiscal calendar determines the start date for the tax year.

Name: tranPrefix
Label: Document Number Prefix
Help:
When you use auto-generated numbering with NetSuite OneWorld, you can make your document number sequences independent per subsidiary.
Enter up to 8 alphanumeric characters in this field to number transactions with a prefix to signify this subsidiary.
To set up auto-generated numbering, go to Setup >  Setup Tasks > Auto-Generated Numbers. On the Document Numbers subtab, check the Use Subsidiary box next to each transaction to which this prefix should be applied.

Name: url
Label: Web Site
Help: Set this subsidiary�s Web site address or URL.

Name: availableToPartners
Label: Available to Adv. Partners
Help: If true, this item is available in the Advanced Partner Center.

Name: class
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Classes. This field is required when the Make Classes Mandatory preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: department
Help: Set a department to associate with this item. For details on existing department records, in the UI go to Setup > Company > Departments.

Name: description
Label: Description
Help: Enter a description for this item. This description will appear in the Description column of sales forms.

Name: displayName
Label: Display Name/Code
Help:
You can set an optional name for this item in addition to the item name. If you are integrating with a Yahoo! store, this field is imported from Yahoo!.
The display name prints in the Item column of the sales form when Basic printing is used. If this item is a member of a kit, this name appears in the Item column when the Print Items box is checked. 
If you do not set a display name, then item name appears on printed forms.

Name: includeChildren
Label: Include Children
Help:
Check the Include Children box to share the item with all the sub-subsidiaries associated with each subsidiary selected in the Subsidiary field.
Note: When sharing items across subsidiaries, all of the options selected on the item record must be compatible across subsidiaries.
 
For example, when entering an inventory item to be shared across subsidiaries, you should select Income and Asset accounts on the item record that are also shared across the same subsidiaries.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: Sets the item as inactive. By default, this field is set to false.

Name: issueProduct
Label: Product
Help:
Select the product this item is associated with.
Product records are tracked with versions and builds for issue management.
To create product records, go to <_TABNAME=ADMI_ISSUEPRODUCT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_ISSUEPRODUCT_> > Products > New.

Name: itemId
Label: Item Name/Number
Help:
Type up to 60 characters for the name of this item. This name appears in lists on transactions.
If you have the option of entering a display name and do not, the item name prints in the Item column of sales forms.
If you have the option to enter a vendor name and do not, the item name prints in the Item column of purchase forms when Basic printing is used. If you have entered a display name, it will print on purchases instead of the item name when Basic printing is used.

Name: location
Help:
Select a location to associate with this item.
To use a location, the Multi-Location Inventory feature must be enabled.
    * If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is not enabled:
      Selecting an item record location limits the items that certain roles can access.
      For example, Role A is set up to access only items associated with Location One. Therefore, employees who have Role A can access only items associated with Location One.
      Note: If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is not enabled, you cannot use this field to track inventory by locations. For example, you cannot track how many widgets you have in stock in Location One.
      For more information click here.
    * If the Multi-Location Inventory feature is enabled:
      Selecting an item record location classifies the item by that location to limit the items that certain roles can access. To track inventory per location, use the Locations subtab at the bottom of this form.
      For more information click here.
Select New to enter a new location record.
Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_LOCATION_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_LOCATION_> > Locations for details about existing location records.

Name: assigned
Label: Assigned To
Help:
References an employee record that already exists in your account.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: caseNumber
Label: ID
Help:
If you use auto-generated numbering, this number is automatically assigned to give the case a unique identifier.
You can use this case number to quickly access this case using the case search or the Global Search field.

Name: category
Label: Type
Help: References a value in a user defined list at Setup > Support > Case Types. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: company
Label: Company
Help:
References an existing company record in your NetSuite account.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: contact
Label: Contact
Help:
References an existing contact record in your NetSuite account.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: createdDate
Label: Creation Date/Time
Help: When adding a record, this field defaults to the current system date and time. This field cannot be overwritten. The default value is set regardless of any use default settings.

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: email
Label: Emails
Help: Accepts a comma or semicolon deliminated list of e-mail addresses for the company. Note that e-mails cannot be be sent using Web services.

Name: emailForm
Label: Email reply
Help: This field allows a true or false value only.

Name: endDate
Label: Date Closed
Help: The date and time when the case was closed.

Name: escalationMessage
Label: Escalation Message
Help: Sets the message that is e-mailed to the people listed in the escalateToList. The customer does not receive a copy of this e-mail message. The message is not stored in the case record.

Name: helpDesk
Label: Help Desk
Help:
Check this box if this case is internal and is being submitted by or for an employee.
Help desk cases are not included in Customer Service reports.

Name: inboundEmail
Label: Inbound Email Address
Help:
If this case was submitted by email, this field displays the email address to which the case was sent to submit the case.
For example, if you use two support email addresses, support@yourcompany.com and help@yourcompany.com, this field shows which address was used.
The email address the customer sent the message from displays in the Email field.

Name: incomingMessage
Label: Message
Help:
If this case was submitted by a customer, the customer's most recent message appears here.
If you are creating this case, enter the problem or question here.
If you change the customer or company who submitted this case, the last message remains, even if it is from the previous company.
To view all past messages, click View History on the Messages subtab.

Name: insertSolution
Help:
Add a solution to this case in one of the following ways:
    * Enter the first few letters of the solution title, and press Tab.
    * Click List to select the solution from a list.
    * Click Search to search for a solution.
    * Click New to create a new solution.

Name: internalOnly
Label: Internal Only
Help:
Check this box if you do not want your reply to be seen by customers.
Only people in your company who view this case record can see your internal message.
When editing a case, you can also send email to customers or employees using the Email button on the Messages subtab.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: Sets whether the case is active or not. Default value of False.

Name: issue
Label: {#Case#} {#Issue#}
Help: References a value in a user defined list at Setup > Support > Case Issues. This value represents an issue type. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: item
Label: Item
Help: References an item record that already exists in your NetSuite account. Only items that have the Offer Support tag enabled can be referenced in this field. This tag can be set in Lists > Accounting > Items. It can also be set when creating item records via Web services. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: lastMessageDate
Label: Last Message Date
Help: The date and time of the last message received or sent relating to the case.

Name: lastModifiedDate
Label: Last Modified Date/Time
Help: This is a read only field. When updating a record, this field defaults to the current system date and time.

Name: lastReopenedDate
Label: Date Last Reopened
Help: The date and time when the case was last changed from Closed to Re-opened.

Name: module
Label: Module
Help:
Select the product module this case is related to.
You can create and edit modules on product records at <_TABNAME=ADMI_ISSUEPRODUCT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_ISSUEPRODUCT_> > Products.

Name: origin
Label: Origin
Help: References a value in a user defined list at Setup > Support > Case Origin Types. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: outgoingMessage
Label: Reply
Help:
Use this field to enter a reply to the message. This can be an answer, solution or request for more information based on the information in the Message field.
Check the Send Email box to email this reply to the email address saved on this case record.
Check the Internal Only box to email this reply only to those selected in the Email Employees field.

Name: phone
Label: Phone
Help: Sets the contact phone number for this case.

Name: priority
Label: Priority
Help: References a value in a user defined list at Setup > Support > Case Priorities. This value represents an issue status.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: product
Label: Product
Help:
Select the product this case is related to.
You can create and edit product records at <_TABNAME=ADMI_ISSUEPRODUCT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_ISSUEPRODUCT_> > Products.

Name: profile
Label: Profile
Help:
Select the profile you want to assign to this case. This profile determines the following:
    * the from name and from email address shown on notification sent for this case
    * the notification templates used
You can create new case profiles at <_TABNAME=EDIT_CASEPROFILE_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=EDIT_CASEPROFILE_> > Case Profiles > New.

Name: serialNumber
Label: Serial/Lot Number
Help: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: startDate
Label: Incident Date
Help: The default value for this field is the current date and time.

Name: status
Label: Status
Help: References a value in a user defined list at Setup > Support > Case Statuses. This value represents an issue status. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: subsidiary
Label: Subsidiary
Help: The subsidiary for the customer associated with this case is displayed here.

Name: title
Label: Subject
Help: Sets the title that is displayed in the cases list, subtabs of  completed company, customer and contact records and in the subtab of completed solution records.

Name: description
Help:
Enter information to define what kinds of cases should have this issue selected.
This description is saved on this record and shows in the Support Issue List.

Name: insertBefore
Help: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: isInactive
Help: This field is false by default.

Name: name
Help:
Enter the name for this case issue.
You select this name on case records to siginify what the case is about.

Name: accessLevel
Label: Private
Help: The default value is false. True indicates that the task is private.

Name: actualTime
Label: Actual Time
Help: The Actual Time field shows the total amount of time entered against this task.

Name: assigned
Label: Assigned To
Help:
References an entity record that already exists in your account.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: company
Label: Company
Help: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: completedDate
Label: Date Completed
Help: Enter the date this task was actually completed.

Name: contact
Label: Contact
Help:
Select the contact for this task.
The contacts in this field are the contacts attached to the company selected above. Click Open next to the Company field to add contacts to a company's record.
You can select additional companies and contacts on the Contacts subtab.

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: dueDate
Label: Due Date
Help: Enter the projected date when this task needs to be complete.

Name: endDate
Label: End Date
Help: This field is required in the UI but not when submitting requests via Web services.

Name: estimatedTime
Label: Initial Time Budget
Help:
In the Initial Time Budget field, enter your first approximation of the amount of time this task will take. Later, you can increase or decrease your time estimate in the Current Time Budget field.
 
By maintaining an initial time estimate in this field, you can compare your initial estimate to your altered estimate.
 
If you entered a time estimate on a job task template, that amount shows here.

Name: estimatedTimeOverride
Label: Current Time Budget
Help: If your estimate of the time this task will take increases or decreases from your original estimate, enter the altered estimate in the Current Time Budget field.

Name: message
Label: Comments
Help:
Enter any comments about this task.
These comments appear in the e-mail sent to the person this task is assigned to.

Name: milestone
Label: Milestone
Help: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: owner
Label: Created By
Help:
References an entity record that already exists in your account. The field defaults to the current user.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: parent
Label: Child Of
Help:
Select the parent task if this task is the subordinate of another.
Note: By identifying this task as a subordinate, the parent task becomes a summary task. A summary task cannot have resources assigned to it because it does not track work, it only tracks information about subordinate tasks.

Name: percentComplete
Label: Percent Complete
Help:
In the Percent Complete field, enter an estimate of how much of the total amount of work for this task is already completed.
 
For example, if half the work toward completion is done, enter 50%.
 
Note: The percentage you enter in this field overrides the auto-calculated figure in the Percent Time Complete field and is used for task calculations.

Name: percentTimeComplete
Label: Percent Complete (Time)
Help:
The system auto-calculates a value for the Percent Time Complete field, by dividing Actual Time by Current Time Budget (or by Initial Time Budget, if no Current Time Budget has been entered). This value indicates how much of the budgeted time for the task has been completed.
You can override this value by entering a percentage value in the Percent Complete field.

Name: priority
Label: Priority
Help: The values used to populate this field are _low, _medium or _high.

Name: reminderMinutes
Label: Set up Reminder
Help: This field is settable only if timedEvent is set to TRUE.

Name: reminderType
Label: Reminder type
Help: This field is settable only if timedEvent is set to TRUE.

Name: sendEmail
Label: Send email
Help: The default value is false.

Name: startDate
Label: Start Date
Help: This field has a default value of the current date and time. It is required in the UI but not when submitting requests via Web services.

Name: status
Label: Status
Help: The values used to populate this field are _notStarted, _inProgress or _completed.

Name: supportCase
Label: Support Case
Help: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: timedEvent
Label: Timed Event
Help:
In Web services the startTime and endTime field are not exposed. Therefore, to set start and end times for a timed task, users must first set the timedEvent field to TRUE. Then the time component of the DateTime value that is specified in startDate will be set for startTime, and the time component of the DateTime value that is specified in endDate will be set for endTime. 
Note that the fields reminderMinutes and reminderType are also only settable if timedEvent is set to TRUE.

Name: timeRemaining
Label: Time Remaining
Help:
The Time Remaining field shows the estimated remaining amount of time for this task.
 
Time remaining is calculated as follows:
(Initial Time Budget - Actual Time)
If you have entered a Current Time Budget to update your Initial Time Budget, then the time remaining for the task is calculated as:
(Current Time Budget - Actual Time)

Name: title
Label: Title
Help:
Enter a name for this task.
This name is the subject line of the e-mail sent to the assignee if you check the Send e-mail box.
This title also appears to others if the Private Task box is not checked. The title shows on the Tasks list.

Name: transaction
Label: Transaction
Help:
References an opportunity record that already exists in your account.
In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: description
Label: Description
Help: Enter a description for this account.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: If TRUE, inactivates the account.

Name: name
Label: Name
Help: Enter a name for this account.

Name: taxAcctType
Label: Tax Account Type
Help: Select the type of tax control account you are creating.

Name: city
Label: City
Help:
Enter the city where this tax should be applied.
This value is used by NetSuite to automatically determine the correct tax when an order is entered or a customer places an order on your website.
This field is available only if the SuiteTax feature is disabled in your account.

Name: county
Label: County
Help:
Enter the county where this tax should be applied.
 
This value is used by NetSuite to automatically determine the correct tax when an order is entered or a customer places an order on your website.
 
This field is available only if the SuiteTax feature is disabled in your account.

Name: description
Label: Description
Help: Enter a description for this record.

Name: includeChildren
Label: Include Children
Help:
Check this box to apply the tax code to the children of the subsidiary that you selected in the Subsidiaries field. In the Subsidiaries field, colons separate parent subsidiaries (on the left) from their children (on the right).
This field is available only if the SuiteTax feature is disabled in your account.

Name: isDefault
Label: Default Code
Help:
Check this box if this code is the default tax group selected on transactions.
 
This tax code is selected if the customer's shipping address does not match another tax group.
 
This field is available only if the SuiteTax feature is disabled in your account.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help:
This field is false by default. Check this box to inactivate this record. Inactive records do not show on transactions and records for selection in lists.
On nexus and tax type records, this field is available only if the SuiteTax feature is enabled in your account.

Name: itemId
Label: Name
Help:
Enter a name for this record.
This field is available only if the SuiteTax feature is disabled in your account.

Name: piggyback
Label: Piggy Back
Help:
Check this box if you want this tax code to include GST in addition to the line item amount when calculating PST.
If you do not check this box, PST is calculated for the line item amount only.

Name: rate
Label: Rate
Help:
Enter the appropriate tax rate as a percentage.
Example: 8%
This percentage will be calculated when you select this tax item on transactions.
This field is available only if the SuiteTax feature is disabled in your account.

Name: state
Label: State
Help:
Select the state, province, or county that you are making this record for. You can create a new state, province, or county at Setup > Company > Setup Tasks > States/Provinces/Counties.
On tax code records, this field is available only if the SuiteTax feature is disabled in your account.

Name: taxitem1
Label: GST/HST
Help: Select the GST item you want to include in this tax code.

Name: taxitem2
Label: PST
Help: Select the PST item you want to include in this tax code.

Name: taxType
Label: Tax Type
Help:
Select the tax type for this tax code. You can create a new tax type at Setup > Accounting > Taxes > Tax Types > New.
If the SuiteTax feature is enabled in your account, you cannot change the value in the Tax Type field after the tax code record has been saved.

Name: unitprice1
Label: Rate
Help: The tax rate for the GST item is shown here.

Name: unitprice2
Label: Rate
Help: The rate for the PST item is shown here.

Name: zip
Label: Zip Codes
Help:
Enter the zip codes where this tax should be applied. Separate each zip code with a comma.
 
This value is used by NetSuite to automatically determine the correct tax when an order is entered or a customer places an order on your website.
 
This field is available only if the SuiteTax feature is disabled in your account.

Name: country
Label: Country
Help: Select the country that you are making this record for.

Name: description
Label: Description
Help: Enter a description for this record.

Name: doesNotAddToTotal
