Label: Does Not Add to Transaction Total
Help:
Check this box for special tax types that do not impact the transaction total, such as withholding tax. Tax types with this property can be used on sales and purchase transactions.
This field is available only if the SuiteTax feature is enabled in your account.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help:
This field is false by default. Check this box to inactivate this record. Inactive records do not show on transactions and records for selection in lists.
On nexus and tax type records, this field is available only if the SuiteTax feature is enabled in your account.

Name: name
Label: Name
Help:
Enter a name for this record.
On tax code records, this field is available only if the SuiteTax feature is enabled in your account.

Name: postToItemCost
Label: Post to Item Cost
Help:
Check this box if the tax amounts for the tax type should be added to the related item cost. Tax types with this property can be used on purchase transactions only.
This field is available only if the SuiteTax feature is enabled in your account.

Name: reverseCharge
Label: Reverse Charge
Help:
Check this box if reverse charge applies to transactions that have this tax type. Tax types with this property can be used on purchase transactions only.
On tax code records, this field is available only if the SuiteTax feature is disabled in your account.
On tax type records, this field is available only if the SuiteTax feature is enabled in your account.

Name: taxInNetAmount
Label: Tax Included in Net Amount
Help:
Check this box for special tax types where the tax amount is included in the item price. Tax types with this property can be used on sales and purchase transactions.
 
This field is available only if the SuiteTax feature is enabled in your account.

Name: dateDriven
Label: STANDARD
Help: If set to TRUE, you can NOT set daysUntilNetDue, discountPercent, and daysUntilExpiry. If set to FALSE, you can NOT set dayOfMonthNetDue, dueNextMonthIfWithinDays, discountPercentDateDriven, and dayDiscountExpires.

Name: dayDiscountExpires
Label: Day Discount Expires
Help:
If you offer a discount for early payment under date driven terms, enter the last day of the month the early payment discount is available.
For example, if the early payment discount is available through the 20th of each month, enter 20 in this field.

Name: dayOfMonthNetDue
Label: Day Of Month Net Due
Help:
For date driven terms, enter the day of the month when the net amount of the invoice is due.
If you enter a date that does not exist in the month the transaction is due, the last day of the month becomes the due date.

Name: daysUntilExpiry
Label: Days Till Discount Expires
Help:
For standard terms, enter the number of days the early payment discount is available.
For example, if the early payment discount is available for 15 days after the bill is issued, enter 15 in this field.

Name: daysUntilNetDue
Label: Days Till Net Due
Help:
Enter the number of days until the net amount of the bill becomes due.
For example, if you are creating a term of Net 30, enter 30 in this field.

Name: discountPercent
Label: % Discount
Help: For standard terms, enter the percentage discount if the invoice is paid early.

Name: discountPercentDateDriven
Label: Date Driven % Discount
Help: For date driven terms, enter the percentage discount if the invoice is paid early.

Name: dueNextMonthIfWithinDays
Label: Due Next Month If Within Days
Help:
For date driven terms, enter the number of days before the due date that the invoice can be postponed until the next month's due date.
For example, if invoices are due on the 30th of each month and you enter 5 in this field, then invoices issued between the 25th and 30th are due for payment by the 30th of the following month.
For another example, Day of Month Net Due = 15 and Due Next Month if Within Days = 30
Date range within 30 days:
5/16-6/14 move to 7/15
6/15-7/15 move to 8/15
8/16-9/14 move to 10/15
9/15-10/15 move to 11/15
10/16-11/14 move to 12/15
11/15-12/15 move to 1/5

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help:
Check this box to remove all references to this record from your account.
You can reactivate the record at any time.

Name: name
Label: Terms
Help: Enter the name for this record. This name appears in lists that include this record.

Name: preferred
Label: Preferred
Help: Terms set on customer records override terms marked as preferred here.

Name: approvalStatus
Label: Approval Status
Help: Select an approval status for this time entry.

Name: caseTaskEvent
Label: Task
Help: Set this field to a case, task or event associated with the employee. You must first perform a search on the employee to get a list of associated cases, tasks, or events.

Name: class
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Classes. This field is required when the Make Classes Mandatory preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: customer
Help: References an existing customer. If you select a customer or job, you must also select a service item.

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: Select the type of form to use.

Name: department
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when Make Departments Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: employee
Label: Employee
Help: References an existing employee record. Required on Add.

Name: hours
Label: Duration
Help: Required on Add.

Name: isBillable
Label: Billable
Help: If set to TRUE, the time entered can be billed.

Name: item
Label: Service Item
Help: References an existing service item record. This field is required when the customer field is set.

Name: location
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations. This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: memo
Label: Memo
Help:
If you want, enter a memo for this time transaction.
If you are billing this time back to a customer or job, this memo appears as a description for this line item on the customer invoice.

Name: overrideRate
Label: Lock this Rate
Help:
If you're billing this time back to a customer, check this box to lock the rate you enter so it's not affected by rate changes that happen before the customer is billed.
If you're entering time for a charge-based project and there are time-based charge rules, the rate is determined by the applied charge rule. Any rates entered on time records are discarded.
If you are entering time for a payroll item like vacation time, leave this field blank.

Name: paidExternally
Label: Paid Externally
Help:
Set to TRUE to designate that this time will be or has been paid to the employee outside of NetSuite.
This removes the time entry from NetSuite payroll lists and transactions but still keeps the time available for billing back to the customer.

Name: payrollItem
Label: Payroll Item
Help: References an existing payroll item.

Name: price
Label: Price Level
Help:
If you've set up a custom price level for your customer, it appears here. Otherwise, Sales Price 1 on the service item's record appears.
If you want to change the price level, select one from the list. Select Custom to enter a new price in the Rate field.
If you're entering time for a payroll item like vacation time, leave this field blank.
If you're entering time for a charge-based project and there are time-based charge rules, any price level selected in this field will be overridden by the applied charge rule.

Name: rate
Label: Rate
Help:
If you selected a price in the Price Level field, it automatically appears here.
If you don't use multiple prices or if you selected Custom in the Price Level field, enter a rate for this time transaction.
If you're entering time for a payroll item like vacation time, leave this field blank.
If you're entering time for a charge-based project and there are time-based charge rules, any rate entered in this field will be overridden by the applied charge rule.

Name: rejectionNote
Label: Rejection Note
Help: If you are rejecting this time entry, enter a rejection note for this time entry. Rejection notes are used to explain why an entry was rejected.

Name: subsidiary
Help: The subsidiary associated with the employee is displayed here.

Name: supervisorApproval
Label: Supervisor Approval
Help: Can only be set for roles that have approval permissions.

Name: timeType
Label: Type
Help:
The type of time transaction is displayed here. 
Actual time is time that has been worked by an employee. Planned time is time that has been accounted for when planning a project. Allocated time is time that has been assigned due to a resource allocation.

Name: tranDate
Label: Date
Help: Required on Add. Defaults to the current date.

Name: approvalStatus
Label: Approval Status
Help: Select an approval status for this time entry.

Name: billingClass
Label: Billing Class
Help: Select a billing class for this time entry. If a billing class is selected for this employee it is automatically selected.

Name: caseTaskEvent
Label: Task
Help: Set this field to a case, task or event associated with the employee. You must first perform a search on the employee to get a list of associated cases, tasks, or events.

Name: class
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Classes. This field is required when the Make Classes Mandatory preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: customer
Help: References an existing customer. If you select a customer or job, you must also select a service item.

Name: department
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when Make Departments Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: hours
Label: Duration
Help: Required on Add.

Name: isBillable
Label: Billable
Help: If set to TRUE, the time entered can be billed.

Name: item
Label: Service Item
Help: References an existing service item record. This field is required when the customer field is set.

Name: location
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations. This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.

Name: memo
Label: Memo
Help:
If you want, enter a memo for this time transaction.
If you are billing this time back to a customer or job, this memo appears as a description for this line item on the customer invoice.

Name: overrideRate
Label: Lock this Rate
Help:
If you're billing this time back to a customer, check this box to lock the rate you enter so it's not affected by rate changes that happen before the customer is billed.
If you're entering time for a charge-based project and there are time-based charge rules, the rate is determined by the applied charge rule. Any rates entered on time records are discarded.
If you are entering time for a payroll item like vacation time, leave this field blank.

Name: paidExternally
Label: Paid Externally
Help:
Set to TRUE to designate that this time will be or has been paid to the employee outside of NetSuite.
This removes the time entry from NetSuite payroll lists and transactions but still keeps the time available for billing back to the customer.

Name: payrollItem
Label: Payroll Item
Help: References an existing payroll item.

Name: price
Label: Price Level
Help:
If you've set up a custom price level for your customer, it appears here. Otherwise, Sales Price 1 on the service item's record appears.
If you want to change the price level, select one from the list. Select Custom to enter a new price in the Rate field.
If you're entering time for a payroll item like vacation time, leave this field blank.
If you're entering time for a charge-based project and there are time-based charge rules, any price level selected in this field will be overridden by the applied charge rule.

Name: rate
Label: Rate
Help:
If you selected a price in the Price Level field, it automatically appears here.
If you don't use multiple prices or if you selected Custom in the Price Level field, enter a rate for this time transaction.
If you're entering time for a payroll item like vacation time, leave this field blank.
If you're entering time for a charge-based project and there are time-based charge rules, any rate entered in this field will be overridden by the applied charge rule.

Name: subsidiary
Help: The subsidiary associated with the employee is displayed here.

Name: timeType
Label: Type
Help:
The type of time transaction is displayed here. 
Actual time is time that has been worked by an employee. Planned time is time that has been accounted for when planning a project. Allocated time is time that has been assigned due to a resource allocation.

Name: approvalStatus
Label: Approval Status
Help: Select an approval status for this time entry.

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: Select the type of form to use.

Name: employee
Label: Employee
Help: References an existing employee record. Required on Add.

Name: startDate
Label: Start Date
Help: NetSuite displays the start date for the current timesheet.

Name: subsidiary
Help: The subsidiary associated with the employee is displayed here.

Name: totalHours
Label: Total Hours
Help: NetSuite displays the total hours entered on this timesheet. This field is updated in real time.

Name: description
Label: Brief Description
Help:
Enter a description of this topic.
This description shows in the topic list and also where it is published.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: This field is false by default.

Name: longDescription
Label: Detailed Description
Help:
Enter the text of this solution or topic here.
You can use Javascript, HTML and CRMDSK tags in this description.
Click Preview to see how this solution will appear when published.

Name: parentTopic
Label: Parent Topic
Help:
If this topic is a subtopic, select the parent topic here.
If this is a top-level topic, leave this field blank.

Name: title
Label: Title
Help: Required on Add.

Name: altShippingCost
Label: Shipping Cost
Help: This field displays shipping costs associated with this transfer order.

Name: class
Help:
Select a class to associate with this transaction.
To create a new class, select New.
For details on existing classes, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_CLASS_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CLASS_> > Classes.

Name: department
Help:
Select a department to associate with this transaction.
To create a new department, select New.
For details on existing departments, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_DEPARTMENT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_DEPARTMENT_> > Departments.

Name: employee
Label: Sales Rep
Help:
Select an employee to associate with this transfer order.
Select New to add a new employee.
Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_EMPLOYEE_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_EMPLOYEE_> > Employees for details about existing employees.

Name: firmed
Label: Firmed
Help: When the Firmed box is checked, the line items are no longer eligible for reallocation to another order. The items must remain committed to the firmed order. Firmed transfer orders are not available to be rescheduled or cancelled.

Name: incoterm
Label: Incoterm
Help:
For transfer orders and intercompany transfer orders, use the following default international commercial terms (incoterms) to define when the transfer of ownership occurs for items being transferred between locations:
    * Ex Work (EXW) – inventory ownership is transferred at the shipping point
    * Delivered at Place (DAP) – inventory ownership is transferred at the destination point
Be aware that the incoterm you select impacts accounting and inventory information.
When creating a transfer order, you can only select EXW or DAP. After the order status is pending approval or pending fulfillment, you can choose another incoterm.

Name: location
Help:
In the From Location field, select the originating location for the transfer. Items are taken out of this location and the inventory count for the item is decreased at the location when the order is fulfilled.
You are not required to enter a source location to enter a transfer order, but you must choose a source location to approve and fulfill the transfer order.
To create a new location, select New.
For details on existing locations, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_LOCATION_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_LOCATION_> > Locations.

Name: memo
Label: Memo
Help:
Enter a memo to identify this transfer order.
When you use the Search Transactions feature, you can search for specific words and phrases in the Memo field.

Name: orderStatus
Label: Order Status
Help:
Select Pending Approval to route this order through the approval process before it is fulfilled.
Select Pending Fulfillment to skip the approval process.

Name: shipAddressList
Label: Ship To Select
Help: Select the appropriate shipping address for this transaction. Select New to enter a new shipping address.

Name: shipComplete
Label: Ship Complete
Help:
Check this box if you want to ship this order when there are enough items available to fully fulfill the orders.
When fulfilling orders in bulk, you can filter the list to include those orders marked Ship Complete that can be completely fulfilled by selecting Respect Ship Complete in the Filter By field.

Name: shipDate
Label: Ship Date
Help: The date defaults to show the current date. You can type or pick another shipping date for this order.

Name: shipMethod
Label: Ship Via
Help:
Select a shipping method for this order.
If you automatically charge for shipping, the shipping amount is entered in the shipping costs field. To automatically charge for shipping, go to <_TABNAME=ADMI_SHIPPING_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_SHIPPING_> > Shipping and check the Charge for Shipping box. Click Submit. You must also set up the charge details of your shipping items.
To add or edit shipping items, go to Lists > Accounting > Shipping Items.

Name: shippingCost
Label: Shipping Cost
Help:
The shipping cost automatically calculates depending on the shipping method you select in the Ship Via field above.
To change the cost of a shipping method, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_SHIPITEM_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_SHIPITEM_> > Shipping Items and select the shipping method you want to change.
If you use UPS Real-Time rates and a package is over 150lbs, the package is charged as multiple packages equal to or less than 150lbs.

Name: subsidiary
Help:
Select the subsidiary where the items will be taken from. The selection you make in this field determines which locations are available to be selected in the From Location field.
For example, if you select Subsidiary B here, you can choose a source location from a list of locations limited to only those associated with Subsidiary B.

Name: subTotal
Label: Subtotal
Help: As you add items, the total shows in this field.

Name: total
Label: Total
Help: This field shows the total amount associated with this order, including shipping and handling costs.

Name: tranDate
Label: Date
Help:
The current date autofills for this transfer order.
You can select or enter a different date.

Name: tranId
Label: Transaction Number
Help:
Enter the number of this transfer order.
If you use autogenerated numbering, the next order number in the sequence shows here. You can enter another number if you choose.

Name: transferLocation
Label: Destination {1}
Help:
In the Destination Location field, select the receiving location for the transfer. The inventory count and asset value for the item is increased at this location when the items are received.
You are required to enter a destination location to enter or approve a transfer order.
The Ship To Address of the transfer order defaults to the address of the destination location.
To create a new location, select New.
For details on existing locations, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_LOCATION_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_LOCATION_> > Locations.

Name: useItemCostAsTransferCost
Label: Use Item Cost As Transfer Cost
Help:
Check this box to use the transfer price as a declared shipping value for reference only. For example, for insurance or international shipping.
    * The transfer price is not a charge for the destination location.
    * The transfer price does not affect inventory costing on transactions.
    * The transfer price defaults to show the value in the Transfer Price field of item records.
    * Partial fulfillment and receipt of transfer orders is allowed, but you cannot receive more than you have fulfilled on any date. For example, if you have fulfilled 10 widgets out of 20 on a transfer order, you cannot receive 12 widgets on that order.
Clear this box to use the transfer price shown on the transfer order as the item cost on the item receipt.
Important: If no transfer price is entered on the transfer order, no cost is recorded on the item receipt.
    * Any difference between the actual cost and the transfer price posts to a Gain/Loss account when the item is shipped.
    * The transfer price and the Gain/Loss account are defined on each item record.
    * The transfer price defaults to show the value in the Transfer Price field of item records.
If you use approval routing, this setting can be changed on a transfer order as long as the transfer order is not yet approved. Once the transfer order is approved, this setting cannot be changed.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: This field is false by default.

Name: name
Label: Type Name
Help: Enter a name for the type of units you are creating. For example, enter "Length" to create units of Inch, Foot and Yard.

Name: accountNumber
Label: Account Number
Help: Sets the account number for vendors to reference.

Name: altName
Label: Vendor
Help: This is the name of this person or company.

Name: altPhone
Label: Alt. Phone
Help: Phone numbers can be entered in the following formats: 999-999-9999, 1-999-999-9999, (999) 999-9999, 1(999) 999-9999 or 999-999-9999 ext 9999

Name: balance
Label: Balance (Base)
Help: This is a read-only calculated field that returns the vendor's current accounts payable balance. The balance field on the customer is only returned in search if you set the BodyFieldsOnly flag to false.

Name: bcn
Label: Business Number
Help: Enter the 15-digit registration number that identifies this vendor as a client of the Canada Customs and Revenue Agency (CCRA).

Name: billPay
Label: Enable Online Bill Pay
Help:
Check this box in order to send this vendor payments online.
Before you can use this feature, you must set up Online Bill Pay at <_TABNAME=ADMI_XML_PAYTRUST_SETUP_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_XML_PAYTRUST_SETUP_> > Online Bill Pay.

Name: category
Label: Category
Help: References a value in a user defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > Vendor Categories.

Name: comments
Label: Comments
Help: Enter any other information you wish to track for this vendor.

Name: companyName
Label: Company Name
Help: Required on Add when the isPerson field is set to FALSE.

Name: creditLimit
Label: Credit Limit
Help: A credit limit for your purchases from the vendor. If set, and depending on preferences, a warning is generated when this customer's limit is exceeded during a transaction addition.

Name: currency
Label: Currency
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Accounting > Currencies. This value sets the currency that all transactions involving this vendor are conducted in. If defaults are OFF, this field is required. Can only be set if the multicurrency feature is enabled?

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: dateCreated
Label: Date Created
Help: The date this record was created displays here.

Name: defaultAddress
Help: Read-only field that returns the default address for the vendor.

Name: defaultTaxReg
Label: Default Tax Reg. Number
Help: Select the default tax registration number for this entity.

Name: email
Label: {1} Email
Help: Sets the email address for the vendor. If giveAccess is also set to true this is the email used by the customer for login.

Name: emailPreference
Label: Email Preference
Help: Reference to a value in a system list. Possible values include: _PDF, _HTML.

Name: emailTransactions
Label: Email Transactions
Help:
Set a preferred transaction delivery method for this vendor.
 
Choose to send transactions by regular mail, by email, by fax, or by a combination of the three. Then, when you select the vendor on a transaction, their preferred delivery method is marked by default.
    * Email – Check this box to check the To Be Emailed box by default on transactions when this vendor is selected.
    * Print – Check this box to check the To Be Printed box by default on transactions when this vendor is selected.
    * Fax – Check this box to check the To Be Faxed box by default on transactions when this vendor is selected.
Once you enter these settings on the vendor record, these boxes are checked by default for transactions created from the vendor record or for transactions that are copied or converted.
Note: These settings override any customized settings on transaction forms you use.
There are also preferences to set default values for new vendor records at <_TABNAME=ADMI_PRINTING_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_PRINTING_> > Printing, Fax and Email Preferences. On the Print subtab, Fax subtab, or Email subtab, check Vendors Default to [Print/Fax/Email] Transactions.
You can also set these fields using the Mass Update function. Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_BULKOP_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_BULKOP_> > Mass Updates > General and click Vendor.

Name: entityId
Label: Entity ID
Help: Required on Add.

Name: expenseAccount
Label: Default Expense Account
Help: References an existing account to be used for goods and services you purchase from this vendor.

Name: fax
Label: Fax
Help: Sets the fax number for the vendor.

Name: faxTransactions
Label: Fax Transactions
Help:
Set a preferred transaction delivery method for this vendor.
 
Choose to send transactions by regular mail, by email, by fax, or by a combination of the three. Then, when you select the vendor on a transaction, their preferred delivery method is marked by default.
    * Email – Check this box to check the To Be Emailed box by default on transactions when this vendor is selected.
    * Print – Check this box to check the To Be Printed box by default on transactions when this vendor is selected.
    * Fax – Check this box to check the To Be Faxed box by default on transactions when this vendor is selected.
Once you enter these settings on the vendor record, these boxes are checked by default for transactions created from the vendor record or for transactions that are copied or converted.
Note: These settings override any customized settings on transaction forms you use.
There are also preferences to set default values for new vendor records at <_TABNAME=ADMI_PRINTING_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_PRINTING_> > Printing, Fax and Email Preferences. On the Print subtab, Fax subtab, or Email subtab, check Vendors Default to [Print/Fax/Email] Transactions.
You can also set these fields using the Mass Update function. Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_BULKOP_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_BULKOP_> > Mass Updates > General and click Vendor.

Name: firstName
Label: First Name
Help: Required on Add when the isPerson field is set to TRUE.

Name: giveAccess
Label: Login Access
Help: Enables access to your NetSuite account for the vendor. The level of access is defined by the role assigned in the accessRole field.

Name: globalSubscriptionStatus
Label: Global Subscription Status
Help:
Email recipients can have one of four subscription statuses:
    * Confirmed Opt-In - When an email recipient has indicated that they want to receive your campaign messages, they are assigned this subscription status. Only a recipient can set his or her subscription status to Confirmed Opt-In.
    * Soft Opt-In - Recipients with this status can receive opt-in messages that enable them to confirm whether or not they want to receive your email campaigns as well as email marketing campaigns.
      You can set a recipient’s status to Soft Opt-In manually or through a mass update.
    * Soft Opt-Out - Recipients with this status cannot receive campaign email messages but can receive opt-in messages.
      You can change this subscription status to Soft Opt-In manually or through a mass update.
    * Confirmed Opt-Out - Only the recipient can set their subscription status to Confirmed Opt-Out.
      Recipients with this status cannot receive email campaigns or opt-in messages. Recipients with this status can only opt in again through the Vendor Center or by clicking the link in a campaign message they have received prior to opting out.

Name: image
Label: Image
Help: References an image file that has already been uploaded to the account.

Name: incoterm
Label: Incoterm
Help:
Choose the standardized three-letter trade term to be used on transactions related to this vendor.
These terms are international commercial procurement practices that communicate the tasks, costs, and risks associated with the transportation and delivery of goods. Incoterms define where the customer takes ownership of the product and are typically used for international orders, such as when an item goes through customs or crosses a border.

Name: is1099Eligible
Label: 1099 Eligible
Help:
If set to TRUE, this vendor is 1099 eligible.
Note: Only vendors that use the U.S. dollar are 1099 eligible.

Name: isAccountant
Help: If set to TRUE, this vendor has free access to the NetSuite account and the isAccountant field is set to FALSE for any vendor record previously defined as the Free Accountant.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: This field is false by default.

Name: isJobResourceVend
Label: Job Resource
Help: Sets this vendor as a resource on tasks and jobs.

Name: isPerson
Label: Is Individual
Help: By default, this is set to True which specifies the type of vendor record as Individual. If set to False, the vendor record is set as a Company type.

Name: laborCost
Label: Labor Cost
Help: Enter the cost of labor for this vendor in order to be able to calculate profitability on jobs.

Name: lastName
Label: Last Name
Help: Optionally enter a last name here.

Name: legalName
Label: Legal Name
Help:
Enter the legal name for this vendor for financial purposes.
If you entered a name in the Company Name field, that name appears here.

Name: openingBalance
Label: Opening Balance
Help: Enter the opening balance of your account with this vendor.

Name: openingBalanceAccount
Label: {1} Account
Help: Select the account this opening balance is applied to.

Name: openingBalanceDate
Label: {1} Date
Help: Enter the date of the balance entered in the Opening Balance field

Name: password
Label: Password
Help: Sets the password assigned to allow this vendor access to NetSuite.

Name: password2
Label: Confirm Password
Help: Sets the password confirmation field.

Name: payablesAccount
Help: Choose the default payable account for this vendor record.

Name: phone
Label: Phone
Help: Phone numbers can be entered in the following formats:999-999-9999, 1-999-999-9999, (999) 999-9999, 1(999) 999-9999 or 999-999-9999 ext 9999.

Name: phoneticName
Label: Furigana
Help: Enter the furigana character you want to use to sort this record.

Name: printOnCheckAs
Label: Print on {1} As
Help: Sets the Pay to the Order of line of a check instead of what you entered in the Vendor field.

Name: printTransactions
Label: Print Transactions
Help:
Set a preferred transaction delivery method for this vendor.
 
Choose to send transactions by regular mail, by email, by fax, or by a combination of the three. Then, when you select the vendor on a transaction, their preferred delivery method is marked by default.
    * Email – Check this box to check the To Be Emailed box by default on transactions when this vendor is selected.
    * Print – Check this box to check the To Be Printed box by default on transactions when this vendor is selected.
    * Fax – Check this box to check the To Be Faxed box by default on transactions when this vendor is selected.
Once you enter these settings on the vendor record, these boxes are checked by default for transactions created from the vendor record or for transactions that are copied or converted.
Note: These settings override any customized settings on transaction forms you use.
There are also preferences to set default values for new vendor records at <_TABNAME=ADMI_PRINTING_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_PRINTING_> > Printing, Fax and Email Preferences. On the Print subtab, Fax subtab, or Email subtab, check Vendors Default to [Print/Fax/Email] Transactions.
You can also set these fields using the Mass Update function. Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_BULKOP_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_BULKOP_> > Mass Updates > General and click Vendor.

Name: purchaseOrderAmount
Label: Vendor Bill - Purchase Order Amount Tolerance
Help: Enter the tolerance limit for the discrepancy between the amount on the vendor bill and purchase order.

Name: purchaseOrderQuantity
Label: Vendor Bill - Purchase Order Quantity Tolerance
Help: Enter the tolerance limit for the discrepancy between the quantity on the vendor bill and purchase order

Name: purchaseOrderQuantityDiff
Label: Vendor Bill - Purchase Order Quantity Difference
Help: Enter the difference limit for the discrepancy between the quantity on the vendor bill and purchase order.

Name: receiptAmount
Label: Vendor Bill - Item Receipt Amount Tolerance
Help: Enter the tolerance limit for the discrepancy between the amount on the vendor bill and item receipt.

Name: receiptQuantity
Label: Vendor Bill - Item Receipt Quantity Tolerance
Help: Enter the tolerance limit for the discrepancy between the quantity on the vendor bill and item receipt.

Name: receiptQuantityDiff
Label: Vendor Bill - Item Receipt Quantity Difference
Help: Enter the difference limit for the discrepancy between the quantity on the vendor bill and item receipt.

Name: representingSubsidiary
Label: Represents {1}
Help: Indicates that this entity is an intercompany vendor. Select the subsidiary this vendor represents as the seller in intercompany transactions.

Name: requirePwdChange
Label: Require Password Change On Next Login
Help: If set to TRUE, the vendor is required to change the default password assign on the next login attempt.

Name: sendEmail
Label: Send New Access Notification Email
Help: This field can only be set on ADD. When set to TRUE, an email notification is sent to the Vendor to inform them that they have been granted access to your account.

Name: subsidiary
Help:
Select the subsidiary to associate with this vendor. If you use NetSuite OneWorld, select the primary subsidiary to assign to this vendor.
You cannot enter transactions for this vendor unless a subsidiary, or primary subsidiary is assigned.
The default primary currency for the vendor is the base currency of the primary subsidiary.
If you select this vendor on a transaction, the transaction is associated with this subsidiary. The vendor is able to access only information associated with this subsidiary.
 
Note: After a transaction has posted for the vendor, you are not able to change the subsidiary selected on the vendor record. If you have NetSuite OneWorld, after you save the vendor record, you cannot change the primary subsidiary.

Name: taxIdNum
Label: Tax ID
Help: Sets the Vendor�s Tax ID number.

Name: taxItem
Label: Tax Code
Help:
Select the default tax code you want applied to purchase orders and bills for this vendor.
You can change the tax code on individual transactions.

Name: terms
Label: Terms
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > Term and sets the standard discount terms for this Vendor�s invoices.

Name: unbilledOrders
Label: Unbilled Orders (Base)
Help:
This field displays the total amount of orders that have been entered but not yet billed.
 
If you have enabled the preference Vendor Credit Limit Includes Orders, then this total is included in credit limit calculations.
 
Set this preference at <_TABNAME=ADMI_ACCTSETUP_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_ACCTSETUP_> > Accounting Preferences > General.

Name: url
Label: URL
Help: Only available when isPerson is set to FALSE.

Name: vatRegNumber
Label: VAT Registration No.
Help: For the UK edition only. Note that this field is not validated when submitted via Web services.

Name: workCalendar
Label: Work Calendar
Help: Select the work calendar for this vendor.

Name: account
Label: Account
Help:
Select the Accounts Payable account that will be affected by this transaction.
Click New to set up a new account.
For details on accounts, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_ACCOUNT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_ACCOUNT_> > Chart of Accounts.

Name: approvalStatus
Label: Approval Status
Help:
The approval status of this bill shows in this field.
Accept the default status or choose one of the following:
    * Approved – No further review or processing is required before a payment is processed.
    * Pending Approval – Someone with permission must approve the bill before a payment can be processed for it.

Name: availableVendorCredit
Label: Available Vendor Credit
Help:
From the web services perspective, this field is available only with the get, getList, and asyncGetList operations. This field is not available through search.
For more information about this field, refer to the field help in the UI. That is, navigate to the record and click the Available Vendor Credit label. In response, the system displays a popup window that contains more information about the field.

Name: billAddressList
Label: Bill To Select
Help:
In the Vendor Select field, choose a vendor.
Verify the billing address displayed in the Vendor field.

Name: class
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Classes. This field is required when the Make Classes Mandatory preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. Depending on account configuration, this field may need to be set at the item line level.

Name: creditLimit
Label: Credit Limit
Help: This is a read-only field that returns the credit limit set for the vendor.

Name: currency
Label: Currency
Help:
The transaction currency for this bill is shown here.
If this bill was created from a purchase order, the currency on the originating purchase order is shown, and you cannot change the currency on the bill.

Name: currencyName
Label: Currency
Help: A read only field that defaults to the currency associated with the customer referenced by the entity field.

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: Select the appropriate standard or custom form to use.

Name: department
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Departments. This field is required when Departments is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. Depending on account configuration, this field may need to be set at the item line level.

Name: discountAmount
Label: Discount Amount
Help: A read-only field that returns the amount discounted on this bill.

Name: discountDate
Label: Discount Date
Help: A read-only field that returns the last day you can pay this bill in order to receive a discount.

Name: dueDate
Label: Due Date
Help: Sets the due date for the bill. Defaults to the current date.

Name: entity
Help: Required on Add.

Name: entityTaxRegNum
Label: Vendor Tax Reg. Number
Help: The tax registration number for this entity displays here.

Name: exchangeRate
Label: Exchange Rate
Help: Required on Add. Defaults to the rate associated with the Vendor set in the entity field.

Name: landedCostMethod
Label: Cost Allocation Method
Help:
Available values are:
_quantity
_value
_weight

Name: landedCostPerLine
Label: Landed Cost per Line
Help: Check this box to enter a landed cost per line item.

Name: location
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations. This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. Depending on account configuration, this field may need to be set at the item line level.

Name: memo
Label: Memo
Help: Enter a memo that will appear on such reports as the 2-line Accounts Payable Register.

Name: nextApprover
Label: Next Approver
Help: This field displays the next person set to approve this bill via approval routing.

Name: nexus
Label: Nexus
Help:
This field shows the nexus of the transaction. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. 
You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different nexus in the dropdown list, the corresponding tax registration number is automatically selected in the Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number field.

Name: paymentHold
Label: Payment Hold
Help:
Check the Payment Hold box to apply a payment hold on a disputed bill:
    * The Make Payment button does not appear on the vendor bill and a vendor payment for that bill cannot be processed.
    * Vendor bills subject to a payment hold do not appear on the bill payments page.
    * The Electronic Payment SuiteApp does not process payments that are subject to a payment hold.

Name: postingPeriod
Label: Posting Period
Help: Required on Add when the Accounting Periods feature is enabled.

Name: subsidiary
Help: Enter the subsidiary you want to associate with this transaction.

Name: subsidiaryTaxRegNum
Label: Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number
Help:
This field shows the tax registration number of the transaction nexus. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. 
You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different tax registration number in the dropdown list, the corresponding nexus is automatically selected in the Nexus field.

Name: tax2Total
Label: PST
Help: NetSuite multiplies the tax rate by the taxable total of line items and enters it here.

Name: taxDetailsOverride
Label: Tax Details Override
Help: Check this box to override the tax information on the Tax Details subtab of the transaction. Only roles with at least the Edit level of the Tax Details Tab permission can override the tax details.

Name: taxRegOverride
Label: Tax Registration Override
Help: Check this box to override the values in the Nexus and Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number fields. Only roles with at least the Edit level of the Tax Details Tab permission can override the values that NetSuite automatically selects in these fields.

Name: taxTotal
Label: Tax
Help: NetSuite multiplies the tax rate by the taxable total of line items and enters it here.

Name: terms
Label: Terms
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > New > Terms.

Name: tranDate
Label: Date
Help: Required on Add. Defaults to the current date.

Name: tranId
Label: Reference No.
Help: Sets the number to identify this transaction, such as the vendor's invoice number.

Name: transactionNumber
Label: Transaction Number
Help:
By default, transaction lists display only the Number field in searches and reporting. If you plan to include the new Transaction Number field, be aware that this value will be the different from the value in the Number field for the twelve transaction types available through Version 2014 Release 1.
For the transaction types available through previous releases, these two values will be the same.
Note: The Transaction Number field is visible by default on standard NetSuite forms and invisible by default on customized forms. You can customize a form to display this field.

Name: userTotal
Label: Amount
Help: A read-only field that returns the total amount of the transaction. check this -- in the UI, this can be entered but then is overwritten on submit.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help:
Check this box to remove all references to this record from your account.
You can reactivate the record at any time.

Name: isTaxAgency
Label: Tax Agency
Help: You can set up tax agencies as vendors to initiate, record, and track tax payments. Select this check box if this vendor is a taxing agency.

Name: name
Help: Enter the name for this record. This name appears in lists that include this record.

Name: account
Label: Account
Help:
Select the Accounts Payable account that will be affected by this transaction.
Click New to set up a new account.
For details on accounts, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_ACCOUNT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_ACCOUNT_> > Chart of Accounts.

Name: applied
Label: Applied
Help: NetSuite will update the Applied amount as you check bills on the Apply tab.

Name: autoApply
Label: Auto Apply
Help: Check the Auto Apply box if you want NetSuite to apply the credit amount to the oldest outstanding vendor bills. NetSuite remembers your preference for using the Auto Apply box on vendor credits. The next time you enter a vendor credit, the Auto Apply box is checked or cleared by default based on the last vendor credit you entered.

Name: billAddressList
Label: Bill To Select
Help:
In the Vendor Select field, choose a vendor.
Verify the billing address displayed in the Vendor field.

Name: class
Help:
Select a class to associate with this transaction.
To create a new class, select New.
For details on existing classes, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_CLASS_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CLASS_> > Classes.

Name: createdFrom
Label: Created From
Help: This field displays the return authorization from which this bill credit is created.

Name: currency
Label: Currency
Help: Select the currency you want to enter this credit in.

Name: currencyName
Label: Currency
Help:
This vendor's currency is shown in this field.
All currency amounts on this transaction are shown in this currency.

Name: department
Help:
Select a department to associate with this transaction.
To create a new department, select New.
For details on existing departments, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_DEPARTMENT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_DEPARTMENT_> > Departments.

Name: entity
Help:
Select the vendor for this credit. Click New to set up a new vendor.
If you have NetSuite OneWorld and you have defined vendor records that are shared with multiple secondary subsidiaries, you can associated this vendor credit with any of the subsidiaries assigned to this vendor. The items that can be credited reflect the combination of the selected vendor and subsidiary. 
Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_VENDOR_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_VENDOR_> > Vendors for details about existing suppliers.

Name: exchangeRate
Label: Exchange Rate
Help:
The currency's exchange rate is shown in this field.
You can edit the exchange rate for this transaction only, or you can update the currency record with the exchange rate you enter here.

Name: location
Help:
Select a location to associate with this line item. Select New to create a new location record.
Go to Lists > Locations for details about existing locations.

Name: memo
Label: Memo
Help: Enter a memo that will appear on such reports 2-line Accounts Payable Register.

Name: nexus
Label: Nexus
Help:
This field shows the nexus of the transaction. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. 
You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different nexus in the dropdown list, the corresponding tax registration number is automatically selected in the Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number field.

Name: postingPeriod
Label: Posting Period
Help:
Select the period you want to post this vendor credit to.
If a period is closed, you cannot post to that period.

Name: subsidiary
Help: This field displays the subsidiary associated with this transaction.

Name: subsidiaryTaxRegNum
Label: Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number
Help:
This field shows the tax registration number of the transaction nexus. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. 
You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different tax registration number in the dropdown list, the corresponding nexus is automatically selected in the Nexus field.

Name: taxDetailsOverride
Label: Tax Details Override
Help: Check this box to override the tax information on the Tax Details subtab of the transaction. Only roles with at least the Edit level of the Tax Details Tab permission can override the tax details.

Name: taxRegOverride
Label: Tax Registration Override
Help: Check this box to override the values in the Nexus and Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number fields. Only roles with at least the Edit level of the Tax Details Tab permission can override the values that NetSuite automatically selects in these fields.

Name: tranDate
Label: Date
Help:
NetSuite inserts today's date for the posting date of this vendor credit. You can type or pick another date.
What you enter here determines the date range in which this transaction appears on the Accounts Payable Register.
You can select or enter custom date ranges on registers.

Name: tranId
Label: Reference No.
Help: Enter up to 45 characters to identify this transaction, such as the vendor's invoice or credit number. This reference appears on reports such as the Accounts Payable Register.

Name: transactionNumber
Label: Transaction Number
Help:
If you have set up auto-generated numbering (Setup > Company > Setup Tasks > Auto-Generated Numbers), this field displays To Be Generated for this transaction type.
Account-based transaction types such as Check, where the numbering sequence is dependent upon a particular account, and transaction types where the numbers are used for external reference such as Vendor Bill, display this read-only field.
Note: By default, transaction lists display only the Number field in searches and reporting. If you plan to include the new Transaction Number field, be aware that this value will be different from the value in the Number field for account-based and externally referenced transaction types. For the other transaction types, these two values will be the same.

Name: unApplied
Label: Unapplied
Help: NetSuite will update the Unapplied amount as you check bills on the Apply tab.

Name: userTotal
Label: Amount
Help: You can enter the dollar amount of the transaction, but NetSuite will update this as you add or edit line items.

Name: account
Label: Account
Help: Set the bank account that will be used to pay these bills.

Name: address
Label: Address
Help: NetSuite automatically generates the mailing address of the vendor from the record at Lists > Relationships > Vendors. You can change the address here for just this transaction by typing up to four rows of information.

Name: apAcct
Label: A/P Account
Help: Set the Accounts Payable account that will be affected by this transaction.

Name: approvalStatus
Label: Approval Status
Help:
In the Approval Status field, choose one of the following:
    * Approved – No further review or approval processing is required before a payment is processed.
    * Pending Approval – Bills with a Pending Approval status require that someone with permission must approve the bill before a payment can be processed for it.
    * Rejected – The payment cannot be processed further.

Name: availableBalance
Label: Available Balance
Help:
The Available Balance is displayed for the selected account.
The bank account available balance is calculated as follows: 
    * Bank account balance - Sum of outstanding in-transit payments = Available balance

Name: balance
Label: Balance
Help: NetSuite automatically shows the balance in this bank account.

Name: billPay
Label: Bill Pay
Help:
Check this box to send this payment online.
You must follow the set up procedure in How Do I Set Up Online Bill Pay before you can use this feature.
The NetSuite basic package includes a set number of bill pay transactions. Click the Charges May Apply link for more information.

Name: class
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Classes. This field is required when the Make Classes Mandatory preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. If you are using a customForm that has class customized at the body level, you can NOT set this field at the item level. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: currency
Label: Currency
Help: Select the vendor's transaction currency you want to enter this bill in.

Name: currencyName
Label: Currency
Help: This field auto-populates based on selection of Payee (entity).

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: Select the form to use for this payment. Custom forms you have previously created can be chosen.

Name: department
Help: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when the Make Departments Mandatory preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: entity
Label: Payee
Help: Select the payee for this purchase. Select a vendor to pay vendor bills. Select an employee to pay an employee expense. In the UI, go to Lists > Relationships > Vendors for details about existing suppliers. Go to Lists > Employees > Employees for details about existing employees.

Name: exchangeRate
Label: Exchange Rate
Help:
The currency's exchange rate is shown in this field.
You can edit the exchange rate for this transaction only, or you can update the currency record with the exchange rate you set here.

Name: isInTransitPayment
Label: In Transit
Help:
Check the In Transit box to designate this vendor payment as an In-Transit Payment.
This defaults based on the setting for the Use In-Transit Vendor Payments by Default preference.
The In Transit box can be checked only when first creating a payment. After the payment form is saved, this setting cannot be changed.
Clear this box if this vendor payment is not an In-Transit payment.
The setting for this field cannot be changed after the form is saved.

Name: location
Help: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations. This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

Name: memo
Label: Memo
Help: Enter a memo that shows the vendor's invoice number or your account number. This appears on the memo line of the check.

Name: nextApprover
Label: Next Approver
Help: This field displays the employee designated as the approver on the employee record. If no approver is selected, the supervisor approves payments. If both a supervisor and an approver are selected, either can approve the payment.

Name: postingPeriod
Label: Posting Period
Help: Set the period you want to post this bill payment to. If a period is closed, you cannot post to that period.

Name: printVoucher
Label: Voucher
Help: Set to true to queue a voucher to print for this payment. After you have entered payments, you can print vouchers for them at Transactions > Management > Print Checks and Forms > Payment Vouchers.

Name: subsidiary
Help: In a OneWorld environment, NetSuite displays the name of the subsidiary associated with the bill in a read-only field.

Name: toAch
Label: To ACH
Help: Set to true to send this payment via ACH processing.

Name: toBePrinted
Label: To Be Printed
Help: Set to true if you want to save this in a queue of checks to print.

Name: total
Label: Amount
Help: NetSuite automatically updates this amount as you add or edit line items.

Name: tranDate
Label: Date
Help:
NetSuite inserts today's date for the posting date of this bill payment. You can set another date.
The date you set here determines the date range in which this transaction appears on the Accounts Payable Register.
Note that you can set custom date ranges on registers.

Name: tranId
Label: Check #
Help: If you have set To Be Printed to true, you will choose starting check numbers later when you print those checks. If you are submitting and immediately printing this check, NetSuite increases the largest check number by one. If you wish, you can set another number here, and the next check number will revert to the standard pattern.

Name: transactionNumber
Label: Transaction Number
Help: This field displays the system-generated number associated with this transaction.

Name: billAddressList
Label: Bill To Select
Help:
In the Vendor Select field, choose a vendor.
Verify the billing address displayed in the Vendor field.

Name: class
Help:
Optionally select a class.
Click New to enter a new class.
Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_CLASS_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CLASS_> > Classes for details about existing classes.

Name: currency
Label: Currency
Help:
Select the vendor transaction currency you want to enter this return authorization in.
If you are creating this return authorization from a purchase order, the currency from the originating purchase order is used and cannot be changed.

Name: currencyName
Label: Currency
Help:
This read-only field displays the currency assigned to this vendor on the Vendor record. You can access vendor records at <_TABNAME=LIST_VENDOR_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_VENDOR_> > Vendors.
All transactions with this vendor occur in this currency. NetSuite converts transaction amounts from the vendor's currency to your base currency in registers and on reports.
If any user has saved a transaction for this vendor, then the vendor's currency cannot be changed.

Name: department
Help:
Optionally select a department.
Click New to enter a new department.
Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_DEPARTMENT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_DEPARTMENT_> > Departments for details about existing departments.

Name: entity
Help:
Select the vendor to whom you are returning items.
If you have NetSuite OneWorld and you have defined vendor records that are shared with multiple secondary subsidiaries, the Vendor field lists all of the vendors that are assigned the selected subsidiary.
For information on existing vendors, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_VENDOR_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_VENDOR_> > Vendors.

Name: exchangeRate
Label: Exchange Rate
Help:
The currency's exchange rate is shown in this field.
You can edit the exchange rate for this transaction only, or you can update the currency record with the exchange rate you enter here.

Name: intercoStatus
Label: Intercompany Status
Help:
Intercompany Transaction Status can be:
    * Linked - intercompany order has been paired with an intercompany order in another subsidiary.
    * Pending - iintercompany order has not been paired with a corresponding order in another subsidiary.
    * Rejected - intercompany purchase order or vendor return authorization cannot be paired with a sales order or return authorization because it contains incorrect information, such as subsidiary, currency, amount, or other detail.

Name: intercoTransaction
Label: Paired Intercompany Transaction
Help:
Identifies the intercompany order in another subsidiary that this order is paired with.
Order pairs are Sales Order/Purchase Order and Vendor Return Authorization/Return Authorization.

Name: location
Help:
Optionally select a location.
Click New to enter a new location.
Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_LOCATION_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_LOCATION_> > Location for details about existing locations.

Name: memo
Label: Memo
Help: If you wish, enter a memo to describe this vendor return authorization. What you enter in this field will appear on reports.

Name: nexus
Label: Nexus
Help:
This field shows the nexus of the transaction. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. 
You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different nexus in the dropdown list, the corresponding tax registration number is automatically selected in the Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number field.

Name: orderStatus
Label: Order Status
Help:
If your company uses the approval process for vendor return authorizations, Pending Approval is your default status. If your company does not use the approval process, Pending Receipt is your default status.
The default status for return authorizations is set by an administrator. You can change the status for each vendor return authorization in this field, if needed.

Name: subsidiary
Help:
This field displays the subsidiary associated with this transaction.
This field shows only if you use NetSuite OneWorld. If you have defined vendor records that are shared with multiple secondary subsidiaries, you can change the subsidiary where the vendor return is authorized.

Name: subsidiaryTaxRegNum
Label: Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number
Help:
This field shows the tax registration number of the transaction nexus. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. 
You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different tax registration number in the dropdown list, the corresponding nexus is automatically selected in the Nexus field.

Name: taxDetailsOverride
Label: Tax Details Override
Help: Check this box to override the tax information on the Tax Details subtab of the transaction. Only roles with at least the Edit level of the Tax Details Tab permission can override the tax details.

Name: taxRegOverride
Label: Tax Registration Override
Help: Check this box to override the values in the Nexus and Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number fields. Only roles with at least the Edit level of the Tax Details Tab permission can override the values that NetSuite automatically selects in these fields.

Name: tranDate
Label: Date
Help: Accept, enter, or select the date of this transaction.

Name: tranId
Label: Transaction Number
Help:
Optionally enter a number to refer to this return transaction. Typically, this is a number provided by the vendor once the return is approved.
You can enter a maximum of 45 characters in this field.

Name: userTaxTotal
Label: Tax
Help: This field shows the total tax amount for this transaction.

Name: userTotal
Label: Amount
Help: The total currency amount of the line items you enter below shows in this field.

Name: creditLimit
Label: Credit Limit
Help: A credit limit for your purchases from the vendor. If set, and depending on preferences, a warning is generated when this customer's limit is exceeded during a transaction addition.

Name: subsidiary
Help:
Select the subsidiary to associate with this vendor. If you use NetSuite OneWorld, select the primary subsidiary to assign to this vendor.
You cannot enter transactions for this vendor unless a subsidiary, or primary subsidiary is assigned.
The default primary currency for the vendor is the base currency of the primary subsidiary.
If you select this vendor on a transaction, the transaction is associated with this subsidiary. The vendor is able to access only information associated with this subsidiary.
 
Note: After a transaction has posted for the vendor, you are not able to change the subsidiary selected on the vendor record. If you have NetSuite OneWorld, after you save the vendor record, you cannot change the primary subsidiary.

Name: taxItem
Label: Tax Code
Help:
Select the default tax code you want applied to purchase orders and bills for this vendor.
You can change the tax code on individual transactions.

Name: isInactive
Label: Inactive
Help: Sets whether the current category is active. Defaults to False.  An inactive category cannot be used as a selection.

Name: name
Label: Reason
Help: Sets the name that is displayed for selecting this category in the UI.

Name: assemblyItem
Label: Assembly
Help:
Select the Assembly you need to build.
After an item is selected, the assembly components are displayed on the Items subtab.
This field cannot be changed after an assembly build is associated with this work order.

Name: autoCalculateLag
Label: Auto-calculate Lag
Help: Check the Auto-Calculate Lag box to automatically calculate the optimal lag amount, which is the shortest possible lead time for each work order.

Name: billOfMaterials
Label: Bill of Materials
Help: Select the Bill of Materials (BOM) you want to associate with this assembly.

Name: billOfMaterialsRevision
Label: Bill of Materials Revision
Help:
Select a Bill of Materials Revision to associate with this work order.
A BOM Revision displays BOM updates and details throughout the product lifecycle.

Name: built
Label: Built
Help: The Built field displays the total number of assemblies that have been completed on associated assembly builds.

Name: class
Help:
Select a Class if you track them.
The selected class carries over to the assembly build.

Name: createdFrom
Label: Created From
Help:
The Created From field displays the number of the sales order associated with this work order, if any.
Note: The Created From field is not available if you are creating a stand-alone work order on the Enter Work Orders page. The Created From field appears only on existing work orders created from sales orders using one of these methods:
    * By clicking on the Work Ord. link on the line item in the sales order
    * By automatic work order creation from a sales order when the Create WO field is marked upon saving the sales order

Name: customForm
Label: Custom Form
Help: In the Custom Form list, select the form to use with this work order.

Name: department
Help:
Select a Department to associate with the assemblies on this work order.
This selection is carried over to the assembly build.
Click New to enter a new department.

Name: endDate
Label: Production End Date
Help:
In the Production End Date field, enter the date you expect to complete assembly production.
This field defaults to show the transaction date plus lead time.

Name: entity
Help: Select a Customer to associate with this work order.

Name: expandAssembly
Label: Mark Sub-assemblies Phantom
Help:
Check the Mark Sub-Assemblies Phantom box to build member items that are also assemblies used to complete the work order.
Sub-assembly components are displayed on the Items subtab.
To learn more, see Work Orders and Sub-Assemblies

Name: firmed
Label: Firmed
Help: Check the Firmed box to save the the order and process it when the supply planning engine runs.

Name: isWip
Label: WIP
Help:
Check the WIP box to designate the work order to use WIP instead of a standard assembly build.
This option is only available when the order status is Released.
It cannot be changed once a posting assembly transaction is logged against the work order.
To learn more, see Using WIP on Work Orders.

Name: job
Help: Select a job if the assemblies on this work order are for a particular job. Click the Open icon to open a list of jobs.

Name: location
Help:
Select a Location to display only work orders for that location.
Select All to display work orders for all locations.
If you use Multi-Location Inventory, the selected location is the one that component inventory items are committed from.

Name: manufacturingRouting
Label: Manufacturing Routing
Help:
Select the a Manufacturing Routing.
After you select an assembly, NetSuite display the default routing for the assembly based on the location setting.
To select an alternate routing, the Manufacturing Routing field displays all routings associated with the assembly for the selected location.

Name: memo
Label: Memo
Help:
Optionally, enter a Memo for this work order.
You can search for the memo text to find this work order.

Name: orderStatus
Label: Order Status
Help:
Select the work order Status.
For example, In-Process or Built.

Name: quantity
Label: Quantity
Help:
Enter the Quantity of assembly items you want to create.
This can be a fractional number.

Name: revision
Label: Revision
Help:
For work orders, NetSuite automatically populates the effective revision based on the effective date. If you change the revision selected on the work order, then NetSuite changes the components on the top level assembly based on the revision selected.
If you change the revision selected on the work order and the Build Subassembly box is checked, then top-level components will change based on the revision selected and the lower level components are determined based on the effective date.

Name: schedulingMethod
Label: Scheduling Method
Help:
Select a Scheduling Method:
Forward Scheduling - to set production start date and calculate the time, materials, and resources required to complete all necessary operations to finish the task.
Backward Scheduling to set the production end date, which is the date you need to have the completed items. NetSuite calculates the time, materials, and resources required to complete all necessary operations.

Name: startDate
Label: Production Start Date
Help:
In the Production Start Date field, enter the date you expect to begin assembly production. This field defaults to today's date.
    * Demand Planning bases component demand on the production start date.
    * Manufacturing Routing production start date depends on whether NetSuite uses forward or backward scheduling to calculate production requirements.
To learn more, see Production Scheduling Methods Overview.

Name: subsidiary
Help: If you use OneWorld, select a subsidiary.

Name: tranDate
Label: Date
Help:
NetSuite displays today's Date as the default work order date.
You can enter or select another date.

Name: tranId
Label: Order No.
Help:
NetSuite increases the largest work order number by one.
   1. To enter another order number, go to Setup > Company > Setup Tasks > Auto-Generated Numbers.
   2. On the Transactions subtab, next to Work Order, check the Allow Override box.
   3. Click Save.
      The next order number will revert to the standard pattern.

Name: units
Label: Unit of Measure
Help: The Units field displays the units of the component used in the parent assembly.

Name: class
Help: Optionally select a class if you track them.

Name: completedQuantity
Label: Completed Quantity
Help: The quantity to be completed shows in this field.

Name: createdFrom
Label: Created From
Help: This field identifies the work order that this completion is created from. The work order is linked to the completion record.

Name: department
Help: Optionally select a department if you track them.

Name: endOperation
Label: Ending Operation
Help: Select a Starting Operation and Ending Operation to define a range. The default component quantity shows for components to be completed within the operation range.

Name: inventoryDetail
Label: Inventory Detail
Help: After you have entered a quantity to build, click the Inventory Detail button to specify a bin, serial or lot number for the items being processed.

Name: isBackflush
Label: Backflush
Help: Check the Backflush box to enter the completions with backflush. Using backflush means that component consumption is recorded at the same time. Component consumption is based on the proportion designated on the original work order and the build quantity.

Name: item
Label: Assembly
Help:
In the Assembly field, select the assembly item you want to complete.
A completion can be entered only for assembly items on record.
To create new assembly item records, click Assembly at Lists > Accounting > Items > New .

Name: location
Help: The location is displayed in this field.

Name: manufacturingRouting
Label: Manufacturing Routing
Help: This field displays the associated routing.

Name: memo
Label: Memo
Help: Optionally enter a memo for this transaction. You can search for text entered here to find the transaction later.

Name: orderQuantity
Label: Work Order Quantity
Help: The quantity of assemblies from the work order displays in this field.

Name: postingPeriod
Label: Posting Period
Help: Select a posting period for this transaction.

Name: quantity
Label: Quantity
Help: Enter the number of assemblies to record as being completed.

Name: revision
Label: Revision
Help: Select the revision to be used for this completion. For details, click Help and read Revision Control BOM Management .

Name: scrapQuantity
Help: Enter the quantity to record as being scrapped.

Name: startOperation
Label: Starting Operation
Help: Select a Starting Operation and Ending Operation to define a range. The default component quantity shows for components to be completed within the operation range.

Name: total
Label: Projected Value
Help: Unlike on an assembly build, the Projected Value field on a work order completion displays the cost of the assembly, not individual components (unless you use backflush.)

Name: tranDate
Label: Date
Help: Select or verify the date for this transaction. The current date autofills this field.

Name: tranId
Label: Ref No.
Help: In the Reference # field, you can enter a reference number to track this transaction.

Name: units
Label: Unit of Measure
Help: The unit of measure for this item is displayed in this field.

Name: createdFrom
Label: Created From
Help: This field identifies the work order that this issue is created from. The work order is linked to the issue record.

Name: endOperation
Label: Ending Operation
Help: Select a Starting Operation and Ending Operation to define a range. The default component quantity shows for components to be issued within the operation range.

Name: item
Label: Assembly
Help:
In the Assembly field, select the assembly item you want to issue.
An issue can be entered only for assembly items on record.
To create new assembly item records, click Assembly at Lists > Accounting > Items > New .

Name: manufacturingRouting
Label: Manufacturing Routing
Help: This field displays the associated routing.

Name: memo
Label: Memo
Help: Optionally enter a memo for this transaction. You can search for text entered here to find the transaction later.

Name: postingPeriod
Label: Posting Period
Help: Select a posting period for this transaction.

Name: revision
Label: Revision
Help: Select the revision to be used for this issue. For details, click Help and read Revision Control BOM Management .

Name: startOperation
Label: Starting Operation
Help: Select a Starting Operation and Ending Operation to define a range. The default component quantity shows for components to be issued within the operation range.

Name: tranDate
Label: Date
Help: Select or verify the date for this transaction. The current date autofills this field.

Name: tranId
Label: Ref No.
Help: In the Reference # field, you can enter a reference number to track this transaction.
